I’m not a bachelor anymore.ScenesMonica: So don’t think of it as a bachelor party, think of it as a…a two month anniversary present.ScenesRoss: Sure, one year is paper, but two months is lapdance! (Joey nods his agreement.)ScenesMonica: Please! I feel so bad! Just watch the hot woman get naked!ScenesChandler: All right fine! But I’m only doing this for you!ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesChandler: And Joey.ScenesMonica: Thank you. All right, now who else do you want to invite?ScenesChandler: Ah, no-no-no just Ross. Ross and Joey is embarrassing enough.ScenesRoss: Uh actually, sorry I can’t even make it. I’m seeing Mona again tonight.ScenesChandler: I understand: who would cancel an actual date to go to a fake bachelor party?ScenesJoey: (on cell phone) I’m sorry I gotta cancel tonight baby…

rows.Scenes: The Restaurant, dinner has ended and Phoebe and Rachel are talking. Dr. Green is not at the table.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I’m sorry I won’t be able to make it to your imaginary wedding, but I’m really busy that day. Yeah, I already have a unicorn baptism and a leprechaun bar mitzvah.ScenesRachel: I know. I know. I panicked, I panicked. I didn’t want him to start yelling at me like I was some ’74 Latour.ScenesPhoebe: It’s Lafite. The ’74 Latour is actually drinking quite nicely.ScenesRachel: All right here he comes. I’m gonna do this, I’m gonna tell him, I’m gonna be strong.ScenesDr. Green: I just called a friend of mine.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesDr. Green: I think I may be able to book The Plaza on short notice.ScenesRachel: Really?! The Plaza?!! Oh daddy!! (Hugs him and Phoebe glares at her.) Right. Daddy, I need to talk to you. Please, sit down.ScenesDr. Green: What is it sweetie?ScenesRachel: There’s not gonna be a wedding. Ross and I are not getting married.ScenesDr. Green: What?!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry daddy.ScenesDr. Green: I don’t believe this!!ScenesRachel: Oh now daddy, stay calm. Please.ScenesDr. Green: Stay calm?!! How do you expect me to stay calm?! This is unacceptable Rachel! And I wanna know why?!! Is it because that punk Ross won’t marry you?! That’s it! Is that it?!ScenesRachel: Yes. Yes, he says I’m damaged goods.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler’s bachelor party has begun, what there is of it, with only Joey (wearing a gold paper top hat) and Chandler (wearing what appears to be a Burger King paper crown) enjoying a nice product placement of Budweisers on ice.]
rows.Content: Joey: So you uh, nervous about getting married?ScenesChandler: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: Look, look let’s pretend it’s a real bachelor party. Okay? Y’know? Before your wedding. Come on, it’ll be fun.ScenesChandler: Okay. I can’t believe tomorrow’s the big day.ScenesJoey: How does it feel knowing you’re never gonna be with another woman again huh? Knowing you’re gonna have to wake up to the same face everyday until you finally have the sweet release of death.ScenesChandler: You’re right, this is more fun.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesJoey: That’s her! Okay, come on! (They go over and open the door.)ScenesStripper: Hi!ScenesChandler: Hi. (Joey blows on a noisemaker.)ScenesStripper: So which one of you lucky boys is Chandler?ScenesJoey: Uh, that-that’s-that’s me!ScenesChandler: That’s me.ScenesJoey: Joey Tribbiani, a big fan.ScenesStripper: So is that a bedroom? (Points to the guestroom.)ScenesChandler: Yeah, yeah right over there.ScenesStripper: All right, whenever you’re ready. (She goes into the bedroom.)ScenesChandler: That was weird.ScenesJoey: Why-why would she go in the bedroom?ScenesStripper: I’m waiting.Scenes(They both slowly enter the bedroom and quickly walk back out.)ScenesChandler: So she’s a…ScenesJoey: Yeah, that’s one naked hooker!

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, Ross and Mona are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Mona: I love your place! Where is this guy from? (A statue from the top of his apothecary table.)ScenesRoss: Uh that’s an eighteenth century Indian artifact from Calcutta.ScenesMona: Oh wow! So, you’re more than just dinosaurs.ScenesRoss: So much more.Scenes(They start making out and she kicks the eighteenth century Indian artifact from Calcutta off of his apothecary table from the days of yore and the magical city of White Plains.)ScenesMona: Oh my God! Oh my God! I’m so sorry!ScenesRoss: Aw forget it, it’s from Pier One. (There’s an angry knock on the door.) Sorry. (Goes and opens the door to an irate Dr. Green.)ScenesDr. Green: You think you can knock up my daughter and then not marry her?! I’m gonna kill you!!ScenesRoss: Y’know this is actually not a great time for me.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Dr. Green: So? Come on! Explain yourself Geller! First you get my Rachel pregnant!ScenesMona: You got Rachel pregnant?!ScenesRoss: Who did?!ScenesDr. Green: You did!ScenesRoss: Yes. Yes, yes I did. (To Mona) But-but it was, it was just a one night thing. It meant nothing.ScenesDr. Green: Oh? Really? That’s what my daughter means to you? Nothing?ScenesRoss: No! No sir umm, she means a lot to me. I mean, I care—I-I love Rachel.ScenesMona: What?!ScenesRoss: (to Mona) Oh but not that way. I mean…I mean I’m not in love with her. I love her like a, like a friend.ScenesDr. Green: Oh really? That’s how treat a friend? You get her in trouble and then refuse to marry her?ScenesRoss: (to Dr. Green) Hey! I offered to marry her!ScenesMona: Wh…ScenesRoss: (To Mona) But I didn’t want to.ScenesDr. Green: Well why not? So you can spend your time with this tramp?!ScenesMona: Tramp?!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry. Dr. Green, Mona. Mona, Dr. Green.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Joey are discussing what to do about the now naked hooker in the guestroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can’t believe there is a naked hooker in there!ScenesJoey: Wait! Wait! Maybe she’s a hooker and a stripper, but she got confused about what she’s supposed to do.ScenesChandler: Could be. I mean technically she did strip, we just, we just missed it. (Walks towards the bedroom.) Ma’am, are you also a stripper?ScenesHooker: Uh, no. But I could pretend to strip, but that’s gonna cost extra. Okay, here’s the extras, handcuffs, spanking… (Chandler grunts for her not to continue and Joey pulls him back into the kitchen.)ScenesJoey: Maybe Monica’s playing a joke on ya. Y’know? Getting her own husband a hooker, that’s pretty funny.ScenesChandler: That is funny, maybe for my birthday she’ll murder someone.ScenesJoey: I bet Ross was in on it too. I mean he was conveniently busy.ScenesHooker: Do you mind if I smoke in here?ScenesChandler: Oh actually, I’d rather you…Yeah, go ahead. We’re gonna have to burn that room down anyway.

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Mona: How could you have kept all of this from me?ScenesRoss: I was going to tell you, but…ScenesDr. Green: But what?! You figured you’d get what you wanted and then dump her like you dumped Rachel!ScenesRoss: Hey! I did not dump Rachel! (To Mona) Nor are we still together. (The phone rings and Ross goes to answer it, only he’s trapped behind the apothecary table by Dr. Green.) Can I just… (Dr. Green glares at him.) Why don’t we just let the machine get that?ScenesJoey: (on machine) Hey Ross. It’s Joey. There’s a hooker over here and we thought maybe you’d know something about it.ScenesRoss: No! No! No! No! No! I-I-I-I—I need to, I need to lie down.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, she’s cooking as one of her waiters, Stu, comes over to talk to her.]
rows.Content: Stu: So, tonight’s the night of the big bachelor party?ScenesMonica: Yeah! Hey! Thanks for getting me that girl’s number.ScenesStu: No problem. So who’s the party for?ScenesMonica: My husband.ScenesStu: You hired your husband a hooker?ScenesMonica: She’s a stripper.ScenesStu: No, she’s a hooker.ScenesMonica: Is that, is that what they call strippers sometimes?ScenesStu: When they’re hookers.ScenesMonica: Oh my God Stu! I-I can’t believe you did this! Now are you absolutely sure she’s a hooker?ScenesStu: Either that or she’s just the best, most expensive date I ever had.Scenes(Monica runs out.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Joey and Chandler are still deciding what to do about the hooker.]
rows.Content: Joey: Maybe she meant to get you a hooker.ScenesChandler: Why would she do that?ScenesJoey: Maybe she wants you to learn something. Huh? Now is there anything you’re really bad at y’know, sexually?ScenesChandler: This is the worst bachelor party ever!ScenesHooker: What’s taking you boys so long?ScenesJoey: In a minute!ScenesChandler: (To Joey) In a minute? What’s gonna happen in a minute?!ScenesJoey: All right, all right maybe-maybe you should just ask her to leave.ScenesChandler: Why me?!ScenesJoey: Hey! It’s your bachelor party.ScenesChandler: Which is why you should do it.ScenesJoey: I don’t want to. You do it!ScenesChandler: You do it!ScenesJoey: You do it!ScenesChandler: All right Rock, Paper, Scissors who has to tell the whore to leave! (Joey smirks.) What?ScenesJoey: I miss this.ScenesChandler: I don’t think we’ve actually done this before!ScenesJoey: No, I-I miss hanging out with you.ScenesChandler: Well we…we still hang out.ScenesJoey: Not like we used to. Remember? You and me used to be inseparable. Y’know now it’s like…things are different.ScenesChandler: Well y’know, things are different. I’m…I’m married now.ScenesJoey: Oh sure—And hey, don’t get me wrong, I am so happy for you guys. I just…I miss…hanging out…just-just us, y’know?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I miss that too. I tell you what; from now on we’ll make time to hang out with each other.ScenesJoey: You got it. Come here. (They hug and are observed by the hooker.)ScenesHooker: Oh God! Listen, I am this close to robbing you guys. (Does the close sign.)ScenesMonica: (entering quickly) She’s a hooker! She’s a hooker! She’s a… (Stops as she sees her.) Hi! Uh, we spoke on the phone. (Goes and shakes the hooker’s hand.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are at the counter as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: So your dad dropped by. He’s a pleasant man!ScenesRachel: (quietly) Oh no…ScenesPhoebe: I’d better go. (She goes and sits down in the La-Z-Boy E-cliner 3000, the chair that Sit magazine called chair of the year, and they both look at her.) Just over here: I don’t want to miss the fight.ScenesRachel: Ross I’m so sorry. Okay. I-I will promise I will straighten this out with him tomorrow in person, or via e-mail.ScenesRoss: I don’t care about your dad! I care about Mona! She was there and now she’s totally freaked out!ScenesRachel: Oh okay, I’ll fix that to. What’s her e-mail address?ScenesRoss: Rachel!ScenesRachel: All right, I promise. I’ll fix this. I swear. I’ll-I’ll-I’ll-I’ll talk to her.ScenesRoss: Okay!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Thank you!ScenesPhoebe: That’s it?! You call that a fight? Come on! "We were on a break!" "No we weren’t!" What happened to you two?!

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, Ross is opening the door to Mona. Rachel is there as well.]
rows.Content: Ross: Thank you so much for coming back over.ScenesMona: Oh good, you’re here. Yeah, and I was worried that it was going to be uncomfortable.ScenesRachel: I know Mona, just hear me out. First of all, I’m so sorry about my father yelling at you, but I heard you totally held your own. You’re gonna have to tell me how you did that.ScenesRoss: Focus.ScenesRachel: Okay. Um…But—Okay, yes Ross and I used to date. And yes we are gonna have a baby. But we are definitely not getting back together.ScenesMona: How can I be sure on that?ScenesRachel: Oh we just—we drove each other crazy!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: I mean he was possessive, he was jealous, he could never just let the little things go!ScenesRoss: Trying to date this woman.ScenesRachel: Right! But, none of that compared to how kind and-and how gentle and thoughtful he is. (Rubbing his shoulder.)ScenesRoss: Probably shouldn’t touch me.ScenesMona: Y’know, I-I-I just…I don’t want to get in the middle of something so complicated.ScenesRachel: I know, I get it, but Mona, what relationship is not complicated? I mean we all have our baggage! You must too! Why else would you still be single? (Mona looks at her.) I am so gonna leave right now. (Ross opens the door for her and she leaves.)ScenesRoss: Should I leave this open for you too?ScenesMona: I’m not sure yet. Why didn’t you just tell me about all this?ScenesRoss: Because what’s going on with Rachel has nothing to do with how I feel about you.ScenesMona: Yeah? Well you still shoulda told me.ScenesRoss: I know and I was going to, but I thought it was better that you heard it from Rachel’s father. Look I…I made a mistake, but it’s only because I really, really like you. Really!ScenesMona: Okay, I guess you can…close the door now. (He does so and they kiss.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Forgot my purse! (Sees them kissing.) Oh, you guys made up. (To Mona) He’s a good kisser isn’t he? (Ross goes to close the door on her.) I’m going! (Quickly leaves and Ross locks the door.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, the bachelor party has ended and Monica is trying to explain herself to Chandler.]
rows.Content: Monica: I swear I didn’t know she was a hooker! I mean wh—Did you let her smoke in here?ScenesChandler: Her ass print is still on your grandmother’s quilt, do you really want to talk about smoking?ScenesMonica: Y’know what? I’m gonna make this up to you. I promised you a stripper (turns on the radio), and you’re gonna get a stripper. (She starts to strip.)ScenesChandler: Monica! Wait!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: (puts on his crown) Carry on.Scenes(She does so by taking off her jacket seductively, only she has trouble getting one hand out and slams the jacket on the chair angrily to remove it.)ScenesMonica: Ooh, these tennis shoes are so tight. I think I’ll take them off. (Goes to do so.)ScenesChandler: Could you not narrate?ScenesMonica: Gotcha sailor. (Kicks one of her shoes off and it lands in the kitchen knocking something down, but she continues to strip.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is being yelled at by her dad over the phone, and he’s been going on for so long Rachel is holding the phone away from her ear and reading a book.]
rows.Content: Dr. Green: (on phone) …just because you’re not in love with the guy you can’t…ScenesPhoebe: (entering, quietly) Wow, you told your dad the truth.ScenesRachel: About an hour ago.ScenesPhoebe: Wanna go see a movie?ScenesRachel: Yes! (She gets up and sets the phone on the counter without hanging it up.) Bye daddy. (Phoebe and her leave.)ScenesDr. Green: (on phone, not hearing her) …there’s gonna be a wedding! (Joey enters from his room and goes to get a beer from the fridge.) That’s unacceptable Rachel! What the hell does love have to do with it anyway?! There are more important things in a marriage other than love! (Joey hears something and looks around for the source.) …constantly thinking about things! You have to think about the consequences of your decision. (Joey finds that the sound is coming from the phone and puts it to his ear.)ScenesJoey: (on phone) Hey! I do too think about the consequences of my decisions! (Listens) What gives you the right to… (Listens) Go to hell! (Hangs up the phone and opens the fridge.) Stupid guy on my phone.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The RumorScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is reading What to Expect When You’re Expecting as Rachel enters from her bedroom.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Rach listen, did you know that during pregnancy your fingers swell up to twice their size and never go back.ScenesRachel: (looking at her fingers) Oh my…God! Let me see that! (Grabs the book from him.)ScenesJoey: (laughing) You fall for it every time!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: I brought you my old maternity clothes! (Sets a bag on the counter.)ScenesRachel: Oh Pheebs that’s so sweet—(Grabs a pair of pants)—Ooh, those are so cute!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! And look, (Grabs the pants) see how they expand as the baby grows? (There’s a stretchy part in front.) And then after the baby’s born, they’re great for shoplifting melons.ScenesMonica: (entering) Oh good you’re all here. Thanksgiving tomorrow, four o’clock. (To Rachel) Oh, guess who I invited. Remember that guy Will Colbert from high school?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMonica: He was in Ross’s class…marching band…kinda overweight? Well, really overweight. I mean I was his thin friend.ScenesRachel: Wow! I don’t remember him. Honey, are you sure you’re not talking about your imaginary boyfriend.ScenesMonica: No that was Jarred! Wow! I haven’t thought about him in a long time… (Stares off into the distance lost in thought.) (Pause) Anyway, umm Will’s, Will’s here on business and he didn’t have a place to go so I invited him here.ScenesRachel: Oh that’s nice.ScenesMonica: Oh, and by the way, he’s lost a bunch of weight. I mean he looks goo-ood! Okay, I mean really, really gorgeous! (Joey clears his throat.) I still love Chandler.ScenesJoey: I just want you to say it once in a while.ScenesMonica: All right okay, just so you know, I’m not gonna make a turkey this year.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesMonica: Well Phoebe doesn’t eat turkey…ScenesJoey: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Turkey’s are beautiful, intelligent animals!ScenesJoey: No they’re not! They’re ugly and stupid and delicious!ScenesMonica: All right! Okay, it’s just Phoebe. Will’s still on a diet, Chandler doesn’t eat Thanksgiving food, and Rachel’s having her aversion to poultry.ScenesJoey: She is?ScenesRachel: Remember I had to leave the room the other day when you had that roast chicken?ScenesJoey: Yeah. But I thought that was because I put the whole thing on my hand and made it walk across the table.ScenesMonica: Anyway, it just doesn’t seem worth it to make a whole turkey for just three people. Okay? It’s a lot of work.ScenesJoey: But you gotta have turkey on Thanksgiving! I mean, Thanksgiving with no turkey is like-like Fourth of July with no apple pie! Or Friday with no two pizzas!ScenesMonica: All right fine! If it means that much to you! But just—there’s gonna be a ton left over.ScenesJoey: No there won’t! I promise I will finish that turkey!ScenesMonica: All right, you’re telling me you can eat an entire turkey in just one sitting?ScenesJoey: That’s right! ‘Cause I’m a Tribbiani! (To Rachel) And this is what we do! I mean we may not be great thinkers or world leaders, we don’t read a lot or run very fast, but damnit! We can eat!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is watching football, and it’s actually the right game Green Bay at Detroit (although not this year’s), as Monica is getting everything ready.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, isn’t weird to think about how next year at this time they’ll be a little baby at the table? (Chandler turns around in horror.) (Seeing him) Rachel’s! But good to know where you’re at!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesMonica: You too!ScenesPhoebe: Anything I can do to help?ScenesMonica: Actually there is. Chandler usually helps me with this, but he’s really into the game so I don’t want to bother him. Could you help me fold these napkins? (Hands her a stack of them.)ScenesPhoebe: Sure!ScenesMonica: I’m gonna go across the hall to check on the yams.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (She starts folding the napkins in half.)ScenesMonica: No! No! No! No sweetie! No! Not like that! We’re not at a barn dance. You’ve gotta—you wanna fold them like swans. Like I showed you at Christmas time, remember?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, it all just came screaming back to me. (Monica exits.) (To Chandler) So how’s the game?ScenesChandler: I have no idea.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: Yeah! I’m just pretending to watch the game so I don’t have to help out with stuff.ScenesPhoebe: I don’t believe you! That is…brilliant! And Monica has no idea?ScenesChandler: Nope! Every once and a while I just scream stuff at the TV.Scenes(Monica enters and Chandler screams stuff at the TV.)ScenesMonica: Is your team winning hon?ScenesChandler: Yeah! Anderson just scored again! (To Phoebe) There’s no Anderson.ScenesPhoebe: Well I want to get in on this. Hey Mon? I don’t think I can help you after all, I didn’t realize this game was on.ScenesMonica: Oh, I didn’t know you liked football.ScenesPhoebe: Well normally I don’t, but y’know…(looks at the TV)…Green Bay is playing.ScenesMonica: You like Green Bay?ScenesPhoebe: Well it’s only like my favorite bay! {Actually, it’s not bad. It just gets a little cold in winter, but in Wisconsin winter only lasts from August to June. J }Scenes(Phoebe joins Chandler on the couch as there is a knock on the door which Monica answers.)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesWill: Hey!Scenes(Oh, I should point out that the live studio audience at this point goes absolutely wild. And I had absolutely no idea that this Will character was that popular! Maybe they should make him the seventh friend. Which would work out just fine since he’s already married to one of them. Will is played by some guy named Brad Pitt, I guess he’s some sort of actor.)ScenesWill: Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesMonica: Aww thanks! God Will I’m so glad that you came! You look great! You must’ve lost like…ScenesWill: 150 pounds. Yeah, I’m gonna be in one of those Subway sandwich commercials.ScenesMonica: A pie! (Will brought a pie.)ScenesWill: Oh right. All right, it’s no fat, it’s no sugar, it’s no dairy…it’s no good. Throw it out.ScenesMonica: You wanna meet some people? This is uh; this is my husband Chandler. Chandler, this is Will.ScenesWill: Hey.ScenesChandler: Oh hey. I’d shake your hand but uh; I’m really into the game. Plus, I think it’d be better for my ego if we didn’t stand right next to each other.ScenesMonica: This is Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: (nonchalantly glancing) Hey. (Turns back around.) Wow! (Looks up.) Well done.ScenesMonica: (to Will) Wanna give me a hand?ScenesWill: Sure! Monica, I can’t get over how great you look! You look stunning!ScenesMonica: Well you look incredible too! You’re just—you’re so fit!ScenesChandler: I’m watching the game, but I’m not deaf!ScenesMonica: Oh umm, I meant to tell you, Ross is coming.ScenesWill: Ross is coming. Great! I love Ross!ScenesMonica: Good. And Rachel Green too. (Will stops suddenly.)ScenesWill: Oh.ScenesMonica: Is there a problem?ScenesWill: Nope. Uh, it’s okay. It’s just uh, God I hated her.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesWill: Yeah, I hated her. She was horrible to me in high school. But hey, it was a long time ago, I’m in a good place, it might be actually fun to see her again. You got any cakes or cookies or something? (Starts looking.) No Will no!ScenesChandler: (To Phoebe) Y’know, it’s been a while since we’ve screamed something. Maybe we should.ScenesPhoebe: Oh okay.ScenesChandler: Oh come on!ScenesPhoebe: Noooo!! Damn you ref! You burn in hell!!!Scenes(Joey enters eating potato chips.)ScenesMonica: Hey, what are you doing? You gotta save room, you’ve got almost an entire turkey to eat.ScenesJoey: Let me explain to you how the human body works. I have to warm my stomach first. Eatin’ chips is like stretching.ScenesMonica: All right.ScenesJoey: Don’t worry, Tribbianis never get full.ScenesWill: I actually know what you’re talking about. I’m here to tell you something my friend, you can eat and eat and eat but nothing will ever fill that void.ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Who the hell is this guy?ScenesMonica: Will! From high school.ScenesJoey: Oh hey!ScenesMonica: (to Will) Joey.ScenesWill: Hello.ScenesRoss: (entering) Will!ScenesWill: Ross!ScenesRoss: Hey-hey you came! Man you look incredible! Hot stuff! (They hug and Ross realizes what he said.) Hot stuff?ScenesWill: It’s good to see you man.ScenesRoss: Yeah, you too. Man, so-so what are you up to?ScenesWill: I’m a commodities broker.ScenesRoss: Really? Yeah that-that sounds interesting.ScenesWill: Yeah, it’s not. But I’m rich and thin.ScenesRoss: Oh! Man I don’t think I’ve seen you since uh, Lance Davis’ graduation party.ScenesWill: That was such a fun night!ScenesRoss: Yeah. It would’ve been good if we had gotten in, but still real fun.ScenesWill: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesWill: God we were lame back then. Do you remember how into dinosaurs we were?ScenesRoss: (laughs) Yeah.ScenesWill: So what do you, what do you do now?ScenesRoss: So how long are you in town?ScenesRachel: (entering, carrying a baking dish) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey sweetie. Oh good. (Takes the baking dish from her.)ScenesWill: (glaring at Rachel) Rachel Green.ScenesRoss: Aw—oh, that’s right. Are-are you gonna be okay?ScenesWill: Oh, I’ll-I’ll be fine. Just God I hate her Ross! I hate her!ScenesRoss: Will, high school was-was a long time ago.ScenesWill: Look at her standing there with those yams! My two greatest enemies Ross: Rachel Green and complex carbohydrates.ScenesRachel: (sees Will) Oh my God Monica, who is that?ScenesMonica: That’s Will from high school!ScenesRachel: Oh! I do not remember him! Wow! He's really got that sexy, smoldering thing going on. (We see Will angrily staring at Rachel.) Oh my God, he’s… Look at the way he’s just staring at me. I think he’s trying to mouth something to me, but I can’t make it out. (Will mouths, "I hate you.")ScenesMonica: Okay, dinner’s ready!ScenesChandler: Good game!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Solid effort. Solid effort.ScenesMonica: Oh, so who won?ScenesPhoebe: (simultaneously) Green Bay.ScenesChandler: (simultaneously) Detroit.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Well the Lions technically won, but it was a moral victory for the Green Bay…Mermen.Scenes(They sit down at the table and Will goes to talk to Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Hi! Will, right?ScenesWill: Right.ScenesRachel: Hi! I’m Rachel Green.ScenesWill: Oh I-I remember you.ScenesRachel: Really?! Aren’t you sweet! I gotta tell you though, I am, I am having the hardest time placing you. Oh-oh hang on! Did we umm, did we fool around at Lance Davis’ graduation party?ScenesWill: You are unbelievable.ScenesRachel: Thank you!ScenesMonica: (breaking it up) Uh Rachel? Rachel, why don’t you sit here? (Next to Joey) And Will you sit way over there. (The other side of the table.)Scenes(Monica sets something on the table and removes the cover. It kinda looks like turkey.)ScenesJoey: That’s it?! Even if nobody helps me I can eat that no problem. At least give me a challenge!ScenesMonica: (laughs) This is Chandler’s chicken. This is the turkey. (Sets down a huge turkey.)ScenesJoey: (quietly) Oh. How-how big is that?ScenesMonica: About nineteen pounds.ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) It’s like me when I was born.ScenesRachel: All right, who would uh, like some yams? Will?ScenesWill: Oh, you’d like that wouldn’t ya?ScenesRachel: What? (Joey starts offering Ross some turkey.) Oh y’know what? Can we please keep the chicken and the turkey and everything on the other side of the table? The smell is just yuck!ScenesWill: (sneeze talks) Typical.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry. What?ScenesWill: I said it was typical. Typical of you, Rachel Green, Queen Rachel does whatever she wants in little Rachel land. (Does a fake hair flip.)ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Seriously, who is this guy?ScenesRachel: Umm, I’m sorry. Do you-do you have a problem with me?ScenesWill: I don’t know? Do I? Do I?ScenesPhoebe: I think you do.ScenesMonica: (To Rachel) Apparently you were umm, a little mean to him in high school.ScenesWill: A little mean? You made my life miserable!ScenesRachel: I’m-I’m—I had no idea. I’m sorry. I…ScenesWill: Well you should be. Screw it! Bring on the yams!ScenesMonica: Oh Will. But you-you’ve worked so hard…ScenesWill: Yams!!!!ScenesMonica: Okay. (Chandler grabs the dish from Monica and hands it to Will who starts dishing out a large helping.)ScenesRachel: Uh Will umm, I just want to say that I’m real sorry for whatever I-I did to you in high school…ScenesWill: Oh, it wasn’t just me. We had a club!ScenesRachel: You had a club?!ScenesWill: That’s right, The I Hate Rachel Green Club!ScenesRachel: Whoa! My God! So what, you all just joined together to hate me?! Who else was in this club?ScenesWill: Me and Ross. (Points at Ross.)ScenesRoss: No need to point, she knows who Ross is.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, scene continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (To Ross) So you were in an I Hate Rachel club?ScenesWill: Yes he was. (Holds up his hand for a high-five.)ScenesRoss: No. No.ScenesRachel: So who else was in this club?ScenesRoss: Uh actually, there-there was also that exchange student from Thailand but I-I don’t think he-he knew what it was.ScenesRachel: So Ross, we went out for two years, and you never told me you were in an I Hate Rachel club.ScenesWill: You went out with her?! We had a pact!ScenesRoss: That was in high school! It’s not like it was binding forever.ScenesWill: Then why did it have the word eternity in it?ScenesRachel: Okay Monica, did you know about this?!ScenesMonica: I swear I didn’t. (To Ross and Will) Hey! Is that why you guys used to go up to your bedroom and lock the door?ScenesRoss and Will: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Hmm, a little relieved, I gotta say.ScenesRoss: Look Rach I-I’m sorry, okay? I…I was a stupid kid, okay? The only reason I joined…ScenesWill: Co-founded!ScenesRoss: …co-founded. Co-founded the club was because I was insanely in love with you. Obviously I didn’t handle it very well. But if you think about it the I Hate Rachel Club was really the I Love Rachel Club.ScenesWill: Uh, except that it was really the I Hate Rachel Club.ScenesRachel: Okay. So what? You guys would just like get together and like just say mean things about me?ScenesWill: Well, we did a little more than that.ScenesRoss: No-no! No-no. No-no.ScenesPhoebe: What?! What else did you do?ScenesWill: We started a rumor.ScenesRachel: What rumor?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, come on Will! Just take off your shirt and tell us!ScenesRachel: Ross!ScenesRoss: It was no big deal. We-we…said that the rumor was…that umm…you had both…male and female reproductive parts.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesWill: That’s right! We said your parents flipped a coin, decided to raise you as a girl, but you still had a hint of a penis.ScenesRachel: (shocked) Oh my God!ScenesMonica: You started that?!ScenesRachel: What?! You heard that?! (Goes and stands behind Joey.)ScenesMonica: Everyone at our school heard it!ScenesChandler: Everybody at my school heard it! You were the hermaphrodite cheerleader from Long Island?!ScenesRachel: Oh no!!!! Oh my God!! This is all making so much sense to me now! This is why Adam Carter wouldn’t go out with me! This is why Billy Tratt would just stay in this region! (Motions to her breasts.) (Joey has turned around.)ScenesRoss: Actually, Billy Tratt is gay now. So-so that one’s not really our fault.ScenesRachel: Monica, how come you never told me this?!ScenesMonica: I thought it might be true. And I was afraid that you were gonna cry and then show it to me.Scenes(Joey is now looking at Rachel, and since Rachel’s standing and he’s sitting down and he’s not looking at her face… You get the picture.)ScenesRachel: Joey stop staring! There’s nothing there! It’s not true!ScenesJoey: I’m afraid I’m gonna need proof.ScenesRachel: Oh! (Hits him and storms out.)Scenes[Time Lapse, dinner has ended for everyone except Joey who looks like to have finished the turkey, until he turns the plate around and reveals he only ate one side.]ScenesJoey: You are my Everest.ScenesMonica: Joey, you don’t have to finish that.ScenesJoey: Oh yes I do. Otherwise what’s next? Today I’m just a guy who can’t finish a turkey, but tomorrow I’m the guy who eats half a Powerbar, wraps up the rest, and puts in the fridge? No! No, I just…I just—I gotta change my pants. (Gets up and heads for the door.) Jeans have no give. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: (entering carrying a book) Okay! Okay! Listen to what Sean McMahon wrote in my yearbook senior year, "Dear Rach, you’re such a good person." Not girl! Person!ScenesRoss: Rach, I think you’re reading a little too much into it.ScenesRachel: (reading what he wrote again) "Dear Rach, you’re a great person. Sorry about your tiney-wienie." (Will laughs.)ScenesRoss: Look, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to call everyone in the entire school and tell them it wasn’t true?!ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesWill: Could you also tell them I’m skinny now?ScenesMonica: Oh! Me too!ScenesRoss: Well look-look I’m not calling anybody! Okay? It was like a million years ago!ScenesRachel: I don’t care how long ago it was! You told people that I was half and half! Y’know what? I just want to point out I never did anything to hurt you in high school.ScenesMonica: That’s not totally true.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Well you-you did start that rumor about Ross making out with Mrs. Altman, our 50-year-old librarian.ScenesRoss: (shocked) (To Rachel) How did you know that?!!!!ScenesMonica: It’s true?!!ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: Yes it is! I saw you guys going at it behind the card catalog!Scenes(Ross is at a loss for words.)ScenesWill: Mrs. Altman? She also made out with Takaka Ci-Kek the night before he went back to Thailand.ScenesChandler: I’m sorry. When you were in high school you made out with a 50-year-old woman?ScenesRoss: Hey! She didn’t look 50!ScenesChandler: Did she look 16?ScenesRachel: Ohh, there’s a picture of her in the yearbook actually.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! (They all look.) Wow!ScenesRoss: She didn’t photograph well!ScenesChandler: Well, she probably wasn’t familiar with the process having spent most of her life sitting for oil paintings!ScenesPhoebe: So how did this happen? Did she, did she lure you to an early bird dinner?ScenesRoss: I was working late in the library one afternoon. It was just the two of us. She needed some help with her word jumble. And one thing led to another. If you must know, Anita was very gentle and tender. May she rest in peace…ScenesMonica: Didn’t she walk with a cane?ScenesRoss: Only when it was damp!! (To Rachel) I can’t believe you-you told people about this?! Everybody knew?! Y’know what? (To Will) I’m back in the club!ScenesWill: Yeah! (They high-five.)ScenesPhoebe: I wanna join!ScenesRachel: Wh—Phoebe!!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I never got to be in a club. I-I didn’t go to high school, but three of us would meet behind a dumpster to learn French. Bonjour.ScenesRachel: All right, y’know—Fine! You guys have your stupid little club, but I would just like to say is what you did to me is way worse than what I did to you! You gave me a tiney-wienie! (Will laughs.)ScenesMonica: All right, listen you’re just being silly. Rachel, even with that rumor you were one of the most popular girls in school and everyone wanted to be like you. One girl wanted to be like you so much she stuffed her pants with a Tootsie Roll!ScenesRachel: Wow…ScenesMonica: And Ross, if it weren’t for Rachel’s rumor I mean no one in high school would even know who you were. She put you on the map!ScenesRoss: As a romancer of the elderly.ScenesMonica: Hey! Mrs. Altman was the kind of woman you could tell she used to be pretty.ScenesRoss: The eyes…did still sparkle.ScenesMonica: Hey guys this stuff is just so way in the past. You-you’ve been through so much since then. And right now you’ve got so much more important stuff going on in your life. Can’t you just let this go?ScenesRachel: She’s right.ScenesRoss: Yeah. I mean we are having a baby together.ScenesWill: Hold on! You got her pregnant?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesWill: Are ya getting married?ScenesRoss: Nope.ScenesWill: So you knocked her up but you’re not gonna marry her. Dude! (Wants another high-five and Ross ignores him.) Anybody?ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Goes over and hugs him.) It’s exactly how I’d imagined it would be.ScenesJoey: (entering, wearing the maternity pants from earlier) All right where’s that turkey!ScenesPhoebe: Joey! Those are my maternity pants!ScenesJoey: Not now! These are my Thanksgiving pants!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Will has left and the rest of the gang is watching Joey finish the turkey.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well that’s it. I’m done. Whew! (Wipes his forehead.) There come the meat sweats. (Chandler hands him a towel and he wipes his face.)ScenesMonica: Well Joey, we’re all…we’re all very proud of you.ScenesChandler: Yes, I believe we can expect a call from the President any moment now.ScenesPhoebe: Is there anything we can do for you?ScenesJoey: No just, nobody press on my stomach.ScenesRachel: You can keep those pants by the way.Scenes(Joey notices Monica has gotten a pie.)ScenesJoey: Whoa—hey—wh-wh-what do you got there? What is that? Pie?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you want some?ScenesJoey: Ah, just cut me a little sliver. (Monica prepares to cut a little sliver.) A little bigger. (Monica prepares to cut a bigger piece.) Little bigger. (Monica moves the knife again.) What?! Are you afraid you’re gonna run out?! Cut me a real piece!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Monica’s BootsScenesTeleplay by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesStory by: Robert CarlockScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is trying on a pair of new boots as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey! So what do you think?ScenesChandler: New haircut? (Monica nods ‘No.’) Necklace? (No) Dress? (No) Boots? (Monica nods ‘Yes.’) Boots!ScenesMonica: Yes! Now, they’re a little more than I normally spend on boots…or rent (Shows him the receipt.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesChandler: I’m gonna miss being able to afford food.ScenesMonica: I’m sorry, they just, they just look so good! And the saleswoman was looking at me like, "Oh, these are way too expensive for you.ScenesChandler: She had a point. (Shows her the receipt.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! (Notices the boots) Oh Monica! Those boots are amazing!ScenesMonica: They’re mine!ScenesChandler: Yeah well, too bad we’re gonna have to return them.ScenesRachel: Return them?! Shh! They’re gonna hear you!ScenesMonica: Honey, I’m not returning them. Okay? I mean I-I know they cost a lot, but I’m going to wear them all the time. You’ll see. Besides, I love the compliments. I mean, have you ever had something so beautiful everyone wanted it?ScenesChandler: I have you.ScenesMonica: Nice try; I’m keeping the boots.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are sitting on the couch and Ross is talking to Rachel’s, who is now showing, stomach.]
rows.Content: Ross: That’s right, I love you! And-and I’m gonna play with you all the time.ScenesPhoebe: How can you let him talk to your crotch like that?ScenesRachel: (pause) He’s talking to the baby.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! Okay! Okay, cause when-when he said, "I can’t wait to hear your first words," I thought, "There’s a trick.ScenesRachel: Okay. Well, I gotta go you guys. I’ll see you later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRoss: Bye.ScenesRachel: Bye. (She gets up to leave but is stopped by Joey)ScenesJoey: Oh hey Rach, listen—Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesJoey: Umm, can you do me a favor? I was talkin’ to my sister and she knows you work at Ralph Lauren…ScenesRachel: No, forget it! No way! I am not sending anymore Ralph Lauren clothes to prison. It is a waste.ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no-no-no, not her, not her. My youngest sister, Dina, she’s really interested in fashion, and she wants to talk to someone successful, y’know, to give her some advice.ScenesRachel: I guess I can talk to one of my supervisors…ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no-no, she wants to talk to you!ScenesRachel: Really?! Oh my God! I’m successful!ScenesJoey: Okay, so will you meet with her?ScenesRachel: Yes! I’d love to! Have her come by the office.ScenesJoey: Great! Thanks! You’re gonna love her so much. And—Oh, she’s the smartest of all the Tribbiani children. Hey, y’know the S.A.T’s?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: She took ‘em!Scenes(Joey goes to get coffee and Rachel exits as the camera pans to Phoebe and Ross on the couch.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey Ross! Doesn’t Ben go to the Smithfield Day School?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Why?ScenesPhoebe: Sting has a son that goes there too!ScenesRoss: Yeah I know; he’s in Ben’s class.ScenesPhoebe: You knew this and you never said anything?! With all the stupid dinosaur stuff you tell us?!ScenesRoss: Fine! No more dinosaur stuff! Can I talk about fossils? (Joey is about to sit down and hears this so instead he groans and exits.)ScenesPhoebe: Sting’s son, seven years old and there’s a picture.ScenesRoss: What are you reading? The Kidnappers Guide to Manhattan Private Schools?ScenesPhoebe: No, it’s New York magazine. It’s an article about the best schools in the city. So how well do you know Sting?ScenesRoss: Uh, I actually haven’t even met him.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, yeah that’s too bad. I really want to go to his concert Friday night, but it’s totally sold out. I know! Why don’t you meet him and get tickets?! If you get two I’ll take you.ScenesRoss: Well actually, I’m picking Ben up tomorrow, maybe he’ll be there.ScenesPhoebe: There you go! Oh, you are so lucky! You might actually get to meet Sting tomorrow! That’s why you have kids!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the next day Rachel, Phoebe, and Chandler are there as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey.ScenesRachel: Hi Monica!ScenesMonica: Hey. (Sits down on the arm of the couch.)ScenesRachel: Hi boots.ScenesMonica: See Chandler? I’m getting a lot of use out of them already! They’re very practical. See, you can wear them with dresses, with skirts, with pants…ScenesChandler: You can wear them with shorts on a street corner and earn the money to pay for them. (Goes and gets some coffee at the counter.)ScenesPhoebe: Wow! They’re beautiful!ScenesRachel: Ahh…ScenesMonica: (almost crying) They hurt so much!ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesMonica: The guy who made these hates feet and wants to see them die!ScenesRachel: Well-well you can give them to me! I haven’t felt my feet in years!ScenesMonica: I can’t! I spent so much money on them and I told Chandler that I’d wear them all the time, I just can’t give them away!ScenesPhoebe: Well then get your money back and return them!ScenesMonica: I can’t do that either! The soles’ are already a little scuffed up and the insides are filled with my blood.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: (returning to his seat) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey I uh just picked up Ben from school…ScenesChandler: (spinning around looking for him) I don’t think you did a very thorough job!ScenesRoss: I dropped him off at Carol’s. (To Phoebe) Anyway, it turns out that I’m not going to be able to get those tickets though.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! Why not?ScenesRoss: Well it turns out that Ben and Sting’s son do not get along.ScenesPhoebe: How come?!ScenesRoss: Apparently, Sting’s son made fun of the fact that Ben’s moms are lesbinims.ScenesPhoebe: Wait! But Ross if they don’t get along then you should smooth things over. Make them be friends.ScenesRoss: Phoebe, you can’t force kids to be friends.ScenesPhoebe: Sure you can! Give them some blocks, put them in a playpen!ScenesRoss: Playpen?! Ben’s seven!ScenesPhoebe: Your kid is seven?! (Ross nods, "Yes.") (To the rest) He’s really small. (To Ross) Please! Please get the tickets!ScenesRoss: Look I’m sorry Pheebs, I can’t do it.ScenesPhoebe: Yes you can! Sting says so himself!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Rosssss can!ScenesRoss: Look Phoebe, I’m sorry it’s just…ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Rossss can!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, I…ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Rosss can! Give me the tickets! Ross can give me the tickets!!Scenes(Ross runs out to get the tickets.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, Joey has brought Dina to meet with Rachel.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering, with Dina) Here she is! Future fashion superstar!ScenesRachel: Oh Joey, I’m hardly a…ScenesJoey: My little sister Dina!ScenesRachel: Right! Hi Dina!ScenesDina: Hi.ScenesRachel: Nice to meet you. (They shake hands.)ScenesDina: Thanks so much for meetin’ with me. Joey’s told me so much about you!ScenesJoey: This is so exciting for her. Well, I’ll let you two fash…ists get down to business. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: Okay. All right Dina, well let’s talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. Let’s see, there’s design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. Uh, there’s-there’s sales, which is great because you get to travel…ScenesDina: I…I don’t care about fashion! I’m pregnant! And I know you are too, so you gotta help me!ScenesRachel: (stunned) And there’s marketing…

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Monica is returning, but before she enters the apartment she stops on the step and changes from wearing tennis shoes to the boots and she moans in pain as she puts each boot on.]
rows.Content: Monica: (standing up) Ahhhhhhhh!ScenesChandler: (opening the door) What’s wrong?ScenesMonica: Oh nothing I’m just—just was yawning. (Mimics the groan from before and stretches.)ScenesChandler: Oh don’t forget, my office holiday party is tonight. (They go into the apartment.)ScenesMonica: Honey, we don’t really have to go to this thing tonight do we?ScenesChandler: Now sweetie, I know you don’t like my office parties, but you can wear your new boots. See? Every cloud has a…supple leather lining.ScenesMonica: I-I don’t-I don’t think that I’m gonna wear the boots tonight.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesMonica: Well y’know, I’m just-I’m just worried that bosses will see them and think they pay you too much money. Or! Or your assistant will see them and-and want a raise!ScenesChandler: Do you think I work at some kind of boot pricing company?ScenesMonica: Anyway, I picked up this outfit that I want to wear and the, and the boots don’t really go with it.ScenesChandler: You said that you paid all that money because those boots go with skirts, dresses, and pants!ScenesMonica: Fine! If you want me to wear the boots, I’ll wear the boots. In fact, I’ll go into my room right now and y’know try the outfit on.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay? (She starts to walk which causes her to start crying) Ooo wee! Christmas party in my boots! (Runs into the bedroom and mixes saying ‘ow’ with laughing.)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Rachel is about to enter her apartment with Dina to tell Joey the news.]
rows.Content: Dina: I-I can’t go in there. I can’t tell him!ScenesRachel: Honey, it’s going to be okay. He’s been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; that’s what the meatball sub is for. (She gives Dina a sandwich wrapped in aluminum foil.)ScenesDina: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(They enter.)ScenesJoey: Hey! It’s my fashion girls! (They don’t react.) What’s wrong?ScenesRachel: Honey, why don’t you sit down? Dina has something that she wants to tell you.ScenesJoey: (concerned) Oh. What’s, what’s going on? Is it mom? Is she sick? Is it dad’s heart? Is that a sandwich?ScenesDina: Joe, mom and dad are fine…ScenesJoey: Is that a sandwich?!ScenesRachel: Joey…there’s something that you…should know. Dina?ScenesDina: I’m pregnant.ScenesJoey: (angrily) What?!ScenesRachel: (To Dina) Now! Give him the sandwich! Give him the sandwich! (She quickly sets the sandwich in front of him.)ScenesJoey: Well obviously this is a mistake! You can’t be pregnant! Because you have to have sex to get pregnant!ScenesDina: Joe, I tried to wait until I was 25 like you did!ScenesRachel: What?! Dina…ScenesJoey: (to Rachel) Bub!!! (Points at her and quiets Rachel.) (To Dina) I can’t believe this! You’re the good one! You went to college! Both years! Who did this to you?!ScenesDina: Bobby Corso, but he’s a real nice guy. I like him a lot. He’s real funny.ScenesJoey: You got pregnant for funny?! Dina…if he’s funny…laugh! All right, I’ll be back in a little while! You stay here!ScenesDina: Why? Where are you going?ScenesJoey: I can’t look at you right now! (Exits and slams the door behind him.)ScenesDina: Wow.ScenesRachel: I know.Scenes(Joey storms back in and covering his face so he doesn’t see Dina grabs the sandwich and heads back out.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Midfield Day School, it’s after school and Ben is taking a drink of water as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, there you are Ben!ScenesBen: Aunt Phoebe, what are you doing here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I heard you’re having a problem with one of the boys in your class. And so I thought I would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. Now umm, the boy’s name is Sting’s son.ScenesBen: Jack? I hate him! He’s a jerk.ScenesPhoebe: Now Ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.ScenesBen: I have to go. My friend Doug is waiting for me over there. (Goes over to Doug.)ScenesPhoebe: Him you’re friends with. (Starts looking at the children trying to find Jack and a teacher notices her.)ScenesThe Teacher: Excuse me. Can, can I help you with something?ScenesPhoebe: Yes! Yes you can, I’m looking for Jack’s parents.ScenesThe Teacher: Are you with one of the students?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, I’m with Ben.ScenesThe Teacher: Are you one of Ben’s mothers?ScenesPhoebe: I am one of Ben’s mothers. I’m a lesbian. It was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.ScenesThe Teacher: Well hi, I’m Jenny Boone. I’m the new teacher here.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesThe Teacher: I’ve only met your partner Carol.ScenesPhoebe: Ah! Okay so that would make me Susan.ScenesThe Teacher: Right. Are you looking for Jack’s parents to discuss the problems he’s having with Ben? (Phoebe nods ‘Yes.’) Yeah. Because I really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Let’s do that!! That-that sounds good. We should sit down and talk, just me, my lover Carol, and the Stings. Umm, how-how will I get in touch with them?ScenesThe Teacher: Oh, their number is on the contact sheet.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Umm, could-could I get a copy of that? ‘Cause Carol threw it out, she lost ours. She’s such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

rows.Scenes: A Street, Chandler and Monica are walking down the sidewalk after his office holiday party.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Y’know, that party wasn’t bad.ScenesMonica: Yeah! I didn’t know there would be dancing. That was a fun surprise!ScenesChandler: I don’t see any uh, cabs. Maybe we should just walk?ScenesMonica: Oh no, we can’t walk!ScenesChandler: What honey, it’s like fifteen blocks to the subway. Let’s go.ScenesMonica: Hey! Do you think that we can get to the subway right there if we climb down through the manhole cover?ScenesChandler: What’s going on?ScenesMonica: I can’t walk. Okay? Okay? These boots were a huge mistake!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: Okay you were right! All right, I never should have bought them! They’re killing me! One toe at a time!ScenesChandler: So I was right. This is what it feels like to be right. (Pause) It’s oddly unsettling.ScenesMonica: How are we gonna get home? Maybe a piggy-back ride?ScenesChandler: Hop on.ScenesMonica: Okay. Wait, just give me a second, I need to just get my boots off first. (She starts taking them off.) Ah…Ooh…Oohh…Ohh…Oh God…Ohh…Oh…Ohh…Ohhhh…ScenesChandler: Honey, I know you’re in pain right now, but I’m a little turned on.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Dina and Rachel are reading pregnancy books, Dina Pregnancy for Dummies and Rachel something else.]
rows.Content: Dina: Do you ever worry that you’ll be walking and your baby will just like slip out?ScenesRachel: What college was that Dina?Scenes(Joey enters dragging a guy.)ScenesDina: Oh my God! Bobby!ScenesBobby: Hi Dina. Good to see you.ScenesRachel: Joey, what are you doing?ScenesJoey: Just what needs to be done! Dearly beloved, we are gathered here to join this man and this woman…ScenesRachel: Oh Joey this is crazy!ScenesJoey: Don’t interrupt me when I’m talkin’ to God! Now where were we? Oh right, okay. Do you Dina, take this man…ScenesDina: No!ScenesJoey: Oh you’ll take ‘em!ScenesDina: No I won’t!ScenesJoey: Hey! You don’t get a say in this!ScenesDina: Yes I do!ScenesJoey: Ahhh! I heard "I do", we’re halfway there! Okay! (To Bobby) You!ScenesRachel: All right Joey! That is enough! (Grabs him and pulls him away from Bobby and Dina) Listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, it’s not legal. Okay? They-they don’t have a marriage license, they don’t have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!ScenesBobby: Yeah, he took the other one off and hit me with it.ScenesJoey: Well what am I supposed to do?ScenesRachel: You’re supposed to realize that they are adults! And that they can make their own decisions.ScenesJoey: No they can’t! They were stupid enough to get knocked up!ScenesRachel: Heyyyyy! Contraceptives are not always effective! (To Bobby and Dina) Right?ScenesBobby: Yeah…we kinda didn’t use any…ScenesRachel: Oh, come on kids! A little help here!

rows.Scenes: Sting’s Apartment, Phoebe has come to talk about Jack and is waiting for Sting’s wife, Trudie Styler, to enter.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Wow! This place is incredible! (Gasps) Sting’s pen…that he gave to Phoebe. (Puts the pen in her purse and goes over to a floor-to-ceiling bookcase) Come on! Secret passageway! (Starts pulling books at random as Trudie enters.)ScenesTrudie Styler: Hi! (By the way, it’s actually her.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesTrudie Styler: I’m Trudie.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesTrudie Styler: You must be Ben’s mum.ScenesPhoebe: Why else would I be here?ScenesTrudie Styler: Do sit down.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. (They go and sit down.)ScenesTrudie Styler: I gather Jack and Ben haven’t been getting along lately.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesTrudie Styler: I’m told there are two sides to this story, but all I’ve heard is that Ben’s a bit of a poo-poo head.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I’m sorry. Won’t-won’t Jack’s father be joining us?ScenesTrudie Styler: Oh I’m sorry, Jack’s father is not available.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm. Okay. Well then, could we reschedule? For say, Friday night perhaps at 8 o’clock?ScenesTrudie Styler: Oh no, I know that wouldn’t work. My husband’s in concert.ScenesPhoebe: Concert. Yeah. That does put us in…quite a pickle. Because you see I’m very busy before and after the concert, and he’s obviously busy during.ScenesTrudie Styler: So, I guess you and I should talk about Jack and Ben right now.ScenesPhoebe: Unless! Unless umm, okay I-I would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.ScenesTrudie Styler: Are you here for tickets?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank you. Four would be great.ScenesTrudie Styler: I’m not giving concert tickets to someone who’d use their son like this!ScenesPhoebe: Oh good! Then you’re in luck! Ben’s not my son!ScenesTrudie Styler: (stands up) Look, I’ve just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. Any minute now, the police will be here!ScenesPhoebe: The Police? Here? A reunion?! (She gets out her camera.)

rows.Scenes: The Street, Chandler is carrying Monica past a store window.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, ten blocks down. Five to go.ScenesMonica: (notices something in the window) Oh wait! Stop! Stop! Stop!ScenesChandler: Oh I’m sorry! Do you need a break?ScenesMonica: My boots in tan! Hey! Can you get a little closer so I can see the price?ScenesChandler: I can see it from right here. It’ll cost you one husband.ScenesMonica: Okay, I’m sorry. I think I can walk the rest of the way now. Just-just give me my boots.ScenesChandler: (pause) I don’t have your boots.ScenesMonica: Well I don’t have them either. Where are they?ScenesChandler: Well, why don’t you check in one of my saddlebags while I chew on a bale of hay!ScenesMonica: Okay. (She gets off him.) God well, we gotta go back and get them!ScenesChandler: Honey, are you seriously ever gonna wear the boots again?ScenesMonica: Okay, I’m never gonna wear them again. I just didn’t get a chance to say goodbye.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? You can say goodbye to the tan ones.ScenesMonica: Okay. (Climbs back on his back.) All right.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Moves closer to the window.)ScenesMonica: (to the boots) Bye boots—Wait! Half off?! (Chandler runs off.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Rachel are still discussing Bobby and Dina’s situation.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!ScenesJoey: Oh? Oh! Okay! Okay! Let’s hear their plan! Now, what’s the future look like for Dina and Bobby?ScenesBobby: Well…I really have high hopes for my band.ScenesJoey: (to Dina) You were right. He is funny.ScenesRachel: Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?ScenesBobby: Well it’s just me and my pal Rooster, the band’s name is Numb Nuts.ScenesRachel: (To Dina) Really? (Nods her head at Bobby.)ScenesJoey: Dina, if you’re having a baby you should be married! Even if it is to Bobby! (Bobby gets happy.) Dude, that’s not a compliment!ScenesDina: No Joey! I knew you wouldn’t be supportive!ScenesJoey: So whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! What are you gonna do? You’re gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself…without a husband?! You can’t be a single mother alone! You’re gonna ruin your life!ScenesRachel: Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?ScenesJoey: No! No! No! It’s different for you. You’re so strong and together. You’re not some dumb kid who doesn’t know what she’s doing.ScenesDina: Excuse me?ScenesJoey: One pregnant woman at a time, please! I just want you to be okay.ScenesRachel: So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?ScenesJoey: Maybe! (To Bobby) Well! Well…so-so uh, what kind of music does Numb Nuts—Oh forget it! I can’t!ScenesDina: Joey, I am scared to death about this. But I really think I can do it, I’m just gonna need some help. And Bobby’s gonna be here the whole time.ScenesBobby: You bet I am! (To Joey) And to answer your earlier question, we’re straight-up gangster rap. (Joey shakes his head as if he’s about to lose it.)ScenesDina: Look, Rachel’s told me how much easier you’ve made all this on her. Why can’t you do that for me?ScenesJoey: Because! ‘Cause… ‘Cause you’re my baby sister!ScenesDina: And you’re my big brother! I mean, you’re my favorite guy in the whole world. I’m not even scared to tell mom and dad. I was scared of telling you.ScenesJoey: Well I’d be scared of them, but all right.ScenesDina: Joey, I can’t stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. I want him to have his uncle. Is my baby gonna have his Uncle Joey?ScenesJoey: Of course he’s gonna have his Uncle Joey!ScenesDina: We’re gonna be all right. I mean, even if we’re not married this baby is gonna be so loved. Not just by us.ScenesJoey: That’s right! By his uncle too!ScenesBobby: And by you.ScenesRachel: Okay Bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment. (Drags Bobby away from Joey and Dina.)ScenesJoey: Come here! (Hugs Dina and Bobby looks to hug Rachel.)ScenesRachel: No! Seriously! What’s wrong with you?!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Ross are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: You’re gonna love me so much. I got Sting tickets!! (Holds up two.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! I do love you! How did you do it?!ScenesRoss: Well…let’s just say… (singing) Rosss caaaaan!ScenesPhoebe: Oo, where are the seats?ScenesRoss: Uh, middle balcony.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, now would you say that that’s more than 50 yards away from Sting, his wife, or a member of his family?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Then that’s not breaking the law! I’m there!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Ross’ Big Step ForwardScenesWritten by: Robert CarlockScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is looking around the shop as Phoebe returns from getting some more coffee.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Look at that guy by the window, wow!ScenesPhoebe: He’s awfully short and I think he’s talking to himself. And to be completely honest, he’s not that good in bed.ScenesRachel: Oh, what is wrong with me lately? I mean it’s like every guy I see—I mean look here. (Points behind them) Look at that guy for example, I mean normally that’s not someone I would-would be attracted to, but right now, with the way I’m feeling, all I want to do is rip off his sweatpants and fanny pack.ScenesPhoebe: Wait a second! This is about the fourth month of your pregnancy, right?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: This is completely normal, around the fourth month your hormones start going crazy.ScenesRachel: Really?! So this has happened to you?ScenesPhoebe: Oh absolutely yeah! Oh and keep in mind, now, I was carrying triplets so in, y’know, medical terms I was-I was thrice as randy.ScenesRachel: Wow! This explains so much! Last weekend, I went from store to store sitting on Santa’s lap.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Yeah, I remember trying to steal a cardboard cutout of Evander Holyfield from a Foot Locker.ScenesRachel: Ah.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Well, y’know what? I go see my doctor tomorrow, I’ll ask her about this. Maybe she can give me a pill or something.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Yeah, that’s what you need a good…pill.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are there as Mona enters.]
rows.Content: Mona: Hey! (To Joey) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesMona: Hi! Look! I got our pictures developed from Rockefeller Center.ScenesRoss: Oh great! Hey-hey Joey, do you want to check out pictures of me and Mona ice skating?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, ordinarily I would love too, but I am just swamped right now. (Brushes something off of his shirt and looks around, but doesn’t move from his chair.)ScenesRoss: Hey where-where are the pictures that creepy pretzel vendor took of us together?ScenesMona: Oh yeah, probably at the end. (Flips to the end.) Oh my God! He only took pictures of my breasts!ScenesJoey: I’m missin’ picture time?! (Jumps over to look, Ross glares at him and he retreats.)ScenesPhoebe: (sitting down next to Ross) Y’know she has a face Ross!ScenesMona: Okay. Okay, here’s a good one of us.ScenesRoss: Wow! That is a good one! Wow, it looks like a, like a holiday card y’know, with the tree in the middle and the skaters and the snow.ScenesMona: Y’know, every year I say I’m gonna send out holiday cards and I never do it. Do you wanna, do you wanna send this one out together?ScenesRoss: (pause) Together? Like-like to people?ScenesMona: Yeah, y’know. Happy holidays from Mona and Ross. It’ll be cute, okay?ScenesRoss: Okay. (Not happy about it.)ScenesMona: Oh, I gotta get to work. So call me later?ScenesRoss: Uh sure, sure.ScenesMona: Bye guys.ScenesPhoebe: Bye.Scenes(Mona exits.)ScenesJoey: (To Ross) Congratulations! You just got married!ScenesRoss: I know. Can you believe that?ScenesPhoebe: Wait, I’m-I’m sorry. What’s the big deal about a holiday card?ScenesRoss: Married couples send out cards, families send out cards, people who have been dating for a couple of months do not send out cards! What-what is she crazy?!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey, hey that’s your wife you’re talking about!

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office, his boss Doug is entering, Monica is there as well.]
rows.Content: Doug: Bing! Ho! And the Bing-ette!ScenesChandler: Honey, you remember my boss Doug right?ScenesMonica: Yes, hi.ScenesDoug: Hi. So good news, the divorce is final. I signed the papers this A.M.ScenesChandler: I didn’t know you and Carol were getting divorced, I’m sorry.ScenesDoug: Sorry? Finally chewed my leg out of that bear trap. Hey, congratulations to you guys though!ScenesMonica: No leg-chewing for us sir.ScenesDoug: Oh well, give it time. So the divorce, the marriage, we’ve got a lot to celebrate. How about we all go out to dinner tomorrow night?ScenesMonica: I can’t think of anything we’re doing. (Quietly) Why can’t I think of anything we’re doing?ScenesDoug: Tomorrow night it is then, I should be out of court by six. They keep throwing these sexual harassment cases at me and I keep knocking them out of the park!ScenesMonica: Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow! (Doug exits.) Just so you know, we’re not seeing him tomorrow. (Chandler wonders why.) I-I cannot spend another evening with that man. Do you remember how he behaved at our wedding?ScenesChandler: No.ScenesMonica: That’s because he wasn’t invited because of the way he behaved at our engagement party.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah. Boy, urine cuts right through an ice sculpture doesn’t it?

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, there’s a knock on the door and he opens it to Mona.]
rows.Content: Mona: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMona: Hey, I went by the photo shop, take a look, here is a mockup of our card. What do you think?ScenesRoss: Huh. Wow, this is great.ScenesMona: Now, do you think it should say, "Love Ross and Mona?ScenesRoss: Well, we-we haven’t said that to each other yet, but I guess its okay to say it to other people.ScenesMona: How many did you want? I’m getting a hundred.ScenesRoss: A hundred?! Well, I-I guess I’ll take a—Mona, uh…I-I’m not sure about the whole uh, card thing.ScenesMona: Really? Why not?ScenesRoss: Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just don’t know if we’re really quite there yet.ScenesMona: Oh y’know, I didn’t think of it that way. You’re right. You’re right. So, can I ask you a question?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMona: Where are we?ScenesRoss: Huh.ScenesMona: Y’know, like where are we? Where is this relationship going?ScenesRoss: Hmm…ScenesMona: I mean I love spending time with you, y’know I just—I hope we’re moving forward. I mean, we should probably talk about that. Don’t you think?Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRoss: Let’s do the card!ScenesMona: What?ScenesRoss: The card! I think we’re there!ScenesMona: Okay. I—But I think we should still have this conversation.ScenesRoss: Really?! I mean, even with the card?

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Doctor’s Office, she is waiting for her doctor as a nurse enters.]
rows.Content: Nurse: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesNurse: Just so you know, Dr. Long can’t be here today, she was called to the hospital, so Dr. Schiff will be seeing you.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay. Hey, can I ask you a question? Was it me, or-or was the guy who took my blood sample really cute? Y’know who I’m talking about, bald haircut, hairy fingers… (Stops when she realizes it was her.)ScenesDr. Schiff: (entering) Hi Rachel? I’m Dr. Schiff. (By the way, he’s an attractive man.)ScenesRachel: Yes, you are.ScenesDr. Schiff: So, how’s it going?ScenesRachel: Oh, really, really good. But enough about me, come on! Where-where are you from? What do you do?ScenesDr. Schiff: I’m a doctor.ScenesRachel: Right! Right! I-I actually meant in your spare time, do you cook? Do you ski? Or do you just hang out with your wife or girlfriend?ScenesDr. Schiff: Uh, I don’t have a wife or girlfriend, but I do like to ski.ScenesRachel: Oh, I love to ski! How amazing is this?!ScenesDr. Schiff: So, are you experiencing any discomfort?ScenesRachel: No. I’m very comfortable.ScenesDr. Schiff: Any painful gas?ScenesRachel: No! Shoot, Dr. Schiff what kind of question is that?!ScenesDr. Schiff: Okay then, would you like to lie down on the table?ScenesRachel: Well would you like me to lie down on the table?ScenesDr. Schiff: I’m sorry, is there something going on here?ScenesRachel: Do you feel it too?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi.ScenesPhoebe: Oh hey! So, how did your doctor’s appointment go?ScenesRachel: Well, let’s see. Uh, they gave me cute doctor today and in the middle of the exam I put my pinky in his chin dimple.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God.ScenesMonica: Why did you do that?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, remember that little problem I was having during my fourth month of pregnancy?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, the Evander Holyfield phase. Oh man you were so hard up you practically came on to me.ScenesPhoebe: You wish.ScenesMonica: Hey, I could’ve had you if I wanted you.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah? Come and get it.ScenesRachel: Okay, even this is turning me on!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Oh hey! Hey Ross! Hey how’s it, how’s it going with you and Mona? Are you guys still together?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, yeah we’re moving forward. You’ll be getting our card!ScenesMonica: You and Mona are doing a holiday card together?ScenesRoss: Yeah, we’re not just doing a card! Y’know, she-she also wants to have the conversation about where the relationship is going.ScenesPhoebe: Ugh! Women!ScenesRoss: I know! I know! Why do you guys need to have this conversation?! Huh? I mean no self-respecting man would ask a woman, "So, where is this going?ScenesRachel: Uh Ross? You asked me that.ScenesRoss: Hey! You were a closed book! Okay? I’m not a mind reader! Besides, I hate those conversations. I’m horrible at them. Really! Maybe-maybe I need kind of a gesture. Y’know, something that says we’re moving forward without having to talk about it.ScenesMonica: Like asking her to move in with you?ScenesRoss: Smaller than that.ScenesMonica: Making her a mixed tape?ScenesRoss: Uh, bigger than that.ScenesPhoebe: Give her a key to your apartment.ScenesRoss: Whoa-hello! We were closer with the mixed tape.ScenesMonica: All right. Have you said, "I love you?" You could say, I love you.ScenesRoss: Yeah I-I don’t-I don’t think I’m quite there yet, but I could say I looove spending time with you.ScenesPhoebe: No, we hate that.ScenesMonica: That is a slap in the face.ScenesRoss: Forget it. I-I—Y’know what? I’ll just have the conversation. I’ll just say I like things the way they are, and hope for the best. What do you think Rach?ScenesRachel: I think, if it was a little colder in here I could see your nipples through that sweater.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office, Doug is entering.]
rows.Content: Doug: Bing! We’re all set for tonight, 8 o’clock.ScenesChandler: Oh uh, as it turns out, we can’t do it. Monica has to work.ScenesDoug: Oh, my ex-wife didn’t work, unless you call turning into her mother work. Fine. Tomorrow night then.ScenesChandler: Oh uh well tomorrow’s no good for her either.ScenesDoug: Oh? Why not?ScenesChandler: It’s the semi-finals…of her…botchy ball tournament.ScenesDoug: What’s going on Bing? Does uh, your wife have a problem with me or something?ScenesChandler: Well now-now you’re just talking crazy.ScenesDoug: So why can’t the three of us go out together?ScenesChandler: Because uh…we-we…we split up. Monica and I split up. Hold me.ScenesDoug: Good God Bing I…well I can’t say I’m altogether surprised, I saw the way she looked at you, and there was no love there. And the way she looked at me, pure lust.ScenesChandler: Y’know what would really help me through this tough time is choking something. Can I choke ya?ScenesDoug: Bing my boy, we’re gonna get you over this. Now here’s the plan, grab your coat, we’re going to a strip club.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, Monica would freak. (Doug looks at him.) But to hell with that bitch.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is getting Mona some coffee.]
rows.Content: Ross: Here we go. Mona umm, I think it’s time we-we had a conversation about-about where things are with us.ScenesMona: Yeah, I-I think I suggested that.ScenesRoss: Aw, we-we are so…(Motions that they’re connected.) So umm, well I-I-I like you and I-I love umm, y’know hanging out with you. And I mean-I’m having a lot of fun. (He pauses and thinks there might be more, but decides there isn’t.)ScenesMona: Okay.ScenesRoss: I mean, there’s no point in spending time with someone if-if it’s just fun. It’s gotta be, it’s gotta be going somewhere right? So where-where is it going? (Pause) Ah! That’s-that’s the real question. And-and the answer is…is it’s going somewhere…fun. Now I-I know what you’re thinking, fun was fine for you like ten years ago y’know, but you’re-you’re not getting any younger. No I mean—No not you, not you, you—you are getting younger. I mean—you-you look like you’re getting younger by the second—What’s your secret?ScenesMona: I’m sorry, so umm, so where are we?ScenesRoss: Well, well to sum up, we’re having fun, you look young.ScenesMona: Okay…ScenesRoss: But that’s not enough. So… So…here’s a key to my apartment. (Hands her his key.)ScenesMona: Really?!ScenesRoss: Really.ScenesMona: You don’t think this is too fast.Scenes(Ross groans no.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Ross is telling Rachel and Monica about yet another mistake he’s made with a woman.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You gave her a key to your apartment?!ScenesRoss: Not just a key, I gave her the only key! I am now a homeless person in a very serious relationship.ScenesPhoebe: (entering with some guy) Hey. Ooh Ross! How’d the conversation go?ScenesRoss: Oh great, I live on the street.ScenesPhoebe: Where?! (Ross exits.)ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hi! Okay, Monica, Rachel, this is my friend Roger.ScenesRoger: Hey everybody.ScenesMonica: Hi Roger.ScenesPhoebe: So umm, I’m gonna get us some drinks. (To Rachel) Would you help me out?ScenesRachel: Yeah. (They go into the kitchen.)ScenesPhoebe: Umm, he’s here to have sex with you.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: You’re welcome.ScenesRachel: Phoebe no!ScenesPhoebe: It’s okay, he’s a virgin.ScenesMonica: Rachel umm, I was just talking to this guy and I think he’ll have sex with you.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay let’s leave these two alone.ScenesRachel: No! I do not care what my hormones are doing, I am not going to just do it with some random guy!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! Then you tell Roger because he was really looking forward to this! (Phoebe exits.)

rows.Scenes: A Strip Club, Doug and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Doug: Oh Bing, look at those twin sisters dancing together. Let me buy you a lap dance with those girls. Huh?ScenesChandler: Oh that’s all right sir, and that’s just one girl.ScenesDoug: Bing—What’s this?! (Grabs his hand.)ScenesChandler: It’s a hand. It’s a thing you use as a Jack and Coke holder.ScenesDoug: No, it’s a wedding ring. You gotta get rid of it. We’re gonna go to the East River right now and throw it in there!ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no!ScenesDoug: Oh yeah-yeah-yeah, y’know I did it and I felt a hell of a lot better and if you whip it just right you might hit a seagull in the head.

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, a locksmith has finished changing the locks on Ross’s door.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, and oh I’m gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.ScenesMona: (entering) Hey Ross, what’s going on? You changing the lock?ScenesRoss: No. That guy is.ScenesMona: I don’t understand. You-you give me a key to your apartment and then you change the lock.ScenesLocksmith: Good luck buddy. (Exits.)ScenesMona: Umm, I-I thought we were moving forward and now you’re-you’re sending me all these mixed signals. What are you trying to tell me?ScenesRoss: I’m trying to tell you I made you a mix tape.ScenesMona: What?ScenesRoss: I love you!ScenesMona: Ohh! (Hugs him.) And I love spending time with you. (Ross isn’t happy.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is eating dinner as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi honey I’m home.ScenesMonica: From the tequila factory?ScenesChandler: It was awful. To get out of going to dinner with Doug I told him that you and I split up. So then he took me to all these strip clubs and sleazy bars, and then when I wouldn’t give him my wedding ring, he threw a soda can at a bird!ScenesMonica: Come here. I can breath through my mouth.ScenesChandler: Y’know what the worse part was? I got to see what my life would be like without you. It was like It’s a Wonderful Life with lap dances. Please promise that you will never leave me, that we will grow old together, and be with each other for the rest of our lives.ScenesMonica: I promise. Hey, speaking of together, how about we send out a holiday card this year?ScenesChandler: Ooh, I don’t know if we’re there yet.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is on the phone.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Yes. Hi, I’d like to order a pizza. Okay, can I ask you a question? Is-is the cute blond guy delivering tonight? Very Ambercrombie & Fitch. (Joey enters.) I’ll call you back.ScenesJoey: Who was that?ScenesRachel: It’s just the pizza place.ScenesJoey: You hung up on the pizza place? I don’t hang up on your friends.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry honey, I’m just having a, having a rough day.ScenesJoey: Oh, what’s wrong?ScenesRachel: Oh you really, you really just don’t want to hear about it.ScenesJoey: Then why did I ask?ScenesRachel: Okay, it’s just—and this is really embarrassing—but lately with this whole pregnancy thing I’m just finding myself…how do I put this umm, erotically charged.ScenesJoey: Is that college talk for horny?ScenesRachel: Yeah. So y’know, I have all of these feelings and I don’t know what to do about them, because I can’t date like a normal person, which is fine because I don’t need a relationship, I mean all I really want is one great night. Just sex, y’know? No strings attached, no relationship, just with someone that I feel comfortable with and who knows what he’s doing. For just one great night, I mean is that really so…hard…to find. (Looks at Joey.) So how was your day?ScenesJoey: Good, I uh, I saw a pretty big pigeon.ScenesRachel: Well, I gotta get up early and it’s almost seven o’clock.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I gotta, I gotta go to my room too.ScenesRachel: Okay, good night!ScenesJoey: Good night. (They both enter their rooms.)Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: (entering) I can’t do it!ScenesRachel: (entering) I didn’t ask you to do it!ScenesJoey: You’re Rachel!ScenesRachel: You’re Joey!ScenesJoey: You’re my friend!ScenesRachel: Right back at ya!ScenesJoey: But plus, it would be wrong and weird and-and-and bad.ScenesRachel: And so bad. I don’t even know what you’re talking about because I didn’t ask you to do anything!ScenesJoey: I know!Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: Do you wanna do it?ScenesRachel: No!ScenesJoey: All right, me neither! I was just testing you!ScenesRachel: That’s the end of this conversation!ScenesJoey: This conversation never happened!ScenesRachel: Never happened! Good night!ScenesJoey: Good night!Scenes(They both go into their rooms and after a little while Rachel pokes her head into the living room.)ScenesJoey: Get back in there! (Rachel re-enters her room and closes the door.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is there as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi. Listen, I’m sorry about that whole thing with Roger. It really wasn’t right, and I, and I want to make it up to you, so umm, I brought you something that I think you’ll really enjoy. (Goes into the hallway and returns carrying the Evander Holyfield cutout.) Now, this is just a loan. Okay? I’m gonna, I’m gonna want him back. So… (Looks at him longingly) I’m gonna go now. (Exits.) (Pause) (Entering) I’m sorry, I thought I could do it and I can’t! (She grabs the cutout and exits for good.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Joey Dates RachelScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen PlummerScenesDirected by: David SchwimmerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are entering carrying groceries and find Phoebe already there standing in front of a huge object that has been gift wrapped.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! I got you a present!!ScenesChandler: Oh my goodness! Where did you hide it?ScenesPhoebe: I got it for your wedding and I ordered it weeks ago, and it finally got here!ScenesChandler: Pheebs you didn’t have to get us anything for our wedding you already sang…ScenesMonica: (interrupting) I love it! It’s huge!! Let’s open it! Open it!!
