(Monica rips open the paper.)ScenesPhoebe: It’s a Ms. Pac-Man machine!!ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: I didn’t know where to put it so I just left it here for now.ScenesMonica: Oh well, maybe we can put it in the guest bedroom.ScenesChandler: Oh, okay.ScenesMonica: All right. (He goes to push it and it doesn’t move.)ScenesChandler: I kinda like it here.ScenesPhoebe: Do you really like it?ScenesMonica: Are you kidding?! I practically spent my entire childhood at the arcade! This is like—Oh my, this is like my second favorite game!ScenesPhoebe: Oh really? What was your first?ScenesMonica: Well I-I really don’t remember the name of it.ScenesChandler: Well what did it do?ScenesMonica: Well, you just—you put a quarter in and y’know pull-pull some handles and win like a candy bar or something.ScenesChandler: A vending machine?ScenesMonica: Don’t feel bad for me! I won like every time!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Rachel are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! Oh, I’m so glad you guys are here. I’ve been dying to tell someone what happened in the Paleontology department today.ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Do you think he saw us or can we still sneak out?ScenesRoss: Professor Neuman, the head of the department, so….ScenesRachel: They made you head of the department!ScenesRoss: No, I get to teach one of his advanced classes! (Pause) Why didn’t I get head of the department? (Goes and gets some coffee.)ScenesJoey: Oh! Hey Rach, listen umm…ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: I got a big date coming up, do you know a good restaurant?ScenesRachel: Uh, Paul’s Caf�. They got great food and it’s really romantic.ScenesJoey: Ooh, great! Thanks!ScenesRachel: Yeah! Oh, and then afterwards you can take her to the Four Seasons for drinks. Or you go downtown and listen to some jazz. Or dancing—Oh! Take her dancing!ScenesJoey: You sure are naming a lot of ways to postpone sex, I’ll tell ya…ScenesRachel: Ooh, I miss dating. Gettin’ all dressed up and going to a fancy restaurant. I’m not gonna be able to do that for so long, and it’s so much fun! I mean not that sitting at home worrying about giving birth to a sixteen pound baby is not fun.ScenesJoey: Hey, y’know what?ScenesRachel: Huh?ScenesJoey: Why don’t I take you out?ScenesRachel: What?! Joey, you don’t want to go on a date with a pregnant lady.ScenesJoey: Yes I do! And we’re gonna go out, we’re gonna have a good time, and take your mind off of childbirth and c-sections and-and giant baby heads stretching out…ScenesRachel: (interrupting) Okay! I’ll go with ya! I’ll go! I’ll go with ya.ScenesJoey: I’ll be fun.ScenesRachel: All right?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is watching Phoebe play Ms. Pac-Man.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: No. No! Yes! Ahh. Oh, would you look at that Monica? I just knocked off all of your top scores, how sad.ScenesMonica: Okay, I’m next. (Phoebe starts another game.) Don’t! Don’t start another game! I said I’m next! Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t hear you over all the winning.ScenesMonica: Chandler! Phoebe’s hogging the game!ScenesChandler: Who cares? It’s a stupid game.ScenesMonica: You only think it’s stupid because you suck at it.ScenesChandler: I don’t suck. It’s sucks. You suck.ScenesPhoebe: Wait okay, if this game is gonna cause problems between the two of you, then maybe I should just keep it.ScenesMonica: No! No-no! I love it! It is a great present! In fact, why don’t you go home and wait for the thank you card?ScenesChandler: Why do you want to play this game so bad?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! It’s not like it spits out a Clark bar after every game.ScenesMonica: Okay. Phoebe that’s it. Come on, get out—out of the chair. Get out! (She goes to move Phoebe, but Phoebe goes limp and Monica can’t move her.) Oh come…Phoebe!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her date with Joey as there is a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey? Could you get that? (There is no answer and she goes and opens the door to Joey.) What are you doing here? I thought you were in your room?ScenesJoey: No, I’m picking you up for our date. These are for you. (Hands her some flowers.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, Lilies. Joey, they’re my favorite. Thank you.ScenesJoey: And, a brownie! (Hands her a bag with the brownie in it.) Well, half a brownie. Actually, it’s just bag. It’s been a long walk from the flower shop and I was startin’ to feel faint so…ScenesRachel: Oh man! This is so great! I actually feel like I’m going on a real date! Although, I have a hint of morning sickness, and I’m wearing underwear that goes up to about…(She snaps the waistband on her underwear that is just slightly below her breasts)…there.ScenesJoey: Hey come on now, this is a real date. Uh, so…nice place you got here. Foosball, huh? Pizza box. Oh, a subscription to Playboy, my kind of woman.ScenesRachel: Yeah, actually that’s my roommate’s.ScenesJoey: I would like to meet him. He sounds like a stand up guy.ScenesRachel: Ah yes, but he’s very protective of me so you’d better watch yourself.ScenesJoey: Ah… Hey, so this roommate of yours…is he good looking?ScenesRachel: Hm-mmm.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, it must be tough to keep your hands of him, huh?ScenesRachel: (laughs) Yeah, but I’m pretty sure he’s gay.ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no, he’s not! No! Why are you trying to ruin the game? Come on!

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U, Ross is teaching a class.]
rows.Content: Ross: …which brings us back, of course, to Greely’s theory of dominance. (The bell rings.) Okay, that-that’s all for today. Oh, uh does anyone know where the Freeman building is?ScenesStudent: Yeah, it’s the new building on Avenue A.ScenesRoss: What?! That-that’s all the way cross town, I’m supposed to teach a graduate seminar there in ten minutes.ScenesStudent: Ooh, dude. That’s not gonna happen.Scenes(Ross grabs his things and runs to the door only to be blocked by his exiting students.)ScenesRoss: Move it! Move it! Move it!! Hey!!! I’m the teacher!!

rows.Scenes: The Freeman Building, Ross is entering his new class completely out of breath.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello. (He throws his jacket towards the coat rack and misses.) I’m sorry I’m a little late. Ah—(Checks his watch)—Whoa! A lot late. Let me start by uh, by introducing myself, I am Professor Geller. (The bell rings.) So to sum up, I’m Professor Geller. Good job today.

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, a waitress is taking Joey and Rachel’s dinner order.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Now the filet mignon, what comes with that?ScenesWaitress: There’s a side of steamed vegetables.ScenesRachel: Emmm. Now, instead of the vegetables, is there anyway I can substitute the three-pound lobster?ScenesJoey: Y’know what? Bring her both, and I’ll have the same. (The waitress leaves.)ScenesRachel: Wow! This is shaping up to be a pretty good date—Oh, I almost forgot. I didn’t pay you the rent check.ScenesJoey: Oh whoa-whoa-whoa, no roommate stuff. Okay? We’re on a date.ScenesRachel: Okay. Wow! So I get to see what Joey Tribbiani is like on a date. So do you have any moves?ScenesJoey: No! No. Umm, just myself and if they don’t like me for—(Laughs.) I’m sorry I couldn’t even get through that.ScenesRachel: I knew it! I knew it. Come on tell me your moves.ScenesJoey: Oh alright. Umm, well, okay, I usually start by having a bottle of wine sent to my table from a fan.ScenesRachel: Oh my God. And that works?!ScenesJoey: Well it does when you combine it with, "This is so embarrassing, I just want to have a normal life!ScenesRachel: Oh, you poor little famous man.ScenesJoey: Oh okay, how about this one. I was gonna wait until the end of the night to kiss you, but you’re so beautiful…I don’t think I can.ScenesRachel: (looks interested) Oh my God! Wow! That was fantastic, I almost leaned in. I really almost did!ScenesJoey: Alright, so…so tell me one of your moves.ScenesRachel: Alright. So where’d you grow up?ScenesJoey: That’s your move? Boy Rach, you’re lucky you’re hot.ScenesRachel: Come on, just answer the question!ScenesJoey: (exasperated) Queens.ScenesRachel: And so were-were you close to your parents?ScenesJoey: Yeah, with my mom. Yeah, not so much with my dad.ScenesRachel: Why not?ScenesJoey: I don’t know. I guess there’s just always been this distance y’know—I mean we both try to pretend it’s not there, but it is.ScenesRachel: (sympathetic) Oh. (Starts rubbing his wrist with her fingers.) It’s gotta be rough.ScenesJoey: Yeah, it is. It’s really tough. Y’know sometimes I think—Wow!! Nice move!ScenesRachel: Huh?ScenesJoey: "Where’d you grow up," it’s so simple!ScenesRachel: Thank you! And now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go to the rest room.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Rachel gets up and heads for the rest room.)ScenesRachel: And now you’re watching me walk away.ScenesJoey: Yes I am! Again so simple!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is entering to find Chandler playing Ms. Pac-Man.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesChandler: You are not going to believe what I did today!ScenesMonica: Well it clearly wasn’t showering or shaving.ScenesChandler: I got good. I played this game all day and now I rule at it! They should change the name of it to Ms. Chandler. (Pause) Although I-I hope they don’t.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, you stayed home all day and played Ms. Pac-Man while I went off to work like some kind of chump?!ScenesChandler: Uh-huh, and I got all the top ten scores, I erased Phoebe off the board! High five! (Holds up his hand to give Monica a high five, only he can’t straighten his fingers.)ScenesMonica: What is the matter with your hand?ScenesChandler: Well I’ve been playing it for like eight hours, it’ll loosen up. Come on, check out the scores. Oh, and also look at the initials, they’re dirty words.ScenesMonica: Chandler, why would you do that?ScenesChandler: Because it’s awesome.ScenesMonica: You think this is clever?ScenesChandler: Well y’know, they only give you three letters, so after A-S-S it is a bit of a challenge.ScenesMonica: Hey wait a minute, this one isn’t dirty.ScenesChandler: It is when you put it together with that one.ScenesMonica: Ah, well if you don’t clear this off, you won’t be getting one of those from me. But Ben’s coming over here tomorrow to play this game, this can’t be there.ScenesChandler: Come on, he won’t even know what they mean.ScenesMonica: Chandler! He’s seven; he’s not stupid.ScenesChandler: Have you talked to him lately?ScenesMonica: All right, look I’m just gonna unplug it.ScenesChandler: No-no-no, if you unplug it, I’ll have nothing to show for my day! It would be like I was at work. (She unplugs it.) No! (And plugs it back in.) Hey look at that! Look at that, it’s still there! This thing must have some kind of primitive ROM (Read Only Memory, it’s a memory chip.) Chip in it or something!ScenesMonica: Honey you-you got to beat your scores!ScenesChandler: With the claw?!ScenesMonica: All right fine. Fine, I’ll do it. I’ve just got to get this off the screen. Carol and Susan are still upset that you taught him pull my finger.ScenesChandler: (smiles) Pull my finger—(Looks at his hand)—My hand is messed up.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Rachel are returning from their date.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I am not gonna answer that!ScenesJoey: Oh come on! Just pick one! Between Monica, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross if you had to, if you had to, who would you punch?ScenesRachel: No one! They are my friends, I wouldn’t punch any of them.ScenesJoey: Chandler?ScenesRachel: Yeah, but I don’t know why. Look at me, I’m having such a wonderful time!ScenesJoey: Me too! Hey Rach, can I just say I think this is the best date I ever had!ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesJoey: I never laughed so hard—Did you see the wine come out of my nose?ScenesRachel: Joey, I think everyone saw the wine come out of your nose.ScenesJoey: I gotta say, I never knew I could enjoy the non-sex part of the date so much.ScenesRachel: Well that is because you have never been on a date with me before.ScenesJoey: Huh. Huh.ScenesRachel: All right, now don’t judge me. I normally wait until my date leaves, but you live here. I’m ripping into this swan.ScenesJoey: Ah! Okay, well then you don’t judge me. I’m gonna suck on the cellophane from the brownie I had before. (They both do as they planned.)ScenesRachel: So tell me, what are Joey Tribbiani’s end of the night moves?ScenesJoey: Ah, well, if I want the girl to kiss me, first thing I do is make my lips look irresistible.ScenesRachel: How do you do that?ScenesJoey: Now you can’t tell anyone, but uh…I put on shiny lip balm.ScenesRachel: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: Yeah, like a moth to a flame, I’m telling ya. Okay all right, so now you go.ScenesRachel: No, I don’t want to tell you.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesRachel: Because it’s embarrassing.ScenesJoey: More embarrassing than shiny raspberry lip balm?! (Rachel just looks at him.) I didn’t say raspberry before did I? All right just-just tell me Rach, just tell me!ScenesRachel: (laughs) Okay. All right, stand up. (They do so.) Well, when we’re at the door, I lightly press my lips against his, and then move into his body just for a second, and then I make this sound, "Hmmm." Okay, I know it doesn’t sound like anything, but I swear it works.ScenesJoey: (stunned and turned on) Yeah. Why—Yeah, that would work for ya…ScenesRachel: All right, I gotta go to bed. Honey, I had such a wonderful time.ScenesJoey: Oh. (She kisses him.) Yeah. (She goes into her room.) Me to. (He then starts to freak out.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is telling Rachel about his class location predicament.]
rows.Content: Rachel: …you were 50 minutes late to the class, what did you crawl there?!ScenesRoss: No, I ran. It was really far, and when did people stop understanding the phrase, "Get the hell out of my way!ScenesRachel: Well, why didn’t you just take a cab?ScenesRoss: Ugh, between the traffic that time of day and all the one-way streets it’ll take me twice as long. Besides, I teach the class three times a week, who am I? Rockefeller?ScenesRachel: Well you’re not gonna be able to keep doing this.ScenesRoss: Well I have to. Okay? If I don’t, they’ll take the class away from me. And…I already put it in my family newsletter.ScenesRachel: You what?ScenesRoss: You’ve seen it, the Geller Yeller.ScenesRachel: Right. Wow!ScenesRoss: Besides, I-I think I figured out a much faster route, I’m sure I can make it this time. I just…I just can’t be afraid to get a little bit…hit by cars. (He goes to the bathroom as Joey enters.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi! Hey, remember how last night we were talking about that movie Cujo?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, I still can’t believe you haven’t seen Cujo. What is wrong with you?ScenesRachel: Relax! It’s not like it’s Citizen Kane!ScenesJoey: Have you ever tried to sit through Citizen Kane?ScenesRachel: Yeah I know it’s really boring, but it’s like a big deal. Anyway, I was thinking about renting Cujo sometime.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? All right, let’s do it tonight.ScenesRachel: Well don’t you have that big date tonight?ScenesJoey: Oh right!ScenesRachel: Hey Joey, can I ask you something?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRachel: After our date last night, did you feel a little weird?ScenesJoey: Oh my God! You did too? It totally freaked me out, what was that?!ScenesRachel: I don’t know! (Pause) I’m-I’m kinda thinking it-it was the lobster…ScenesJoey: Oh yeah-yeah, the lobster.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I mean I was up sick all night.ScenesJoey: Yeah me too, all night.ScenesRachel: Really?! How come we didn’t cross paths?ScenesJoey: Yeah well that’s because uh…I stayed in my room. Yeah, you don’t want to look in my hamper.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is trying to erase Chandler’s dirty words while he looks on.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, I got that. I’ll escape over there. I’ll come back over here. All right, come on Ms. Pac-Man. It’s got—Right—(She dies.) Well, you’re just a little bitch, aren’t you?ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey, you guys. Listen, I’m sorry that I was hogging the game before—(Sees the top ten list)—Oh my God! Your friends have some unfortunate initials!ScenesMonica: They’re all Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: Chandler sucks! He couldn’t have gotten this good!ScenesChandler: I did. (Looks at his still deformed hand) But it came at a price.ScenesMonica: But Ben is coming over tonight and he can’t see this.ScenesChandler: Oh come on, by age seven kids have already seen orgies. (They both look at him.) Was it just me?!

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U, Ross’s new class, he is entering out of breath.]
rows.Content: Ross: Yeah!!!! Yes, I made it! I’m on time! (Grabs a bottle of water from a student, takes a drink, and splashes some on his face like the marathon runners do.) Okay, why don’t we all uh, (Exhales loudly) open our books to page 23. Where… (Exhales again) Where you will see…a uh…a bunch of uh…red spots. Okay, (Closes his book.) umm, why don’t, why don’t you all start to read, while I—(Passes out and collapses.)

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Joey is on his hot date and they’re not speaking right now.]
rows.Content: Joey's Date: Hey. Are you all right? You seem a little distracted.ScenesJoey: No-no! I’m fine. It’s just… Hey, can I ask you something? Have you ever looked at someone that you’ve known for a while and then suddenly…suddenly see them a different way?ScenesJoey's Date: You mean like from behind?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Yeah, that…that’s exactly it. You’re right. Yeah.ScenesJoey's Date: Ew, y’know what? One time I saw this guy from behind and he seemed like a totally normal guy and then he turned around and it was Stephan Baldwin!ScenesJoey: (deadpan) Ooh! Yeah. So yeah, so you know exactly what I’m talking about.ScenesJoey's Date: Totally! Wow! (Pause) Would you excuse me for a sec?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure. (She gets up, walks towards the bathroom, and Joey watches her go.) Ehhh.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, now it’s Phoebe’s turn to erase Chandler from the board.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh my God Phoebe, you’re on fire!ScenesPhoebe: I know!ScenesChandler: One more score to go! You can do it! (Touches her shoulder.)ScenesPhoebe: Don’t touch me!!ScenesMonica: Don’t touch her!!ScenesChandler: All right! Go left! Go left! Go right!! Go right!!ScenesPhoebe: I can’t!! I can’t!! (She dies.) Noooooooo!!!!!!! You son of a bitch!!!!!Scenes(At this point a stream of obscenities burst forth from Phoebe’s mouth just in time for Ben and Ross to enter and hear most of it, and in slow motion Ross tries to shield his innocent son from Phoebe’s vulgarity.)ScenesRoss: Phoebe!!ScenesPhoebe: Oh hi Ben—No!! Don’t look at the machine! (Covers the screen.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is watching Cujo while Joey returns from his date scaring Rachel.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh God! Thank God you’re home! I’m watching Cujo.ScenesJoey: (incredulous) Alone?!ScenesRachel: Yes! But what is wrong with this dog?!ScenesJoey: Hey, did you get to the part where they’re trapped in the car and Cujo’s throwin’ himself at the windshield?ScenesRachel: No! No! Seriously, what’s wrong with the dog?! Wait a minute, what are you doing home so early? What happened to your date?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, it didn’t work out.ScenesRachel: Oh. Do you want to watch the rest of the movie with me?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, okay. Yeah.ScenesRachel: Y’know, I never thought I’d say this about a movie, but I really hope this dog dies. (Joey brings over a stool at sits on it next to Rachel who’s in the big chair.) What are you doing over there? Come sit here, you protect me.ScenesJoey: Oh sure, yeah, why not? (Sits on the arm of the chair.)ScenesRachel: Okay. (Pushes play.) Okay, that’s him! That’s him! That’s Cujo! That’s Cujo!ScenesJoey: All right, I know! I know. Yeah, it’ll be okay.ScenesRachel: Oh my God….What’s he gonna do now? I can’t watch! (Drags Joey closer to her and cowers into his chest.) Oh. Seriously, how can you watch this? Aren’t you scared?ScenesJoey: Terrified. (But for a totally different reason.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U, Ross’s new class, this time he’s actually about to do a lecture.]
rows.Content: Ross: So is everybody here? I got here a little early myself. Let us begin. Now, the hydrosaurids have been unearthed in two main locations. (He moves to the map and we see why he made it to class on time, he’s wearing in-line skates and hasn’t taken them off.) Here. (Points to the map, somewhere in the Middle East, then spins on the skates and points to the map.) Here. (China.) Now as for the hydrosaurs…Scenes(He tries to move in front of the class, only goes out of control and rolls into the hall, catching himself on the doorway with his pointer. He then pulls himself back into the room with the pointer, only he jams one end of it between the door frame and the door and breaks the pointer in half.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Takes a BathScenesWritten by: Vanessa McCarthyScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesWith Help From: Dan Gottleib

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is at the counter eating a bowl of Frosted Flakes.]
rows.Content: Joey: (thinking) All right. It’s a new day. All that stuff about Rachel, you don’t feel that now. It was crazy! You’re fine. You’re better than fine! You are, as your friend Tony would say, Grrrreat! Everything’s normal! She’s just your friend Rachel! Your friend Rachel. Your friend! Rachel.ScenesRachel: (coming from her room) Hi, sweetie.ScenesJoey: (thinking) Hey, it’s your girlfriend, Rachel!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is sitting on the couch watching TV as Monica comes out of the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Monica: (airily) Hi.ScenesChandler: Are you, are you high?ScenesMonica: I just had the most amazing bath.ScenesChandler: Really? I don’t like baths.ScenesMonica: Wait, you like them with me.ScenesChandler: Honey, it’s not the bath I enjoy, it’s the wet, naked lady.ScenesMonica: Oh, baths are so relaxing!ScenesChandler: Really? What do you do? You just sit in there stewing in your own filth.ScenesMonica: How dirty do you think I am? I’m telling you, if you had some candles and some bubbles and some music, you would love it! It would take all of your stress away.ScenesChandler: Honey, it’s 2:00 on a Wednesday and I’m watching Road Rules, how stressed do you think I am?ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey, Chandler, you got a minute? I-I really need to talk to you.ScenesChandler: Oh! Uh, yeah! Is this a cold pizza talk or a leftover meatloaf talk?ScenesJoey: Well, neither.ScenesChandler: Oh my God, what’s up?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know. It’s-it’s just…lately, I’ve been feeling… Okay, here’s what it is… (Pause) You know what? I feel a lot better, thanks! (Starts to leave)ScenesChandler: Oh no-no, no you don’t, just come back.ScenesJoey: All right. Okay. You and Monica, friends for a long time, and sure there are rules, but then you went to London. Oh, no, but that’s different. I mean, there are rules there, too! You know what I mean?ScenesChandler: Do you?ScenesJoey: It was different for you guys! I mean, I mean, you were both in the same place, right?ScenesChandler: In London?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yes. When Monica and I were in London, we were both in London.ScenesJoey: You know what? This is a bad idea. Forget it. Forget it, and listen, do me a favor, this conversation was between you and me.ScenesChandler: If that.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch. Ross sits down.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi! Oh, Ross, don’t forget, we have that doctor’s appointment tomorrow!ScenesRoss: Right.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, are you going to find out the sex of the baby?ScenesRoss: No-no, we talked about it. We don’t want to know. All we care about is that it’s happy and healthy.ScenesRachel: Yep! Happy and healthy! And cute!ScenesRoss: And smart!ScenesRachel: Popular.ScenesRoss: With an aptitude for science.ScenesPhoebe: Are you two talking about the same baby? Hey! Have you started off thinking of names yet?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! I’ve come up with a bunch of ideas!ScenesRoss: Really? Me too!ScenesPhoebe: Me too!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Uh huh! If it’s a girl, Phoebe, and if it’s a boy, Phoebo!ScenesRoss: Maybe. But it wouldn’t hurt to have a backup, you know? Uh, Rach-Rach, what were you thinking? (Gives her a look)ScenesRachel: Okay! I was thinking if it’s a girl, how about Sandrine? It’s French.ScenesRoss: Huh. That’s a really pretty name for-for an industrial solvent.ScenesRachel: Okay fine, what do you have?ScenesRoss: Well, OK, it’s for a boy. Well, I know it’s a little out there, but…Darwin.ScenesRachel: Wow, oh my God, our child will be beaten to death in the schoolyard.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, by Sandrine.ScenesRoss: You’re just saying that 'cause I said no to your name!ScenesRachel: I’m really, really not.ScenesPhoebe: How-how about you each get five vetoes?ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesRoss: That sounds fair.ScenesRachel: Yeah! I don’t think you’re going to need it though. Okay, check this out. If it’s a girl, Rain.ScenesRoss: Veto.ScenesRachel: Why?ScenesRoss: Rain? Hi. Hi, my name is Rain. I have my own kiln, and my dress is made out of wheat.ScenesPhoebe: I know her! I bought homemade soap from her at a Dead show!ScenesRoss: Okay, how about, for a guy, Thatcher?ScenesRachel: Ross, why do you hate our child?ScenesRoss: Fine, you go.ScenesRachel: Okay, James.ScenesRoss: Huh.ScenesRachel: But only if it’s a girl.ScenesRoss: Oh, veto. How about—Ooh, I like Ruth! What about Ruth?ScenesRachel: Oh! I’m sorry! Are we having an 89-year-old? How about Dayton?ScenesRoss: Veto. Stewart?ScenesRachel: Veto. Sawyer?ScenesRoss: Veto. Helen?ScenesRachel: Veto.ScenesPhoebe: Is it me, or is veto starting to sound really good?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica comes from the bathroom as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Boy, do I have a surprise for you!ScenesChandler: Sex on the balcony?ScenesMonica: No, but someone’s really not going to get over that idea, are they?ScenesChandler: What is it?ScenesMonica: I drew you a bath!ScenesChandler: Honey, I don’t like baths! Could you draw me a picture of us having sex on the balcony?ScenesMonica: Please, could you just try it for me? Come on, I used all my best stuff! I-I-I lit some candles. I put on some music. I used bath salts, plus bubble bath! And got you this little plastic Navy ship. So it’s a boy bath!ScenesChandler: Well, this does butch it up a bit.ScenesMonica: I swear, if you try it, you will love it!ScenesChandler: All right, if I do this, can we at least discuss sex on the balcony?ScenesMonica: Absolutely.Scenes(Chandler runs into the bathroom)ScenesMonica: Bet I know how that discussion’s going to go.Scenes[Cut to Chandler laying in the bathtub. "Only Time," is playing in the background.]ScenesChandler: (thinking) All right, this isn’t so bad. I like the flower smell! Which is okay, because I’ve got my boat.ScenesMonica: (entering) So?ScenesChandler: Oh my God.ScenesMonica: I told you you were a bath person! Hey, when you get out, maybe I can give you a facial!ScenesChandler: I’m going to need a bigger boat.

rows.Scenes: The Doctor’s Office, the doctor is writing something as Rachel is on the table, and Ross is standing.]
rows.Content: Ross: I don’t think you had an open mind about the name Ruth. I mean, come on, little Ruthie Geller, how-how cute is that?ScenesRachel: Oh, oh my God! I can practically hear the mahjong tiles!ScenesDr. Long: Okay! All your tests look fine. Now, are you two interested in knowing the sex of the baby?ScenesRoss: Uh, no. No, we’re not.ScenesRachel: But you have it right there in that file? You could tell us whether it’s a boy or a girl? Dayton or Sandrine? Phoebe or Phoebo?ScenesDr. Long: That’s right. But if you don’t want to know…ScenesRoss: No, no, we want to wait, right?ScenesRachel: Right. Right.ScenesDr. Long: (looks at her beeping pager) Oh, I’ll be right back. And, uh, I know it’s really not my place, but please don’t name your child Phoebo.ScenesRachel: (looking at the bulletin board with baby pictures) So, which of these babies do you think is the ugliest?ScenesRoss: What? Rach! Come on, that’s terrible! They’re…uh…they’re babies. They’re-they’re all beautiful.ScenesRachel: Third one from the left?ScenesRoss: Yeah, why is it staring at me? I think it knows I’m talking about it. (Rachel starts to peek at the file) Don’t-don’t you—Wh—Wha—Hey!!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: You’re looking!ScenesRachel: I didn’t!ScenesRoss: I saw you!ScenesRachel: Okay fine, I did. But I didn’t see anything, I swear.ScenesRoss: Shame on you! Ugly baby judges you!ScenesRachel: Okay, but Ross just listen to me…ScenesRoss: No, no, no, no! Don’t tell me! I don’t want to know!ScenesRachel: But I couldn’t even if I wanted to, because I don’t know! I swear; I didn’t see anything, and I don’t want to know! It was just a momentary lapse.ScenesRoss: Momentary lapse. Don’t-don’t you have any self-control?ScenesRachel: (holding stomach) Okay, a couple months late on the lecture, Ross.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica’s, Monica is entering.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hello?ScenesChandler: I’m in the bathroom, can you come in here? I think there’s something wrong.ScenesMonica: You know what? I-I think I’ll wait out here.ScenesChandler: I’m in the bathtub.ScenesMonica: Oh. (She goes into the bathroom.) What’s wrong?ScenesChandler: I drew my own bath, but I did it wrong! The water’s tepid. The salt didn’t dissolve and is now… lodged places. And the scents I used don’t compliment each other. Eucalyptus and chamomile—Oh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: The bath salts! They’re starting to effervesce! It’s different. (Pause) It’s interesting.ScenesMonica: Okay, let’s talk about something else.ScenesChandler: Yeah! Sure, sure. So, what was going on with you today? Oh-oh-oh!ScenesMonica: Well, I actually had the weirdest conversation with Joey. He was talking about rules and right and wrong and…ScenesChandler: I had the exact same conversation.ScenesMonica: You did? What was he talking about?ScenesChandler: I don’t know! Joey hasn’t had this much trouble getting out words since we saw him in Macbeth!ScenesMonica: (groans) That was a long night.ScenesChandler: All right, let’s break this down. What exactly did he say to you?ScenesMonica: Okay, he was talking about rules.ScenesChandler: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: Umm, and looking at people differently.ScenesChandler: He didn’t say anything about that to me.ScenesMonica: What did he tell you?ScenesChandler: He was asking all these questions about you, me, and London. And, of course the glue that holds this all together, the rules.ScenesMonica: Okay. So you, me and London. Looking at people differently. Maybe he wants to do what you and I did in London with someone.ScenesChandler: But what did he mean by rules?ScenesMonica: Wait a minute! He stopped talking the minute Phoebe came in!ScenesChandler: Because he was looking at her differently.ScenesMonica: And Phoebe is his friend, so he thinks that would be breaking the rules!ScenesChandler: My God! He wants to do it with Phoebe in London!ScenesPhoebe: (from outside the bathroom) You guys?ScenesMonica: Just a minute! (To Chandler) That’s Mrs. Tribbiani!ScenesChandler: You don’t say anything.ScenesMonica: Why would I say anything? That two of our best friends could start the greatest love affair of their lives! And they would have me to thank, and we could all start having babies?ScenesChandler: I’m not going to let you say anything.ScenesMonica: You just stay here! (Dumps a jar of bath salts in the bathtub)ScenesChandler: Oh, God!Scenes(Monica runs out to Phoebe, who is in the kitchen)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hey, Monica, I brought back your iron.ScenesMonica: Oh, you had that?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: I thought I lost it. I got a new one, like, a month ago.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, just as well, I broke this one.Scenes(Monica starts smiling)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesMonica: Nothing.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesMonica: I mean, I-I, I really shouldn’t say. I mean, I’m really not supposed to.ScenesPhoebe: Fine.ScenesMonica: It’s a humdinger!ScenesPhoebe: Then it’s really too bad that you can’t tell me.ScenesMonica: Somebody likes you!ScenesPhoebe: (Groans) Is it Chandler?ScenesMonica: No!ScenesPhoebe: Well, then tell him to stop staring!ScenesMonica: It’s Joey!ScenesPhoebe: Really?! Joey?! You don’t say.ScenesMonica: Is it something you’d be interested in?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, I don’t know, I don’t know. You know, I mean, on the one hand, Mother may I? But y’know on the other hand… No. No, I can’t. We’re friends. No, oh, no. I don’t want to risk what we have.ScenesMonica: I guess that makes sense. So, you think you’re going to talk to him?ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah. I mean, it’s Joey. I don’t want him to get hurt. Well, I must say, I am on fire! First Chandler, now Joey!ScenesMonica: Not Chandler, just Joey.ScenesPhoebe: Sure.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central perk, Ross is sitting on the chair as Rachel walks in.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesRachel: You know what? I’ve been thinking about it. I’m really coming around on the name Ruth. I think I would actually consider naming our child that.ScenesRoss: Rach, I-I can’t tell you how-how much that means to me! Ohh… Wait a minute. Wait a minute. You-you hated the name Ruth! Why-why would you change your mind? Unless, you know we’re never going to have to use it. You did see the folder. You know it’s a boy!ScenesRachel: I didn’t see anything! I actually changed my mind about the name.ScenesRoss: I don’t think so! You’re just giving me Ruth so you’ll get to name it when it’s a boy, and that’s when you’ll swoop in and name him Heath or Blaine or Sequoia.ScenesRachel: I would—Sequoia?ScenesRoss: Veto.ScenesRachel: Fine.ScenesRoss: Unless… (Rachel groans.) You anticipated that I would figure all this out and you know that it actually is a girl, and you really do want her to be named Ruth! Well, I’m not falling for that! Okay? Ruth is off the table!ScenesRachel: But Ross, you want the name Ruth!ScenesRoss: Not like this!

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey’s, Joey is sitting on his recliner as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey. Well, what’s up?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Joey, I know.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesPhoebe: I knooow.ScenesJoey: Whaaat?ScenesPhoebe: I know about your feelings.ScenesJoey: Oh my God. You do?ScenesPhoebe: Yes, and I’m sorry. I-I know things worked out for Chandler and Monica, but that’s very rare.ScenesJoey: I know. I know. And this is so much more complicated than it was for those guys. I mean, it’s Rachel for God sakes.ScenesPhoebe: For God sakes, it’s Rachel!ScenesJoey: I know. I know. And she’s not only my friend; she’s my pregnant friend! She’s my pregnant friend who’s Ross’ ex!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah that’s Rachel. (To herself) Beat me over the head with it.ScenesJoey: What am I going to do? You know, and I keep, I keep trying to get rid of these feelings, y’know? I stayed up all last night and made a list of everything I don’t like about her. You want to hear it?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesJoey: She made me switch to light Mayo. That’s it! That’s all I got! And, you know what? It tastes the same and my pants fit better!ScenesPhoebe: Joey, I just think you’re getting worked up over nothing. This is probably just a crush.ScenesJoey: You think?ScenesPhoebe: Absolutely! Y’know, you get this rush of feelings, but then it goes away.ScenesJoey: Yeah, just a crush! That’s all this is! It’s a crush! I’m Joey; I don’t get deep feelings.ScenesPhoebe: That’s right, there you go! Crushes happen all the time! I know I’ve had them for all you guys. Well, except for Ross and Chandler. And I’m sure you’ve had them for us.ScenesJoey: Not really.ScenesPhoebe: Mm-hmm. (To herself) Throw me a bone here.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is on the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, I uh… I called the doctor and now we both know the sex of the baby.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: That’s right. The student has become the master.ScenesRachel: Ross, I swear, I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Oh, come on, you know it’s a girl!ScenesRachel: A what?!ScenesRoss: You really didn’t know?ScenesRachel: We’re having a girl?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: That’s what you just said!ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: You said girl!ScenesRoss: Yes. I’m… I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.ScenesRachel: I’m not! We’re having a girl! Sometimes I can’t believe it’s with you—But still! We’re having a girl!ScenesRoss: I know! I know. You know what? I’m putting Ruth back on the table!ScenesRachel: Oh, yes! We’ll have ourselves a little baby Ruth…ScenesRoss: Permission to veto.ScenesRachel: Yes, please.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler enters as Monica comes from the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Do I smell essential oils?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’m going to take a bath. I’m just going to get a magazine.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(As soon as Monica leaves the room, Chandler takes off his jacket and runs to the bathroom. Monica enters the bathroom to find Chandler in the bathtub.)ScenesMonica: What do you think you’re doing?ScenesChandler: L-leaving my troubles behind?ScenesMonica: I know that you’re new at this, but this is completely unacceptable bath decorum.ScenesChandler: Oh, it’s so hard to care when you’re this relaxed.ScenesMonica: Fine, you can have the bath, but I am taking your boat. Now you’re just a girl in a tub!Scenes(Phoebe enters the bathroom)ScenesChandler: (upset) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hi, Bubbles. Manly. Well, I just thought I would drop by and let you know how it went with Joey.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) You told her?!ScenesMonica: She pulled it out of me! She’s like a conversational wizard! How’d it go?ScenesPhoebe: Well, you were wrong, he doesn’t like me!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! How would you like it if I sent you to Lee Majors’ house and told you that he liked you, and you went down there and you found out that he didn’t like you? How would you feel?ScenesMonica: (Pause) I don’t think I’d care.ScenesPhoebe: Really? Lee Majors is hot!ScenesJoey: (from outside the bathroom) Hello?ScenesPhoebe: We’re in the bathroom!ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesChandler: (sarcastically) Because it’s a relaxing and enjoyable time!ScenesJoey: (entering the bathroom) What are you guys doing in here?ScenesMonica: Oh my God! A friend he’s looking at differently, but it’s wrong. It’s Rachel!ScenesChandler: You like Rachel?!ScenesJoey: It’s no big deal, okay? Phoebe and I talked about it. It’s just a crush! It’s going to go away! (Looks down) Dude, you gotta rearrange your bubbles! Oh!ScenesPhoebe: (checking for herself) (To Monica) Mazel tov.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! Ross and I were looking for you! What are we all doing in here? (Looks at Chandler) Oh, my! (Covers the spot where Joey wants bubbles to be replaced.)ScenesMonica: Honey, cover it up with the boat!ScenesRoss: (from outside the bathroom) Hello?ScenesChandler: (sarcastically) Yes we’re all in here and we would love for you to join us!ScenesRoss: (entering) Well hey! What’s going on? Ooh, cool boat—(Sees why the boat’s there)—Oh, no. (Averts his eyes by looking around the room) (To Rachel) Hey, did you, did you tell them?ScenesRachel: No, I was waiting for you!ScenesPhoebe: Tell us what?ScenesRachel: We’re having a girl.ScenesAll: Oh, wow! Yay! Wow! Hooray! Oh, man!Scenes(They all hug and then turn and look at Chandler)ScenesChandler: I’ll…I’ll get you later!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting at the counter eating Cocoa Puffs.]
rows.Content: Joey: (thinking) All right. It’s a new day, and it’s just a crush, that’s all! Just a little crush! All that worrying I was doing, that was crazy. Crazy! Like my friend here the bird would say, "it was cuckoo!" Everything’s going to be fine. It’s just a crush.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi, sweetie.ScenesJoey: (thinking) I love you.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica’s bathroom. Both are sitting on opposite ends of the bathtub.]
rows.Content: Monica: It sure is nice to do this together, isn’t it?ScenesChandler: Yeah. And what you’re doing feels so good.ScenesMonica: I’m not touching you.ScenesChandler: You’re not?ScenesMonica: It’s the salts.ScenesChandler: Oh, sweet Lord. New realms of pleasure!ScenesMonica: (To herself) Whatever keeps you off the balcony, big guy!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Secret ClosetScenesWritten by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Phoebe walks up to and knocks on Chandler and Monica’s door.]
rows.Content: Monica: (opens the door wearing a robe, but leaves the chain on) Hey, what’s up?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I left my guitar here again.ScenesMonica: Oh, okay. No problem.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Monica closes the door, gets the guitar, and then hands it out.)ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMonica: Here you go.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Umm…(Monica closes the door again and Phoebe knocks again.)ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: So do you want to hang out or something?ScenesMonica: Phoebe! You kinda caught me at a bad time.ScenesPhoebe: Oh are you and Chandler…ScenesMonica: Yes! Exactly.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Do you guys want me to play for you?ScenesMonica: (laughs) No. (Closes the door as Chandler walks up.)ScenesChandler: Hey Pheebs, what’s up?ScenesPhoebe: You ask an intriguing question Chandler Bing.Scenes(Chandler lets her into the apartment and reveals that Monica is getting a massage from another woman.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! You’re getting a massage! You never let me massage you!!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, I can explain!ScenesPhoebe: You told me you hate massages!ScenesChandler: Buy stamps, pick up dry cleaning…Don’t let Phoebe in.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe this! How long as this been going on?ScenesMonica: Well umm, Alexandra has been…ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it has a name?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, don’t get upset!ScenesPhoebe: Okay—Oop! Too late! I’m leaving! Come on Chandler let’s go! (She storms out.)ScenesChandler: Well, Phoebe I thought I’d—(Off Phoebe’s look)—Yeah, what the hell. (Exits with Phoebe.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Bedroom, Joey is having a dream about Rachel giving birth with him as the father.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh okay, okay! One more push! One more push! Come on honey, we’re almost there! We’re almost there!ScenesRachel: Oh Joey, I’m so happy things worked out for us that we’re having this baby together. I love you so much.ScenesJoey: Oh, I love you too.ScenesRachel: And I hope it’s not an inappropriate time to say this but, you’re the best sex I ever had.ScenesJoey: That’s always appropriate! (Back to the matter at hand) Oh, okay. One more push! One more push!Scenes(Finally, the baby is delivered and starts crying.)ScenesDoctor: Oh, here is your beautiful baby. Congratulations!Scenes(She hands the baby to Joey who pulls down the blanket to reveal Ross’s face where the baby’s should be.)ScenesRoss: (crying) I hope you’re a better father than you’re a friend!! (Cries again and Joey wakes up in horror.)ScenesRachel: (bursts into the room) Joey! Joey!ScenesJoey: What? What’s going on?ScenesRachel: Come feel this! Come feel my belly!ScenesJoey: Aaaah…ScenesRachel: Joey! The baby is kicking for the first time! Will you please come feel this?!ScenesJoey: Really?!ScenesRachel: Yes!Scenes(Joey starts to get up but stops.)ScenesJoey: Oh, y’know what? Maybe uh, you…you should come to me. I’m a not, I’m not wearing any bottoms.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay! (She goes over to him and he feels her belly.)ScenesJoey: Oh my, oh my God!ScenesRachel: Aw, it’s unbelievable! Wow! She is kicking so much! Oh, she’s like umm…oh…who’s that kind of annoying girl soccer player?ScenesJoey: Mia Hamm?ScenesRachel: Mia Hamm!ScenesJoey: Oh that’s amazing. (Drops the sheet.)ScenesRachel: (looking down) Oh-oh!! One hand on the sheet Joe!ScenesJoey: Whoa-hey-oh! Sorry!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica has opened another wedding present as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey babe.ScenesMonica: Hi honey. We just got a wedding gift from Bob and Faye Bing; they don’t like us do they? (They gave them a pok-a-dotted punch bowl.)ScenesChandler: Who says you can’t get a nice punch bowl for under six bucks? Maybe we can take it back?ScenesMonica: No, it doesn’t say where it came from. Where would we return it?ScenesChandler: How about to the street say from the balcony?ScenesMonica: Why don’t we just find a place for it?ScenesChandler: Okay. How about in that cabinet?ScenesMonica: No! That’s where we keep the canned goods! Have you completely forgotten everything you learned at orientation?ScenesChandler: How about the closet by the bathroom? (The secret green door by the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: Oh, okay. Here, why don’t you let me do it?ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, I will do it. Honey, you have to learn to sit down and relax and let your husband take care of things once and awhile. (Tries the door.) It’s locked, you have to help me. Why is it locked?ScenesMonica: No reason. I-I keep private things in there.ScenesChandler: Oh y’know, I’ve been living here a while and I’ve never seen what’s inside that closet. What is, what is in there?ScenesMonica: Feminine stuff.ScenesChandler: Don’t try to make me uncomfortable with feminine stuff!ScenesMonica: Chandler, there is nothing in there that concerns you! If you love me you-you’ll let it go.ScenesChandler: Fine.ScenesMonica: Thank you! (He tries the door again and Monica glares at him.)ScenesChandler: (walking casually away) Love you.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hello Chandler, lovely day huh? (To Monica) You!ScenesChandler: Phoebe if it helps Alexandra has only been massaging Monica for like three years. (Phoebe rolls her eyes and walks away and Monica glares at him.) If! I said, "If it helps!" (Goes to the bedroom.)ScenesPhoebe: Why won’t you let me massage you?ScenesMonica: Well it’s…I mean I’d just—I’d be self-conscious. You’re my friend; I’d be naked.ScenesPhoebe: Monica! We lived together for years! I’ve seen you naked!ScenesMonica: That’s different, we were roommates! And when?!ScenesPhoebe: I’m curious about the human body.ScenesMonica: Hey, come on Phoebe, you can understand why this would be weird for me.ScenesPhoebe: But I’m a professional! And I’m really good! Look, if you’re uncomfortable we can stop. Just give me a chance, okay. Please?ScenesMonica: Okay, if it means that much to you…ScenesPhoebe: It does! How would you feel if you couldn’t share your cooking? Or-or imagine how Ross would feel if he couldn’t teach us about dragons.ScenesMonica: Dinosaurs.ScenesPhoebe: Potato, potaato.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Rachel are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey Ross! The baby’s kicking!ScenesRoss: What?! It is?! (He tries to quickly remove his gloves, but runs into trouble and finally throws them off of his hands like a hockey player in a fight and grabs Rachel’s belly.)ScenesRachel: It’s not kicking right now. Although we would love to see you do (Mimics him) that again.ScenesRoss: Hey, when-when was it kicking? What happened?ScenesRachel: Last night! I just felt it and I went into Joey’s room and he was sleeping…ScenesJoey: A dreamless sleep.ScenesRoss: My God, the baby’s kicking. That’s great. Although I…kinda wish I-I would’ve been there to feel the kicking for the first time y’know.ScenesJoey: Well I got stuff going on in here (Rubbing his belly) if you wanna feel.ScenesRoss: Look, I-I don’t want to miss anymore baby stuff. So…Here. Here’s my new pager number, okay? Anytime anything pregnancy related happens use it! I’ll be there! Okay? I don’t care if it’s three in the morning and all you want is ice cream.ScenesJoey: Wow! Can I get a copy of that?

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's Apartment, Monica is lying on the massage table waiting for Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (calling from her room) Are you under the sheet?ScenesMonica: Yes.Scenes(Phoebe turns on some music and grabs some oil.)ScenesPhoebe: (in a soothing voice) Great, let’s begin. (She starts the massage.) How’s the pressure?ScenesMonica: Nice! Wow Phoebe you are good!ScenesPhoebe: Stating the obvious, but thank you. And it’s not weird is it.ScenesMonica: No. Ooohh…ScenesPhoebe: That’s right, you just enjoy.ScenesMonica: (in a sexy voice) Oh. Oh yeah! Ohhhhh! Ohh! Oh yeah!ScenesPhoebe: (getting uncomfortable) Okay.ScenesMonica: Oh God Phoebe!! (Phoebe covers one ear.) Oh that’s it! That’s it! Right there! Oh! (Tries to cover the other ear.) Ooooh-oooh-ooooh… (Covers both ears and continues the massage with her elbows.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler has a box of keys and is trying them on the secret closet when someone enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I wasn’t trying to open your closet! I wasn’t trying to open your closet! I swear! (Running into the kitchen and sees its Joey.)ScenesJoey: Whoa, Monica runs a pretty tight ship over here. What are you doing?ScenesChandler: Monica has a secret closet and she won’t let me see what’s in it.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesChandler: I don’t know! What could she possibly be hiding in here that I can’t see?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know. Ooh, I bet it’s Richard.ScenesChandler: Why would Monica be keeping Richard in here?ScenesJoey: Well off the top of my head uhh, maybe she’s having her cake and eating it too. You being the cake and Richard being the too. Or!ScenesChandler: And here we go…ScenesJoey: I saw this movie once where there was a door and no one knew what was behind it, and when they finally got it open millions and millions and millions of bugs came pouring out and they feasted on human flesh. Y’know it wouldn’t kill ya to respect your wife’s privacy! (He walks away and into his apartment and looks the door.) Stupid closet full of bugs!ScenesRachel: Joey. Joey, something feels weird and not good weird. I don’t—Whoa!! (Winces in pain.)ScenesJoey: Oh hey whoa-whoa, don’t worry. Okay. When my sisters were pregnant they got every weird feeling in the book, it was always nothing.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Absolutely. But, we’re gonna stop by the hospital just to be sure, okay? I’ll page Ross on the way. Come on.ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh God—Ow!—Oo!ScenesJoey: Okay Rach-Rach-Rach look at me, look at me, everything’s gonna be fine, trust me. Okay. Take my hand. Here we go. (Rachel grabs his hand.) Oww crushing bones!

rows.Scenes: The Hospital, Joey is in the waiting room as Rachel comes back out with the doctor.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! So?ScenesDr. Long: She’s fine. She’s experiencing Braxton-Hicks contractions, mild discomfort caused by contractions in the uterine wall.ScenesRachel: Hmm, mild discomfort. So I take it you’ve had one of these Braxton thingies?ScenesJoey: So but everything is normal.ScenesDr. Long: Absolutely.ScenesJoey: And-and there’s no danger to her and the baby?ScenesDr. Long: No-no. Contractions can be unnerving if you don’t know what they are, but she’s fine.ScenesRachel: Thank you doctor. (Dr. Long exits.) (To Joey) Oh thank you for being so nice and calm.ScenesJoey: Calm?! I wasn’t calm! I’ve never been more scared in all my life!ScenesRachel: But wait you said everything was gonna be okay.ScenesJoey: Well what do I know?! I’m not a doctor!ScenesRachel: But I—But everything is okay. I’m fine!ScenesJoey: You sure?!ScenesRachel: Yes! Yes! I got half a mind to contract that doctor’s uterus though. Mild discomfort, what’s he talking about?ScenesJoey: (seeing Ross) Oh hey-hey!ScenesRoss: (rushes in) Is everything okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah, everything’s fine!ScenesRoss: Your page said come to the hospital, what? What was it? What happened?ScenesJoey: Something called Braxton-Hicks contractions.ScenesRoss: Oh. Oh. Thank God, most women don’t even feel them.ScenesRachel: Okay, no uterus, no opinion.ScenesJoey: Hey uh, what’s with the candy?ScenesRoss: Oh when you beeped me I was on line at the concession stand at the movie theater.ScenesRachel: Oh you went to the movies by yourself?ScenesRoss: No I—Mona!ScenesRachel: Oh, I gotta go back in there.ScenesRoss: What? Why? What’s wrong?ScenesRachel: No, everything’s fine. I just gotta go back…ScenesRoss: No really, you tell me what’s up.ScenesRachel: I-I forgot my underwear. (Ross lets her go.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) So, thanks so much for bringing her to the hospital.ScenesJoey: Oh hey, don’t worry about it man. Don’t worry about it, no big deal.ScenesRoss: Yeah but still, I mean it should’ve been me. I’m the dad.ScenesDr. Long: (To Joey) Uh, if you have any questions, here’s some information on Braxton-Hicks. (Hands Joey a pamphlet.) Oh and by the way, you did the right thing by bringing her in. You’re gonna make a wonderful father.ScenesJoey: Oh uh, hey. Not as good as this guy! (Grabs Ross around the shoulders.) He brought Twizlers!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Joey and Chandler are still working on the door.]
rows.Content: Chandler: There has got to be a way!ScenesJoey: Easy there Captain Kirk. Oh, do you have a bobby pin?ScenesChandler: Yeah. (Checks his hair.) Oh no wait, I’m not an nine-year-old girl.ScenesJoey: Then why do you throw like one?ScenesChandler: Maybe Monica has a bobby pin.ScenesJoey: Sure. "Monica.ScenesChandler: So, how’s the hideously inappropriate crush on Rachel coming?ScenesJoey: Uh, really good. Really good. Yeah, I should be ready to kill myself any day now. (Chandler returns with a bobby pin and hands it to Joey.) Wow, you sure found that quick. (He tries the pin in the lock.) I just—I wish I didn’t feel this way about Rachel anymore, y’know? I wish things could go back to normal. I mean, I love living with her and God, helping out with the baby is just amazing, but now I think…I think Ross feels left out. Y’know? When I had to take Rachel to the hospital, the doctor thought I was the father. God… You should’ve seen the look on Ross’s face. (Pause) By the way, I have no idea what I’m doing here. For all I know I’m just locking it more. Oh hey, did you try opening it with a credit card?ScenesChandler: That’s a good idea.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Okay. (They switch places and Chandler gets out a credit card.) So uh, Ross is kinda bummed huh?ScenesJoey: Oh, I just…I feel terrible.ScenesChandler: Well, it’s not your fault. What are you gonna do? Not take her to the hospital? Y’know? You’re doing nothing wrong. (Pause) Except for harboring an all consuming love for the woman whose carrying his baby. (He loses his card behind the door.) Richard? If-if you’re in there, could you pass me my credit card?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesMonica: I gotta tell you, yesterday was amazing. That massage felt so good!ScenesPhoebe: No-no, I got that.ScenesMonica: So umm, what do you say we make it a weekly appointment?ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Okay but you should know though, I’ve raised my rates to $200 an hour.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: I mean $500.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: 600.ScenesMonica: What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you make sex noises when you get massaged!ScenesMonica: What? (Laughs.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and it really freaked me out! And after a while I even tried to hurt you and it just spurred you on.ScenesMonica: What?! You’re crazy! There’s nothing sexual about the noises I make!ScenesPhoebe: Really? There’s nothing sexual about this? (Sexily) Oooh. Oo God! Ohh. Ohhhh. Ohh. (Some cute guy is watching closely.) (To him) What are you looking at?! (Pause) I mean hi.ScenesMonica: Oh my—This is so embarrassing. Oh my God, I’m never gonna get massaged again!ScenesPhoebe: No, you can’t let this stop you from getting massages! No look, I have, I have lots of clients that make the same noises you do!ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Well not clients, lovers. But let’s just y’know, try it again. Come back and-and we’ll work through it.ScenesMonica: Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: Yes.ScenesMonica: I guess.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Okay, if you’ll just excuse me. (To the guy) So, did you hear something you liked?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is balancing an aluminum can on her stomach as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Ross! Check it out! I learned a new trick!ScenesRoss: Hey uh, I brought you some lunch.ScenesRachel: Ohh! That’s so sweet of you! Oh yum! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich and starts to get sick.) Did you put pickles on this?ScenesRoss: Well yeah!ScenesRachel: Oh Ross!! (Runs to the bathroom and closes the door.)ScenesRoss: What?! What?! Rach what?!ScenesJoey: What’s going on?ScenesRoss: I made her favorite, tuna salad with pickles.ScenesJoey: Pickle? Pickles make her sick. Giving her pickles is like giving me salad.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) I-I’m sorry Rach, I didn’t know. Are you gonna be okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I’ll be fine. But could someone please make sure that sandwich is gone when I get out there?ScenesJoey: I’m on it! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich.)ScenesRoss: I can’t believe this! I shouldn’t be the one making her throw up!ScenesJoey: Dude relax! It could happen to anyone.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Not to you, because you know this stuff. I don’t know any of it and I’m the father. I wish I’d be more involved y’know.ScenesRachel: (entering) Well, if anyone is keeping score, I no longer eat tuna.ScenesJoey: Hey uh, can I, can I talk to you guys for a second?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: What’s up?ScenesJoey: Uh, sit down. I wanna talk about our situation.ScenesRachel: (Gasps) Are you breaking up with us?ScenesJoey: The thing is…’cause I live with Rachel I’m here for a lot of the stuff, okay? (To Rachel) And Ross…Ross is missing everything. So…ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Maybe you two should live together.ScenesRachel: Are you asking me to move out? Do you not want me here?ScenesJoey: Oh no-no, no-no I love living with you. It just seems that…if you’re gonna have a roommate, y’know it might as well be the father.ScenesRachel: But Joey, I don’t think Ross wants me to move into his apartment and disrupt his life like that. I mean—(Ross turns to her with wishful eyes.)—Or he does.ScenesRoss: No I-I-I would love to be around for you and the baby. And we-we can just try it like on a temporary basis.ScenesRachel: But Ross, its you and me!ScenesRoss: So? Sure! But it-it wouldn’t be anything romantic. And I’m-I’m dating Mona—Damnit Mona! I was supposed to meet her like an hour ago! What is wrong with me?!ScenesJoey: All right now, so? What do you think?ScenesRachel: I don’t know. Is it crazy?ScenesRoss: No! No it’s not. Joey, this is a smart idea.ScenesJoey: Well, I was due.ScenesRachel: Okay, let’s do it. I’ll move in.ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Oh Rach that’s great. That’s great. (They hug and Joey breathes a sigh of relief.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is pounding out the hinge pins on the closet door to get it open.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Not to shabby, I got this all off myself…using my wife’s tools. (He takes the door off the frame and we finally get to see what’s behind the green door! It is stacked, floor to ceiling, with junk.) Oh my God!ScenesMonica: (entering) (Gasps) How did you get in there?!ScenesChandler: (laughs) You’re messy.ScenesMonica: Oh no! You weren’t supposed to see this!ScenesChandler: I married Fred Sanford!ScenesMonica: No Chandler, you don’t understand! (Chandler starts singing the theme for Sanford and Son, an old TV show starring Redd Fox.) Okay! Okay! Okay! Fine! Now you know. Okay? I’m y’know…I’m sick.ScenesChandler: No, honey you’re not sick! Look, I don’t love you because you’re organized, I love you in spite of that.ScenesMonica: Really? You promise you won’t tell anyone?ScenesChandler: Yes! And look, now that I know if I got some extra stuff lying around can we, can we share the closet.ScenesMonica: Well…it’s just umm…I’m afraid you might mess it up.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is drinking a gallon of orange juice as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesChandler: So Rachel’s all moved out huh? How are you taking it?ScenesJoey: Well uh, I wanted to have a few beers, but uh, I got rid of those because Rachel couldn’t stand the smell of them. But I have thrown back a lot of orange juice with calcium though. And uh, it’s a couple weeks past it’s expiration date, so it’s got a bit of a kick.ScenesChandler: Are you okay?ScenesJoey: Are you kidding me? I’m great! Yeah, I’m uh; I’m better than great. I am good. And now that she’s gone, I can uh, I can do all this stuff around here that I couldn’t do before. Y’know? Like umm, I can walk around naked again. Y’know? I can uh, I can watch porn in the living room. Right? This is uh, this is good for me. Y’know? I like being on my own, I’m uh, better off this way. I’m uh, a lone wolf. Y’know? A loner. Alone. All alone. Forever. What’s a wolf got to do to get a huh around here?! (Chandler rushes over and hugs him.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's Apartment, Phoebe is giving Monica another massage.]
rows.Content: Monica: Ohhh.ScenesPhoebe: That’s it. Just relax.ScenesMonica: Ohh. Oh! Ohh!ScenesPhoebe: Come on more!ScenesMonica: Oh God!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you like that don’t you?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah right there!ScenesPhoebe: You want it there? You take it there baby!ScenesMonica: Uh Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, say my name. Say it! (She stops when she realizes what she’s doing.) And now I’m going to cover you back up, and umm we’re never doing this again.ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The Birthing VideoScenesWritten by: Dana Klein BorkowScenesTranscribed by: Dan Gottleib

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel is getting a cup of coffee as Joey and Phoebe enter and sit down.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh! Hey, Rach!ScenesRachel: Hi! Hey, Happy Valentine’s Day!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you, too.ScenesJoey: Hey, so, uh, how’s it going living over at Ross’?ScenesRachel: It’s good. Except he makes us watch the Discovery Channel all day long. Did you know that something really boring happened to someone really ugly in the Middle Ages? (to the waitress handing her a cup of coffee) Oh, thank you. I’ll see you guys later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesJoey: Bye.Scenes(Rachel exits with coffee)ScenesJoey: There’s one lucky to-go cup of coffee.ScenesPhoebe: (sighs) Honey, I wish you would get over her. I hate seeing you like this. Is there anything I can do for you? Do you want to look down my top?ScenesJoey: Thanks. But maybe later.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Gunther, can I get a scone?ScenesGunther: (to Joey) You want anything?ScenesJoey: You know what I want? I want a lot of things! I want to be with the woman I love on Valentine’s Day! And I want her to love me back! And I want just one moment of relief from the gut-wrenching pain of knowing that that’s never going to happen!ScenesGunther: We have red bagels.ScenesJoey: Oh, okay.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s. Phoebe and Ross are sitting in the living room talking.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So, how does Mona feel about you and Rachel living together?ScenesRoss: Oh, I’m actually on my way to tell her right now. Yeah, she’s been away all week visiting her parents, but she’ll be cool. I mean, she’s been so supportive. She-she even got the baby a tiny T-shirt that says, ‘Fossils are my friends.’ScenesPhoebe: Ugh. Come on, Mona, don’t kiss ass.ScenesRoss: Uh, I’m going to take off.ScenesPhoebe: All right. Oh! Shoot! Oh shoot! Uh, Rachel wanted to see this tape!ScenesRoss: What is it?ScenesPhoebe: It’s a video of my friend giving birth. Could you just bring it back to your apartment?ScenesRoss: All right. (reading the label) ‘Candy and Cookie?’ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Candy’s the mother, Cookie’s the daughter. The father’s also Cookie. Why am I friends with these people?ScenesMonica: (entering with something behind her back) Phoebe, c’mere. I want to show you something in the bathroom.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Monica, grow up!ScenesRoss: Hey, what’s behind your back?ScenesMonica: Nothing. Just something I want to get Phoebe’s opinion on for Valentine’s Day.ScenesRoss: You don’t want my opinion?ScenesMonica: Not really.ScenesRoss: Come on, I’m your older brother, ask me!ScenesMonica: All right, big brother. (holds up two erm…revealing articles of clothing) Which of these do you think would make your little sister look hotter, so your best friend would want to do her?ScenesRoss: (quietly) The red one.

rows.Scenes: Joey and…wait…just Joey’s. Joey is sitting at the counter eating a pizza.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (knocking and entering) Hey. Look, I know you’ve been really depressed lately, so I brought someone over to cheer you up. Right outside this door is a real, live, furry playmate.ScenesJoey: No, I’m not sleeping with your friend Jane again.Scenes(Phoebe goes into the hall and brings a dog inside!)ScenesPhoebe: He-hee!ScenesJoey: Hey! A dog! Hi! Who, you got to admit, looks a lot like Jane.ScenesPhoebe: This is the happiest dog in the world. I borrowed him from my friend Wendy. Now, you can only keep him until he cheers you up. And he will cheer you up!ScenesJoey: Thanks so much, Pheebs! (to the dog) We are going to have so much fun, yes we are! (the dog sticks his head between Joey’s legs) Oh! Not that kind of fun.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s. Chandler enters with a bouquet of roses.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Happy Valentine’s!ScenesMonica: (from her bedroom) Okay! I’ll be right out. I’m slipping into something a little less comfortable, and a little more slutty.ScenesChandler: (picking up a video from the table) ‘Candy and Cookie’. ‘Candy and Cookie?’ Monica got me porn?! Girl-on-girl porn?! She really must love me!! (Chandler runs over to the TV, puts the tape in, and sits down to enjoy some "porn")Scenes(A woman on TV breaths hard)ScenesMan on TV: Yeah, just relax.ScenesChandler: I love you, St. Valentine.Scenes(The woman groans, moans, grunts, and screams. Chandler’s eyes get huge!)ScenesChandler: Woah, woah, that’s not pretty!ScenesMan on TV: Now, push!ScenesWoman on TV: Ow! Ow! Ooh! That hurts!ScenesChandler: Worst porn ever! Worst porn ever! (Chandler starts to press buttons on the remote control, frantically.)ScenesWoman on TV: Ohhh! Make it stop!ScenesChandler: I am trying!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s. Joey is playing fetch with the dog.]
rows.Content: Joey: Get the ball, ready? Get the ball, get the ball! (Joey pretends to throw it, but really doesn’t, and the dog goes running off.) Well, you’re cute, but you’re not too smart!Scenes(The dog returns with a ball that looks exactly like the same one Joey has.)ScenesJoey: (looking at the ball the dog brought back) Did I just throw this?ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi.ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesRachel: I accidentally packed these with my stuff. (looks at the dog and gasps) Who is this?ScenesJoey: Oh, that’s, uh, that’s Phoebe’s friend’s dog. I don’t know what his real name is, but I call him Mozzarella.ScenesRachel: (talking with a higher voice, and puckered lips…kind of like you do to a baby or...well…a puppy…it’s hard to explain. Just use your imagination!) Oh, well, you are so cute! I wish I could play with you more, but I’ve got to go to work! I hope I stop talking like this before my marketing meeting, yes I do. Yes I do. (still talking like that) Bye-bye, Joey. Oh, I seriously can’t stop it. (exits)ScenesJoey: (to the dog) C’mere. Hey. C’mere. That’s Rachel. She’s the one who used to live here. Might as well be honest with you—we love her. But we can’t have her. I really miss her. Well, hey, you understand, right? You’re a guy. (thinks about it and picks up the dog and looks) Well, you used to be.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s. Chandler is sitting on the couch staring at the tape on the coffee table with his eyes huge and his mouth wide open.]
rows.Content: Monica: (entering from her bedroom) So what do you think? (referring to her outfit)Scenes(Chandler glances up at Monica with his mouth still wide open and his eyes still huge)ScenesMonica: (to herself) I’ve still got it!ScenesChandler: (pointing at the video) Why did you get me this?ScenesMonica: What is it?ScenesChandler: It’s yelling…bleeding…dilating. Oh, the dilating…ScenesMonica: Is this the video of the baby being born? Sweetie, this is Phoebe’s. Why were you even watching it?ScenesChandler: I thought…maybe…you got me porn for Valentine’s Day.ScenesMonica: Chandler, if you thought I was going to get you porn for Valentine’s Day… (pulls a video out of a basket) you were right! Apparently, it’s about a young girl who moves to the big city, you know, in search of stardom, but ends up having sex with a lot of guys! Yeah, it got four starts! (looks closer) Oh, wait a minute. Those aren’t stars. Anyway, you want to take a look?ScenesChandler: Well, I’m not really in a sexy mood right now.ScenesMonica: Honey, what’s going on?ScenesChandler: Well, remember the first time we saw Jaws?ScenesMonica: Mm-hmm.ScenesChandler: How long it took to go back in the water?ScenesMonica: Chandler, we can’t let this tape wreck Valentine’s Day!ScenesChandler: You don’t know. You didn’t see it.ScenesMonica: Child-birth, it’s a natural thing! It’s beautiful.ScenesChandler: Oh, beautiful? Really? Beautiful? You think this is beautiful? (picks up the remote and presses a button, and he immediately makes a face that just looks like he’s going to throw up!)ScenesMonica: Oh! Oh, my God! No wonder my mother hates me!ScenesChandler: See, honey, there’s—(puts his hand on her leg)ScenesMonica: Don’t touch me!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Ross is sitting on the couch reading a magazine as Mona enters.]
rows.Content: Mona: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey! (they hug) So, how was Atlantic City?ScenesMona: Good.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesMona: I brought you back a present.ScenesRoss: Wha—? Oh, come on. You didn’t have to—saltwater taffy?! (Mona laughs) Thanks! This is interesting. You know, most people think this is made with sea water, but it’s actually made with, uh, salted fresh water. That’s not interesting.ScenesMona: I think it’s interesting.ScenesRoss: I do too! I missed you!ScenesMona: I missed you, too! So, how was your week?ScenesRoss: Oh, it was good! It was good. Actually, the baby started kicking!ScenesMona: How exciting!ScenesRoss: Yeah! I know! It was. Oh… the only sad thing is I wasn’t around when it happened for the first time.ScenesMona: Oh no.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I’m missing out on all this other stuff, too. So, Joey suggested Rachel move in with me.ScenesMona: (laughing) Yeah right!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMona: Joey cracks me up! It’s like, ‘Yeah, why don’t you have your ex-wife move in with you? That wouldn’t be awkward at all!’ (she laughs again)ScenesRoss: (not amused) Huh…uh-huh.ScenesMona: Huh, could you imagine. I go away for a few days, and come back, and my boyfriend is living with some woman he got pregnant! (Mona laughs…yes…again!)Scenes(Ross fake laughs, obviously not finding this funny, and he’s starting to panic, so he shoves the whole saltwater taffy he’s eating in his mouth)ScenesMona: So, what’d you tell him?ScenesRoss: (with his mouth full) Just a second! (he fake laughs, but turns his head and starts to break down)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Ross and Phoebe are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: How could you not tell Mona that Rachel is living with you?ScenesRoss: I don’t know, she seemed to think it was such a crazy idea! Um, plus, she, uh, she got me taffy!ScenesPhoebe: Taffy, really? I’ve never had any.ScenesRoss: Ever?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think my mother was too busy planning her suicide to provide saltwater treats. (Ross hands her one) Thank you! So what, you’re just never going to tell her?ScenesRoss: Oh, no, no, no, I will! I just want to butter her up, first! You know, I’m going to take her to an amazing Valentine’s dinner. Do all this romantic stuff, and then, just when she thinks I’m the best boyfriend in the world, then I’m going to tell her that my pregnant ex-girlfriend is living with me.ScenesPhoebe: If I haven’t said it before: she’s a lucky, lucky lady! So, where are you going to—what the mother of crap is up with this stuff? (Referring to the taffy, which she’s been chewing this whole time.) Oh, God. Is it gum, is it food? What’s the deal? (she swallows it, finally) Oh, it’s nice! May I try a pink one?

rows.Scenes: Joey’s. Joey is laying on his recliner, depressed, and the dog is laying on the footrest.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, between her and me being friends, and her history with Ross, it just isn’t going to happen. It would be like you falling in love with a cat.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, buddy. How’s my favorite dog, huh? How’s my favorite dog? (the dog doesn’t move) You’re subdued. (to Joey) Did you give him a beer?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Will you excuse us, we need to talk for a moment.ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure. Go ahead. (pause) Oh, me, right!Scenes(Joey follows Phoebe into the kitchen)ScenesPhoebe: He’s miserable! What happened to him?ScenesJoey: Nothing. We just talked about stuff.ScenesPhoebe: What stuff?ScenesJoey: Rachel stuff.ScenesPhoebe: Oh…Joey, you bummed him out! This was the happiest dog in the world, and he spends half a day with you, and look at him!ScenesJoey: He’s breathing!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I’m going to take him back to Wendy’s.ScenesJoey: No, no, no, no! He’s fine! Look, look, look! (picks up the ball) Here’s your ball! Get your ball! Get your ball! (he throws the ball and it bounces right next to the dog) Get your ball! My God, what have I done to you, huh? I broke the dog! Pheebs, I broke the dog!

rows.Scenes: Ross and…Rachel’s…I guess I have to call it that now. Rachel is reading on the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Well, I’m, uh, going to pick up Mona. What have you got going tonight?ScenesRachel: Oh, I’ve got big Valentine’s plans! I’ve got my Chinese food on the way, and the rest of your saltwater taffy!ScenesRoss: Y’know, it’s interesting! Most people think that’s made with seawater, when in fact—ScenesRachel: Ross, we actually watched the documentary together.Scenes(There is a knock on the door.)ScenesRachel: Ooh! My Chinese food! Let me get my cash! (runs to her room to get her money)ScenesRoss: (opening the door to see Mona standing there) Mona? What are—hi! What are you doing here? I’m, um, supposed to pick you up!ScenesMona: Change of plans, I made you a special Valentine’s dinner! Surprise!ScenesRoss: (he makes some really weird noise hear that sounds kind of like…)Ayyyayyyy!ScenesRachel: (entering) Oh, hey, Mona!ScenesMona: Hi! Hi. Hi, Rachel! (to Ross) What’s she doing here?ScenesRoss: I have no idea!ScenesRachel: I’ll be watching TV if anybody needs me. (exits to her room)ScenesMona: Seriously, what is she doing?ScenesRoss: Uh…lately, she just likes hanging out here.ScenesMona: Why?ScenesRoss: I think she’s lonely.ScenesMona: Okay, but it’s Valentine’s Day!ScenesRoss: I know.ScenesMona: Can’t we just ask her to go?ScenesRoss: No, no. She’s way to emotional. And by emotional I mean crazy.Scenes(Doorbell rings)ScenesRachel: I’m not here! That’s just my Chinese food!ScenesMona: Oh, my God! She has food delivered here?ScenesRoss: Mm-hmm. She’s—she’s emotional, but, but ballsy.ScenesRachel: You know what I’m going to do? I’m going to get in my sweats, and eat this in bed! (exits)ScenesRoss: And you thought she was going to be in our way! So, why don’t you, uh, open the champagne, and I’ll be right back. I’ve got a surprise for you.ScenesMona: You got another ex-wife back there?ScenesRoss: (fakes a laugh) Please start drinking! (exits)ScenesRachel: (entering) I’m just going to grab the phone.ScenesMona: Oh, Rachel! Wait! Hey, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way, but, but, um… what are you doing?ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry! Do you need the phone?ScenesMona: No, no. Listen, Ross is too nice to say anything, but this is his apartment, and, and, we gotta have some boundaries, so why don’t you go back to your place and give us some privacy?ScenesRachel: (as Ross enters with a present) But, but, Mona, I live here.ScenesRoss: (handing Mona the present) Happy Valentine’s Day! …Or something to remember me by.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s. Monica and Chandler are sitting on the couch still staring at the screen.]
rows.Content: Monica: How long has it been this time?ScenesChandler: 90 seconds.ScenesMonica: That’s better. 90 seconds is a long time not to think about it…except all I did was think about it.ScenesChandler: You know, it haunts me? Up ‘til now, the worst thing I ever saw, was my father doing tequila shots off the naked houseboy. After this, I would gladly make that my screensaver!ScenesMonica: Okay, well, we have to get past this! Why don’t we get rid of the tape and pretend it never existed?ScenesChandler: I can do that.ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes(Chandler takes the tape and sticks it under the chair cushion)ScenesChandler: Okay. Now all we’ve got to do is get rid of this chair.Scenes(Chandler crawls over to Monica and they move in to kiss, but they can’t do it and back up. They move in to kiss again, and kiss very awkwardly for a second, until someone knocks on the door.)ScenesMonica: Oh, thank God!ScenesChandler: Oh, I know!ScenesMonica: Come in!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi! I’m so sorry to barge in on your Valentine’s, but I had to get away from all the yelling. Mona is dumping Ross.ScenesMonica: Oh, my God.ScenesChandler: Poor Ross.Scenes(Monica and Chandler both look at each other and run over to the window to watch the action in Ross’ apartment)ScenesChandler: Oh, great. We have to watch him do yoga in his underwear, but for this he closes the drapes!ScenesMonica: Rach, you know that birthing tape you wanted to see? It’s here.ScenesChandler: Oh, and we should warn you, before you watch it: don’t watch it.ScenesRachel: Why? You saw it? Is it scary?ScenesChandler: Well, let’s just say it’s ironic how footage of someone being born can make you want to kill yourself.ScenesRachel: Well, now, wait. Now I’m all freaked out. Come on, you guys will watch it with me.ScenesMonica: No, but I will leave a sweater that smells like me right next to you!ScenesRachel: C’mon, seriously, you guys, you’re not going to make me watch this alone!ScenesMonica: She’s right…of course not. Honey, get the tape.ScenesChandler: (with his arm all the way under the cushion, moving it around) This reminds me of a very specific part of the tape. (Chandler puts the tape in, and they all sit down) Okay, here we go.ScenesRachel: Okay. (watching the tape) Ooh, my! (Rachel jumps when the woman starts screaming) Woah! Why is that baby torturing that woman?!ScenesChandler: Why have I seen this thing three times?!ScenesMonica: It’s…still beautiful.ScenesRachel: Uh! It’s horrible!ScenesMonica: I know! I know, I’m so sorry for you!ScenesRachel: Oh, my God!Scenes(Monica and Rachel both cover their eyes)ScenesChandler: Wait, you guys, look!ScenesRachel: What? Did her ass explode?!ScenesChandler: No, the baby’s out! Look, look!ScenesMonica: Oh, look at those little fingers and toes!ScenesChandler: And look how happy the mom is now!ScenesMonica: Oh…Rach!ScenesRachel: Oh, screw you guys, you don’t have to do it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Ross is getting coffee as Joey comes from…God knows where! Some back area of Central Perk around the corner that we’ve never seen! Weeeiiirrrddd….]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, hey, man!ScenesJoey: Hey, what’s up?ScenesRoss: Uh…Mona just dumped me.ScenesJoey: Oh, man, I’m sorry. Why?ScenesRoss: Well, with everything that’s been going on lately, I haven’t exactly been the perfect boyfriend. You know, I, uh, I didn’t tell her I got Rachel pregnant.
