I gave her a key to my apartment, and then had the locks changed! And then I lied to her about Rachel moving in with me. In a way, I actually judge her for not breaking up with me sooner, you know?ScenesJoey: Still, that really sucks, man. Especially on Valentine’s Day.ScenesRoss: Yeah. Wait a minute. What are you doing here? Joey Tribbiani without a date on Valentine’s Day? What’s going on, huh? Girl trouble?ScenesJoey: Sort of.ScenesRoss: Really?!ScenesJoey: You don’t have to seem so happy about it.ScenesRoss: Oh, sorry. Well, look, maybe I can help you with it.ScenesJoey: Oh, I…I d—ScenesRoss: Hey, whatever it is, I am sure it has happened to me. Y’know, actually once—once I got dumped during sex.Scenes(Two girls sitting at a table next to them look up in disgust, and Ross and Joey move away)ScenesRoss: Anyway, so, uh, so what is it?ScenesJoey: Forget about it. It’s no big deal.ScenesRoss: C’mon! Joey! What is it?ScenesJoey: It’s nothing.ScenesRoss: Hey, hey, it’s me. Why can’t you tell me?ScenesJoey: Okay, uh…sit down. (they do) Um… there’s this woman that I like. A lot. But, uh…it can’t happen.ScenesRoss: She’s not a Tribbiani?ScenesJoey: No!ScenesRoss: I knew it. So, is she someone from work?ScenesJoey: Yes.ScenesRoss: Well, uh, does she like you?ScenesJoey: Sometimes I think maybe she could. But it doesn’t matter, because I can’t do anything about it.ScenesRoss: Why not?ScenesJoey: Well, it’s complicated. She’s with this other guy. For a long time. Someone from work, too. And I could never do that to the guy, because we’re really good friends.ScenesRoss: So, uh, this guy, she used to go out with, is, uh… is he still in love with her?ScenesJoey: No. I don’t think so.ScenesRoss: Okay. Um… is he a good guy?ScenesJoey: Yeah, he’s the best.ScenesRoss: Then talk to him! He might be fine with it.ScenesJoey: Oh, I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Joey, it’s worth finding out. I mean, if you really like her.ScenesJoey: I do! So much! I can’t stop thinking about her! I can’t sleep, I—ScenesRoss: Okay, Joey, you know what? You have to go for it. How often does this happen to you, huh? You owe it to yourself.ScenesGunther: (placing a cup in front of Ross) Here’s your warm milk.ScenesRoss: I’m going to…uh…I’m going to, um, put the bourbon in it at home.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah.ScenesRoss: Anyway… seriously, uh…just…just talk to the guy, okay? And tell me how it goes. (walks towards the door until…)ScenesJoey: It’s Rachel.Scenes(Ross just stands in the doorway, for like a minute…Ahh! What’s going to happen next??!!! I can’t make it all the way through the Olympics!!!)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel’s. Rachel is standing in front of the TV holding a video.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (thinking) You’re going to have a baby, and you need to be prepared. Now, you’re going to make yourself watch the whole thing. Just do it! (Rachel puts the tape in the VCR)ScenesWoman on TV: I came to the big city to become a star! I’ll do…anything to make that happen!ScenesMan on TV: Anything?Scenes(Music starts playing…yes…you know what kind of music…)ScenesRachel: (thinking) Hmm…maybe it starts with how she gets pregnant.ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Joey Tells RachelScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesLisa Kudrow: (voiceover) Previously on Friends

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is talking to Ross]
rows.Content: Joey: There’s this woman, that I like.  A lot.  Well, it’s complicated.  She’s with this other guy.  For a long time.  And I could never do that to the guy, y’know?  ’Ccause we’re really good friends.ScenesRoss: So, uh, this guy, she used to go out with, is, uh… is he a good guy?ScenesJoey: Yeah, he’s the best.ScenesRoss: Then talk to him! He might be fine with it.ScenesJoey: Oh, I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Joey, it’s worth finding out. I mean, if you really like her.ScenesJoey: I do! So much! I can’t stop thinking about her! I can’t sleep, I—ScenesRoss: Okay, Joey, you know what? You have to go for it. How often does this happen to you, huh? You owe it to yourself. (Walks towards the door until…)ScenesJoey: It’s Rachel.Scenes[Fade to Black, then fade in again with Ross stopped at the doorway.]ScenesRoss: (closes the door) Did you um—I’m sorry, did you just say it’s Rachel?ScenesJoey: Yes.ScenesRoss: Um, you…you like Rachel?ScenesJoey: Yes. I like Rachel.ScenesRoss: Rachel?!ScenesJoey: (startled) Yeah, okay but look, buy uh—Hey-hey, y’know, y’know who else I like? You! And it-it doesn’t get said enough. I like you Ross.ScenesRoss: But R-R-Rachel-Rachel?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, but it’s not a big deal.ScenesRoss: It’s not a big deal? Oh, I’m sorry I just…um, I…what about all the stuff you-you just said? I mean how about, I like—you-you can’t stop thinking about her. Like how you can’t sleep?ScenesJoey: I’m an actor, y’know? As-as a group, we tend to be over dramatic.ScenesRoss: Rachel who’s carrying my baby? Rachel?ScenesJoey: Look no, I-I know it’s bad, and I know it’s wrong. Okay? But-but it’s not like anything’s ever gonna happen. Y’know? These-these are just feelings, they’re gonna go away.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? I-I gotta go. (Starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Oh come on Ross! Hey Ross-Ross don’t…ScenesRoss: (stops) I just—y’know—I-I just have one—Rachel?!Scenes(He exits and starts to walk away, passes a window, stops, and says "Rachel?!" again. Joey sighs and turns around to face Gunther.)ScenesGunther: Rachel?!!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel and Chandler are on the couch.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh-oh! Okay, she’s kicking!ScenesChandler: Oh! (Puts his hand on her belly.) She’s growing inside you.ScenesRachel: Whoa!!ScenesChandler: Oh! (Pulls his hand away.)ScenesRachel: Wow that was a big one.ScenesChandler: I think that’s the youngest girl ever to reject me.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh hey you guys!ScenesChandler: Oh hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey listen let me ask you, do you believe in soul mates?ScenesRachel: Oh yes I do. I do. I believe that there is one perfect person out there for everyone. And do you know how you find him? You stop looking for him. That’s why I stopped looking for Russell Crowe. He’ll find me.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, (To Chandler) and you?ScenesChandler: No. I mean I believe that uh, certain people are more suited for each other and I believe in falling in love, but soul mates, I don’t think they exist.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, good.ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesPhoebe: Well last night, I met Monica’s.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I had a date with this guy, and I swear to God, he is her other half.ScenesChandler: Come on, don’t be crazy. (To Rachel) You don’t think there’s someone out there better suited for Monica than me, do ya? (Rachel looks at him.)ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) Well, what’s he like?!ScenesPhoebe: Well he’s tall.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: He has brown hair.ScenesRachel: Of course, of course.ScenesChandler: A tall guy with hair similar to mine, oh unknowable universe!ScenesPhoebe: He works with food!ScenesRachel: Oh sure. Older?ScenesPhoebe: Obviously, and he’s British.ScenesRachel: Oh, I was just gonna ask!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah? And, he’s-he’s so centered and mature and confident.ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s so sad they never had a chance to meet.ScenesChandler: Luckily, the guy she settled for can’t hear what you’re talking about.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’m so sorry. Um, and maybe I’m wrong! I but—y’know I’m gonna go out with him again, I’ll find out more.ScenesChandler: You believe that this guy is destined for someone else and you’re still gonna date him?ScenesPhoebe: Well, he may not be my soul mate, but a girl’s gotta eat.

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is opening the door to Monica.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesMonica: I just talked to Joey, I just—I want to see how you were.ScenesRoss: Oh y’know, I still—I can’t believe it. Joey and Rachel I mean it’s… It’s like you and me going out, only weirder!ScenesMonica: All right, I know you’re hurting, and-and I want to be supportive, but don’t say that again.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! What if, what if they get married? Then he’d be the stepfather of my child.ScenesMonica: Honey, I don’t think that’s something we need to worry about! First of all he’s-he’s never gonna tell her how he feels about her. And even if he did you have no idea how she’d react.ScenesRoss: Sure, because women never like Joey. Y’know, I think he’s a virgin.ScenesMonica: Joey…he’s not even thinking about going after Rachel!ScenesRoss: He’s not?ScenesMonica: No! All he’s thinking about is how you’re taking this! I mean, listen it’s totally freaking him out. He’s talking about moving to Vermont.ScenesRoss: Why?ScenesMonica: He says he wants to leave the country. (Pause) He thinks you hate him.ScenesRoss: Hate him? I… No, I don’t hate him. (Pause) It’s just it’s Rachel, y’know?ScenesMonica: Honey I can’t even imagine how hard this must be for you. But, I don’t want you to lose Joey over it. And right now he just needs to know that you’re still his friend.ScenesRoss: Okay. Okay, I’ll talk to him.ScenesMonica: All right. Now do it soon, he just asked me how to convert his dollars into Vermont money.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are on the couch as Phoebe enters with Monica’s soul mate.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh! Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Chandler, Monica, this is Don.ScenesDon: Oh, hello. (Shakes Chandler’s hand.) Hello. (Shakes Monica’s hand.)ScenesPhoebe: (mouths to Chandler) Soul mate.ScenesChandler: (mouths to Phoebe) What?ScenesPhoebe: (cough talks) Soul mate.ScenesMonica: So, what have you guys been doing?ScenesDon: Well, we just had a terrible lunch today at Reattica. What is with all the sun-dried tomatoes at that place?ScenesMonica: I know! What is this, 1985?!ScenesDon: That’s exactly what I said. Phoebe, isn’t that strange.ScenesMonica: Not really.ScenesChandler: What’s wrong with sun-dried tomatoes? (Everyone stares at him.) On a barbecue chicken pizza? (Still there’s staring.) No?ScenesMonica: So Don, what-what other restaurants do you like?ScenesDon: Well, Octavio, 27&7—Oh! And there’s this great little place, Alessandro’s.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! That’s my restaurant, I’m the chef there.ScenesDon: You’re kidding me!ScenesMonica: No!ScenesDon: Your food is fantastic! Wow, I really want to talk to you about your menu, once I get some coffees first. Um, anyone want any?ScenesMonica: Oh, I’d like a latte. Oh y’know what? If you’re gonna talk about me, I’m gonna go with you.Scenes(They go over to the counter and Chandler moves closer to Phoebe.)ScenesChandler: What are you doing?!ScenesPhoebe: Nothing! I swear to God I didn’t know you guys would be here! And the good news is you didn’t believe in soul mates. So…ScenesChandler: I believe in tall, handsome strangers who hit on my wife!ScenesPhoebe: They’re just talking, and y’know what? Just because I think they’re soul mates doesn’t mean anything’s gonna happen.ScenesMonica: (returning) Phoebe, good work.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Yeah! Oh he’s great, I love him. (Walks away and Chandler glares at Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Don’t worry, we’ll find you someone else.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Apartment, there’s a knock on the door and Joey answers it to Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesJoey: Look, I understand if you came by to hit me, I deserve it.ScenesRoss: No, I don’t want to hit you.ScenesJoey: Oh what then? Kick me?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesJoey: (getting worried) Bite me?ScenesRoss: No, no I don’t want to do anything to you. All right? I just want to tell you that I’m not mad at you and…and that I certainly do not hate you. I just, I just came here to say that. (Starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Oh now—Hey Ross-Ross! Do you wanna-wanna come in for a beer or something?ScenesRoss: Uh…yeah sure. (Enters.)ScenesJoey: Do uh, do you got any beer? All-all I got is this melon stuff that Rachel left. I don’t…ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJoey: (pouring two glasses) Hey look Ross, you need to understand something okay? I uh…I am never gonna act on this Rachel thing, okay? I-I would never do anything to jeopardize my friendship with you. (He hands Ross a glass.)ScenesRoss: Thank you.Scenes(They clink glasses and take a drink. Ross likes it, Joey hates it. Then Ross sees Joey hating it, mimics he hates it as well.)ScenesJoey: Anyway, it uh…look it’ll just…take me a while to get over her, that’s all. I’m not even sure how to do that, I mean I’ve never been in love before so…ScenesRoss: What?! You’re in love with her.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I thought you knew that.ScenesRoss: Umm, no.ScenesJoey: Wow. Hey look, if it helps, I don’t want to feel this way. Honest. I just keep thinking, "Ah, I’ll get over this." Y’know? I just—It just keeps gettin’ harder. I don’t, I don’t know what to do. Y’know? What do I do?Scenes(Pause)ScenesRoss: I think you need to tell her how you feel.ScenesJoey: Okay that’s the green stuff talkin’.ScenesRoss: No, I’m serious. You-you need to find out where she is, because if she’s not where you are, then you can start to move past this.ScenesJoey: But what if uh—and I’m not saying she will be—But…ScenesRoss: If she is where you are then uh…then my feeling weird about it shouldn’t stand in the way.ScenesJoey: Are you sure?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Look if-if she’s gonna end up with somebody else, the truth is she couldn’t find a better guy. So…ScenesJoey: Hey thanks.ScenesRoss: So when do you think you’re gonna talk to her?ScenesJoey: Oh my God I have to tell her! I haven’t even thought about what I will say. What should I say?ScenesRoss: I’m understanding, but let’s not get carried away.ScenesJoey: I’m sorry, you’re right. What am I gonna say? (He takes another sip of the green stuff and recoils at the taste.) Oh!ScenesRoss: Yeah, tell me about it. (He stands up, turns his back to Joey, and enjoys another sip.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Chandler are watching Monica and Don talk.]
rows.Content: Don: …so I’ve been slowly phasing out the wine importing and focusing more on the cheese side of things.ScenesChandler: Cheese you say? That’s some pretty smelly work, huh Don?ScenesDon: Excuse me?ScenesChandler: Cheese, it’s smelly. You must smell a lot of the time too.ScenesDon: Uh, not really. But when it comes to cheese, I’m one of the people who thinks the smellier the better.ScenesMonica: Me too! Yeah, Chandler can’t stand it. He won’t even allow me to have blue cheese in the house.ScenesDon: And you’re still married to him? (They both laugh, and Chandler tries to but fails.)ScenesMonica: You know what I’d love to do? I would like to go to France and eat nothing but bread and cheese—Not even bread, just cheese. No, I want the bread. Yeah. Ah, and pastries… (Breathlessly) And pate. Oh, I’m really not high, it’s just I used to be fat.ScenesDon: Well if you where ever enter the Loire valley let me know, I’ve got a great little villa you can stay at.ScenesChandler: Is it made of cheese?ScenesDon: No. But God, a house made of cheese, wouldn’t that be incredible?!ScenesMonica: I’d move in tomorrow!ScenesChandler: (disgusted) Oh come on! (To Phoebe) Are you listening to this?ScenesPhoebe: I’m so sorry.ScenesChandler: What do we do?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, they both want to live in a house of cheese! I don’t know how you fight that.

rows.Scenes: Outside Ross and Rachel's, Joey walks up to knock on the door, but stops.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay. Okay, I can do this. I can tell her how I feel. Just uh, just stand up straight. (Does so.) Take a couple deep breaths. (Does so.) Look confident. (Does so as Rachel opens the door and startles him.)ScenesRachel: Joey? What’s up?ScenesJoey: I uh, I just came by because I-I want to talk to you about something.ScenesRachel: Okay what’s up?ScenesJoey: Here? In the hall? What are we animals?ScenesRachel: Well honey, I’m late for a meeting. So can you just make it quick?ScenesJoey: Okay umm, I just came by to tell you that I…want to have dinner with you tonight. That’s all.ScenesRachel: Sure! That sounds great! Just leave me a message and tell me where to meet you. Okay? (Walks away.)ScenesJoey: Okay. That’s good. Okay, that give you a couple hours to prepare what you’re gonna say. Good. Yeah. (Someone comes out of his apartment and it startles Joey again.) Don’t you people ever knock?!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are entering.]
rows.Content: Monica: I’d like to have Don and Phoebe over. Wouldn’t that be nice?ScenesChandler: Sure, why don’t you set it up. I’ll just be over here, browsing through the personals.ScenesMonica: Are you okay? You’ve been acting weird all afternoon.ScenesChandler: Yeah, fine. Fine. Not perfect!! But good enough.ScenesMonica: Jeez! What is with you?ScenesChandler: I’m sorry, did you say cheese?ScenesMonica: All right, what’s going on?ScenesChandler: Phoebe thinks you and Don are soul mates, and I don’t believe in that kind of stuff. But then you two totally get along. So look, I won’t stand in your way if you want to run off with Don and live in a house of cheese.ScenesMonica: Chandler, you don’t believe in soul mates?ScenesChandler: No. But I’m sure (mimics Don) ‘tomatoes’ does.ScenesMonica: I don’t believe in soul mates either.ScenesChandler: You don’t?ScenesMonica: No. I don’t think that you and I were destined to end up together. I think that we fell in love and work hard at our relationship. Some days we work really hard.ScenesChandler: So you…you don’t want to live with Don in a cheese house?ScenesMonica: No, I’ve had second thoughts about that. Do you realize how hard that would be to clean?ScenesChandler: I love you.ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? I am going to take you out to dinner tonight. I found this place that makes the greatest mozzarella sticks and jalepino poppers . (Monica doesn’t look impressed.) No? Really? They taste so good.

rows.Scenes: A restaurant, Joey and Rachel are having dinner.]
rows.Content: Rachel: …and I know Chandler is kidding but it happens every time he touches my stomach. I mean I’m really worried the baby’s not going to like him. (Joey is staring at the table.) Are you okay?ScenesJoey: What? Yeah! Sure! Uh, look at the uh, the reason…(Exhales slowly)—Is it hot in here?ScenesRachel: No. Not-not for me, but why don’t you take off your sweater?ScenesJoey: I would, but this is a nice place and my T-shirt has a picture of Calvin doing Hobbs.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Really?! Can I see it?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Sure. (They both half stand up, Joey pulls the neck of his sweater out, and Rachel looks down it to see his T-shirt.)ScenesRachel: Huh. Wow, I wouldn’t think Hobbs would like that so much.ScenesJoey: Uh… How long have we known each other?ScenesRachel: Um, seven…e-e-eight, eight years. Wow.ScenesJoey: Uh-huh, long time.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: But over the past few weeks…Scenes(A waiter runs over interrupting Joey.)ScenesWaiter: Hah, sorry about the wait, but it is mega-jammed in here! We have a couple specials tonight…ScenesJoey: Actually uh, could you give us a second?ScenesWaiter: Sure. Sure. (Turns away, then turns back) Second’s up! (Joey glares at him.) Not…that kind of table. (He walks away.)ScenesRachel: So you were saying?ScenesJoey: I’m not quite sure.ScenesRachel: Okay, well you had asked me how long we had known each other, and I said, "Eight years." And the um, waiter came over and cut his tip in half, and umm…now here we are.ScenesJoey: Yeah, here we are. Uhh… I… I think I’m…falling in love with you.ScenesRachel: (stunned) What?ScenesJoey: I’m falling in love with you.ScenesRachel: (looking around) Who are you talking too? Oh, you’re kidding! Oh, it’s a joke! (Laughs.) It’s funny. It’s funny. I don’t get it. (Joey doesn’t say any thing and Rachel realizes it’s not a joke.) Oh. (Pause) Okay. Umm… I-I…uh, wow. Are you uh… How did umm… When?ScenesJoey: Does it really matter?ScenesRachel: Wow! Wow. Wow. Wow, it is hot in here.ScenesJoey: Okay look Rach, I know this is a lot. You don’t have to say anything. You-you uh, you take as much time as you need. (Long pause as Rachel says nothing.) Okay, you gotta say something!ScenesRachel: Joey, Joey I love you so much, but I…ScenesJoey: But. (Hangs his head down.)ScenesRachel: Joey.ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah right. That’s okay. That’s fine. That’s uh, pretty much what I was expecting. So uh, it’s no big deal. All right? I think I’m gonna go. (Stands up.)ScenesRachel: No! Joey please! Please don’t! Please don’t leave like this! Now come on, you cannot do this to a pregnant woman! (Starts to cry.)ScenesJoey: Don’t start doing that. You can’t do that Rach, ‘cause then you’re gonna make me do that. (Starts to cry.) Oh, here we go! (Sits down next to her.)ScenesRachel: Can I? (Hug him.)ScenesJoey: Sure!Scenes(They hug.)ScenesRachel: Oh Joey honey I don’t…I don’t want to lose…ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey, hey! You can’t. Okay? Ever!ScenesRachel: I’m so sorry.ScenesJoey: Oh no-no Rach, please, don’t be sorry. Okay? Don’t be sorry. (They hug again.) Y’know I was only kidding you.ScenesRachel: Yeah, that was a real good one.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: A restaurant, Joey and Rachel are still hugging as a waiter walks by the table to talk to the annoying waiter from before who is watching.]
rows.Content: Waiter No. 2: Is this your table?ScenesWaiter: Yeah.ScenesWaiter No. 2: God, you’re gonna be here all night!ScenesWaiter: I know! I haven’t even read them the specials yet!ScenesWaiter No. 2: What’s the matter with them?ScenesWaiter: I don’t know. I think maybe one of them is dying. (Pause) I kinda hope it’s the girl. (The other waiter is shocked.) The guy is really cute!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Tea LeavesScenesTeleplay by: Steven RosenhausScenesStory by: R. Lee Flemming, Jr.ScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Rachel walks up the stairs and knocks on Joey’s door.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey? Are you in there?Scenes[Cut to inside Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Chandler and Joey are eating breakfast.]ScenesJoey: (hearing Rachel and jumping up with his plate) Oh God! That’s Rachel!ScenesMonica: Joey, you have to talk to her!ScenesJoey: No-no, I can’t! I can’t! Not after the other night, it’s just it’s…too weird, okay? Don’t tell her I’m here! (Turns to run to the bathroom and his bagel falls off the plate onto the floor.) Don’t eat that! (Runs to the bathroom as Rachel enters.)ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey Rachel!ScenesRachel: Is Joey here?ScenesChandler: I don’t see him. (To Monica) Do you see him?ScenesMonica: I don’t see him. Hey! Maybe he’s in the sugar bowl! (Opens the sugar bowl) Joey? Nope! (Closes the sugar bowl and they both laugh.)ScenesRachel: Well, at least you make each other laugh.ScenesMonica: What’s up?ScenesRachel: Well, I haven’t seen him since that night that he told me how he y’know… I don’t know, I think he’s avoiding me. Why is that bagel on the floor?ScenesMonica: We were playing a game.ScenesRachel: Ew, was Chandler naked? Sort of like a, like a ring toss kind of situation?ScenesMonica: Sure.ScenesChandler: What?! No! No!ScenesRachel: All right. Well listen, if you see Joey will you just tell him uh…tell him I miss him. (Exits and Joey enters.)ScenesMonica: (To Joey) Okay, did you hear that?ScenesJoey: Yeah, a naked bagel game? (Picks up his dropped bagel.) (To Chandler) Dude, I don’t know. That’s a pretty small hole.ScenesMonica: Honey, you gotta talk to her.ScenesJoey: I can’t! Y’know? You guys don’t know what it’s like to put yourself out there like that and just get shot down.ScenesChandler: (incredulous) I don’t know what that’s like?! Up until I was 25 I thought the only response to, "I love you," was, "Oh crap!ScenesMonica: Hello? No rejection? I got shot down at fat camp! Boy, kids are mean when they’re hungry.ScenesJoey: All right so, so what do I do?ScenesMonica: This is Rachel. I mean, what are you gonna do, never going to talk to her again? I mean I know it’s weird, it’s awkward, but you gotta at least try.ScenesJoey: Yeah. Okay. (Goes to take a bite out of the previously mentioned bagel.) Whoa! (Stops.) I almost forgot this was on your…ScenesChandler: (interrupting him) We didn’t play it!!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is holding a book as she, Rachel, and Monica drink some tea as Chandler looks on.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, so when you’re done with your tea I’ll look at your leaves and tell you your fortune.ScenesChandler: I didn’t know you read tea leaves.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, I’ve done it for years. I actually stopped because I was so accurate. Y’know, and-and y’know, one of the great joys of life is it’s-it’s wondrous unpredictability. Y’know? And also tea tends to give me the trots.ScenesMonica: Okay, I’m done. Read mine.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Looks at the leaves.) Ooh, I see a ladder. (Checks the book) Which can mean either a promotion or a violent death.ScenesMonica: (stunned) I-I’m the head chef. I-I can’t get promoted.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm. Uh-hmm, who’s next?ScenesRachel: Okay, I’m done. Do mine.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Reads the leaves) Umm, oh! Okay, I see a circle.ScenesRachel: Ah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! (Checking the book) Which can either mean you’re having a baby or you’re gonna make a scientific discovery!ScenesRachel: Well, I have been spending a lot of time in the lab.ScenesChandler: What does yours say Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Umm… Wow, all right. (Checks the book.) Wow! Yay! Ooh, I’m gonna meet a guy! And really soon! And he’s gonna be the man of my dreams. Probably not the guy I had a dream about last night. (Points at Chandler.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey! Has anyone seen my shirt? It’s a button down, like a, like a faded salmon?ScenesMonica: You mean your pink shirt?ScenesRoss: Faded salmon color.ScenesMonica: No, I-I haven’t seen your pink shirt.ScenesRoss: Great! Great. Then I must’ve left it at Mona’s. I knew it!ScenesChandler: Well, I’m sure you get another one at Ann Taylor’s.ScenesRoss: That’s my favorite shirt! Okay? I love that shirt!ScenesRachel: Well just ask Mona to give it back!ScenesRoss: I don’t know. I mean I-I guess I could. It’s just that we didn’t really end things such good terms. And if I go over there I’d be ignoring the one thing she asked me to do when we broke up, jump up my own ass and die. (Walks away.)ScenesPhoebe: (noticing a guy sitting by the green post looking at her) Oh wait a second you guys…for the last couple weeks I’ve been that guy everywhere I go. We take the same bus. We go to the same bookstore, the same dry cleaners; maybe he’s the tea guy. (He gets up to leave, and smiles at Phoebe.)ScenesChandler: Phoebe, did you see that?! He totally checked you out! He is so cute! (Looking at his tea.) Mine has a picture of The Village People, what does that mean?Scenes(Joey enters.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey.Scenes(He slowly walks to the other side of the couch and sits down at the table, an awkward silence follows.)ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hi.Scenes(More awkward silence.)ScenesMonica: Tea gives Phoebe the trots.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is cooking as Rachel paces nervously.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So I thought Joey and I would be okay once we hung out, but it’s not even like we know how to be with each other anymore.ScenesChandler: I know it’s tough now, but things will get better.ScenesRachel: How do you know that? What if it just gets worse and worse and worse, to the point where we can’t even be in the same room with each other?!ScenesChandler: I’m not great at the advice, can I interest you in a sarcastic comment? Some cheese?ScenesMonica: Honey, what is the Bruce Springsteen CD in the Kat Stevens case?ScenesChandler: Let’s just say if I can’t find the right CD case I just put it in the nearest one.ScenesMonica: Okay, where is the Kat Stevens CD?ScenesChandler: In the James Taylor case.ScenesMonica: Where is the James Taylor CD?ScenesChandler: Honey, I’m gonna save you some time, 200 CDs, not one of them in the right case.ScenesMonica: Okay. No need to panic. Deep breathes everyone. Okay umm uh, we’re just gonna have to spend some time and put the CDs in the right cases.ScenesChandler: Well, if we’re gonna do that we should come up with some kind of order. Y’know alphabetically or by genre?ScenesMonica: Hmm, I don’t know. We really have to talk this through.ScenesRachel: Oh my God!! You guys have such problems!! I feel so terrible for you!ScenesMonica: Okay, I-I’m sorry. You and Joey, your both focusing on this uncomfortable thing, what you need to do is to change the subject. Next time you see him try to get him talking about something else.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah. That makes sense.ScenesMonica: Yeah, like I don’t know, maybe you have a work problem that you need his advice on.ScenesRachel: Ooh, I can do that.ScenesMonica: Good. (To Chandler) Uh honey, the Miami Vice soundtrack? Really?ScenesChandler: They were just giving those away at the store (off Monica’s look) in exchange for money.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesMonica: Uh I really don’t know what to tell you Rach, I really don’t. I mean, maybe Joey can help you out with your, with your big work problem.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: Yeah Joey she’s…Rachel’s got this really big work problem, and it is a head scratcher. Wow! (To Chandler) Y’know what, if we’re gonna make dinner we’re gonna have to leave. Yeah. (She and Chandler exit.)ScenesJoey: So you uh, have a…big work problem?ScenesRachel: Yeah it’s umm… Yeah it’s uh… It-it’s y’know—It’s nothing.ScenesJoey: Huh. Okay. (Awkward silence.) So uh, I think I’m gonna take off.ScenesRachel: Yeah—No wait! Joey no wait it is. It’s something. It’s-it’s umm…it’s my boss.ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Yeah, and umm my baby.ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRachel: My boss wants to buy my baby!ScenesJoey: What?! Oh my-oh my God!ScenesRachel: I know I told you, it’s a really big problem.ScenesJoey: What he wants to buy your baby?!ScenesRachel: Can you believe that?!ScenesJoey: That’s crazy!ScenesRachel: That’s what I told him!ScenesJoey: Okay, how did this even happen?ScenesRachel: Well I’ll tell ya! (Pause) See uh my-my boss and his wife—They-they can’t have children. So umm, and that—we were at the Christmas party, and he got drunk, and he said to me, "Rachel, I want to buy your baby.ScenesJoey: Man! When you said it was a problem about your boss and the baby I figured it was something about maternity leave.ScenesRachel: Ohh! Yeah! (Pause) Yeah that-that would’ve been a much simpler problem.

rows.Scenes: A newsstand, Phoebe is looking at a magazine as the guy from before walks by and picks up a newspaper.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh hello.ScenesGuy: Oh, it’s you. I see you everywhere. I’m Jim, Jim Nelson.ScenesPhoebe: Oh Jim, Jim Nelson I’m Phoebe, Phoebe Buffay. We certainly have been seeing a lot of each other lately.ScenesJim: We have. Maybe we’ll be seeing each other at dinner tomorrow night, say around 8 o’clock?ScenesPhoebe: Well, maybe we will. (Starts to walk away.) Oh! (She turns around and the exchange information.)

rows.Scenes: Outside Mona’s Apartment, Ross is knocking on the door.]
rows.Content: Ross: Mona? (There’s no answer, so he starts to leave but remembers where her extra key is. He reaches atop a hall light just outside her door and grabs the key. He looks at in triumph as the pain from it being hot moves along his nervous system to his brain, and when it arrives his brain orders his hand to drop the hot key and his mouth to squeal in pain. After dropping the key he pulls his shirtsleeve over his hand and uses the key to open the door and enter Mona’s apartment.) Okay, if I were a salmon shirt, where would I be? (He hears a key in the door and as it opens he dives behind the couch.)ScenesMona: (entering, with her date) I am so sorry I spilled wine all over your shirt.ScenesMona's Date: Oh, it’s okay.ScenesMona: No, it’s still wet. Y’know what? Let me get it out before it sets. Ooh, I have something you can wear. Here. (Hands him Ross’s shirt.)ScenesMona's Date: Oh umm, I-I don’t know if I want to wear a woman’s shirt.ScenesMona: No-no that’s a man’s shirt.ScenesMona's Date: It’s awfully pink. (Ross mouths, "It’s salmon!")

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are sorting their CDs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh my God, honey we are so meant to be together. We both have copies of the Annie soundtrack.ScenesMonica: Honey, both yours.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! Great advice on that Joey thing!ScenesMonica: Yeah? The work problem?ScenesRachel: Oh it was perfect! I mean it really felt like he was my friend again.ScenesChandler: What problem did you tell him you had?ScenesRachel: Oh that’s not important. The point is, I really—I think everything’s gonna be okay.

rows.Scenes: Mr. Zelner’s Office, he’s in a meeting as Joey bursts in.]
rows.Content: Mr. Zelner: May I help you?ScenesJoey: Do you think you can just buy my friends baby?!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: A restaurant, Phoebe and Jim are on their date.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Isn’t it funny how we kept running into each other? It’s as if someone really wants us to be together.ScenesJim: Someone does. Me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, witty banter. Well done.ScenesJim: So, tell me a little bit about yourself.ScenesPhoebe: Oh okay, well I’m a masseuse, and I used to work at this place…ScenesJim: Do you like to party?ScenesPhoebe: I-I-I like, I like parties.ScenesJim: You’re wild, aren’t ya?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I guess, a little.ScenesJim: It ain’t no thing, I’m wild too.ScenesPhoebe: (a little freaked out) So! Umm, anyway I-I lived in New York, someone wildly I guess, for umm—Well since I was fourteen.ScenesJim: I’m sorry. I’m staring. It’s just that you have the most beautiful eyes.ScenesPhoebe: Oh stop it.ScenesJim: And your breasts! Hmm!!!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Umm look, you’re coming on a little strong. But I’m going to give you the benefit of the doubt, because it seems the universe really wants to be together. So, why don’t we just start over okay? And you can just tell me about yourself.ScenesJim: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesJim: I write erotic novels, for children.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesJim: They’re wildly unpopular.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesJim: Oh also, you might be interested to know that I have a Ph.D.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You do?ScenesJim: Yeah, (looks at his crotch) a Pretty Huge…ScenesPhoebe: All right. (Gets up and walks out.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Chandler, and now Rachel are organizing CDs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (singing) The sun’ll come out…tomorrow! Bet…your bottom dollar that tomorrow… (The girls start laughing, and in a deep voice) …there’ll be sun.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey! Oh Joey, honey listen, thank you for talking to my yesterday about that thing with my boss. That really meant a lot.ScenesJoey: Not a problem. Oh, and just so you know, that guy’s not going to be bothering you about that baby thing anymore.ScenesRachel: (worried) What?ScenesJoey: Let’s just say I took care of it.ScenesRachel: Whoa-whoa-whoa, let’s say more!ScenesJoey: Don’t worry! Don’t worry. I just told him, very nicely, "You don’t go buying people’s babies, so back off!!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesChandler and Monica: What?!ScenesRachel: No! No, no-no-no Joey he doesn’t want to buy my baby! I made that up!ScenesJoey: What?! Why?!ScenesRachel: So that we would have something to talk about! So it wouldn’t be awkward!ScenesJoey: And you couldn’t think of anything else?!ScenesMonica: You said your boss wants to buy your baby?!ScenesRachel: (To Joey) I can’t believe that you yelled at my boss! I’m-I’m gonna lose my job! What am I going to do?!ScenesChandler: You can always sell your baby.ScenesRachel: Oh Joey, I can’t believe you brought my boss into this! I’m gonna get fired!ScenesJoey: You lied to me!ScenesRachel: Well, she told me too! (Points to Monica and Joey glares at her.)ScenesMonica: Chandler has two copies of Annie!

rows.Scenes: Mona’s Apartment, she and her date are making out as Ross flips through a magazine while lying behind the couch and sees something that he likes. Meanwhile, Mona’s date takes off Ross’s shirt and Mona throws it on the floor. While they start making out again, Ross tries to pull the rug the shirt is on over to him, but while he does that he moves the coffee table and it bumps into the couch.]
rows.Content: Mona: (seeing Ross) Oh my God! Ross!!!ScenesRoss: Hello!!ScenesMona: Ross, what are you doing?!ScenesRoss: Not touching myself if that makes anyone less uncomfortable.

rows.Scenes: Mr. Zelner’s Office, Rachel is knocking on the door.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Morning. You wanted to see me?ScenesMr. Zelner: Please, come in. Have a seat. (She does so.)ScenesRachel: Okay look Mr. Zelner…ScenesMr. Zelner: Oh I think it’s best that I speak first.ScenesRachel: Yeah. (Motions for him to continue.)ScenesMr. Zelner: I’ve asked Lee from human resources to be here as a witness to our conversation.ScenesRachel: Oh God.ScenesMr. Zelner: If I in any way implied that I wanted to buy your baby…I am sorry. Okay? Last week when I asked you when your due date was uh, I certainly did not mean that I felt that I was due your baby. Yeah, I want to be very clear that I understand that its your baby, and it is not mine to purchase.ScenesRachel: Well, as long as we are clear about that. (Exits smugly.)

rows.Scenes: A Street, Phoebe and Monica are walking down it.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh there it is.ScenesMonica: That’s not your regular dry cleaners.ScenesPhoebe: I know, but that creep that I went on that date with goes to there so I have to find a new one. I also have to find a new video store, a new bank, a new adult bookstore, a new grocery store…ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: A new grocery store. The universe said I was going to meet a nice guy and that’s what they gave me? (Looks up) When I get up there I’m going to kick some ass.ScenesMonica: Don’t worry Phoebe, you’re gonna meet someone. If I can meet a great guy, so can you.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, we both can. And we both will.Scenes(They enter the dry cleaners.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you didn’t have to come in with me.ScenesMonica: Are you kidding? This is where they get out stains! Okay? This is like Disneyland for me. I’m-I’m gonna be over here watching the dance of the clean shirts. (She points to and walks over to the electric clothes rack they have.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(A guy enters that looks suspiciously like Alec Baldwin from The Hunt for Red October, Pearl Harbor, and Beetlejuice.)ScenesGuy: (To Phoebe) Oh, excuse me! I think you dropped s…(looks at Phoebe.) Wow!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesGuy: I’m sorry, it’s just that you’re so incredibly beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah well, I’m sorry about that too, but what are you going to do?ScenesGuy: I hope you don’t think I’m crazy but I feel like I was meant to pick this up, do you believe in that kind of thing?ScenesPhoebe: A little. (She turns around and looks up.) (To the universe) Now you’re talking.ScenesGuy: Would you like to go out and have a cup of coffee?ScenesPhoebe: I-I-I’d love to. Let me just tell my friend.ScenesMonica: (to the clerk) Ooh, an ink stain! Hey, can I watch how you get this out?ScenesPhoebe: (looking around) She must’ve left.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is watching Joey pace nervously as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi.ScenesJoey: So? What-what-what happened?ScenesRachel: It’s all gonna be okay. They’re just so happy that I’m not suing them that they gave me one extra month paid maternity leave. So long as I understand that the money should not construed as a down payment on this or any other child I should bear.ScenesChandler: Wow, Ralph Lauren is really going out of there way to show they’re not in the baby buying business.ScenesRachel: Chandler, can you give us a minute?ScenesChandler: Oh I’m sorry, you’re kicking me out of my own living room?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesChandler: I’ll be in there. (Goes into the bedroom.)ScenesRachel: Joey, I’m really sorry that I lied to you. I was just trying to make things…ScenesJoey: I know. I know.ScenesRachel: It kinda worked. I mean y’know, I don’t know about you buy I haven’t thought about our thing since all this.ScenesJoey: Hey you’re right. Yeah, it’s kinda been like us again a little bit.ScenesRachel: Yeah I know! I miss that.ScenesJoey: Me too. I mean I…haven’t thought at all about how I put myself out there and said all that stuff and how you didn’t feel the same way about me and-and how it was really awkward.Scenes(Awkward silence.)ScenesRachel: My gynecologist tried to kill me.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is ordering something over the phone from a catalog.]
rows.Content: Ross: (on phone) Item J437-A, color: winterberry. (There’s a knock on the door as he hangs up the phone. He answers it to Mona.) Hi umm, listen come here, come in. (She does so.) I’m so-so sorry about yesterday. I-I’m really sorry. It’s just that I… (He picks up the pink shirt.)ScenesMona: (interrupting him) Listen Ross, you don’t have to apologize. I understand why you were there.ScenesRoss: You do?ScenesMona: Yeah, you still have feelings for me. And-and to be honest, I-I still have feelings for you. And I wish that we can work it out Ross, but we can’t. It’s too complicated with you and Rachel and the baby, I-I just… It just wasn’t meant to be.ScenesRoss: (faking starting to cry) Oh God you’re right.ScenesMona: Ross, we…we have to be strong. Okay, I-I’m gonna go. (She picks up the shirt Ross has just set down.) Can I? To remember you?ScenesRoss: (laughs) No. (Takes the shirt back.)ScenesEndScenesThe One In MassapequaScenesTeleplay by: Mark KunerthScenesStory by: Peter TibbalsScenesTranscribed by: CassieScenesWith Help From: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent’s anniversary party?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Sure. Yeah.ScenesJoey: So, who’s the guy?ScenesPhoebe: Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners.ScenesChandler: Oooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers? (Sits up) Who said that?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, he’s really great though. He has this incredible zest for life, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughty girl I am.ScenesMonica: (To Ross) Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to mom and dad this year?ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20th?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’d really like to.ScenesRoss: Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you.ScenesMonica: Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it’s always really moving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I’m going to make them cry.ScenesChandler: And you wonder why Ross is their favorite?ScenesMonica: No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him, and pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, "God, your brother." Know what they’ll say this year? "God, youScenesJoey: Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying. (Points to himself) I’m an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue. (snaps fingers)ScenesMonica: Really you can do that?ScenesJoey: Are you kidding me? Watch! (Makes funny faces trying to cry) Well I can’t do it with you guys watching me!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica’s, they’re getting ready to leave for the party.]
rows.Content: Chandler: What are you doing?ScenesMonica: Oh I’m working on my toast for the party, or as I like to call it. Sob fest 2002. Hey check this out. (Hands him a picture.)ScenesChandler: It’s a dog.ScenesMonica: It’s a dead dog. That’s Chi-Chi; she died when I was in high school.ScenesChandler: It’s your parents’ anniversary and you’re going to talk about their dead pet?ScenesMonica: The good stuff, huh?Scenes(Ross, Joey, and Rachel enter)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: You got a present for my parents. That’s so sweet.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, in honor of their 35th wedding anniversary, I had a star named after them.ScenesRoss: Aww that is so cool.ScenesJoey: And I got them a book on Karma Sutra for the elderly.ScenesRachel: Hey, do you guys have any extra ribbon?ScenesChandler: Yeah, sure. What do you need? We got lace, satin, sateen, raffia, gingham, felt, (Pause) and I think my testacles may be in here too.ScenesRoss: (picking up Chi-Chi’s picture) Aww! Chi-Chi! Oh, I loved this dog! Y’know Monica couldn’t get braces because Chi-Chi needed knee surgery.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRoss: You were the 200-pound 11-year-old who rode her!Scenes(Phoebe and Parker enter)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesAll: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Everybody, this is Parker, Parker this is…ScenesParker: No, no, no wait! Don’t tell me. Let me guess. (Points as he says their names) Joey, Monica, Ross, Rachel and, I’m sorry Phoebe didn’t mention you. (Chandler makes a face) Chandler, I’m kidding all ready you’re my favorite!ScenesChandler: Ha!ScenesParker: Why don’t all of you tell me a little about your self?ScenesRoss: Ah, actually, I’m sorry we-we probably should get going.ScenesParker: (laughs) Classic Ross. Rachel, Rachel, oh how you glow. May I? (Puts hand on her stomach)ScenesRachel: I, uh, think you already are.ScenesParker: Rachel, you have life growing inside you. Is there anything in this world more miraculous than—Oh a picture of a dog! Whose is this?ScenesMonica: That’s my old dog. He passed away years ago.ScenesParker: Oh well, at least you were lucky to have him. Bow-wow old friend, bow-wow. So where’s the party?ScenesMonica: It’s out on the island. It’s in Massapequa.ScenesParker: Maaaassapequa, sounds like a magical place. Tell me about Massapequa, is it steep in Native American history? {Transcriber’s Note: Interestingly Alec Baldwin was born in Massapequa.}ScenesRoss: Well, there is an Arby’s in the shape of a tee-pee.ScenesMonica: Okay, I got my note cards. (To Chandler) Do you got the presents?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesMonica: And I’ve got the car keys.ScenesParker: We’re driving!?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesParker: Aces!Scenes(Everyone except Ross and Rachel leave.)ScenesRoss: So uh, he seems like a nice guy.ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah I like him a lot.ScenesRoss: Ya wanna hang back and take our own cab?ScenesRachel: Yeah, otherwise I’m not going.

rows.Scenes: The Anniversary Party, Ross and Rachel are arriving and see his parents.]
rows.Content: Mr. and Mrs. Geller: HiScenesRoss: Hi! (Kisses his mom.) Hey mom.ScenesRachel: This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys have any pearls of wisdom?ScenesMrs. Geller: Jack?ScenesMr. Geller: Why would you serve food on such a sharp stick? (Looking a toothpick)ScenesRoss: That’s a good question, dad. That’s a good question…ScenesRachel: Hmmm….ScenesWoman: (To Ross and Rachel) Congratulations you two!ScenesRachel: Thank you…we’re so excitedScenesWoman: And also, congratulations on your wedding.ScenesRoss: Wha—What?ScenesMrs. Geller: Can we talk to you for just a y’know… It’s just a little thing. Well we think it’s absolutely marvelous that you’re having this baby out of wedlock, some of our friends are less open-minded. Which is why we’ve told them all that you’re married.ScenesRoss and Rachel: What?!ScenesMrs. Geller: Thanks for going along with this.ScenesRoss: Dad so what we have to pretend that we’re married?ScenesMr. Geller: Son, I had to shave my ears for tonight. You can do this.ScenesRoss: Can you believe that?ScenesRachel: Yeah, if you’re going to do the ears, you might as well take a pass at the nosal area.ScenesRoss: No, us having to lie about being married.ScenesRachel: No, I know I don’t either, but ya know what, it’s their party, and it’s just one night. And we don’t even have to lie; we just won’t say anything. If it comes up again, we’ll just…smile. We’ll nod along.ScenesWoman: Ross!ScenesMan: Rachel!ScenesRoss: Hi Aunt Lisa, Uncle DanScenesAunt Lisa: Congratulations on the baby, and on the weddingScenesRoss and Rachel: Hmmmm….ScenesUncle Dan: Here’s a little something to get you started. (Hands them a check)ScenesRachel: Oh…ScenesAunt Lisa: So, how’s married life treating you?ScenesRachel: (looking at the check) Unbelievable!ScenesRoss: We love marriage!ScenesAunt Lisa: Great!Scenes(The rest of the gang arrives including Parker.)ScenesRoss: HeyScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesParker: What a beautiful place. What a great night! I have to tell you, being here with all of you in Event Room C…I feel so lucky. I think of all the good times that have happened here. The birthdays, the proms, the mitzvahs both bar and bat, but none of them will compare with tonight! My God, I don’t want to forget this moment! It’s like I want to take a mental picture of you all! Click! (He takes a mental picture of them all.)ScenesChandler: I don’t think the flash went off.ScenesParker: Dahaaa! (Punches Chandler in the arm and he makes a face of pain.) I’m going to find the men’s room, be right back.ScenesPhoebe: I’ll go with youScenesParker: Come on!ScenesChandler: Somewhere there is someone with a tranquilizer gun and a huge butterfly net looking for that man.ScenesJoey: I have to go to the bathroom too, but I don’t want him complimenting my thing.ScenesRoss: I’m so we weren’t in the car! Did he ever let up?ScenesMonica: He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle.ScenesRoss: (imitating Parker) This room! This night! That waiter! His shoes! I must take a mental picture! (He backs into someone.) Ooh sorry…(He looks behind him then notices its Phoebe then stops his impression.)ScenesPhoebe: Were you guys making fun of Parker?ScenesRoss: That depends, how much did you hear?ScenesPhoebe: So, he a little enthusiastic, what’s wrong with that?ScenesMonica: It’s just that, it’s so much.ScenesPhoebe: Well, so what I like him! Do I make fun of the people you’ve dated? Tag, Janice, Mona? No, because friends don’t do that. But, do you want my opinion? Do you want it? ‘Cause in my opinion, your collective dating record reads like the who’s who of human crap. (Walks off)ScenesMonica: I feel terrible.ScenesJoey: I knowScenesRoss: What was wrong with Mona?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Anniversary Party, Ross and Rachel have just gotten another wedding present.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Open it! Open it! Open it!ScenesRoss: Yeah baby!ScenesMan: So we never got to hear about your wedding!ScenesWoman: We were surprise that we weren’t invited.ScenesRoss: No, no, it was just our parents and 1 or 2 friends. It was a small wedding.ScenesRachel: But it was beautiful. I mean it was small, but kind of spectacular.ScenesMan: Where did you have it?ScenesRachel: On a cliff, in Barbados, at sunset, and Stevie Wonder sang Isn’t She Lovely as I walked down the aisle.ScenesWoman: Really?ScenesRachel: Yeah, Stevie’s an old family friend. (Hits Ross’s chest)ScenesWoman: Oh my God. That sounds amazing. I would love to see pictures.ScenesRachel: So would I. You wouldn’t think that Annie Liebawitz would forget to put film in the camera.ScenesRoss: Would you excuse us for a second? (Pulls Rachel off to the side) Umm…. what are you doing?ScenesRachel: What? I’m not you. This may be the only wedding I ever have. I want it to be amazing.ScenesRoss: Okay, okay. Ooooh, ooh maybe I rode in on a Harley.ScenesRachel: Okay, Ross, it has to be realistic.Scenes(Cut to Phoebe and Parker)ScenesParker: Are you okay? You seem kind of quiet.ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m fine. I’m great. I’m with you.ScenesParker: And I’m with you! What a great time to be alive! Look at this plate-bouncy thing. (Bounces the plates) What an inspired solution to man’s plate dispensing problems.ScenesPhoebe: Hm huh, yeah.ScenesParker: Ah! Oysters! Let me feed you one.ScenesPhoebe: No, that’s not necessary.ScenesParker: Please.ScenesPhoebe: No, actually I don’t eat…ScenesParker: I won’t quit until you try.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, fine! Fine! (Takes the oyster and pretends to eat it while dropping it on the floor) Mmm…hmmmmm….ScenesParker: What are they like? I’ve never had one.ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t you just try one?ScenesParker: No, they look too weird.Scenes(Cut to Monica and Chandler)ScenesChandler: What are you doin’?ScenesMonica: Just going over my toast. Those two will never know what hit ‘em. I can’t wait. They’re going to be crying so hard. They’re going to be fighting for breath.ScenesChandler: Ya know if you want to, I can just hold them down and you could (Punches the air).Scenes(Cut to Rachel and Ross)ScenesRachel: And my veil was lace, made by blind, Belgium nuns.ScenesWoman: Blind?ScenesRachel: Well, not at first, but it was very intricate work and they said even though they lost their sight, it was all worth it.ScenesAunt Lisa: I’ll bet you looked beautiful…ScenesRachel: Well, I don’t know about that, but some said that I looked like a floating angel.ScenesWoman: (To Ross) So, how did you propose?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah. That’s a great story.ScenesRoss: Well, um, actually, I-I took her to the planetarium. That’s-that’s where we had our first date. Um, she walked in and I had the room filled with lilies, her favorite flower…ScenesAunt Lisa: Oh that is so sweet!ScenesRachel: Shhh! I want to hear the rest!ScenesRoss: Then, Fred Astaire singing The Way You Look Tonight came on the sound system, and the lights came down. And I got down on one knee and written across the dome in the stars were the words "Will you marry me?Scenes(Various oohs and ahhs)ScenesRachel: And the ring, was the size of my fist (makes a fist)!Scenes(Cut to Phoebe and Joey)ScenesJoey: Yeah uh, Phoebe! Look umm, I want to apologize about before, okay? We were being jerks. Parker’s a nice guy and I’d like to get to know him.ScenesPhoebe: Then you better do it now.ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesPhoebe: Because I’m going to kill himScenesJoey: What-what?ScenesPhoebe: You guys were right. He’s just too excited about…everything. I mean I’m all for living life, but this is the Geller’s 35th anniversary. Okay? Let’s call a spade a spade this party stinks.ScenesJoey: I know I’m having the worst time. There was a 15-minute line for the buffet, and when I finally got up to the plates, I slipped on a giant booger!ScenesPhoebe: Are you sure it wasn’t an oyster?ScenesJoey: I guess it could’ve been, I didn’t really look at it. Y’know, I just wiped it on Chandler’s coat and got the hell out of there.ScenesPhoebe: He’s just such a great guy I’m so excited about him.ScenesJoey: Oh hey, you should be excited about him. There’s nothing wrong with him he’s a good guy.ScenesPhoebe: You think?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Ya know what I think; I think we were all just being too negative.ScenesPhoebe: You’re right. You’re right, he’s just embracing life. We could all stand to be a little more like Parker. You know what? I am like him! I’m a sunny, positive person.ScenesJoey: Actually, you have a little bit of an edge.ScenesPhoebe: What’s that now?ScenesJoey: Nothing…ScenesPhoebe: Oh look it’s Parker!ScenesParker: Look! It’s the bunny hop!ScenesPhoebe: Oooh I love it!ScenesParker: You do?!ScenesPhoebe: Are you kidding? People acting like animals to music. Come on!Scenes(Cut to Monica, at the microphone)ScenesMonica: Okay it’s time for the toast! Umm now-now, I know that Ross usually gives the toast, but this year I’m going to do it.Scenes(Everyone sighs)ScenesMonica: No, no it’s going to be great. Really! Mom, Dad, when I got married, one of the things that made me sure I could do it was the amazing example the two of you set for me. For that and so many other things I want to say thank you. I know I probably don’t say it enough, but I love you. (Pretends to cry hoping her parents will join her.) When I look around this room, I’m-I’m saddened by the thought of those who could not be here with us. Nana, my beloved grandmother who would so want to be here, but she can’t because she’s dead. As is our dog Chi-Chi. I mean look how cute she is. (Holds up the picture and pretends to cry again). Was. (To an old man by the stage.) Do me a favor and pass this to my parents. Remember she’s dead. Okay, her and Nana, gone. Wow! Hey does anybody remember when Debra Winger had to say goodbye to her children in Terms of Endearment? (Chandler covers his ears) Didn’t see that? No movie fans?! You want to hear something sad? The other day I was watching 60 Minutes these orphans in Romania, who have been so neglected, they were incapable of love. (Waits for people to cry, but doesn’t get any tears.) You people are made of stone! Here’s to mom and dad! Whatever!ScenesMrs. Geller: Thank you Monica that was uh, interesting. Wasn’t it interesting, Jack?ScenesMr. Geller: (looking at the picture) Why don’t I remember this dog?ScenesMrs. Geller: Ross, why don’t you give us your toast now?ScenesRoss: Oh, no, Mom, it’s just Monica this year.ScenesMrs. Geller: You’re not going to say anything? On our 35th wedding anniversaryScenesRoss: No, of course, Um… Um, everybody? Um, I-I just wanted to say…on behalf of my new bride, Rachel (She turns around and smiles), and myself. Umm, that if…if in 35 years, we’re half as happy as you guys are, we’ll count ourselves the luckiest people in the world.ScenesMrs. Geller: (crying) Oh Ross…ScenesMr. Geller: I just wish Nana were alive to hear Ross’s toast.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s apartment, Parker and her are entering.]
rows.Content: Parker: My God what a fantastically well lit hallway!ScenesPhoebe: Can I get you something to drink? Like a water and Valium?ScenesParker: I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words…ScenesPhoebe: Oh thank God.ScenesParker: It’s a haven. A third-floor paradise. A modern-day Eden in the midst…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah? I know! I know! Uh huh? Listen why don’t we just um, sit and relax? You know just be with each other. Quietly!ScenesParker: That sounds great. (Sits down) My God this is the most comfortable couch I’ve ever sat on in my entire life. (Bounces on couch)ScenesPhoebe: Let’s try something else, let’s play a game.ScenesParker: I love games!ScenesPhoebe: Shocking! Let’s play the game of who can stay quiet the longest. (Giggles)ScenesParker: Or…Jenga.ScenesPhoebe: But, let’s play this one first. And remember whoever talks first loses!Scenes(They sit back)ScenesParker: I lose, now Jenga.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Oh my God!ScenesParker: Is something wrong?ScenesPhoebe: Wrong? Really? You know the word wrong. Everything isn’t perfect? Everything isn’t magical? Everything isn’t a glow with the light of a million fairies? They were just brake lights, Parker!ScenesParker: Well, excuse me for putting a good spin on a traffic jam!ScenesPhoebe: You don’t have to put a good spin on everything.ScenesParker: I’m sorry that’s who I am. I’m a positive person.ScenesPhoebe: No! I am a positive person. You are like Santa Clause on Prozac, at Disneyland, getting laid!ScenesParker: So what do you want me to do, you want me to be more negative, less happy?ScenesPhoebe: Much less happy!ScenesParker: Fine! Well then to quote Ross, "I’d better be going.ScenesPhoebe: So long! Don’t let the best door in the world hit you in the ass on your way out! (He exits and she slams the door behind him.)Scenes(There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it.)ScenesParker: Isn’t this the most incredible fight you’ve ever had in your entire life?ScenesPhoebe: Uh huh. (Closes door)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel’s, they’re returning from the party.]
rows.Content: Ross: …and then, we could’ve gone from the ceremony to the reception with you in the sidecar!ScenesRachel: Ross, it just wouldn’t have been feasible.ScenesRoss: But having a dove place the ring on your finger would’ve been no problem?ScenesRachel: It was really fun being married to you tonight.ScenesRoss: Yeah! And! And, it was the easiest 400 bucks I’ve ever made.ScenesRachel: Okay Ross, can I uh, can I ask you something?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: That proposal, at the planetarium…ScenesRoss: I know, I know it was stupid.ScenesRachel: Are you kidding?! With the, with the lilies, and-and the song, and the stars! It was…really wonderful! Did you just make that up?ScenesRoss: No, actually I thought about it when, when we were going out. It’s how I imagined I uh, I would ask you to marry me.ScenesRachel: Well, that would’ve been very hard to say no too.ScenesRoss: It’s a good thing I didn’t do it, because it sounds like it would’ve been a very expensive wedding. (Rachel laughs) Okay, good nightScenesRachel: GoodnightScenes(They go off to their bedrooms)ScenesRoss: Even if the sidecar had a windscreen so your hair wouldn’t get messed up?ScenesRachel: I will think about it.ScenesRoss: That’s all I’m askin’ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay that’s it. I give up. At mom and dad’s 40th anniversary, you’re the one giving the speech.ScenesRoss: Y’know I don’t understand why they didn’t cry. It was a beautiful speech.ScenesMonica: Oh, come on.ScenesRoss: Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, we did learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin. And what you said about Nana. Ohh, yeah she really would’ve wanted to be there. And you know what? I think she was.ScenesMonica: (starts to cry) Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s InterviewScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesEpisodes Orginally Transcribed by: Eric Aasen, guineapig, Josh Hodge, Aaron D. Howard-Miller, and Kiza Abuzahra.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, everyone except Phoebe is there as Rachel enters carrying a magazine.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRachel: So, I’m in my apartment doing the Soap Opera Digest crossword puzzle, and guess who the clue is for three down. (She hands the magazine to Joey.)ScenesJoey: (reading) Three down, Days Of Our Lives star blank Tribbiani. That’s me!! I’m blank!!ScenesMonica: How cool is this?! We know three down! I’m touching three down! (She has her hand on his shoulder.)ScenesJoey: Yeah you are baby.ScenesMonica: Three down knows I’m married, what’s three down doin’?ScenesRachel: So did they call you to tell you your name’s gonna be in this?ScenesJoey: No. They really like me over there. They want to do a big profile on me, but I said no.ScenesRoss: Why’d you say no?ScenesJoey: Remember what happened the last time I did an interview for them? I said I write a lot of my own lines, and then the writers got mad and made my character fall down the elevator shaft. So who knows what I might say this time.ScenesChandler: If only there was something in your head to control the things you say. (Joey nods his agreement.)ScenesRachel: Oh, come on Joey! You will totally keep it in check this time, and plus y’know the publicity would be really good for your career! And you deserve that! And if you do the interview you can mention, oh I don’t know, gal pal Rachel Green?ScenesChandler: Is that gal pal spelled L-O-S-E-R?ScenesRachel: Okay, don’t listen to him. Please?ScenesJoey: Fine! All right, I’ll do it. But hey! You guys have to be at the next table so you can stop me if I y’know, start to say something stupid.ScenesRoss: Just then or-or all the time, ‘cause we-we have jobs y’know.ScenesRachel: Come on! We will be there for you the whole time! Just remember gal pal Rachel Green. (Excited) Ha-ha! I’m gonna be in Soap Opera Digest! And not just in the dumb crossword puzzle. (Looks at Joey.) Seriously, proud of you.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is there for his interview and everyone but Phoebe are hiding on the couch.]
rows.Content: The Interviewer: I really appreciate you taking the time to do this.ScenesJoey: Oh, not at all. Happy to do it.Scenes[Cut to the rest of the gang sitting low on the couch and craning their necks to watch the interview.]ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) You think we’re being obvious?ScenesChandler: No, we’re just four people with neck problems. You talk like this. (Out of the sides of their mouths.)Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesThe Interviewer: (To Joey) Y’know I think its great you wanted to meet here. Y’know when most people hear the magazine is paying for it they want to go to a big fancy restaurant.ScenesJoey: (laughs) Actually, I didn’t know the magazine was paying for it. Wouldn’t have mattered, I’m doing this for the fans, not for the free food.ScenesGunther: Can I get you anything?ScenesThe Interviewer: Umm, I’ll have a cup of coffee.ScenesJoey: And I’ll have all the muffins.Scenes[Cut to the gang.]ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Shhh! We’re not talking.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Finally! Oh. (Sits back in relief.)Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesThe Interviewer: So, according to your bio, you’ve done quite a bit of work before Days of Our Lives. Anything you’re particularly proud of?Scenes[This starts a series of flashbacks; the first one is from Episode 106: The One With The Butt, Joey is in a play called Freud!.]ScenesJoey: (He goes into a song and dance number)ScenesAll you want is a dingle,ScenesWhat you envy's a schwang,ScenesA thing through which you can tinkle,ScenesOr play with, or simply let hang...Scenes[The next one is from Episode 304: The One With The Metaphorical Tunnel, Joey is on Amazing Discoveries.]ScenesHost: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and these darn cartons are so flingin'-flangin' hard to open.ScenesJoey: Oh, you said it Mike. (Rips open the carton and spills milk on the counter) Aw! There's got to be a better way!ScenesMike: And there is Kevin.Scenes[Cut forward.]ScenesMike: This is the first time he’s ever used this product, he's never used this product before, you're gonna see how easy this is to do. (To Kevin) Go ahead. ('Kevin' starts using the product, it is a spout that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don't have to rip it open.) This works with any milk carton.ScenesJoey: (finishing installing the Milk Master 2000) Wow, it is easy. (Starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.Scenes(The crowd ahhs.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 322: The One With The Screamer, it’s the end of Joey’s play.]ScenesLauren: So this is it? Victor?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I guess it is. And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship, (Smoke starts pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, colored lights on the side of it) and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all. (Gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne… baby…I’m gonna want to meet her.Scenes(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 204: The One With Phoebe’s Husband, when everyone including Julie is watching Joey in his porno.]ScenesJoey: Shh, OK, here I come, here I come. See I'm comin' to fix the copier, I can't get to the copier, I'm thinkin' what do I do, what do I do…so I just watch 'em have sex. And then I say, wait, here's my line, (Joey from TV) you know that's bad for the paper tray.ScenesChandler: Nice work my friend.ScenesJoey: Thank you. Wait-wait-wait-wait, you see me again. Hang on, the guy's butt's blockin' me. There I am, there I am, there I am, there I am, there I am…Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: Well, there are so many things, it’s hard to pick just one.Scenes[Cut to the gang.]ScenesPhoebe: I’m gonna get some coffee, anyone want anything?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, I’d actually love a blueberry muffin and a chamomile tea.ScenesRoss: Uh, double latte, extra foam.ScenesChandler: And a bagel with only…ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting him) I was just being polite!Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesThe Interviewer: Okay, how about when you’re not working. What do you do in your spare time?Scenes[This starts another series of flashbacks about Joey’s hobbies. The first one is from Episode 703: The One With Phoebe’s Cookies, Rachel is teaching Joey how to sail his boat, the Mr. Bowmont.]ScenesJoey: (drinking a beer) Look at this clown! Just because he’s got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river. (Yelling) Get out of the way jackass! (To Rachel) Who names their boat Coast Guard anyway?ScenesRachel: That is the Coast Guard.ScenesJoey: What are they doing out here? The coast’s all the way over there. (Points to the coast.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 603: The One With Ross’s Denial, Joey is amazing Phoebe and Monica by holding his breath.]ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Check it out! This is unbelievable! Joey has been holding his breath for almost four minutes!Scenes(We see Joey who has puffed up his cheeks and Chandler nonchalantly reaches down and pinches Joey’s nose shut. In a few seconds, Joey has to move because he’s now forced to actually hold his breath.)ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Dude! What are yo—you trying to kill me?!Scenes[The next one is from Episode 507: The One Where Ross Moves In.]

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's and Ross's, Chandler is entering and when he closes the door Joey pops his head out of the fort like before, but this time he's wearing a cowboy hat.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well, I see you've had a very productive day. Don't you think the cowboy hat is a little much?ScenesRoss: (popping up behind Joey wearing an Indian headdress) Come on, it's fun!ScenesChandler: All right! (He joins them in the fort and comes up putting on a bonnet.) Isn't this a woman's hat?ScenesJoey: Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!Scenes(Chandler does so.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 417: The One With The Free Porn, Chandler and Joey are lamenting the fact that every beautiful woman they see doesn’t want to have sex right then and there like in porn.]ScenesChandler: Y’know what, we have to turn off the porn.ScenesJoey: I think you’re right.Scenes(Goes over and picks up the remote.)ScenesChandler: All right, ready?ScenesJoey: One.ScenesChandler: Two.ScenesBoth: Three.Scenes(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)ScenesJoey: That’s kinda nice.ScenesChandler: Yeah, that’s kinda a relief.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesChandler: You wanna see if we still have it?ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Chandler turns on the TV and…)ScenesChandler: FREE PORN!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah!!ScenesChandler: We have free porn here!!!Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: In my spare time I uh, read to the blind. And I’m also a mento for the kids.(The gang shake their heads.) Y’know a mento, a role model. (Chandler bites his fist to keep from talking.)ScenesThe Interviewer: A mento…ScenesJoey: Right.ScenesThe Interviewer: Like the candy?ScenesJoey: Matter of fact, I do.Scenes(Chandler tries to jump over the couch but everyone stops him.)ScenesThe Interviewer: Well umm, another thing our readers always want to know is how our soap stars stay in such great shape. Do you have some kind of fitness regime?ScenesJoey: Uh, we stars just try to eat right and get lots of exercise.Scenes[Another set of flashbacks begin with Episode 521: The One With The Ball, Joey and Ross are throwing a ball around.]ScenesJoey: Wow! You realize that we've been throwing this ball, without dropping it, for like an hour?ScenesRoss: Are you serious?!ScenesJoey: Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn't want to say anything 'cause I didn't want to jinx it.ScenesRoss: Wow! We are pretty good at this!ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Hey! We totally forgot about lunch!ScenesJoey: Oh, I-I, I think that's the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!Scenes[The next one is from Episode 604: The One Where Joey Loses His Insurance.]

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler enters to find Joey lying in the fetus position on the floor.]
rows.Content: Chandler: What’s wrong with you?ScenesJoey: Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, haven’t been able to stand up since. But um, I don’t think it’s anything serious.ScenesChandler: This sounds like a hernia. You have to—you-you—Go to the doctor!ScenesJoey: No way! ‘Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything it’s gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (Rolls over and shows Chandler.) Why did I have to start working out again? (Looks at the weights he was using.) Damn you 15s!Scenes[The next one is from Episode 609: The One Where Ross Got High, Rachel is describing her desert to Joey and Ross.]ScenesRachel: It’s a trifle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch. [Joey and Ross make impressed faces] Then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef saut�ed with peas and onions, [Joey and Ross look like something’s wrong.] then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!Scenes[Time lapse, Ross and Joey are eating Rachel’s disaster.]ScenesRoss: It tastes like feet!ScenesJoey: I like it.ScenesRoss: Are you kidding?ScenesJoey: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Goooooood.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 619: The One With Joey’s Fridge.]

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Chandler is entering to find Joey bingeing on the food from the fridge. Joey isn’t doing all that well.]
rows.Content: Joey: The fridge broke. I have to eat everything. Cold cuts, ice cream, limes—Hey, what was in that brown jar?ScenesChandler: That’s still in there?!ScenesJoey: Not anymore.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 711: The One With All the Cheesecakes.]

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Chandler and Rachel are on their knees with forks trying to salvage what they can of the cheesecake off of the floor.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh! Yay! Look! There’s a piece that doesn’t have floor on it!ScenesChandler: Stick to your side!ScenesRachel: Hey, come on now!Scenes(Joey finishes climbing the stairs and sees them. Chandler and Rachel both stop and look up at him. Joey sits down on the step.)ScenesJoey: (pulls out a fork) All right, what are we havin’? (Starts digging in.)Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: Uhh, I don’t believe in these crazy diets y’know, just everything in moderation.ScenesGunther: Your muffins. (Sets down a huge plate of muffins in front of Joey.)ScenesJoey: I’ll take those to go. (To the interviewer) For the kids.ScenesThe Interviewer: Oh, I know what I wanted to ask you. You were on the show years ago and then they killed you off. What happened there?ScenesJoey: It was so stupid, I said some stuff in an interview that I shouldn’t have said. But believe me, that’s not gonna happen today.ScenesThe Interviewer: Understood. So, what’d you say back then?ScenesJoey: Well, I said that I… (The gang jumps up and interrupts him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Joey: You guys, this is Shelley, she’s interviewing me for Soap Opera Digest, and Shelley, this are my friends…ScenesRachel: (interrupting him) Hi! I’m gal pal Rachel Green, and if you want the dirt, I’m the one you come too. This might be Joey’s baby (rubbing her stomach), who knows? I’m just kidding—Seriously, (leans into the cassette recorder Shelley is using) gal pal Rachel Green.ScenesRoss: (leaning into the recorder as well) Who just lost the respect of her unborn child.ScenesThe Interviewer: Umm, I’m gonna just go get this warmed up. (She takes her coffee mug up to the counter.)ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMonica: Joey! You’re doing great!ScenesRoss: Yeah, so far nothing stupid.ScenesChandler: Mento?ScenesJoey: No thanks.ScenesThe Interviewer: (returning) So, as Joey’s friends, is there anything that you guys think our readers ought to know?ScenesRoss: Uh no, no just-just that he is a great guy.ScenesRachel: (scoffs at him) Yeah, that’s gonna get you into Soap Opera Digest. Well I…(leans into the microphone again)…I would just like to say that Joey truly has enriched the days of our lives.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I…I just think you don’t expect someone so hot to be so sweet.ScenesThe Interviewer: Oh! I like that. What’s your name?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Phoebe Buffay.ScenesThe Interviewer: How do you spell that? So we can get it right.ScenesPhoebe: Oh okay, it’s P as in Phoebe, H as in hoebe, O as in oebe, E as in ebe, B as in bee-bee and E as in (In an Australian accent) ‘Ello there mate!ScenesThe Interviewer: Great! Well, it was nice meeting all of you.ScenesRoss: Yeah, you too.ScenesRachel: You too!ScenesChandler: Thanks.ScenesMonica: Bye. (They resume their previous positions.)ScenesThe Interviewer: So it seems like you have a lot of friends, who would you say is your best friend?Scenes[They gang all lean back to listen better, and this starts another series of flashbacks. The first one is from Episode 214: The One With The Prom Video, Rachel has just found the bracelet that Joey gave Chandler, which is after he bought one to replace it.]ScenesJoey: How come you have two?ScenesChandler: Well this one's for you.ScenesJoey: Get out.ScenesChandler: No, I can't. No-no, listen, I, I know how much this means to you and I also know that this is about more than just jewelry, (Puts bracelet on Joey) it's about you and me and the fact that we're (Reading bracelet) best buds.ScenesJoey: Wow, is this friendship? I think so. Check it out, we're bracelet buddies.ScenesChandler: That's what they'll call us.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 618: The One Where Ross Dates A Student.]

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey and Rachel are eating spaghetti in the living room while watching TV and Rachel drops some on the floor.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Joey! Sorry!ScenesJoey: No that’s all right. Don’t worry about it.ScenesRachel: Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!ScenesJoey: Rach! Hey! It’s fine! You’re at Joey’s!ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Look! (He throws some of his spaghetti on the floor.)ScenesRachel: I’ve never lived like this before.ScenesJoey: I know.Scenes(Rachel throws some of hers down.)ScenesJoey: All right, don’t waste it, I mean its still food. (He picks it up and eats it.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 224: The One With Barry And Mindy’s Wedding, Joey has to kiss a guy in an audition and has been trying to find one to practice with.]

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is reading a script as Ross enters]
rows.Content: Ross: All right I've been feeling incredibly guilty about this, because I wanna be a good friend, and damnit I am a good friend. So just, just shut up and close your eyes (kisses Joey).ScenesJoey: Wow, you are a good friend, 'course the audition was this morning, and I didn't get it. But that was a hell of a kiss. Rachel is a very lucky girl.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 512: The One With Chandler’s Work Laugh, Joey and Phoebe are betting on who will reach the treat the fastest, the chick or the duck.]ScenesJoey: All right. Let's get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that's over the duck and the laundry basket that's over the chicken.) And they're off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)ScenesPhoebe: Get your foot off my contestant! Judge!ScenesJoey: Judge rules, no violation.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh.ScenesJoey: And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!ScenesPhoebe: (turning from Ross.) No!!
