Hey-hey that's not a Nutter-Butter, that's just an old Wonton!ScenesJoey: Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, tough call.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 401: The One With The Jellyfish, where Monica, Joey, and Chandler are relating that tragic day they spent on the beach.]ScenesJoey: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel...ScenesRoss: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About jellyfish and how if you... (Stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Ewwww!!ScenesMonica: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t...bend that way. So... (Looks at Joey.)ScenesPhoebe, Ross, and Rachel: (turning to look at Joey) Ewwww!!ScenesJoey: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you!Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: Umm, no. No best friend, no. Just a lot of close friends.ScenesThe Interviewer: So umm, now back to the show. How does it feel to have a huge gay fan base?ScenesJoey: Really? Me? Wow! I don’t even know any huge gay people!Scenes[Cut to the gang.]ScenesChandler: It hurts me. It physically hurts me.Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesThe Interviewer: Now, off the record, you’re not…Scenes[Another group of flashbacks begin with Episode 513: The One With Joey’s Bag. Joey is carrying the bag and has entered Central Perk to the amusement of Ross and Chandler.]ScenesJoey: What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!ScenesRoss: Your make-up!Scenes[The next one is from Episode 712: The One Where They’re Up All Night, Joey and Ross are deciding how to climb down the final part of the fire escape.]ScenesRoss: Okay. Now-now-now should I climb down your front so we’re face to face or-or should I climb down your back so we’re-we’re butt to face.ScenesJoey: I think face to face.ScenesRoss: I would say that.ScenesJoey: Face to face, yeah!ScenesRoss: Okay, here I go.ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(Ross steps onto the bottom rung of the ladder and then steps on Joey’s chest.)ScenesJoey: (grunting) Oh my… How much do you weigh Ross?!ScenesRoss: I prefer not to answer that right now, I’m still carrying a little holiday weight.Scenes(Ross continues to climb down. He puts his other foot further down on Joey’s torso, but that doesn’t work very well and he’s forced to wrap his legs around Joey. Which then forces Joey to get a nice and close view of Ross’s crotch.)ScenesJoey: Y’know, when we talked about face to face, I don’t think we thought it all the way through.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 722: The One With Chandler’s Dad.]

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Joey enters strutting.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Pheebs! (He sits down next to her.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Check it out. (He turns around, pulls down his pants, and shows Phoebe that he’s got panties on.) How much of a man am I?!ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Nice! Manly and also kind of a slut.Scenes[The next one is from Episode 608: The One With Ross’s Teeth, Chandler is accusing Joey of becoming less of a man.]ScenesChandler: You’re turning into a woman.ScenesJoey: No I’m not. Why would you say that? That’s just mean.ScenesChandler: Now I’ve upset you? What did I say?ScenesJoey: It’s not what you said. It’s the way you said it… Oh My God, I’m a woman!!!Scenes[The next one is from Episode 706: The One With The Nap Partners.]

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are napping together again and both wake up at the same time.]
rows.Content: Joey: Great nap.ScenesRoss: It really was.Scenes(Suddenly Rachel clears her throat and the camera cuts to the rest of the gang staring at them. Needless to say Joey and Ross are shocked and slowly turn their heads to see the gang.)Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: Uh me? Gay? No! No. No, but I have a number of close friends who are. (Chandler and Ross look at each other.)ScenesThe Interviewer: So, let’s talk about women. I’m sure our female readers will be interested to know about your romantic life.Scenes[Another series of flashbacks begins with Episode 413: The One With Rachel’s Crush, Joey is telling Rachel and Phoebe how he picks up women.]ScenesJoey: Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say, "Hey, how you doin’?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, please!ScenesJoey: (to Phoebe) Hey, how you doin’?Scenes(Phoebe looks at him, and then giggles and looks away.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 605: The One With Joey's Porsche.]

rows.Scenes: The street, Joey is messing with a car cover and still wearing the Porsche stuff. This guy playing street football catches a pass next to the car cover Joey is fooling around with.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! How you doin’?ScenesWoman: (to her friend) He has the most amazing Porsche under there!ScenesJoey: I’d love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. She’s sleeping. (The women both laugh) Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (Just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. It turns out that Joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a Porsche.)Scenes[The next one is from Episode 613: The One With Rachel’s Sister, Chandler has just opened the door to reveal a woman standing there.]ScenesWoman: Hi, is Rachel here? I’m her sister.ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Jill!ScenesJill: Oh my God, Rachel!Scenes(They run and hug each other.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God, introduce us!ScenesRachel: This is Chandler. (Points at him.)ScenesJill: Hi!ScenesRachel: And you know Monica and Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi Jill.ScenesRachel: And that’s Phoebe (points), and that’s Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey, (in the Joey voice) how you doin’?ScenesRachel: Don’t!! (Joey backs away frightened.)Scenes[The final one is from Episode 607: The One Where Phoebe Runs, Joey has been trying to repel Janice and sees it’s not working to his liking so he’s confronting her about the sexual tension.]ScenesJanine: No! I mean you're a really nice guy and I'm happy to be your roommate and your friend, I'm just y'know, I just don't feel that way about you.ScenesJoey: Oh! I see what happened. It's because I was trying to repel you. Right? Believe me, you'd feel a lot different if I turned it on.ScenesJanine: I don't think so.ScenesJoey: Oh, I do. (Gives her the Joey-love look.) How you doin?ScenesJanine: I'm okay.ScenesJoey: What?!?! Oh dear God!Scenes[Cut to the interview.]ScenesJoey: Not much to tell there I’m really shy.Scenes(The gang is confused.)ScenesThe Interviewer: So, that’s it. I guess that’s all I need. Thank you so much. I think they will be running this in the beginning of next month.ScenesJoey: Oh great! Great! Thank you. (They shake hands.)ScenesThe Interviewer: Bye.ScenesJoey: Bye-bye. (The interviewer leaves and he sits down with the rest of the gang.) I did it!ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Amazing! Amazing!ScenesThe Interviewer: (returning) Oh wait! I almost forgot. We have to ask everybody this. Other than Days of Our Lives, what’s your favorite soap opera?ScenesJoey: Oh, I don’t watch soap operas. Excuse me, I have a life, y’know?Scenes(The gang is disappointed.)ScenesThe Interviewer: Thank you. The readers at Soap Opera Digest will be happy to hear that.ScenesJoey: Oh, good to know. (The interviewer leaves.) So close!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, everyone is reading Joey’s interview.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Wow! I can’t believe they didn’t put it in the part where you said you didn’t watch soap operas.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I called the lady about that. I told her I was just joking. She was pretty nice about that.ScenesMonica: You slept with her didn’t you?ScenesJoey: Little bit, yeah.ScenesRoss: Wow! This picture of you sure is steamy.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, that’s just a little something for my huge gay fan base. (Winks at him.)ScenesRoss: Did you just wink at me?ScenesJoey: Hey, you’re the one that loves the picture.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Baby ShowerScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for Rachel’s baby shower.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: So what’s the final head count on my baby shower?ScenesPhoebe: About twenty, a couple people from work who had something else to do.ScenesMonica: Also both of your sisters called and neither can make it.ScenesRachel: What?! You mean they’re not coming to a social event where there’s no men and there’s no booze?! That’s shocking! I don’t care, as long as my mom’s here.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, your mother!ScenesRachel: What?! My mom’s not gonna be here?!ScenesMonica: Well, given that we forgot to invite her it would be an awfully big coincidence if she was.ScenesRachel: My God!ScenesMonica: Well it wasn’t my fault, Phoebe was in charge of the invitations!ScenesPhoebe: Well I don’t, I don’t have a mother so often I forget that other people…ScenesMonica: (interrupting her) Oh give it a rest!ScenesRachel: So my mother is not coming to my baby shower?!ScenesPhoebe: No. (Pause) Neither is mine.ScenesMonica: Okay, y’know what? Don’t worry, okay? We’ll take care of it. We’ll call her. Just go home and get ready.ScenesRachel: Please, make sure she comes. It’s really important to me, I mean it’s my mom!ScenesPhoebe: I know. I know, what’s her number?ScenesRachel: I don’t know.ScenesMonica: Go! I have it in my book. Go! (Rachel leaves and Monica calls Mrs. Green.) (To Phoebe) Wait a minute! If you’re in charge of the invitations why am I the one who has to call her—Hello Mrs. Green! Hi, it’s Monica Geller.ScenesMrs. Green: Oh, hello Monica.ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hi, umm I know this is last minute, but we’ve decided to throw an impromptu baby shower for Rachel today.ScenesMrs. Green: I know, my daughter’s told me about it when they received their impromptu invitations a month ago.ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’m sorry. I’m-I’m so sorry.ScenesMrs. Green: For what dear? For not inviting me or lying about it?ScenesMonica: (To Phoebe) Oh my God, my ass is sweating! (on phone) Please! Please! Can you come? It’s today at four.ScenesMrs. Green: Well all right. I’ll see you at four.ScenesMonica: Thank you. (Hangs up.)ScenesPhoebe: Isn’t it at three?ScenesMonica: Son of a bitch! (Calls Mrs. Green again.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey's Apartment, Joey is reading a script as Ross and Chandler enter carrying a basketball.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey Joe! You wanna shoot some hoops?ScenesJoey: Oh no, I can’t go. I’m practicing; I got an audition to be the host of a new game show.ScenesRoss: Oh cool!ScenesChandler: That’s great.ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, and if I get it by day I’ll (In a sexy voice) Dr. Drake Remoray, but by night I’ll be (In an announcer’s voice) Joey Trrrribbiani!ScenesChandler: You’ll be perfect for this! That’s already your name!ScenesJoey: But the audition’s in a couple hours and I don’t even understand the game.ScenesRoss: Well do you want some help?ScenesJoey: Oh really? That’d be great! You guys can be the contestants!ScenesRoss: Awesome!ScenesChandler: Okay, I guess we can lose to junior high girls some other time.ScenesJoey: (announcer voice) All right! Let’s play Bamboozled!ScenesChandler: Bamboozled?ScenesJoey: Yeah, isn’t that a cool name?ScenesRoss: (simultaneously with Chandler) Yeah!ScenesChandler: (simultaneously with Ross) No!ScenesJoey: All right. Uhh, okay. Our first contestant is Ross Geller. Why don’t you tell us a little something about you Ross?ScenesRoss: Well uh, I-I’m a paleontologist. Umm, I-I live in New York. I have a son Ben. Uh, hi Ben! (Waves.) And uh…ScenesJoey: I said a little bit Ross. Now, how about you Chandler?ScenesChandler: Well Joey, I’m a headhunter. I hook up out of work Soviet scientists with rogue third-world nations. Hi Rasputin! (Waves.)ScenesJoey: Excellent! Let’s play Bamboozled! Chandler, you’ll go first. What is the capital of Columbia?ScenesChandler: Bogota.ScenesJoey: It’s Ba-go-ta, but close enough. Now, you can either pass your turn to Ross or pick a Wicked Wango card.ScenesChandler: What does a Wicked Wango card do?ScenesJoey: I should know that. Let’s see, just one moment please. Umm, here we are, a Wicked Wango card determines whether you go higher or lower.ScenesChandler: Higher or lower than what?ScenesJoey: This is embarrassing. (Looks it up.)ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Can you believe how lame this is?ScenesRoss: I’m sorry, I don’t believe contestants are allowed to talk to each other.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel’s baby shower is underway. Monica and Phoebe are working in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, I told the stripper to be here at five. That’s good right?ScenesMonica: You ordered a stripper for the shower?! That is totally inappropriate!ScenesPhoebe: What? He’s gonna be dressed as a baby! (Mrs. Green enters.) Oh hi Mrs. Green!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: I’m so glad you could make it.ScenesMonica: Yes, thank you so much. And again, we’re so sorry. We could not feel worse about it.ScenesMrs. Green: Try. There’s my little girl. (Goes over to Rachel.)ScenesMonica: She’s still mad.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I know. Isn’t it great? One less person we have to make small talk with.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, Sandra’s mad at you too. It-it doesn’t bother you?ScenesPhoebe: No look, we’ve apologized twice! I can’t do anymore than that. I know you hate it when people are mad at you but you just have to be okay with it.ScenesMonica: Okay. I can do that. (Pause) I gotta go powder my ass.Scenes[Cut to Rachel and Mrs. Green.]ScenesMrs. Green: Look at that face! Just like when you were in high school! If I didn’t know better I’d say you were a cheerleader in trouble. Come on, let’s get some tea.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Mrs. Green helps her up and they walk over and get some tea.)ScenesMrs. Green: Oh my look at that. Only three weeks to go, now have you picked your nanny yet? Now I don’t want you to use your housekeeper ‘cause it would just split her focus.ScenesRachel: Oh well actually gonna use a nanny and uh, I don’t even have a housekeeper.ScenesMrs. Green: It’s like you’re a cave person. Rachel, you must get a nanny. You don’t know how overwhelming this is going to be. I mean when you were a baby I had full time help, I had Mrs. Kay.ScenesRachel: Mrs. Kay! Oh yeah, she was sweet. She taught me Spanish. I actually think I remember some of it, tu madre es loca. (I think that’s your mother’s crazy.)ScenesMrs. Green: Such a sweet woman.ScenesRachel: Well, however great she was I just can’t afford that.ScenesMrs. Green: Oh Rachel!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMrs. Green: I just had the greatest idea! I’m gonna come live with you!ScenesRachel: Wh-wh-what? What?ScenesMrs. Green: Oh, I’m so happy I’m gonna do this for my little girl. Aw, look at you. You have tears in your eyes.ScenesRachel: Yes. Yes I do.

rows.Scenes: Joey's Apartment, the guys are still playing Bamboozled.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right Ross you’re in the lead, would you like to take another question or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?ScenesRoss: The wheel has not been my friend tonight Joey. Uh, I’ll take another question.ScenesJoey: Okay, this is gonna be tough. Hold your breath.ScenesRoss: It’s okay, I’m ready.ScenesJoey: No dude, you gotta hold your breath until you’re ready to answer the question.ScenesChandler: This is ridiculous, he’s not gonna hold his breath… (Ross cuts him off by taking a deep breath and holding it.)ScenesJoey: Okay, what do you have a fear of if you suffer from this phobia, Tris…Holy cow, that’s a big word. Trisc… Seriously look at this thing. Chandler, how do you say that?ScenesChandler: Let me see that.ScenesJoey: This one right here. (Ross whines.)ScenesChandler: Triscadecaphobia.ScenesRoss: (exhaling) The fear of Triscuts!ScenesJoey: No! No, fear of the number 13.ScenesChandler: Fear of Triscuts?ScenesRoss: It’s possible, they have really sharp edges.ScenesJoey: All right Chandler, you’re up.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, I-I believe I’m entitled to use my Angel Pass for a free turn?ScenesChandler: This game makes no sense!ScenesRoss: Y’know what? You’re just upset because you’re losing.ScenesChandler: Oh come on Ross, I think we’re all losers here.ScenesJoey: All right. Chandler, you can either spin the wheel or pick a Google card.ScenesChandler: Let me think. Let me think—Oh! I don’t care.ScenesJoey: You-you must choose Mr. Bing.ScenesChandler: Either, it makes no difference.ScenesJoey: Choose, you jackass!ScenesChandler: I’ll take a card.ScenesJoey: Okay, you picked the Gimmie card! You get all of Ross’s points!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesChandler: This game is kinda fun.ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) You don’t think it’s a little crazy that you get all my points just ‘cause you…ScenesChandler: I don’t think the contestants are supposed to speak to each other.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, the baby shower is continuing as Rachel walks over to Monica and Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Why did you invite my mother?!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: She wants to move in with me and Ross to help take care of the baby.ScenesPhoebe: For how long?ScenesRachel: Eight weeks. I mean I love my mother, but my God, a long lunch with her is taxing.ScenesMonica: I personally would be honored if she wanted to live with me.ScenesPhoebe: She can’t hear you.ScenesRachel: What? You guys, come on! What am I going to do?ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you don’t want your mother to move in with you, just tell her.ScenesRachel: You’re right. You’re right. I mean I’m about to have a baby, I can tell my mother that I don’t want her to just be sleeping on my couch! Oh my God! She’s gonna want to sleep in my bed with me. This cannot happen!ScenesMonica: That’s right. That is right, you go over there and tell her you don’t want her to live with you. Do not take no for an answer!ScenesRachel: Okay. (She goes over to tell her mother.)ScenesMonica: (To Phoebe) This is great! Now she’s gonna be mad at Rachel! Y’know what? And I’m just gonna swoop in there and be like the daughter she never had.ScenesPhoebe: I have new respect for Chandler. All right everybody! It’s time to open the presents!ScenesMonica: Yes! Yes! And I think that the first gift that Rachel opens should be from the grandmother of the baby, because you’re the most important person in this room. And in the world!ScenesMrs. Green: Well uh, I don’t have a gift because I wasn’t invited until the last minute, but thank you so much for bringing that to everyone’s attention.ScenesPhoebe: How about you less important people, let’s open your presents!Scenes(Mrs. Green goes into the kitchen and Rachel follows her.)ScenesRachel: Mom that’s okay that you didn’t get you a gift!ScenesMrs. Green: Well, I kinda did. Me. Eight weeks of me.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah. Okay, see mom, the truth is I can do this on my own.ScenesMrs. Green: Sweetheart I know you’re gonna be terrific mom, I just think you need a little help, especially at the beginning.ScenesRachel: But mom, I really know what I’m doing. I can handle this.ScenesMrs. Green: Really? Remember Twinkles?ScenesRachel: He was a hamster! I am not going to vacuum up my baby!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, come on Rach it’s present time! Y’know you’re the glue that’s holding this whole party together. It’s kinda falling apart here.ScenesMrs. Green: Oh look.ScenesRachel: Wow!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, this is from your friend at work.ScenesRachel: Oh my gosh! Oh wow! Oh, I know what this is! (She’s holding an item with a large suction cup connected to a yellow plastic box, with a long narrow tube and bottle connected the yellow part.) Wait a minute. That can’t be right. Is that a beer bong for a baby?ScenesMrs. Green: Darling, that’s a breast pump!ScenesRachel: Did I say I was done guessing? Okay, thank you for that. Oh wow! What’s this?ScenesWoman: It’s a diaper genie.ScenesRachel: Oh, it dispenses clean diapers!ScenesWoman: No! It’s where you put the dirty ones!ScenesRachel: Well that’s gross, why don’t you just take it outside and throw it in a dumpster?ScenesMrs. Green: Oh you’re gonna do that ten times a day?ScenesRachel: What?! It goes ten times a day! What are we feeding this baby?! Indian food?!ScenesMrs. Green: No dear, that’s what babies do.ScenesMonica: Rachel, listen to your mother. She is very smart.ScenesMrs. Green: Plus, what are you planning on doing with the baby while you’re trotting out to the garbage ten times a day?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, I’d leave it on the changing table? (Everyone gasps.) What?! What’d I do? What’d I do?!ScenesMrs. Green: You can’t leave a baby alone!ScenesRachel: Oh come—(Stutters)—Of course I know that. I mean of course you never leave a baby alone! I mean who would—she wouldn’t be safe as she would be with me, the baby dummy. Oh God, okay. Y’know what? I think opening the presents right now is a little overwhelming right now. So I think umm, I’m just gonna maybe open them a little bit later, but thank you all for coming. And for these beautiful gifts, and this basket is beautiful.ScenesWoman: It’s actually a bassinet.ScenesRachel: Okay mommy, don’t ever leave me. (Hugs her.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey's Apartment, the guys are still playing the game only everyone is really into it.]
rows.Content: Joey: (To Chandler) In what John Houston film would you hear this line, "Badges? We don’t need no stinkin’ badges!ScenesChandler: Treasure of the Sierra Madre!ScenesJoey: Correct! There’s a possible backwards bonus!ScenesChandler: Madre Sierra the of Treasure!ScenesJoey: Yes!ScenesChandler: I’d like to go up the ladder of chance to the golden mud hut please.ScenesJoey: Wise choice, how many rungs?ScenesChandler: Six!ScenesJoey: (makes a sound like a monkey) That noise can only me one thing.ScenesChandler: (disappointed and simultaneously as Ross) Hungry monkey.ScenesRoss: (excited and simultaneously as Chandler) Hungry monkey! (To Chandler) Haaa! (To Joey) I’d like a Wicked Wango card!ScenesJoey: Okay, it’s an audio question, name this television theme song. (Starts humming the theme to I Dream of Genie.)ScenesRoss: (thinking) Oh. (Pause) Oh! Oh my God! Okay, I know this, give me-give me a second!ScenesChandler: Tell it to the Time Turtle!ScenesRoss: Shut up! I Dream of Genie!ScenesJoey: Yes! Yes, you’re back in the lead!ScenesRoss: I’d like to spin the wheel!Scenes(Joey makes a sound like a game show wheel spinning with the pointer bouncing off of the bars on the wheel as it slows and comes to a stop.)ScenesChandler: (annoyed) Oh come on!!ScenesJoey: All right! All right! Uh, umm, Super-Speedy Speed round!ScenesRoss: Is there a hopping bonus?ScenesJoey: Of course!Scenes(Ross gets up and starts to hop on one leg.)ScenesJoey: Who invented bifocals?ScenesRoss: Ben Franklin.ScenesJoey: Correct! Which monarch has ruled Great Britain the longest?ScenesRoss: Queen Victoria.ScenesJoey: Correct again! But, you forgot to switch legs between questions, so no hopping bonus!ScenesRoss: Noooo!!! Every time!!!ScenesJoey: Now, over to Chandler.ScenesChandler: I’d like a Google Card.ScenesJoey: Are you sure?ScenesChandler: Yes! (Pause) No! (Pause) Google!ScenesJoey: Oh my God! Congratulations Ross, because Chandler, you’ve been Bamboozled!ScenesChandler: Nooo!!ScenesRoss: Yeah!!ScenesChandler: This is the best game ever!!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, the baby shower has ended and everyone except for Mrs. Green have left who is talking to Rachel while Monica and Phoebe are cleaning up.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So umm, you’re gonna stay with me as long as I need you?ScenesMrs. Green: Of course I am!ScenesRachel: Oh mom, I swear I’m not an idiot. I’ve read all kinds of books on pregnancy and giving birth, but I-I just didn’t think to read the part about what to do when the baby comes. And-and then guess what? The baby’s coming and I don’t know what to do. Oh, can I throw up in my diaper genie?ScenesMrs. Green: No. Sweetie, you’re gonna be fine. (Starts to get up.)ScenesRachel: Wait-wait where are you going? Where are you going?ScenesMrs. Green: I’m going to the bathroom.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMrs. Green: Now don’t worry! Everything’s gonna be okay. (Hugs Rachel while she is standing and Rachel is sitting, seeing this Monica decides to join in on the hugging by hugging Mrs. Green from behind her back.)ScenesMonica: It is going to be okay! (Mrs. Green glances over her shoulder and glares at Monica while she heads for the bathroom.) It was worth a shot.ScenesRoss: (entering, out of breath) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Why are you all red and sweaty?ScenesRoss: I just Bamboozled Chandler! (Flexes in victory while everyone stares at him.) Which is not uh sexual thing. That was a quick shower.ScenesPhoebe: Not if you were here.ScenesRoss: Wow! It looks like we got a lot of good stuff.ScenesRachel: Oh we did, but my mom got us the greatest gift of all.ScenesRoss: (excited) A Play-Dough Barber Shop?ScenesRachel: No. She’s going to live with us for eight weeks.ScenesRoss: Uh, what?ScenesRachel: Yes! She’s gonna help us take care of the baby! Woo-hoo. (Sees that Ross isn’t happy.)ScenesRoss: What—You’re not serious. I mean she’s a very nice woman, but there is no way we can take eight weeks of her. She’ll drive us totally crazy.ScenesMrs. Green: (entering from bathroom) Hi Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi roomie! (Hugs her and looks at Rachel.)

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Audition, Joey is being shown in.]
rows.Content: Man: Hey Joey, hi! I’m Ray; I’m the producer of the show.ScenesJoey: (announcer voice) It’s a pleasure to meet you Ray.ScenesRay: And this is Duncan (points to the cameraman) and Erin, they’re gonna help us out with the audition. So uh, let’s get the camera rolling.ScenesJoey: (announcer voice) Rightie-O Ray!ScenesRay: Whenever you’re ready.ScenesJoey: (to the camera) Hello, I’m Joey Tribbiani! Let’s play Bamboozled! Erin, you get the first question! In hockey, who is known as The Great One?ScenesErin: Wayne Gretzky.ScenesJoey: Correct! Now, would you like to pick a Wicked Wango card or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?ScenesRay: Uh Joey, didn’t your agents give you the revised rules? We’ve eliminated all of that. No wheel, no cards.ScenesJoey: What—Why?!ScenesRay: Uh well, the game was too complicated and research showed people didn’t follow it.ScenesJoey: Well what’s complicated? You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey; you yank his tail and boom! You’re in Paradise Pond!ScenesRay: Yeah all that’s gone. It’s basically just a simple question and answer game now.ScenesJoey: Well what’s fun about that? You expect me to be the host of a boring game that’s just people standing around answering questions?ScenesRay: Well, there’ll be women in bikinis holding up the scores.ScenesJoey: (announcer voice to the camera) Let’s play Bamboozled!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Mrs. Green is telling Ross what needs to be done to baby proof his apartment.]
rows.Content: Mrs. Green: …and all those dinosaur nick-knacks you have Ross, I thought they might be more at home in the garage.ScenesRoss: Well we…we don’t have a garage.ScenesMrs. Green: Did I say garage? I meant garbage.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? Maybe, Mrs. Green, it’s not absolutely vital that you live with us.ScenesMrs. Green: Well Rachel needs help with the baby.ScenesRachel: I do. I really do. I don’t know anything.ScenesRoss: I’m-I’m sure that’s not true.ScenesRachel: Oh no? Pheebs? Monica? Do I know anything about babies?ScenesPhoebe: No, not a thing.ScenesMonica: It’s frightening.ScenesRoss: Well uh, y’know what? Even if she doesn’t know anything, I do! I have a son. And his mother and I didn’t live together, and whenever he was with me I took care of him all the time, by myself.ScenesMrs. Green: That’s true. You do have another child.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMrs. Green: With another woman. Have you no control Ross?ScenesRoss: That’s a different issue. Uh, the point is, when the baby comes I will be there to…to feed her and bathe her and change her. And more than that I want to do all those things.ScenesMrs. Green: Well then you really don’t need me to live with you.ScenesRoss: Yes! Yes, you’re gonna be so missed.ScenesMrs. Green: You’re gonna be a great father.ScenesRoss: Well you’re gonna be a wonderful grandma. (They hug.)ScenesRachel: Hello?! I still don’t know what the hell I’m doing!ScenesRoss: Oh, come on, every first time mother feels that way. You’ll—you’re gonna pick it up. (Rachel doesn’t believe that.) Hey! You will! Uh look, y’know when you first came to the city? You were this spoiled helpless little girl who-who still used daddy’s credit card. Do you remember?ScenesRachel: I hope you’re going somewhere with this.ScenesRoss: Look at you! What—You’re-you’re this big executive! You are much more capable than you give yourself credit for. I-I have no doubt you’re gonna be an incredible mother.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesRoss: I’m telling you.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (Hugs him.)ScenesMrs. Green: All right you two, I’m gonna get going.ScenesRoss: Oh. (Rachel and he start to stand up.)ScenesMrs. Green: Oh no-no-no-no sweetheart, you stay put. I’ll let myself out. It’s like I’m not here, which I almost wasn’t.ScenesMonica: (laughs) You’re still so funny. You’re so funny. (To Phoebe) What do I do?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing! You have apologized to her like a million times and she’s been nothing but terrible to you. And don’t forget you just threw her daughter a lovely, albeit slightly boring, shower, and she hasn’t even thanked you for it.ScenesMonica: Y’know what? You’re-you’re right.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I mean if you want to say anything to her, I’d tell her off.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!ScenesMonica: Okay! I will! Mrs. Green? Mrs. Green! (She ignores Monica and Monica follows her out into the hall with Phoebe in tow.) It is rude to leave a party without saying good-bye to the host! Yeah, and-and also when someone apologizes to you the decent thing to do is to accept it! Now what I did to you, it wasn’t on purpose! But what you’re during to me now is just plain spiteful!ScenesMrs. Green: Spiteful?!ScenesMonica: That’s right! Maybe it’s time you took a good hard look at a mirror young lady…old lady…lady!ScenesPhoebe: (To Monica) Wrap it up, wrap it up, wrap it up…ScenesMonica: So whenever you’re ready to apologize to me, I will forgive you. Good day! (Monica and Phoebe reenter the apartment and Monica closes the door on a stunned Mrs. Green.) I can’t feel my legs!ScenesPhoebe: You were fantastic! I’m so proud of you!ScenesMonica: Yeah? I’m proud of me too.ScenesPhoebe: You should be!ScenesMonica: Yeah could-could-could you get me something to drink?ScenesPhoebe: You got it!ScenesMonica: Okay. (When Phoebe turns around Monica runs out into the hall after Mrs. Green.) Mrs. Green! Okay I’m really sorry!! I’m apologizing for the—(She trips and falls down the stairs.) (Pause) Okay, I bit my tongue, but I’m still really sorry!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is helping Rachel study for when the baby comes.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (closing a book) Okay! I’m ready.ScenesRoss: You sure?ScenesRachel: Yes, I’ve done my studying and I really know my stuff.ScenesRoss: All right then. (Gets up, in an announcer’s voice) Rachel Green! Let’s play Bamboozled! (Reading from a note card.) How do you test the temperature of the baby’s bath water?ScenesRachel: Uh, put your elbow in it.ScenesRoss: Excellent! How do you put a baby down for a nap?ScenesRachel: Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.ScenesRoss: That’s correct! This is an audio question, what do you do when the baby makes this sound? (Makes a sound like someone is choking a cat.)ScenesRachel: Check if it’s wet, check if it’s hungry, burp it!ScenesRoss: Excellent! Excellent, now-now do you want another question or a Wicked Wango card?ScenesRachel: A card! A card! I pick a card!ScenesRoss: Oh, I’m sorry you’ve been Bamboozled! You’re gonna be a terrible mother! (Rachel stares at him agape.) I’ve lost sight of why we’re doing this! (Rachel gets up and walks away.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Cooking ClassScenesTeleplay by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesStory by: Dana Klein BorkowScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there except Monica as Ross enters carrying a huge stack of newspapers.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey you guys I got some bad news. (He sets the stack of papers down on the table.)ScenesPhoebe: Well that’s no way to sell newspapers. Why don’t you try, "Extra! Extra! Read all about it!ScenesRoss: No, Monica’s restaurant got a horrible review in the Post. (They all gasp.) I didn’t want her to see it, so I ran around the neighborhood and bought all the copies I could find. (He hands the paper to Phoebe and they all read it.)ScenesJoey: Man, this is bad! And I’ve had my share of bad reviews. I still remember my first good one though. (Quoting) "Everything else in this production of Our Town was simply terrible. Joey Tribbiani was abysmal.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: (seeing the stack of newspapers) Oh my God! Look at all the newspapers! It must be a good review! Is it great?!ScenesRoss: Umm…ScenesMonica: (reading) Oh dear God!ScenesRoss: But the good news is, no one in a two-block radius will ever know.ScenesMonica: What about the rest of Manhattan?!ScenesRoss: Yeah, they all know.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, this is horrible!ScenesChandler: I’m so sorry.ScenesMonica: I’m so humiliated!ScenesRachel: Yeah but y’know what they say Mon, "There’s no such thing as bad press.ScenesMonica: You don’t think that umm, (reading) "The chef’s Mahi Mahi was awful awful," is bad press?ScenesRachel: I didn’t write it.ScenesMonica: Is he right? Am I really—Am I awful?ScenesAll: No!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah Monica! You listen to me, okay? And I’m not just saying this because I’m your friend, I’m sayin’ it ‘cause it’s the truth. You’re food is abysmal!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, it’s late at night, Rachel is sitting on the couch in the dark wide-awake as Ross walks to the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ross!ScenesRoss: (startling him) What?! What?ScenesRachel: I am freaking out!ScenesRoss: Are ya?ScenesRachel: My due date is in one week!ScenesRoss: What are you doing up?ScenesRachel: That is seven days!ScenesRoss: Okay look, I had a lot of water before I went to bed. Can we do this after…ScenesRachel: (interrupting him) No-no-no-no-no Ross! Please, come on we do not have any of the big stuff we need! We do not a changing table! We do not have a crib! We do not have a diaper service!ScenesRoss: It’s funny you should mention diapers.ScenesRachel: I’m serious.ScenesRoss: Okay look, there’s nothing to worry about. We have plenty of time. There’s a great baby furniture store on west 10th. Tomorrow, we will go there and we will get you everything that you need. Okay?ScenesRachel: Okay. Thank you. That’s great. Thank you. Wait-wait! Where on west 10th? Because there’s this really cute shoe store that has like this little…ScenesRoss: (interrupting her) Okay. Okay. If uh, if you’re gonna do this, then I’m gonna do that. (Points to the bathroom.) So… (Starts for the bathroom.)ScenesRachel: (stopping him) Oh, wait Ross! I’m sorry, one more thing!ScenesRoss: (annoyed) Yeah!ScenesRachel: Umm, our situation. Y’know umm, what we mean to each other. And I mean we-we’re having this baby together, and we live together. Isn’t that, isn’t that weird?ScenesRoss: (stunned) (thinks) Well uh…ScenesRachel: I’m just kidding! You can go pee! (He does so in a hurry.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is cooking as Chandler looks on.
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey uh Monica, I can’t remember. Did we say we were gonna meet here or at the movies?ScenesMonica: We said at the movies, but…ScenesJoey: Okay, I’ll see you there. (Starts to leave)ScenesMonica: Joey! (He returns) Now that you’re here…ScenesJoey: Sure, I can hang out ‘til I have to meet ya. (To Chandler) What uh—How come you’re not going?ScenesChandler: I have a job interview I have to get ready for.ScenesJoey: I thought you already have a job.ScenesChandler: And people say you don’t pay attention. No, this is a much better job. It’s vice-president of a company that does data reconfiguration and statistical factoring for other companies.ScenesJoey: Wow! How do you know how to do that?!ScenesChandler: That’s what I do now.ScenesMonica: Hey Joey, come taste this.ScenesJoey: What is it?ScenesMonica: Remember that guy that gave me a bad review? Well… (Feeds him a spoonful of what she’s cooking.) I’m getting my revenge!ScenesJoey: You cooked him?ScenesMonica: No. He teaches a course on food criticism at the New School, so before we go to the movies I wanna go by there and make him try my bouillabaisse again. Oh, I cannot wait to read the front page of the Post tomorrow! "Restaurant reviewer admits: I was wrong about Monica.ScenesChandler: The front page? You really do live in your own little world, don’t ya?

rows.Scenes: The Baby Furniture Store, Ross and Rachel are checking out.]
rows.Content: Cashier: Do you uh, want these things delivered Mr. and Mrs. Geller?ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesRachel: No-no-no! No, no, no, we’re not married.ScenesRoss: We are having a baby together, but we’re not involved. (The cashier, a very beautiful woman, looks confused) I mean, uh we-we were seeing each other a while ago, but then we were just friends. And then there was one drunken night. (Rachel looks at him angrily) Or, yes stranger, we’d like this delivered please.ScenesCashier: Why don’t you fill out this address card. (Hands him one.)ScenesRoss: Oh, okay.ScenesCashier: I notice you picked out a lot of our dinosaur items.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! Actually, that’s one of the reasons why we’re not a couple.ScenesRoss: I chose those, I’m a paleontologist.ScenesCashier: Really?! That is so cool!ScenesRachel: Oh. Oh yeah, don’t get to worked up over it. I mean it-it sounds like he’s a doctor, but he’s not.ScenesCashier: Oh no-no, I’m fascinated by paleontology. Have you read the new Walter Alvarez book?ScenesRoss: Yeah! I-I teach it in my class.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! I’m standing at a cash register, holding a credit card, and I’m bored.ScenesCashier: (looking at the completed address card) Oh, I love your neighborhood. There’s a great gym right around the corner from your building.ScenesRoss: That’s my gym.ScenesCashier: I can tell you work out. (Ross is please and Rachel looks at him confused.) A paleontologist who works out, you’re like Indiana Jones. (Rachel has a disbelieving look on her face.)ScenesRoss: I am like Indiana Jones.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Oh, how did baby shopping go?ScenesRachel: Oh, it was great! We got everything that we needed! Oh and Ross, almost got something that wasn’t on the list. A whore.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRachel: Well, we were paying for our stuff and this saleswoman just started flirting with him.ScenesPhoebe: Well did she know you two weren’t married?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Well the idea of a woman flirting with a-with a single man, we-we must alert the church elders!ScenesRachel: You don’t understand! You didn’t see how brazen she was.ScenesPhoebe: Sounds like you’re a little jealous.ScenesRachel: No! I’m not! I-I-I just think it’s wrong! It’s-it’s that I’m—Here I am about to pop and he’s out picking up some shop girl at Sluts ‘R’ Us!ScenesPhoebe: Is that a real place? (Rachel’s stunned) Are they hiring?ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey Phoebe! (To Rachel) Fatty!ScenesPhoebe: Hey Chandler, why so fancy?ScenesChandler: Well, I got a job interview. It’s kinda a big deal too. Its a lot more money and I’d be doing data reconfiguration and statistical factoring.ScenesPhoebe: Wait, I think I know someone who does that.ScenesChandler: Me! I do that. So… Seriously, do I look okay? I’m little nervous.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! You really—You look great.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, just don’t get your hopes up.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesPhoebe: Well, the interview…ScenesChandler: What about it?ScenesPhoebe: Y’know! You don’t make a very good first impression.ScenesChandler: (shocked) What?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh you don’t know.ScenesChandler: Are you serious?!ScenesPhoebe: Yes, when I first met you, you were like, "Blah, blah, blah." I was like, shhh!ScenesChandler: What is it that I do?ScenesPhoebe: Well it’s just like you’re trying too hard. Always making jokes, y’know, you just—You come off a little needy.ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) Did you like me when we first met?ScenesRachel: Chandler, I’m not gonna lie to ya, but I am gonna run away from you. (Gets up and hurries out.)

rows.Scenes: The New School, Monica, carrying her dish, and Joey are confronting the food critic.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi! Umm, I’m Monica Geller, I’m the chef at Alessandro’s.ScenesThe Food Critic: Still?ScenesMonica: I think the things that you said about me are really unfair, and I would like for you to give my bouillabaisse another chance.ScenesThe Food Critic: I don’t see any reason why I would do that to myself again.ScenesJoey: Either eat it, or be in it.ScenesMonica: Spoon? (Hands him one and he tastes it.) So, what do you think?ScenesThe Food Critic: I’m torn, between my integrity and my desire to avoid a beating. But I must be honest, your soap is abysmal. (Throws down the spoon and walks out.)ScenesJoey: Thata girl! Huh? We should get out of here; there’s a new class comin’ in.Scenes(They start to leave.)ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Welcome to introduction to cooking. Now, before we start, can anyone tell me the difference between a hollandaise sauce and a bearnaise sauce? (No one can.)ScenesMonica: I can.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Okay, go ahead.ScenesMonica: Well umm, they both have a egg yolk and butter base, but a bearnaise has shallots, shirvel, and most importantly tarragon.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: That’s very good, what’s your name?ScenesMonica: Monica.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Monica, you go to the head of the class.ScenesMonica: Okay. (Does so.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are unpacking and setting up their new purchases.]
rows.Content: Rachel: All this stuff takes up a lot of room. Hey how uh, how serious are you about keeping Ben in your life?ScenesRoss: My son? Pretty serious. (There’s a knock on the door and Ross answers it.) Oh hey Katie! (The cashier from before) What uh, what are you doing here?ScenesKatie: Well, the delivery went out to you and I realized they forgot this. (A blanket.)ScenesRoss: Ah, must’ve been fairly obvious since it was the only thing left in your store.ScenesKatie: Listen, to be honest, home deliveries are really a part of my job description.ScenesRoss: Oh. (Reaches into his pocket for some money as Rachel enters the living room and watches holding two stuffed dinosaurs.)ScenesKatie: Oh uh…I actually came here to ask you out.ScenesRoss: Oh! Wow! Uh, yeah! That sounds great. I’m just gonna put this (The money) back in my pocket, pretend that didn’t happen. Uh yeah, actually I’m free now. Do you wanna grab some coffee or…ScenesKatie: Sure!ScenesRachel: Horny bitch. (They both look at her, pretending that the dinosaurs she’s holding are arguing.) No! You’re a horny bitch! Noooo! You’re the horny bitch! No! You’re a horny bitch!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, continued from before.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So you guys go, have a really good time.ScenesRoss: (To Katie) Yeah, I’m just gonna grab my coat. And uh, and my whip. (Katie looks worried.) Y’know because of the Indiana Jones? (Katie laughs) Not-not because I’m-I’m into S&M. (Katie’s worried again.) I’m not-I’m not into anything weird. Y’know? Just-just normal sex. (Katie is uncomfortable.) So, I’m gonna grab my coat. (Does so, leaving Katie and Rachel alone.)ScenesRachel: So, you had a good day huh? Big commission; picked up a daddy.ScenesKatie: Are you okay with this?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! Yeah please, you guys have fun.ScenesKatie: Okay. It was nice to see you.ScenesRachel: Oh and it was great to see you too. And you look fantastic, although you missed a button.ScenesKatie: Oh umm, actually I umm…ScenesRachel: Oh okay, I see what you’re doing there.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Phoebe are entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can’t even believe this! I really come off that badly?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! It’s okay, you calm down after a while and then people can see how really sweet and wonderful you really are.ScenesChandler: Oh good. Good, because I’m sure this interview is gonna last a couple of weeks.ScenesPhoebe: All right, don’t freak out! Okay? I-I will help you. How long before you have to leave?ScenesChandler: An hour.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t help you.ScenesChandler: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: All right, all right, we’ll just do our best. Okay? So let’s say I’m the interviewer and I’m meeting you for the first time. Okay. "Hi! Come on in, I’m uh, Regina Philange.ScenesChandler: Chandler Bing.ScenesPhoebe: Bing, what an unusual name.ScenesChandler: Well you should meet my uncle, Bada. (Pause) I’ll let myself out.

rows.Scenes: The Cooking Class, Joey is trying to cook as the teacher walks over to him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hi.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Your Fettuccini Alfredo looks a little dry, did you use all your cheese?ScenesJoey: When you say used, do you mean eat as a pre-cooking snack?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: And the cream?ScenesJoey: Cheese makes me thirsty.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Okay. Let’s move on.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: (To Monica) Oh! Something smells good over at Monica’s station! (She tries Monica’s fettuccini.) Oh my God! This is absolutely amazing! You’ve never made this before?ScenesMonica: Oh no! I don’t know anything about cooking. I had to ask someone what it’s called when the, when the water makes those little bubbles.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Well, hats off to the chef.ScenesMonica: I-I-I’m sorry, your-your mouth was full, I didn’t hear what you said. Umm, hats off to who now?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: The chef!ScenesMonica: That’s right.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Phoebe are still working on his interviewing techniques.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …I think you’ll find if I come to work here, I don’t micro-manage. I don’t shy away from delegating.ScenesPhoebe: Um-hmm, that’s good to know. But let’s stop focusing on what you don’t do, and start focusing on what you do do.ScenesChandler: (suppressing a smile) What I do do…is manage to uh, create an atmosphere of support for the people working with me.ScenesPhoebe: I see. Nice sidestep on the do do thing by the way.ScenesChandler: Hardest thing I’ve ever done in my life.ScenesPhoebe: You gotta go!ScenesChandler: Oh! (Stands up.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, don’t worry. You’re ready.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Absolutely! Just fight all your natural instincts and you’ll be great.ScenesChandler: Okay.

rows.Scenes: The Cooking Class, everyone has finished baking a batch of cookies and the teacher is going around tasting them.]
rows.Content: The Cooking Teacher: Ah Monica, my star student.ScenesMonica: Y’know, you called me that before so I-I took the liberty of fashioning a star out of aluminum foil. Now, no pressure, you like my cookies, you give me the star. (Hands it to her.)ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: (tasting the cookie and with her mouthful) Oh, yum-yum-yum. (Hands the star back.)ScenesMonica: Wow! A star! (The class glares at her.) I know you all hate me and-and I’m sorry, but I don’t care.Scenes(The teacher goes to Joey’s station.)ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Okay Joey, you’re up next. (Tries one of his cookies.) This are good! This is amazing! You get an A!ScenesJoey: I can an A? In-in school? (To Joey) Hey, I’m a dork.ScenesMonica: Joey! I’m so proud of you!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: I think you should give him your star.ScenesMonica: Excuse me? He doesn’t even know what he’s doing!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: We’re all beginners here. Nobody knows what they’re doing.ScenesMonica: I do! I’m a professional chef! (The class gasps.) Oh relax! It’s not a courtroom drama!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: If you’re a professional chef, what are you doing taking Introduction to Cooking?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesMonica: I’m-I’m sorry, it’s just that umm… Well I-I cook at this restaurant, Alessandro’s, and umm I just got a really bad review…ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Oh Alessandro’s! I love that place!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Oh yes! You’re an excellent chef! As a person you’re a little…ScenesMonica: Oh, I’m totally crazy, but you-you like the food?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Very much.ScenesMonica: Okay then, I don’t stink. I’m a good chef. Okay. (Starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I don’t want to go. I’m having fun.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Well actually, did either of you pay for this class?ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey, if my friend says it’s time to go, it’s time to go. (Starts to leave, but comes back for his cookies.)

rows.Scenes: An Office Building, Chandler is on his interview.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …also I was the point person on my company’s transition from the KL-5 to GR-6 system.ScenesThe Interviewer: You must’ve had your hands full.ScenesChandler: That I did. That I did.ScenesThe Interviewer: So let’s talk a little bit about your duties.ScenesChandler: (nervous) My duties? (Trying not to crack a joke) All right.ScenesThe Interviewer: Now you’ll be heading a whole division, so you’ll have a lot of duties.ScenesChandler: (trying not to laugh) I see.ScenesThe Interviewer: But there’ll be perhaps 30 people under you so you can dump a certain amount on them.ScenesChandler: (really try not to laugh) Good to know.ScenesThe Interviewer: We can go into detail…ScenesChandler: No don’t I beg of you!ScenesThe Interviewer: All right then, we’ll have a definite answer for you on Monday, but I think I can say with some confidence, you’ll fit in well here.ScenesChandler: (relieved) Really?!ScenesThe Interviewer: Absolutely. (They walk to the door.) You can relax; you did great.ScenesChandler: Yeah I gotta say thank you, I was really nervous. Y’know I’ve been told I come on to strong, make to many jokes, and then it was really hard to sidestep that duty thing. (The interviewer doesn’t understand) Duties. (Still doesn’t.) Duties! (Still doesn’t.) Poo. (Still doesn’t.)ScenesThe Interviewer: Poo?ScenesChandler: Oh my God this doesn’t count! Okay? The interview was over, that was the real Chandler Bing in there, this is just some crazy guy out in the hall! Call security! There’s a crazy guy out in the hall!ScenesThe Interviewer: Poo?!ScenesChandler: I’ll look forward to your call. (Walks away.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is returning from his date.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hi! You’re back from your date!ScenesRoss: How are you?ScenesRachel: I’m fine, but that’s not important. What’s important is how was she?ScenesRoss: Uhh, it was fun. We, we just had coffee.ScenesRachel: Oh uh-huh, uh-huh, coffee, a little rub-rub-rub under the table.ScenesRoss: What’s uh, what’s going on? Do you not, do you not like Katie?ScenesRachel: No! No, she’s—She was nice. I mean, she’s a little slutty, but who isn’t?ScenesRoss: I liked her.ScenesRachel: Of course you did Ross, you would date a gorilla if it called you Indiana Jones!ScenesRoss: Did you get like a fresh batch of pregnancy hormones today?!ScenesRachel: No! It’s just that, Kate bothered me.ScenesRoss: Why? What was wrong with her?ScenesRachel: There was nothing wrong with her! All right? She was perfectly lovely!ScenesRoss: Okay, so what’s the matter?ScenesRachel: I don’t want you to date her!ScenesRoss: (laughs) Why? What, what are you jealous?ScenesRachel: Yes! And not because I want you to go out with me, but because I don’t want you to go out with anybody! Okay? I know it’s a terrible thing to even think this, and it’s completely inappropriate, but I want you to be at my constant beck and call 24 hours a day! I’m very sorry, but that is just the way that I feel.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: I won’t date. I’ll uh, I’ll be here, with you, all the time.ScenesRachel: Really? But I’m being so unreasonable.ScenesRoss: True, but you’re allowed to be unreasonable. You’re having our baby.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Oh Ross, thank you. Thank you. (They hug.)ScenesRoss: Do you feel better?ScenesRachel: No, not really. You’re pressing the baby into my bladder and now I have to pee. Sorry. (She gets up and starts for the bathroom.)ScenesRoss: Uh Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah. (Stops and starts doing the I-have-to-go-to-the-bathroom dance.)ScenesRoss: Just one thing umm…ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: We live together. You’re having our baby. I’m not gonna see anybody else. Are you-are you sure you don’t want something more?ScenesRachel: (pause) Wow! I don’t know, maybe. I’m…ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, Rach! I was just messin’ around! (She’s stunned) Like you did last night when I had to pee?ScenesRachel: (laughs) I knew that! I knew that! I was just messin’ with you too!ScenesRoss: (pause) Okay. Okay. Because for a minute you said you…ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no-no, no!ScenesRoss: …that you actually…ScenesRachel: No that’s just—(Laughs)—That’s just ‘cause I’m such a good messer!Scenes(They both laugh. Ross sits down, but Rachel doesn’t move and is lost in thought.)ScenesRoss: Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesRoss: The bathroom?ScenesRachel: Right! (Heads for the bathroom.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The New School, Joey and Monica are walking down a hallway.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I had a great time! Learned how to bake, ate great food, that’s the first A I’ve gotten since seventh grade, and I didn’t have to sleep with the teacher this time.ScenesMonica: Oh, look! Acting for Beginners! Want to feel good about yourself?ScenesJoey: What the hell!ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes(They enter.)ScenesThe Acting Teacher: All right, let’s start with some basics. Can anybody tell me what the difference between upstage and downstage is?Scenes(No one can and Monica looks at Joey expectantly.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, this was a stupid idea. (Exits.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel Is LateScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is showing everyone a poster as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! What are you guys looking at?ScenesJoey: Oh, it’s a poster for that World War I movie that I’m in, check it out.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Wow! It looks really violent!ScenesJoey: Uh-huh! I know. I’m coming soon to a theater near you! I’m in THX! I’m unsuitable for children!ScenesRoss: Now I cannot wait to see this.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, it’s already generating Oscar buzz.ScenesPhoebe: I started that!ScenesJoey: I thought I did! Oh hey guess what? The premiere is next week and you’re all invited! (They all gasp.)ScenesMonica: Are we gonna take a limo?ScenesJoey: Sure! Why not?!ScenesMonica: Oh I love taking limos when nobody died!ScenesRachel: Well obviously I won’t be able to come, for those of you who haven’t checked their calendars today is my due date. Well y’know, I just want to take a moment and thank you guys for how great you’ve been during this time. I really couldn’t have done it without you. And I have loved these last nine months! And even though I am so looking forward to the next part, I am really gonna miss being pregnant.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, time lapse, and Rachel is entering still pregnant.]
rows.Content: Rachel: That’s right, still no baby! (To Monica, Joey, and Chandler on the couch) Come on people! Please make some room!ScenesRoss: Uh sweetie, maybe you’d be more comfortable here? (Gets up from the green armchair.)ScenesRachel: You. Like you haven’t done enough.ScenesRoss: Look, I-I know how miserable you are, I wish there was something I can do. I mean I wish I were a seahorse. (She glares at him) Because with seahorses it’s the male, they carry the babies. And then also umm, I’d be far away in the sea. (He sits back down.)Scenes(Rachel turns and looks at the group on the couch and they move over. Chandler measures the room they’ve made with his arm and decides it’s not enough and they all move over again.)ScenesRachel: God. (Sits down.) I have never been so uncomfortable in my entire life!ScenesPhoebe: Oh I know, I’ve been there. I remember toward the end…ScenesRachel: (interrupting her) Oh Phoebe, that’s a great story. Can you tell it to me when you’re getting me some iced tea? (Phoebe gets up and Rachel groans.) (To the baby) Oh God, get out! Get out!! Get out!! Get out!!ScenesChandler: Let’s. (Everyone gets up and leaves Rachel.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Phoebe, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! Did you have the baby yet?ScenesRachel: Do you want me to come over there and sit on you? ‘Cause I’ll do it.ScenesMonica: What are you doing here so early?ScenesRachel: They sent me home from work. They were like, "Start your maternity leave now! Just rest, get ready for the baby." Well y’know what? Screw ‘em! If they don’t want me there, I’ll just hang out with you guys.ScenesPhoebe: Or you can do volunteer work.Scenes(Joey’s cell phone rings and he answers it.)ScenesJoey: Hello?ScenesEstelle: Joey! It’s Estelle! Great news, I was able to get you and one guest tickets to your premiere.ScenesJoey: One guest? You told me I can have six tickets!ScenesEstelle: Well, I sold four of them on Ebay. You’ll be sitting next to HotGuy372.ScenesJoey: Oh my God. So that’s it?! I only get to bring one guest?ScenesEstelle: Yeah, what time do you wanna pick me up? (Joey hangs up on her.) Hello?ScenesJoey: (to Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe) Did you hear that? I only get one extra ticket to my premiere. So some how I have to pick between you three and Ross.ScenesRachel: (overhearing that) What-what about me?ScenesJoey: You said you didn’t want to go.ScenesRachel: I don’t. But I would still like to be acknowledged. What? Just because I’m pregnant you think I’m invisible.ScenesJoey: Definitely not invisible.ScenesMonica: Well, well Ross didn’t care enough to be here, so I think he’s out. You snooze you lose.ScenesChandler: He’s not snoozing, he’s teaching a class.ScenesMonica: Well then somebody’s snoozing. Joey, not that this uh should affect you at all, but if you were to pick me, I was planning on wearing a sequined dress, cut down to here. (Points to her stomach just above her belly button.)ScenesChandler: I haven’t seen this dress.ScenesMonica: Star in a movie.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, you pick who ever you want. Okay? You just listen to your heart. What does it tell you? (Mimicking a heartbeat and tapping her chest.) Phoebe, Phoebe.ScenesJoey: Well uh…I think I want to take Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: (still mimicking a heartbeat, only faster) Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe—Burrrrr! (Mimics the sound of a cardiac monitor going off.)ScenesChandler: You really want to take me?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! I mean I’m sorry, I wish I can take everybody, but y’know Chandler always supported my career. He’s paid for acting classes and head shots and stuff and well this will be my way of paying you back.ScenesChandler: So you’re never actually going to pay me back?ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, just because he paid for your head shots you’re gonna take him? Joey, I don’t think you’re comprehending just how slutty this dress is!ScenesJoey: It’s not just the stuff he paid for, I mean it’s-it’s everything. Y’know? He read lines with me. He-he went with me on auditions when I was really nervous, and then he consoled me after I didn’t get parts that I really wanted. You always believed in me man. Even, even when I didn’t believe in myself.ScenesChandler: I always knew you were gonna make it. I’m so proud of you.ScenesJoey: Thanks. That means a lot to me.Scenes(They look at each other and smile for a while.)ScenesPhoebe: Mon, maybe one of these guys wants to wear your dress.ScenesJoey: (in a manly voice) I’m gonna go shave. (Gets up.)ScenesChandler: (in a manly voice) Yeah well, I’m gonna go spit. (He goes into the bedroom. On his way out, Joey gives Rachel a wide berth.)ScenesRachel: Oh, I have to pee. If I don’t come out in five minutes it’s because I’ve choked to death on the potpourri stink. (Goes into the bathroom.)ScenesPhoebe: When she comes out, you hold her nose, I’ll blow in her mouth, and the kid will just (makes a popping sound) right out of her.ScenesMonica: She’s over a week late! She gotta have it today, right?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. I-I think it’s still gonna be a while.ScenesMonica: Hmm, care to make it interesting? I’ll bet you that she’ll have it by this time tomorrow.ScenesPhoebe: You’re on!ScenesMonica: Okay, how much?ScenesPhoebe: One hundred thousand dollars!ScenesMonica: How about fifty bucks?ScenesPhoebe: Fine! I’ll call Zurich and move some money around.ScenesRachel: (calling from the bathroom) All right, who’s turn is it to help me get up!Scenes(They both look at each other, then Phoebe gets an idea.)ScenesPhoebe: No one’s here! (Monica looks at her.) Oh damnit!

rows.Scenes: The World Premiere of Over There, Joey and Chandler are arriving in a limo and are about to walk down the red carpet.]
rows.Content: Chandler: This is so exciting! It’s so glamorous! People taking our picture. How do I look?ScenesJoey: A little tall.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Do you mind crouching down a little bit, so that I look taller? (Chandler does so) There you go. (And they walk down the red carpet.)ScenesChandler: It’s just so glamorous.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel is entering, still pregnant.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh hey Mon? Rach is here! Ohh, you’re still pregnant. Oh, I’m sorry. I know how uncomfortable you are. Y’know what? You look great. Yeah, like fifty bucks.ScenesRachel: Oh, I have to go pee. Apparently this baby thinks that my bladder is a squeeze toy. (Goes to the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: Damnit! Damnit!! Here’s your fifty bucks! (Pays Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: It’s interesting that you lost. Now, I forget, do you like to lose?ScenesMonica: Now stop it! Double or nothing that she has it by tomorrow!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! You’re on!ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Until then, General Grant, why don’t you set up camp (She puts the bill in her bra) right there.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey is Rachel here? We have a doctor’s appointment.ScenesMonica: She’s in the bathroom.ScenesRoss: Rach, we gotta go.ScenesRachel: In a minute!!!ScenesRoss: People ask me why we’re not together, I just don’t know what to tell them.ScenesRachel: (entering) All right, all right. Let’s go!ScenesRoss: Uh, do you wanna go change first? The doctor’s keeping the office open late for us, but if you hurry…ScenesRachel: No, I’m fine.ScenesRoss: Really? You don’t think that’s a little inappropriate. (She’s wearing a tank top and has her belly sticking out.)ScenesPhoebe: Good God man don’t anger it.ScenesRachel: Ross, it is 100 degrees outside. For the first time in weeks, I am somewhat comfortable.ScenesRoss: Fine! Fine! Y’know what? Whatever you want. Okay? You’re the mommy.ScenesRachel: Oh uh-uh pal! Don’t call me mommy! It’s bad enough you call your own mother that. (He looks at Monica.)ScenesMonica: I’m actually with her on this one.

rows.Scenes: Inside Joey’s Premiere, he is intently watching the movie.]
rows.Content: Joey: (onscreen) "I thought I knew who the enemy was, but it was you all along.ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Okay, this is it. It’s my big fight scene coming up. (He looks over and Chandler and notices that he’s asleep.)

rows.Scenes: Dr. Long’s Office, Ross and Rachel are waiting for the doctor. Ross is drumming his fingers on the bed.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ross.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Can I ask you something?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh.ScenesRachel: When Carol was pregnant with Ben…ScenesRoss: Mmm?ScenesRachel: …were you this irritating?ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: Excuse me?!ScenesRoss: Oh nothing. Nothing! Just uh, you’ve been a little short with me lately. I’m not trying to irritate you.ScenesRachel: Well then you just must have a natural talent for it.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? The doctor will be in soon, why don’t we not speak until then.ScenesRachel: (silently) Okay. (Pause) Seriously, breathe louder Ross! That’s great!ScenesRoss: Y’know we should probably ask the doctor if she even knows how to deliver a baby that’s half human and half pure evil!Scenes(Dr. Long enters.)ScenesRachel: Hi Dr. Long, how are you?ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Oh, you’re nice to her.ScenesRachel: She has the drugs!ScenesDr. Long: We’ll do a quick check.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Rachel lies back.)ScenesDr. Long: So, eight days late huh?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesDr. Long: You must be a little uncomfortable.ScenesRachel: Eh, just a tad.ScenesDr. Long: You’re about 80 percent effaced, so you’re on your way. It still could last a little while longer. If you’re anxious there are a few ways to help things along.ScenesRoss: Do them!!ScenesDr. Long: Actually, they’re things you can do. Just some home remedies, but in my experience I’ve found that some of them are quite effective.ScenesRachel: Well, we are ready to try anything.ScenesDr. Long: Okay, there’s an herbal tea you can drink.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesDr. Long: You can take some caster oil, there’s eating spicy foods…ScenesRachel: Great! We will do all of those.ScenesDr. Long: …taking a long walk, and then there’s the one that’s proved most effective: sex.Scenes(Rachel turns and looks at Ross.)ScenesRoss: You’ve got to be kidding me!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Premiere, the movie is ending and it takes the applause to wake up Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Good job Joe! Well done! Top notch!ScenesJoey: You liked it? You really liked it?ScenesChandler: Oh-ho-ho, yeah!ScenesJoey: Which part exactly?ScenesChandler: The whole thing! Can we go?ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no, give me some specifics.ScenesChandler: I love the specifics, the specifics were the best part!ScenesJoey: Hey, what about the scene with the kangaroo? Did-did you like that part?ScenesChandler: I was surprised to see a kangaroo in a World War I epic.ScenesJoey: You fell asleep!! There was no kangaroo! They didn’t take any of my suggestions! That’s for coming buddy. I’ll see you later. (Starts to walk out.)ScenesChandler: Don’t go! I’m sorry. I’m so sorry! (Sees another guy who is still asleep.) Look! This guy fell asleep! He fell asleep too! Be mad at him! (Looks at him more closely.) Or, call an ambulance.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Rachel are there as Phoebe and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMonica: What did the doctor say? Any news on when the baby will come?ScenesRachel: No. But she did give us some ideas on how to induce labor.ScenesRoss: Yeah, we tried them all. We went for a walk, uh we tried a special tea, caster oil, spicy food nothing has worked.ScenesRachel: Well, there is one thing that we haven’t tried, but someone thinks that, (mimicking Ross) "That will open up a can of worms.ScenesMonica: Well what is it? What is it? If it’s gonna help bring the baby here, like today. I mean, I think you should do it.ScenesRoss: It’s sex.ScenesMonica: Do it!ScenesRoss: Monica!ScenesMonica: I’m just saying it’s been a really long time for you. I mean, women have needs. Do it, get yours!ScenesPhoebe: Oh I-I don’t know about that. No, I think that if the two of you had sex the-the-the repercussions would be catastrophic.ScenesMonica: All right, let’s be practical, if Ross isn’t willing to do it, he’s not the only guy in the world you can have sex with. You can borrow Chandler—Chandler is good!ScenesRoss: Monica, what is the matter with you?ScenesMonica: Nothing. I just want the baby to be born today.ScenesRachel: Why? Why today?ScenesMonica: Okay fine! I keep betting Phoebe that you’re gonna have the baby and I don’t want to lose again!ScenesRoss: What?! While she’s been going through this hell, you’ve been making money?! You’re betting on your friend staying in this misery?! (Phoebe lowers her head and shakes it yes.)ScenesRachel: I’ll take that bet.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Well, I’m miserable here! I might as well make some money out it!ScenesRoss: Can I get some of that action?ScenesMonica: Wait a minute! Now I’m betting against all three of you?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, don’t worry. I really do feel like tomorrow’s the day.ScenesMonica: Oh, okay!Scenes(Rachel turns her head to Ross and Phoebe and mouths, "No way.")

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is there as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Sleeping beauty!ScenesChandler: Where have you been?! I tried to call you! I want to talk to you! I still feel so bad!ScenesJoey: (in a baby voice) Oh no, were you upset? Did you lose sleep?ScenesChandler: I’m so sorry.ScenesJoey: Uh-huh look, the only reason I can over here was to settle things between us! Okay? You’ve done a lot for me and my career, I wanted to pay you back so I took you to the premiere but you missed it! Okay, so how much do I owe you?ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Give me a number, I don’t want to owe you anything!ScenesChandler: You don’t owe me anything, I don’t want you money…ScenesJoey: Ah-ah-ah! We’re doing this! Okay, now you got me my first set of head shots. Right, how much were those?ScenesChandler: I don’t know, five hundred dollars?ScenesJoey: Okay, five hundred dollars. What else?ScenesChandler: Well then there was the second set, the infamous booger head shots.ScenesJoey: Okay, so that’s another five hundred. Five hundred and five hundred, that’s… (Pauses to figure it out.)ScenesChandler: Do you want a calculator?ScenesJoey: Please!ScenesChandler: Here! (Hands him one. Joey adds it up and discovers that he was right.)ScenesJoey: All right, what else?ScenesChandler: Well uh, there was acting classes, stage combat classes, tap classes…ScenesJoey: Which we’re still keeping under our hats!ScenesChandler: Uh then there was that dialect coach who helped you with that play where you needed a southern accent. Which after twenty hours of lessons still came out Jamaican.ScenesJoey: What the hell are you talking about, (in a Jamaican accent) "The south will rise again man.ScenesChandler: Yes, money well spent!ScenesJoey: Yeah. Okay, what else? Rent!ScenesChandler: Okay, two, three years of rent, utilities, food…ScenesJoey: Okay. Okay, so I’m writing you a check for…So you fell asleep during my movie. Big deal right? How do you clear this thing?

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are trying the home remedies again.]
rows.Content: Ross: Come on, finish your enchilada.ScenesRachel: Ross I—We tried all the spicy food. It’s not working.ScenesRoss: Okay here, have one of these peppers. Oh ha… Oh God! So…so hot! (Rubs his eyes.) Oh my—(Laughs.) By the way, you don’t want to touch the pepper and then touch your eye.ScenesRachel: I am feeling nothing. Speaking of hot, watching you do that really makes me want to have sex with you.ScenesRoss: Stop it.ScenesRachel: Oh come on Ross, why are we wasting our time with this other stuff?! We know what’s gonna work! It’s doctor recommended!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry, but we have to have some boundaries! My God, I’m dying.ScenesRachel: Oh come on Ross, we’ve done it before we’ll do it again, it’ll be a nice way to bookend the pregnancy.ScenesRoss: This is insane, I’m not gonna make love to you just so that you’ll go into labor.ScenesRachel: Make love? What are you a girl?ScenesRoss: Always a great way to get in a man’s pants.ScenesRachel: But you will, you will be performing a service. Okay? Just-just think of me as a ketchup bottle, y’know you sometimes you have to bang on the end of it just to get something to come out.ScenesRoss: I love when you talk dirty to me.ScenesRachel: Oh, I know it. You’re right. That’s not sexy. Oh…Oh! (Drops a fork on the floor.) Whoops! Oh, I seem to have dropped my fork. Let me just bed over and get it. (Tries too, but can’t quite seem to make it.) Oh God!ScenesRoss: Okay enough! This is, this is not going to happen.ScenesRachel: Come on Ross! I’m miserable here! Come on! You started this, now you finish it! Come on wuss, make love to me.ScenesRoss: Y’know what?ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: Forget it.ScenesRachel: Oh wow! What now Ross you’re not gonna talk? How on earth will you ever annoy me? Oh wait a minute, I know. (Mimics his breathing.) I mean you’d think the damn jalepeno would’ve cleared up your sinuses, but no!! That’s not enough… (Ross jumps over and kisses her.) What are you doing?!ScenesRoss: I’m getting that baby out of you!Scenes(They kiss again.)ScenesRachel: (breaking the kiss) Oh God!ScenesRoss: Oh, I know.ScenesRachel: Oh no. No-no! I think my water just broke.ScenesRoss: I am good. Okay! Okay! Uh, I got the pillow! I got the bag! You got the keys?ScenesRachel: Okay! I got the keys! Okay! Okay!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: We’re having a baby.Scenes(They hug and then kiss one more time.)ScenesRachel: I didn’t uh, really have time to read this part of the books, but do you think we have time to…ScenesRoss: Not so much.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is paying Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Monica: Two hundred.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you!ScenesMonica: That’s it. I’m done. I don’t care when the baby comes, no more betting.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello? (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up.) I guess we can bet one more time.ScenesPhoebe: Is Rachel having the baby?ScenesMonica: How did you know that?! (Runs to yell at Joey’s apartment.) Joey! Chandler!! It’s time!ScenesPhoebe: They’re at the coffeehouse.ScenesMonica: You know everything!! Oh wait, double or nothing. I bet you the baby is over seven pounds. (Phoebe isn’t interested.) I bet you it has hair. (She’s still not interested.) I bet you it’s a girl.ScenesPhoebe: We know it’s a girl! (Exits.)ScenesMonica: (following her) I’ll give you really good odds.ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel Has A BabyScenesPart I Written by: Scott SilveriScenesPart II Written by: David Crane & Marta KauffmanScenesParts I & II Transcribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Hospital, Ross and Rachel, who’s in a wheelchair, are arriving in the waiting room for the maternity ward.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right! (Checking his watch) Yes!! From home to the hospital in under seven minutes! We did it!!ScenesRachel: (deadpan) Yes, the hard part is truly over.ScenesRoss: No, but come on, we’re off to a great start aren’t we? I knew I’d get you here fast, but this has got to be some kind of a record!Scenes(Phoebe and Monica walk in from getting some coffee.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh you made it!ScenesRachel: Hi! (Ross is stunned.)ScenesMonica: How are you doing?ScenesRoss: Wait a minute! How-how the hell did you beat us here?ScenesMonica: We took a cab. Did you guys walk?ScenesRoss: N… No! We took a cab too, but I did test runs!Scenes(Chandler and Joey enter from the vending machines carrying sodas.)ScenesChandler: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey! You made it!ScenesRoss: Okay is there…some kind of magic tunnel to this hospital?!ScenesRachel: Ross, you stay here and talk, I’m gonna go have a baby.ScenesRoss: Okay. Okay. (To the nurse behind the desk.) Umm hi, this is Rachel Green. I’m Ross Geller. We-we called from the car.ScenesNurse: Right! We have a semi-private labor room waiting for you. So in just a minute…ScenesRachel: (interrupting her) Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I’m sorry, semi-private? We (Laughs), we asked for a private room.ScenesNurse: Yes, I see that here. Unfortunately we can’t guarantee a private room and currently they’re all unavailable.ScenesChandler: Man, if only you’d gotten here sooner. (Ross turns and glares at him.)ScenesNurse: I’m sorry. Semi-private rooms are all we have.ScenesRachel: Okay. Just give us a second. Ross! (They walk away from the desk.)ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Give her some money.ScenesRoss: I really think they’re out of rooms.ScenesRachel: They’re not!! Ross, they’re just saving them for the important people!! Okay?! What-what if I was the president?!ScenesRoss: Well then we’d be in a lot of trouble, you don’t know where any countries are. (Rachel glares at him.) Okay. (He goes over to the desk followed by Rachel.) Uh, say would you umm… Would you mind checking again to see if any umm, private rooms may have (Handing her some money) opened up?ScenesNurse: This is a hospital.ScenesRachel: (standing up) Okay. Y’know what? I’d have to say I really don’t care for your tone. And this is not the only hospital in this city and we have no problem to—Whoa! (She starts a contraction) Oh gosh! Whoa!ScenesRoss: What-what?ScenesRachel: Ow! Ow! Contraction. (Sits back down.) Ow-ow! Ow-ow! (Starts breathing heavily.)ScenesNurse: Would you like to see a semi-private room?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it couldn’t hurt to look.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Rachel is in bed, Ross is fooling around, and Dr. Long is checking on Rachel.]
rows.Content: Dr. Long: Well you’re only two centimeters dilated and we need to get to ten. It’ll be a while.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay.ScenesDr. Long: I’ll be back in an hour to check you again.ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (Dr. Long exits.) Well, I guess we have some time to kill.ScenesRoss: Yeah, guess so. Whew! Check these out! (He’s looking at the stirrups on the other bed in the room and Rachel groans. Ross then hops into the bed and puts his legs into the stirrups.) Never done this before.ScenesRachel: Yeah well it looks great!Scenes(A nurse shows another couple into the room.)ScenesMan: Thank you very much.ScenesWoman: Thanks.Scenes(They stop when they see Ross who has to struggle to get out of the bed.)ScenesRoss: Hi! Hi, I’m uh Ross. I’m here to ruin this magical day for you.ScenesMan: Oh no-no, not at all.ScenesWoman: Don’t worry about it.ScenesMan: Marc Coreger, this is my wife Julie.ScenesRoss: Hi Julie.ScenesJulie: Hi.ScenesRoss: This is Rachel. (Points at her.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMarc: Oh hi Rachel.ScenesRachel: How are you?ScenesJulie: Hi. Is this your first?ScenesRachel: Yeah it is.ScenesJulie: Well, little Jamie here is our third. So, if you have questions or you need anything at all, just holler.ScenesRachel: That’s so sweet.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: Umm say, I-I opened this earlier (The privacy screen) but let me give you guys some privacy.ScenesMarc: No nonsense! We’re all in this together.ScenesJulie: Yeah, we are going to share every moment of this with you. And I think we’re gonna have some fun.ScenesMarc: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Oh, okay.ScenesMarc: Hey! Smile! (Points his camera at Ross and Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Oh no, I really don’t want any—(He takes the picture)—Oh! Thank you. Oh. Oh Ross…ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Here comes another contraction.ScenesRoss: Oh. Okay, just breathe.ScenesJulie: Oh honey, I think I’m having one too!Scenes(During the mutual contraction Julie takes a moment to point out they’re having a contraction at the same time.)ScenesMarc: Look at this! (Takes another picture) There we go!

rows.Scenes: The Waiting Room, the rest of the gang is lounging around.]
