How do you know?ScenesPhoebe: It was his sweater, but—Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Oh, I so wanted Ross to know first, but I’m so relieved you guys know.ScenesMonica: This is so great! And I’m gonna be your baby’s aunt!ScenesRachel: I know! (They hug.)ScenesPhoebe: Me too! (Joins the hug.)ScenesJoey: I’m gonna be an uncle! Come here! (He joins the hug.)ScenesRachel: (breaking the hug) You’re all gonna be aunts and uncles.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but I’m the only one related by blood.ScenesRachel: Okay. Great! So now that you guys all know you can help me. Give me some advice on how I’m gonna tell Ross!ScenesMonica: Well, what were you gonna say?ScenesRachel: Well I was gonna tell him that I’m-I’m gonna have the baby and he can be as involved as he wants.ScenesJoey: Well that, that sounds good.ScenesRachel: Yeah but how do I start? I mean, what’s-what’s the first thing that I say? (They all pause to think.) Okay great! Thanks. (She starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: Hey! Good luck!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, bye.ScenesJoey: Bye.Scenes(Rachel exits.)ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey, what was that all about?ScenesMonica: Well I guess there is no harm in telling you now, Rachel and Ross are gonna have a baby.ScenesChandler: (in a high pitched voice) What?! I didn’t even know that—Why didn’t you tell me?! (Pause) Why am I talking like this?!ScenesMonica: I didn’t think you could keep it a secret.ScenesChandler: (in the high pitched voice) What?! (Normal voice) I am an excellent secret keeper. I have kept all of our secrets.ScenesJoey: What secrets?ScenesChandler: Oh no-no Joey, I am not going to tell you because I am an excellent secret keeper.Scenes(The girls walk away.)ScenesJoey: (whispering to Chandler) You’ll tell me later?ScenesChandler: You already know.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Phoebe are entering.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, it's so romantic to send people off on their honeymoon.ScenesJoey: Y’know, Monica and Chandler are married. Ross and Rachel are having a baby. Maybe you and I should do something.ScenesPhoebe: All in good time my love. All in good time. Oh shoot! I left my guitar in their apartment. Well you can let me in later.ScenesJoey: I don’t have a key, they took mine to give to you.ScenesPhoebe: What?! They took mine to give to you!ScenesJoey: Why would they take away our keys?ScenesPhoebe: Maybe they don’t trust us.ScenesJoey: No that’s not it. They let me keep my key the last time they were out of town.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the time you broke the ketchup bottle and cleaned it up with Monica’s guest towels?ScenesJoey: Hey, I washed those!ScenesPhoebe: No you didn’t.ScenesJoey: Yeah that didn’t sound like me.ScenesPhoebe: Well, what am I gonna do? I really need my guitar!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I have stuff in there too.ScenesPhoebe: What stuff?ScenesJoey: Monica’s chicken parm! I’ll take care of it. (He picks up the phone) Hey Mr. Treeger, it’s Joey Tribbiani. Listen, I need to get into Monica and Chandler’s apartment. It’s an emergency. (Listens) Uhh, gas leak! Yeah oh, and bring garlic bread. (Hangs up.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Did Rachel find you?ScenesRoss: No why?ScenesPhoebe: Oh she was looking for you.ScenesRoss: Oh well, I guess I’ll catch up with her later.ScenesPhoebe: Well, she really wanted to talk to you now.ScenesJoey: Yeah, it seemed pretty important.ScenesRoss: Oh no.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRoss: I think I might know what this is about.Scenes(Phoebe and Joey trade looks)ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Uh, uh we promised we weren’t gonna tell anybody this but uh, about a month ago Rachel and I slept together.ScenesPhoebe: (deadpan) And?ScenesRoss: Wow! I thought you would be a little more shocked.ScenesPhoebe: Oh sorry. (Shocked) And?!ScenesRoss: Well, we-we said we’d just do it that one time but, but now I think she may wanna start things up again.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I don’t think that’s what it is.ScenesRoss: Why? What-what else could it be?ScenesJoey: Oh wow, I don’t feel well.ScenesRoss: I’m telling you. I’m telling you. That’s what it is. No wonder she was looking at me all funny during the wedding. She didn’t say anything to you?ScenesPhoebe: (To Joey) Maybe it’s something you ate?ScenesJoey: Please, just-just, just go and talk to Rachel.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I guess I should. (Starts to leave.) Man, y’know what I have to realize? Maybe I’m just not the type of guy women can have just one night with. Y’know, they-they always seem to want a little bit more. I should remember that. (He pauses and then exits.)

rows.Scenes: The Airport Ticket Counter, Monica and Chandler are standing in line behind another couple kissing who are next in line to be served.]
rows.Content: Ticket Agent: Next?Scenes(The kissing couple doesn’t move.)ScenesMonica: They’re kissing let’s just go around them.ScenesChandler: Oh honey, leave them alone, they’re in love.ScenesMonica: I’m in love too! But in an orderly fashion.ScenesTicket Agent: Next?ScenesMonica: (to the couple) Hi! Can you do that and walk? ‘Cause she said, "Next.Scenes(The couple moves up to the counter.)ScenesWoman: Sorry. We didn’t hear you; we’re on our honeymoon.ScenesTicket Agent: Oh, let me see what I can do. (Checks the computer) There are some first class seats available.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Did you hear that?! They bumped them up to first class because they are on their honeymoon! Come on! Let’s act like we’re on our honeymoon.ScenesChandler: We are on our honeymoon.ScenesMonica: Grab my ass!ScenesTicket Agent: Next?Scenes(They go up to the counter.)ScenesMonica: Hi, sorry. I almost didn’t hear you, because y’know I’m just so in love with my new husband. We’re on our honeymoon.ScenesTicket Agent: Congratulations. Okay, Mr. Bing you’ll be in 25J and Mrs. Bing you’ll be in 25K.ScenesMonica: Oh no, you see we’re on our honeymoon. So umm, can you do your little thing and bump us up to first class?ScenesTicket Agent: I’m sorry, all our first class seats are taken. That couple got the last two.ScenesMonica: You see, if we’d gone around them like I said, we—She would’ve given us those tickets. Damnit!ScenesChandler: 25J and K, any chance those aren’t together?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Phoebe and Joey are playing Rock ‘em, Sock ‘em Robots.]
rows.Content: Joey: I still can’t believe they took away my key. You trust me with yours.ScenesPhoebe: Of course I do! And I’m gonna give it back to you as soon as they’re done with it at the key shining place.Scenes(They hear a knocking sound coming from the hallway and go to investigate.)ScenesJoey: What the hell is that?Scenes(They go into the hallway and see Mr. Treeger watching one of New York’s bravest breakdown Monica and Chandler’s door with an ax.]ScenesJoey: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Treeger, what are you doing?ScenesMr. Treeger: You said there was a gas leak in here.ScenesPhoebe: Well why don’t you use your key?ScenesMr. Treeger: Because by the time I find it on this thing (Holds up a huge key ring with a thousand keys on it), the whole place might have exploded. If that happens at another building that I manage, people are gonna start asking questions. (To the fireman) Come on! Hurry up.Scenes(With a final swing the door gives way.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! We could have done that.

rows.Scenes: The Airport, Chandler and Monica are following the previous couple through a tiny hallway that proves this is a set on a sound stage and not an actual airport, and see them enter the first class lounge.]
rows.Content: Monica: Look at that! Look at that! They’re going into the first class lounge! Do you know what they have in there?ScenesChandler: No.ScenesMonica: Me neither! We have to get in! (She runs through the door with Chandler in tow.)ScenesChandler: Just act like you belong.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Oranges!ScenesChandler: Shh! (To the guy behind the counter) Nice to see you again. (They tries to walk past him.)ScenesAirline Employee: Uh sir, may I see your tickets please?ScenesChandler: Yes, of course. (Shows him the tickets.)ScenesAirline Employee: I’m sorry, would you move your thumb? I can’t see the seat number.ScenesChandler: Oh that’s all right, I have it memorized. It’s 1A.ScenesAirline Employee: (grabbing the ticket from him) Sir, this is not a first class ticket. I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: Apology accepted. Excuse us. (They try to enter again.)ScenesAirline Employee: Sir! I’m afraid I’m gonna have to ask you to leave.ScenesMonica: Fine. (Starts to walk away then she runs over and grabs an orange before she exits.) Go! Go! Go!

rows.Scenes: The Hallway Outside Ross’s Apartment, Ross is walking towards his apartment and sees Rachel sitting in front of the door.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (seeing him) Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi. (He helps her up.) Umm, I think there’s something that we really need to talk about.ScenesRoss: (quietly confident) I think we do. Why don’t we go inside? (They go inside.) Look uh, I know why you’re here.ScenesRachel: You do?ScenesRoss: Yeah, and to save you from any embarrassment umm, I think maybe I should talk first.ScenesRachel: (warily) Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay. (He sits her down in a chair.) Uh, Ross and Rachel. Rachel and Ross. That’s been one heck of a see-saw hasn’t it?ScenesRachel: (confused) What?ScenesRoss: I mean look, that-that one night we had was fun and…and certainly passionate, but don’t you think it’s better if we just stayed friends?ScenesRachel: Seriously. What?!ScenesRoss: Okay. Okay. Y’know what? If you want to, we can do it one more time. I mean I’d-I’d be okay with that. In fact, I have some time right now.ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know what? Can I, can I talk now?ScenesRoss: Oh sure. (He sits on the apothecary table and touches her hand.)ScenesRachel: (touches his knee) I’m pregnant. (Ross stops.) Ross? (Ross is staring off into space.) Ross? (Ross is still frozen) Okay, whenever you’re ready. (Sits back and opens her magazine.) And you’re the father by the way—but you got that…ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (closes her magazine) Can I get you some water?ScenesRoss: I’m good. I’m good.ScenesRachel: Ross, there is no pressure on you. Okay? I mean you can as involved as you want. (Ross nods.)ScenesRoss: Yeah, I need uh… I’m just—I don’t know—I don’t understand, umm, how this happened? We-we used a condom.ScenesRachel: I know. I know, but y’know condoms only work like 97% of the time.ScenesRoss: What? What? What?!! Well they should put that on the box!!!ScenesRachel: They do!ScenesRoss: No they don’t!!! (He runs to the bedroom to check and returns with his box of condoms.) Well they should put it in huge black letters!!!!ScenesRachel: Okay Ross come on let’s just forget about the condoms.ScenesRoss: Oh well I may as well have!ScenesRachel: Listen, y’know what? I was really freaked out too when I found out…ScenesRoss: Freaked out? Hey no, I’m not freaked out! I’m indignant! As a consumer!ScenesRachel: Y’know what? Let’s, let’s talk later.ScenesRoss: No! No! I want to talk now! Okay? I—In fact, (picks up the phone) I am going to talk to the president of the condom company!ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know maybe I should come back… (Starts to leave.)ScenesRoss: (grabs her) Shh! Shh! Shh!ScenesRachel: (stops) Okay.ScenesRoss: (on phone) Yeah I’ll press 1! (Presses one which allows Rachel to escape.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Mr. Treeger has finished inspecting Monica and Chandler’s apartment.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger: I’ve looked everywhere. There’s no gas leak.ScenesJoey: (eating) Huh. So then I can heat this up? (Goes and does so.)ScenesMr. Treeger: Anyway uh, I’ll get moving on that new door.ScenesPhoebe: Oh great! And listen, could you do us a favor and not tell Chandler and Monica about this? ‘Cause y’know umm, they don’t-they don’t have any kids of their own and-and this door was like a child to them.ScenesMr. Treeger: Well I’m gonna have to put on a new lock, they’ll find out anyway.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no.ScenesMr. Treeger: (measures the top of the doorframe) Whoa! This looks like an all day job, I’ll have to cancel my yoga class. (Ross walks up.) Hey Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesMr. Treeger: Could you tell Jasmine that I won't make it to yoga class today?ScenesRoss: Sure.ScenesMr. Treeger: Namaste. (Bows.)ScenesRoss: Namaste. (Bows.)Scenes(Treeger leaves and Ross notices the door.)ScenesRoss: Oh my God! What happened to the door?!ScenesJoey: So it’s noticeable huh?ScenesRoss: Look, is Rachel here? I really need to talk to her.ScenesPhoebe: Didn’t you two already talk?ScenesRoss: Yeah but uh… Okay, okay look you guys know that Rachel and I slept together, but there’s something else. (Pause) Rachel’s pregnant.ScenesJoey: (simultaneously) Oh my God!!! I can’t believe that!!ScenesPhoebe: (simultaneously) Holy mother of God!!!ScenesRoss: With my child.ScenesPhoebe: That is brand new information!!ScenesRoss: You already know don’t you?ScenesPhoebe: A little bit.ScenesJoey: How are you doing?ScenesRoss: Okay. Okay. I mean I’ll be okay. It’s just I don’t think I handled it very well.ScenesJoey: Well, what did you say to her?ScenesRoss: Nothing. But the complaint department at the condom company got an earful. And then when I turned around she was gone.ScenesPhoebe: Oh Ross.ScenesRoss: But hey, in my defense I-I just found out condoms are like only 97% effective.ScenesJoey: (shocked) What?ScenesRoss: I gotta go find her.ScenesJoey: Whoa! Hey! Whoa!! Hold up! Are you serious?! So like 3% of the time they don’t even work?! Huh? They should put that on the box!ScenesRoss: Evidently they do.ScenesJoey: What?! (Grabs his condoms from his pocket and looks.)

rows.Scenes: The Atlantis Resort, Chandler and Monica are arriving to check in, but are behind the couple from before again.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can’t believe we’re here.ScenesChandler: Oh you’ve got to be kidding me.ScenesMonica: What? (Monica sees the first couple and gasps.)ScenesFront Desk Clerk: As a wedding gift to you, the hotel would like to give you the honeymoon suite.ScenesMonica: No!! You have been screwing us all day!ScenesMan: Who are you?ScenesChandler: We’re you just ten seconds later!ScenesMonica: Yeah! You already got the first class tickets; you got the lounge! I mean we should get free stuff too! I mean you’re not the only ones on your honeymoon!ScenesWoman: Well you can have the suite if you want. We don’t care about where we stay. We’re here to celebrate our love together. We don’t have to get free stuff. We just want to be together.ScenesChandler: (looks at Monica then at them) We need the stuff.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Joey is on the phone and Phoebe is watching him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Monica it’s Joey. Listen uh, Phoebe and I smell gas comin’ from your apartment.ScenesMonica: What? Are you serious?! (To Chandler) Joey smells gas!ScenesChandler: What else is new?ScenesJoey: Yeah and we’d go check it out, but you took away our keys.ScenesMonica: Well do something! Get in there!ScenesJoey: How? I guess I could break down your door.ScenesMonica: Yeah! Do that!ScenesJoey: And-and you won’t blame us for any damage? (Gives Phoebe a thumbs up.)ScenesMonica: No! (Pause) Are you doing it?! I don’t hear anything! Come on!ScenesJoey: Uh, okay I’ll-I’ll-I’ll break it down. (He hands the phone to Phoebe, gets up, picks up a chair, and starts banging it on the floor.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh hey hi, he’s doing it. He’s breaking down the door. (The chair breaks in half.) Okay, we’re in. (She hangs up the phone.)

rows.Scenes: A doctor’s office, Rachel is on an examining table with her legs in the stirrups.]
rows.Content: Nurse: Okay Rachel, are you comfortable?ScenesRachel: (sighs) If I said I was, would you judge me?ScenesNurse: The doctor will be here in a minute to do your sonogram.ScenesRachel: Okay. (The nurse exits.) Oh man, I swear if they sold these at Pottery Barn…Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Ross enters.)ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: (shocked) Hi!ScenesRoss: Uh we-we need to talk.ScenesRachel: Uh-uh-uh, right now? Because I’ve kinda got an el fresco situation going on over here.ScenesRoss: Please, please I want to apologize for the way I acted earlier today.ScenesRachel: Okay Ross that’s fine, but can you please stand near my head?ScenesRoss: What? Oh yeah. (He moves next to her head.) I’m sorry. I mean I-I think I went a little crazy. I mean I was thinking about myself when I (Wanders towards Rachel’s feet) really—I should have been thinking about you Rach…ScenesRachel: Okay. Head Ross! Head Ross! Head Ross!ScenesRoss: Right! Right! I just—I want you to know that I’m going to be there through this whole thing, okay? Okay? The doctor’s appointments, the uh, the Lamaze classes, uh baby-proofing the apartment—Although we could probably worry about that ‘til after we get married.ScenesRachel: What married?ScenesRoss: Well yeah, I think we should get married.ScenesRachel: What, because that’s your answer to everything?ScenesRoss: No, because that’s the right thing to do.ScenesRachel: Yeah, maybe if you’re in love. But Ross, we are not in love, are we?ScenesRoss: No but…but still you can’t possibly do this alone.ScenesRachel: Excuse me?ScenesRoss: Come on Rach, you can’t even eat alone in a restaurant.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: I’m just saying if you can’t eat by yourself, how do you expect to have a baby by yourself?ScenesRachel: I can too eat by myself!ScenesRoss: When have you ever?ScenesRachel: When certain people leave the table and I am not finished!ScenesRoss: Well certain other people take two hours to eat a bowl of soup!ScenesRachel: Oh please, you inhale your food!ScenesRoss: I grew up with Monica! If you didn’t eat fast you didn’t eat!!ScenesDr. Long: (entering) Am I interrupting?ScenesRachel: Oh no Dr. Long, please come in. This is Ross, he is the father.ScenesRoss: But not the husband, because evidently she can do this alone.ScenesDr. Long: Huh. Nice to meet you. I’ll get started on this.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel, standing by her feet) I don’t know why you can’t admit that you need me.ScenesRachel: I do need you! I need you to stand near my head!ScenesDr. Long: Okay, everything looks good. Here it is on the screen. (We see Ross and Rachel looking at the screen.) Here is your uterus. And right here is your baby.ScenesRoss: Oh my God.ScenesRachel: Wow. There it is, I see it.ScenesDr. Long: Congratulations. I’ll give you two a minute.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Thank you.Scenes(Dr. Long exits and Rachel starts to cry.)ScenesRoss: Pretty amazing huh?ScenesRachel: I don’t see it!ScenesRoss: What? What?!ScenesRachel: I can’t see it!ScenesRoss: You-you just said that you did!ScenesRachel: I know, I lied! I didn’t want her to think I was a terrible mother! I can’t even see my own baby!ScenesRoss: Oh sure, come here! (Sits her up) Sure you can! Uh, look come here look, (rolls the machine closer) it’s-it’s-it’s, it’s right there (Points).ScenesRachel: Oh. Oh, it’s beautiful. I see it now.ScenesRoss: Do you really?ScenesRachel: No, I don’t see it!ScenesRoss: Come on! Come on! Here, okay-okay, you see this? (Points) This tiny thing that looks like a peanut?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Sweetie that’s it.ScenesRachel: That’s it? Well I saw that! Ohh-ohh-oh, thank you.ScenesRoss: You’re welcome.ScenesRachel: Wow! I can’t believe that’s our baby.ScenesRoss: Yeah, that’s our baby.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Phoebe are there as Rachel and Ross return from the doctor’s appointment.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So how was the doctor?ScenesRachel: Oh, everything went great.ScenesPhoebe: Good.ScenesRoss: Oh hey, show them the picture of your uterus.Scenes(She does so.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesJoey: I don’t see the baby. Where is it?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I know I couldn’t see it either at first, but it’s right umm… (Starts to cry) Ross, I lost it again.ScenesRoss: Oh. (He takes the picture and hugs her.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The VideotapeScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Chandler and Monica are returning from their honeymoon.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Wait. Before we go in, I just want you to know I love you. I had a great time on our honeymoon, and I can’t wait to go in there and spend the rest of our life together.ScenesMonica: You’re really sticking with the shell necklace huh? (Points to necklace of shells he’s wearing.)Scenes(Joey and Phoebe burst forth from his apartment.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey! You’re back! (Hugs and kisses all around.)ScenesMonica: Hi sweetie!ScenesPhoebe: Come on in!Scenes(They grab the luggage and drag it into Joey and Rachel’s forcing Monica and Chandler to follow.)ScenesPhoebe: So how was the honeymoon?ScenesMonica: Oh, so much fun. But the best part is, we met this incredible couple on the way back.ScenesPhoebe: That was the best part? (To Chandler) Good honeymooning tiger.ScenesMonica: No, they were really cool. They were on their honeymoon too!ScenesChandler: They’re terrific, and they live right here in the city.ScenesMonica: Yeah, can we go call them? Is it too soon to call? I wanna call.ScenesChandler: I’m sorry, we’re just kinda excited because we finally have a couple to hang out with.ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesJoey: A couple? Like two people? Like (points to himself) one (points to Phoebe), two people?ScenesMonica: This is different! Greg and Jenny are in a relationship.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Greg and Jenny yuck! (Angrily) Hi Greg, I’m Chandler this is Monica. Hi Monica, this is Jenny. Hi Jenny. Hi Greg.ScenesChandler: Listen, they are really great. If you just got a chance…ScenesJoey: Y’know what? Why don’t you just give us our souvenirs and get the hell out of here?ScenesChandler: We really…didn’t get a chance to…ScenesPhoebe: You have got to be kidding me!ScenesMonica: We didn’t get anything for anyone.ScenesJoey: Hm-mm! Yeah nice necklace!ScenesMonica: That you can have.ScenesOpening CreditsScenes{Transcriber’s Note: Tradition was broken here as there were no commercials immediately after the opening credits, just more show.}

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Ross and Rachel are entering with the rest of the gang already inside.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hello!ScenesRachel: Welcome home.ScenesRoss: So, how was the honeymoon?ScenesMonica: It was great! It was great! How about you?! I mean you’re having a baby!ScenesRachel: Oh! Look! I have a sonogram picture!ScenesMonica: Oh great! (Shows them the picture.)ScenesChandler: Ross! It’s got your wavy black lines!ScenesMonica: All right, so now that Ross knows can you tell us y’know how it happened? I mean, when did it happen? How many times did it happen?ScenesPhoebe: Monica! That’s not right! Start with where.Scenes(Rachel looks at Ross and gets his approval.)ScenesRachel: Well it happened about six weeks ago, and uh I had just got home from work and Ross was already there ‘cause I guess he had been hanging out with Joey.ScenesJoey: You’re welcome buddy.ScenesRoss: (glaring at him) Yeah, thanks. (Joey nods no problem.)ScenesRachel: And so I had a lot of work to do so Ross, nice guy that he is, offered to help me out. And then we had a little wine, we got to talking, and the next thing you know out of nowhere Ross comes on to me.ScenesRoss: (laughs) Umm that’s…that’s a little misleading.ScenesRachel: What is?ScenesRoss: The lie you just told.ScenesRachel: That-that you came on to me?ScenesRoss: There’s the one!ScenesRachel: But you did! I mean, let’s be honest.ScenesRoss: Yes let’s. Y’know what? Uh, it’s-it’s not important. What is important is that, is that we’re having a baby. And it’s not—Doesn’t matter who came on to who.ScenesJoey: Whom. (Everyone looks at him shocked.) That’s right.ScenesRachel: You know you kissed me first.ScenesRoss: What? What?! You were begging me to kiss you! You-you-you were sending me signals all over the place!ScenesRachel: I was sending you signals?ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesRachel: Oh please. Okay, anyone in this room think that I would send Ross begging symbols, please show of hands. (Ross raises his hand and no one else.)ScenesRoss: Y’know what?! It doesn’t matter! It doesn’t matter what you believe! What matters is what happened!ScenesRachel: Okay. So these signals Ross, explain this to me, ‘cause maybe I need to be more careful. I mean, am I sending you these signals right now?ScenesRoss: Y’know what? Y’know what? Rachel, just-just drop it.ScenesRachel: No please, show me how I begged you!ScenesRoss: I can show you, I have it on videotape! (Stunned silence) It’s an expression.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, time has lapsed, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler, and Monica are sitting at the kitchen table.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I can’t believe he taped the two of them having sex!ScenesJoey: Yeah! You gotta tell a girl before you tape her. Such a rookie mistake.ScenesChandler: Y’know who has a great video camera?ScenesPhoebe: (nasally) Greg and Jenny?ScenesMonica: Do you still wanna call ‘em? I wanna call ‘em.ScenesChandler: Let’s call ‘em.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Ask them if they brought their friends any souvenirs!Scenes(Monica goes over and dials their number.)ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) Eighth street deli?ScenesJoey: Hey, hang up! You get food poisoning just talkin’ to that place.ScenesMonica: (on phone) Uh sorry, wrong number. (Hangs up)ScenesChandler: Here you go. (Shows her the number again.)ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) (To All) It’s the deli again!ScenesJoey: All right! I’ll have a sandwich!ScenesMonica: (hangs up) I don’t think this number’s right!Scenes(Joey and Phoebe laugh.)ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: You got fake numbered.ScenesMonica: What?! People don’t do that!ScenesJoey: Oh I think we do.ScenesMonica: They gave us a fake number? Why? Why would they do that?ScenesChandler: I don’t know! You were a delight to talk to. You asked all those insightful, great questions.ScenesMonica: And you’ve never been funnier. Joke, joke, joke, you were a hoot!ScenesJoey: Y’know what? Don’t worry about it, you still got me and Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Excuse me, I don’t want Greg and Jenny’s rejects.ScenesRoss: (entering) Rachel won’t talk to me! She won’t even open the door!ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, I wonder why. Pervert!ScenesRoss: Okay, listen I am not a pervert!ScenesPhoebe: That’s like the pervert motto! Yeah! Yeah! They have you raise your right hand, put your left hand down your pants, and repeat that!ScenesRoss: Filming Rachel is not something I planned. Okay look, here’s what happened, and Joey you-you can back me up on this. All right, about-about a month and a half ago I came to you with a problem? Umm, a personal thing.ScenesJoey: Personal thing? What personal thing? I don’t know.ScenesRoss: About…about sex? (Joey looks at him confused) That I hadn’t had sex in months?ScenesJoey: (laughs) Yeah I knew what you were talkin’ about.ScenesSix Weeks Earlier

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is reading a cereal box as Ross enters wearing the red sweater.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesRoss: Do you have a minute? I’d like to talk to you about something I’m, I’m really uncomfortable talking about.ScenesJoey: Sure. What? About uh, you showering with your mom?ScenesRoss: I actually had a topic in mind! I’m, I’m kinda going through a dry spell, sex wise.ScenesJoey: Whoa, for like months?ScenesRoss: Five to be lying, six.ScenesJoey: Six months? Whoa that’s rough.ScenesRoss: Well, I mean it’s not all bad. I’m learning to appreciate the uh, smaller things in life. Like the sound of a bird and the color of the sky.ScenesJoey: The sky’s blue Ross and I had sex yesterday!ScenesRoss: Please, help me! I have a date tonight. It has to go well okay—I’m scared for my health!ScenesJoey: Okay. Okay. Umm…Ooh! Oh-oh, I got something. It’s this story I came up with, very romantic. I swear any woman that hears it; they’re like putty.ScenesRoss: Really? Well then tell it to me.ScenesJoey: Okay. Now you’re gonna want to have sex with me when you hear it, but you have to remember it is just the story.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) I’ll try to control myself.ScenesJoey: Okay. (Clears throat) Years ago, when I was backpacking across Western Europe…ScenesRoss: (laughs) You were backpacking across Western Europe?ScenesJoey: Have a nice six more months Ross! (Starts to leave.)ScenesRoss: (stopping him) Okay! Okay! Okay. I’m sorry. Please, please, you were in Western Europe and?ScenesJoey: I was just outside Barcelona hiking in the foothills of Mount Tibidabo. I was at the end of this path and I came to a clearing and there was a lake, very secluded. And there were tall trees all around. (Whispering) It was dead silent. Gorgeous. (Softly) And across the lake I saw…a beautiful woman…bathing herself…but she was crying…ScenesRoss: (intently listening) Why?

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, Ross is on his date with Kristen and they’re drinking wine.]
rows.Content: Kristen: Umm, this is great wine.ScenesRoss: It’s from France…In Europe…Western Europe. Y’know umm, a few years ago I actually was backpacking across Western Europe.ScenesKristen: Really?ScenesRoss: Uh-hmm—Wait! It gets better. Um, yeah I was in Barcelona.ScenesKristen: I studied for a year in Barcelona. (Ross is stunned and worried.)ScenesRoss: Anyway, umm so I was um, I was hiking…ScenesKristen: I love hiking!ScenesRoss: (whines) Oh that’s great! I was hiking along the foothills of Mount Tibidaybo…ScenesKristen: I think its Tibidabo.ScenesRoss: Okay! Do you wanna tell the story?!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is standing at the counter as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Whoa! What are you doing here? How did your date go?ScenesRoss: Great! I’m across the street having sex with her right now. Your story sucks!ScenesJoey: Hey! Look, if it didn’t work it’s because you didn’t tell it right! Show me how you did it.ScenesRoss: No! No, I don’t…don’t want to.ScenesJoey: How long since you’ve seen a girl naked?ScenesRoss: I was backpacking across Western Europe.ScenesJoey: I’m not feeling it.ScenesRoss: I was just outside Barcelona, hiking…ScenesJoey: No! No! No Ross! I’m not hot! Are you hot?ScenesRoss: It’s been six months! I’m always hot!ScenesJoey: Well you’re not selling the story! It’s like; it’s like you don’t believe it! Look, I gotta go. I got a date, but try this. Do what I do when I’m preparing for an audition. Okay? I’ll set you up with my video camera and you can record yourself and-and see what you’re doing wrong.ScenesRoss: I’ll try that.ScenesJoey: All right now… All right, you’re all set up. You’re good to go. Just hit record. All right?ScenesRoss: Thanks.ScenesJoey: Good luck.ScenesRoss: Thanks. And-and hey Joe?ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Listen, if you ever have any problem with the ladies you know I’ll help you out.ScenesJoey: (trying not to laugh) That means a lot to me man. (Exits.)Scenes(Ross pours himself a glass of wine, hits record, and sits down in front of the camera.)ScenesRoss: Hello! Can I get you anything? Huh? Lens cleaner? Your battery okay? (Rachel bursts in carrying two boxes and Ross jumps up.) Rachel!ScenesRachel: Oh Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: Thank God you’re here! You have to help me! Were you just talking to yourself?ScenesRoss: That’s less embarrassing, yes. Yes I was.Scenes(They sit down on the couch, which is in front of the still recording camera.)ScenesRoss: (voiceover) So when she came in, I got distracted and totally forgot about the camera. [Cut back to the present day.] It kept rolling and recorded everything.Scenes(Pause)ScenesChandler: Yeah, we’re gonna need to see that tape. (They rest of them agree.)ScenesMonica: Yeah, definitely.ScenesRoss: What a great idea! That will get Rachel to forgive me!ScenesJoey: Y’know what? This is not fair to her. Let’s just forget the tape!ScenesRoss: Thank you. (Joey mouths to Ross, "You’ll show me right?") No!ScenesJoey: You’re right. (Mouths, "I know you’ll show me, right?)ScenesRoss: Joey! No!ScenesJoey: Loud and clear! (Mouths, "You’ll show me," and nods.)Scenes(Ross storms out.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are now sitting in the living room.]
rows.Content: Monica: I still don't get why Greg and Jenny would give us a fake number.ScenesJoey: Y’know, if they knew what they were doing they probably didn’t give you real names either.ScenesMonica: Okay, maybe people give out fake numbers, but they don’t give out fake names.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? (To Phoebe) Hi, Ken Adams, nice to meet you.ScenesPhoebe: Regina Philange. (Ken and Regina shake hands.)ScenesChandler: I still don’t get it, we didn’t do anything wrong.ScenesMonica: I know! Although, you did tell an awful lot of jokes.ScenesChandler: I thought you said those jokes were funny. Joke! Joke! Joke!ScenesMonica: (rolling her head from side to side) Joke. Joke. Blah! Blah! (Joey and Phoebe laugh.)ScenesChandler: Well maybe it was all of your questions.ScenesMonica: What about my questions?ScenesChandler: The sheer volume, it was like flying with the Riddler!ScenesMonica: Oh, I’m sorry. Was that another joke?ScenesChandler: (angrily) Was that another question?ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! Is Ross still here?ScenesJoey: Uh no Rach, he’s gone. But listen, he told us what happened and it does, it sounds like an honest mistake.ScenesRachel: Oh really? Well how would you like it if I had sex with you and I taped it? (Joey smiles luridly) Oh forget it! (Ross enters.) Oh there he is now, the father of my child, the porn king of the west village.ScenesRoss: Look, it was accident! Okay? I-I feel bad that it happened, but I swear, I didn’t even watch it! Anyway, here. (He takes the tape out of his coat pocket.) I thought you might be more comfortable destroying it yourself. (Tosses her the tape.)ScenesRachel: Thank you. (She sets it on the floor and is about to stomp on it with her shoe when the rest of the gang jumps up and yells simultaneously.) What? (They all yell again.) You don’t want to see this do you?ScenesMonica: Hell yeah!!!ScenesRachel: I am not gonna show you this!ScenesPhoebe: No! Not the sex part, just the stuff leading up to it.ScenesRoss: Forget it, she’s destroying it.ScenesPhoebe: Okay fine! Fine! We’ll just have to think of some other way to put the whole ‘Who came onto who,’ thing to rest! Come on now, think!!ScenesRoss: Look, forget it Phoebe. Okay? It’s Rachel’s tape and she can do whatever she wants with it. And she wants to destroy it. So, end of story.ScenesRachel: I wanna see it.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Clearly you don’t want people to see this tape. Now I don’t want people to see this tape either, but you so badly don’t people to see it makes me want to see it. You see?ScenesJoey: (confused) Are we watchin’ the tape or not?!ScenesRoss: I don’t want people to see it for your sake.ScenesRachel: Ahh, I don’t believe you. I think you don’t want them to see you begging me. (Goes to put the tape in the VCR)ScenesRoss: Rachel, please…ScenesRachel: Ah, a little preview!ScenesRoss: Fine. Fine, but I want the record to show that I tried to take the high road, because in about five minutes I’m gonna be saying…(He laughs and points at Rachel sarcastically.)Scenes(They both sit down.)ScenesRachel: Okay, here we go. (Pushes play.)ScenesRoss: (on tape) Hello! Can I get you anything?ScenesJoey: (To Phoebe) I’m so happy!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, the scene is continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (on tape) Oh, thank God you’re here! You have to help me! Were you just talking to yourself?ScenesRachel: There I am.ScenesPhoebe: You’re gonna get pregnant.ScenesRachel: (on tape) I screwed up so bad, I told Monica that I would stuff and send all these wedding invitations like weeks ago and I-I…ScenesRoss: (on tape) You didn’t do it?ScenesRachel: (on tape) I-I know—I had put them in…in-in my desk at work and I completely forgot about them until today.Scenes(Chandler is shocked and Rachel gets scared of Monica very quickly.)ScenesMonica: (taking Rachel’s hand) Sweetie okay. It’s okay. Everybody made it to the wedding. I’m fine.ScenesRachel: Kinda hurtin’ my hand though.ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesRachel: (on tape) (Ross hands her a glass of wine) I cannot believe that I did this. Especially after Monica just went on and on and on about it! (Mimicking Monica) "Okay Rachel! Here are the invitations Rachel! Now be very careful Rachel! Please, drinking no liquids around the invitations Rachel!" (She tilts her wine glass above and moves it back and forth across the invitations) Whoa oh! Oh-oh-oh! Oh…oh-oh-oh…Scenes(Rachel hits fast forward. Monica is completely shocked.)ScenesChandler: Did you do it on our invitations?!ScenesRoss: (pause) Not on the ones we sent out.ScenesChandler: So, just the ones gave back to us and we had framed! (Slams the framed invitation down onto the table.)Scenes(Rachel stops fast forwarding.)ScenesRachel: (on tape) Can you believe this is already happening? I mean it seems like yesterday they just got engaged.ScenesRoss: (on tape) I know. Hey remember…remember the night they got engaged? How uh, you and I almost…ScenesRachel: (on tape) Oh, I remember how we almost. Do you think we would’ve gone through with it? Y’know, if we hadn’t gotten caught. Do you think we would’ve done it?ScenesRoss: (on tape) I mean I…I know I wanted to. I just, I just wasn’t sure if you wanted to.ScenesRachel: (on tape) Oh I wanted to.Scenes(Ross and Rachel trade looks while watching the tape.)ScenesRoss: (on tape) So we…we both wanted to.ScenesRachel: (on tape) Interesting.ScenesRoss: (on tape) Yeah. (Pause) Anyway umm, it probably worked out for the best.ScenesRachel: (on tape) Oh yeah, sure.ScenesRachel: Okay, in about ten seconds you’re gonna see him kiss me.ScenesRoss: And in about five seconds you’re gonna see why.ScenesRachel: (on tape) Ross did I ever tell you about the time that I went backpacking through Western Europe?Scenes(Joey’s shocked and everyone else looks at Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Okay, get ready to see some beggin’!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you came on to Ross!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: Now I’m so happy.ScenesRachel: What are you talking about?!ScenesMonica: You used the Europe story!ScenesChandler: That’s the magic story you use when you wanna have sex!ScenesRachel: How do you know about that story?!ScenesJoey: How do you know about that story?!ScenesRachel: I heard it from my friend Irene who heard it from some guy!ScenesJoey: (raises his hand) Some guy!! (Points to himself.)ScenesRachel: No. No, she told me his name was Ken Adams.ScenesJoey: (raises his hand and points to himself again) Ken Adams!!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is looking at the tape sitting on the counter as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesRachel: So uh, apparently people are familiar with the Europe story?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Listen about that, the whole uh, who came on to who thing really doesn’t matter. I mean, I think it would’ve happened either way. I mean if you hadn’t initiated it I-I-I know I would’ve.ScenesRachel: It was an amazing night.ScenesRoss: It was. It was an amazing night.Scenes(Pause)ScenesRachel: You think it looked amazing?ScenesRoss: I uh… I don’t know. I mean I…I honestly didn’t watch it.ScenesRachel: Yeah, me neither. Yet…ScenesRoss: Uhhhhhh…that-that may be weird.ScenesRachel: Yeah, it would be really weird.Scenes(Ross grabs the tape and heads for the VCR as Rachel goes over and puts the chain on the door and locks it.)ScenesRoss: Good luck.ScenesRachel: Good luck to you.Scenes(Ross pushes play.)ScenesRoss: Mind if I mute?ScenesRachel: Oh please. (He does so.)ScenesRoss: Oh, oh there go the clothes.ScenesRachel: You are undressing very quickly.ScenesRoss: Six months Rachel, six months.ScenesRoss and Rachel: Ah. (Pause) Oh.ScenesRoss: Hey. We-we look…we look pretty good.ScenesRachel: That’s what I was gonna say.ScenesRoss: Oh nice tan!ScenesRachel: Thank you! I had just gone to the beach that weekend.ScenesRoss: Ah….ScenesRachel: Have you been working out?ScenesRoss: I have been working out.ScenesRachel: Really? Wow, this is so much better than I…ScenesRoss and Rachel: Ohh! Ew!ScenesRoss: Oh that’s not pretty.ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh!ScenesRoss: No!ScenesRachel: Oh God!ScenesRoss: Oh no!ScenesRachel: Oh, make it stop!ScenesRoss: Oh no!!ScenesRachel: Make it stop!!ScenesRoss: No!!ScenesRachel: Have to make it stop!!ScenesRoss: No!!!Scenes(They both get out of the chair and run for the VCR.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler have gone through the phone book and found Greg and Jenny’s number which Monica has just dialed.]
rows.Content: Monica: (on phone) Hello Greg? (Listens) Hi, this is Monica from the plane? Listen, the number that you gave me 853-5… (Listens) (To Chandler) That is their old number! Jenny’s been giving it out since they moved!ScenesChandler: Jenny! That is so Jenny!ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hey listen umm, how would you like to get together? Say next Saturday? (Listens) Okay, how about Sunday? (Listens) Okay umm, the week after that? (Listens) The week after that? (Listens) Y’know what Greg? Y’know what? We are good, interesting, funny people with good questions and if you and your precious Jenny can’t see that then… (Listens) January 15th? (Chandler dances.) We’ll see you then! (Listens) Okay!Scenes(She hangs up the phone and they hug.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s DateScenesWritten by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, she is frantically working and is handing two finished dishes to a waitress.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, now this one is rare, this one is medium well! Now go-go-go! (Phoebe enters) Hey Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey how was dinner?!ScenesPhoebe: Dinner was good!ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesPhoebe: I’m just saying hi! Now I’m gonna go!ScenesMonica: Okay!Scenes(Phoebe turns to leave but notices an attractive man.)ScenesPhoebe: (To him) Oh, well hello there.ScenesGuy: Hi.ScenesPhoebe: (To Monica) I didn’t see this on the menu.ScenesMonica: Uh Tim? This is Phoebe. Phoebe this is Tim, my new sous chef.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, so you're Monica’s boss?ScenesTim: Actually she’s my-my boss. Sous is French for under.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I sous stand.ScenesMonica: Hey Tim? I need a calamari and a Caesar salad. And umm, could you get me the pesto?ScenesTim: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh you…you made pesto?ScenesTim: Yes I did.ScenesPhoebe: Would you say your pesto is the best-o?ScenesTim: I…I-I don’t know, but I would say it’s pretty good-o. (Phoebe laughs too hard.)Scenes(Monica goes over and grabs the pesto.)ScenesMonica: All right, I still need a calamari and a Caesar salad.ScenesTim: I like your necklace.ScenesPhoebe: I made it myself.ScenesTim: You are so talented.ScenesPhoebe: Well, it’s no pesto.ScenesMonica: All right, all right! Let’s just cut to the chase, okay? (To Phoebe) You’re single. (To Tim) You’re single. (To Phoebe) He gets off work at eleven. (To Tim) She’ll be waiting for your call. (To Phoebe) I’ll give him your number if I can get one calamari and one Caesar salad!! (Everyone in the kitchen stops.) I did not yell. I am not putting a dollar in the jar.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office, he’s working at his computer as his boss, Mr. Franklin, sticks his head in.]
rows.Content: Mr. Franklin: Wow Bing! Burning the midnight oil.ScenesChandler: You know me sir. Oh ah, I do have a question for ya. Do you know how I get around the office computer network so I can access the really good Internet porn?ScenesMr. Franklin: You’re a joker Bing. (Walks away.)ScenesChandler: What’s funny about that?ScenesRoss: (running up) Hey! Sorry I kept you waiting so long.ScenesChandler: Hey that’s okay. So, where do you want to go?ScenesRoss: Oh ah, I think you know where I want to go.ScenesChandler: The Hard Rock Caf�?ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Again?!ScenesRoss: Yeah!!Scenes(They go out to the elevators.)ScenesRoss: I’m telling you, I like the food!ScenesChandler: You like the Purple Rain display! (A guy walks up.) Hey Bob.ScenesBob: Hey Toby! Have a good night. (Walks by.)ScenesRoss: Did that guy just call you Toby?ScenesChandler: Yeah, he thinks that’s my name.ScenesRoss: Well, why don’t you correct him?ScenesChandler: Oh it’s been going on way to long now. Y’know, I mean the first time he said it we were just passing each other in the hallway, so I didn’t say anything. And then the next time he said, "Hey Toby, do you want a donut?" And I-I wanted a donut. And now it’s five years later, the donut’s gone and I’m still Toby.ScenesRoss: Five years?! Chandler you have to tell him!ScenesChandler: No! That would be so awkward! Look—Besides, we work in different departments. He’s on the sixth floor y’know? So he calls me Toby once in a while. What’s the big deal? It could be worse, it’s not like he’s calling me Muriel. (Chandler suddenly freezes into place.)ScenesRoss: (laughs) Muriel. Wh-why would he call you Muriel? (Ross realizes something.) Oh my God! Chandler M Bing? It’s not just an M, your middle name is Muriel!!ScenesChandler: Shh! It is a family name!ScenesRoss: Chandler Muriel Bing. Boy, your parents never gave you a chance did they?

rows.Scenes: Days Of Our Lives set, Joey is doing a scene with a co-star as Rachel watches on a monitor.]
rows.Content: Joey's Co-Star: Drake, I’ve discovered the reason for all your headaches and memory loss.ScenesDr. Drake Ramoray: What is it?ScenesJoey's Co-Star: Apparently your brain transplant was not entirely successful. It seems your body is rejecting Jessica’s brain.ScenesDr. Drake Ramoray: Is it serious?ScenesJoey's Co-Star: Not if we extract tissue from the original host body, synthesize antibodies, and introduce them into your system, which could stop it from rejecting the brain.ScenesDr. Drake Ramoray: Well that sounds simple enough, let’s just do that.ScenesJoey's Co-Star: We would, but when we went to exhume Jessica’s body, it was gone.Scenes(Dramatic music plays and Joey does a little ‘Smell-the-fart’ acting.)ScenesDirector: Cut! Very nice people!ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Okay, let me just get changed and we can go to dinner.ScenesRachel: Well don’t—What happened to Jessica’s body?!ScenesJoey: I’m not telling, you’ll have to see it on TV!ScenesRachel: You don’t know do you?ScenesJoey: No, couldn’t care less.ScenesJoey's Co-Star: Hey good scene man.ScenesJoey: Hey you too!ScenesJoey's Co-Star: Alright.Scenes(Rachel clears her throat.)ScenesJoey: What? You weren’t in it.ScenesRachel: Oh! (Motions to Joey’s co-star.)ScenesJoey: Oh sorry. Uh-uh, Kash?ScenesKash: Yes?ScenesJoey: This is my friend Rachel. Rachel, Kash, Kash, Rachel.ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesKash: Hey! How come I haven’t seen you here before?ScenesRachel: Well, Joey probably thinks I’ll just embarrass him. Y’know, he thinks I’m some kind of a soap opera nut—Which I’m not! I’m not. Although I do know that your uh, your favorite ice cream flavor is butter pecan. (Starts stroking his arm) And uh, and that your-your dog’s name is Wally. Well look at that, I’m just stroking your arm.ScenesJoey: (grabbing her) Here we go! Here we go! (Starts to pull her away from Kash.)ScenesRachel: Oh, we’re leaving. Bye Kash.ScenesKash: Bye.ScenesRachel: Say hi to Wally.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is getting coffee as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ooh Monica!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! I had the best time with Tim last night. He is so sweet! Oh, I can’t wait to get sous-neath him.ScenesMonica: I…I have to fire him.ScenesPhoebe: But why?!ScenesMonica: Because he’s terrible! Okay, he’s slow, he burns things, last night he lit my pastry chef on fire!ScenesPhoebe: Well maybe he was just nervous, y’know you can be very intimidating. And besides I’ve met your pastry chef and she can stand to be taken down a peg or two.ScenesMonica: Well, now she has no eyebrows, mission accomplished.ScenesPhoebe: But Monica, he loves his job so much! Can you just give him another chance? Please?ScenesMonica: (thinks about it) All right, but if-if he lights someone else on fire he is out of there!ScenesPhoebe: That’s fair! Thank you so much. Thanks. Oops, it looks like when he got the pastry chef he got you a little bit too.ScenesMonica: I paid to have this done.ScenesPhoebe: Love it!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is eating at the counter as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: Oh you know uh Kash, really liked you the other day. He said he thought you were charming.ScenesRachel: I thought I was a complete idiot.ScenesJoey: Hey, I’m with you. He even asked me if I thought you’d go out with him.ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, I think I’m gonna throw up a little bit. What did you say?ScenesJoey: I said no.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: What? I…I just figured since you’re pregnant you’re not gonna be seeing people.ScenesRachel: Okay Joey, first of all Kash Ford is not people. Second of all, what did he say when you told him I was pregnant?ScenesJoey: I didn’t tell him. I didn’t know if you were telling people. This is back when I thought Kash was still people.ScenesRachel: Good-good, don’t tell him. Don’t tell him. Just have him call me okay?ScenesJoey: Rach look, I really don’t think that’s such a great…ScenesRachel: Okay, you go do it! I’ll come back to that set! I’ll meet more actors! I’ll meet ‘em all!

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office Building, Chandler is walking by the elevators and sees Bob standing there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey Bob.ScenesBob: Hey! How’s my pal Toby doing today?ScenesChandler: If I see him, I’ll ask.ScenesBob: (laughs) Toby!Scenes(The elevator doors opens, Bob boards the elevator, Chandler walks away, and Mr. Franklin steps out of the elevator.)ScenesMr. Franklin: Hey-hey! Bing? Was that Bob from six you were just talking too?ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesMr. Franklin: Oh then you know each other.ScenesChandler: We’re on a semi-first name basis.ScenesMr. Franklin: What do you think of adding him to our team?ScenesChandler: Bob? Ooh, working here with us? Everyday? Yeah, I don’t know if he has what it takes.ScenesMr. Franklin: Really? They love him down on six.ScenesChandler: But this is eleven. It’s almost twice as hard up here.ScenesMr. Franklin: Okay, I hear you loud and clear. Bob will stay put.ScenesChandler: I think it’s best sir.ScenesMr. Franklin: But we really do need to find someone up here. The work is starting to pile up. I’ve got a stack of documents on my desk this high. (Holds his hand at shoulder level.)ScenesChandler: Y’know what you should do, just toss ‘em in the shedder and claim you never got ‘em.ScenesMr. Franklin: (laughs) That’s a good one. (Walks away.)ScenesChandler: What does a guy have to do to be taken seriously around here?!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is in the kitchen as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey. Okay, I gave him another chance, but Tim has got to go!ScenesPhoebe: But…ScenesMonica: No! No-no! He is totally incompetent. I called the chef who recommended him to me. He said, "Ha-ha! Gotcha!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Okay, but you can’t fire him today.ScenesMonica: Why not?!ScenesPhoebe: Because I’m dumping him today.ScenesMonica: What?! You said he was sweet!ScenesPhoebe: He is sweet. He’s too sweet. He calls me all the time. (Mimicking him) "So did-did you get home from work okay?" "Did-did you get out of the shower okay?ScenesMonica: Just don’t pick up your phone.ScenesPhoebe: Then he comes over! (Mimicking him) "I’m so worried about you." Uck! Be a man!ScenesMonica: What? So now I’m not allowed to fire him?ScenesPhoebe: You can’t fire him and dump him the same day, he’ll kill himself.ScenesMonica: Okay well then, I’ll fire him today and you go out with him for another week.ScenesPhoebe: Are you kidding?! Another week with that sip, I’ll kill myself!ScenesMonica: Okay well, then we’ll both do it today and he’ll just have to deal with it!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. But the question is who’s gonna go first. ‘Cause whoever goes second is the bitch.ScenesMonica: What do you mean?ScenesPhoebe: Come on! The boss that fires a guy that’s just been dumped, bitch! And the woman who dumps a guy that’s just been fired, blond bitch!ScenesMonica: I wanted to do this days ago so I think I should go first.ScenesPhoebe: All right, that makes sense. (Starts towards the door.) Ugh. But—Screw you I’m going first! (She grabs her purse and runs out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office Building, Bob is standing at the elevators and sees Chandler walk up.]
rows.Content: Bob: Hey Toby, you got a sec?ScenesChandler: Sure, what’s up?ScenesBob: I just had a meeting, I was actually hoping to get transferred up here, but I just found out its not gonna happen. Apparently somebody thinks I’m not eleventh floor material. Say uh, who the hell is this Chandler?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her date and Joey is reading a magazine.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey, what do you think is a better excuse for why I’m not drinking on this date tonight. "Umm, I’m a recovering alcoholic. I’m a Mormon," or "I got so hammered last night I’m still a little drunk?ScenesRoss: (entering with a pizza and beer) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: So, what do you want to do tonight? There’s a Ukrainian film at the Angelica that’s supposed to be very powerful. Interested?ScenesJoey: No. No. But I’ll go see a normal person movie with ya.ScenesRoss: Rach? You wanna come?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I can’t. I got a date.ScenesRoss: A date?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Why? Is that weird for you?ScenesRoss: Why no, it’s the opposite of weird. It’s-it’s uh, regular. It’s-it’s uh, it’s mundane. It’s actually uh, a little dull.ScenesJoey: It’s no Ukrainian film.ScenesRachel: Yeah—Ooh! Earrings! (Goes into her room.)ScenesRoss: A date?! She’s-she’s got a date?! With who?ScenesJoey: I set her up with this actor on my show.ScenesRoss: You set her up?!ScenesJoey: NoScenesRoss: Joey what-what were you thinking?!ScenesJoey: Well, I was thinking that it’d probably be okay because Ross hasn’t gone out with Rachel in five years!ScenesRoss: Joey, I’m not worried about her! I’m worried about my baby! Whoever she dates my baby dates! Now-now where is this (makes the quote-marks sign) actor taking them?ScenesJoey: Hey! I’m an (does the quote-marks thing as well) actor too! I’m not sure. I think they’re taking the ferry out to some Italian place on Staten Island.ScenesRoss: A ferry? My baby is going on a ferry? Do you have any idea how dangerous those are?!ScenesJoey: Are we talking about one of those big boats that carry cars that go like five miles an hour?ScenesRoss: Why don’t they just jump out of an airplane?! Huh?! That-that’s a fun date! Or burn each other with matches?! That’s fun too! Whew!!Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Joey answers it.)ScenesKash: Hey Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey Kash. Uh hey-hey this is Ross. Ross, this is Kash.ScenesKash: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hi. I-I hear you’re going on a ferry tonight.ScenesKash: Yeah.ScenesRoss: A bit of a daredevil are we?ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Hey guys do you think this is too slutty—Hi Kash!ScenesKash: Hey Rachel! You ready to go?ScenesRachel: Yeah! All right, I’ll see you guys later.ScenesRoss: Okay. Have a great time you guys.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesKash: Thank you.ScenesRoss: Yes it is too slutty! (Joey slams the door before Rachel could hear the entire sentence.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is reading a magazine as Tim enters.]
rows.Content: Tim: (walks behind Phoebe) Hi! (And startles her.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi.ScenesTim: Oh, I’m so glad you called. I feel like it’s always me calling you. So, what’s up? Is everything okay with Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: It will be…in a minute. Listen, Tim you’re a really great guy.ScenesTim: It’s because I’m with you.ScenesPhoebe: Aw. (Phoebe gets a bad taste in her mouth when he looks away) I’m just—I’m in a place in my life right now where I…I…Scenes(Tim’s beeper goes off and he answers it.)ScenesTim: Whoops. Sorry. (Looking at it, like a newscaster) This just in. (Phoebe fake laughs.) Oh, it’s 9-1-1 from the restaurant, that means Monica needs me right away. (Starts to leave.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh-oh no she doesn’t! I know what that is. You can stay.ScenesTim: Awww, I’ll miss you too Pheebs. (Starts to leave) And I will be holding you, right here. (Holds his hands over his heart, blows a kiss to Phoebe who catches it, and then leaves and Phoebe throws the kiss back.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are having dinner.]
rows.Content: Joey: So what movie do you want to see—And not another one I have to read. Okay? I get enough of that from books.ScenesRoss: Books?ScenesJoey: All right, car magazines, cereal boxes, but it’s like enough!ScenesRoss: Well, I tell you what. Why don’t we uh, why don’t we just stay here? Let’s not see a movie, we’ll just hang.ScenesJoey: And just wait for Rachel to come back from her date?ScenesRoss: Hey, if that’s what you want to do I’m not gonna say no.ScenesJoey: Dude! What is going on?!ScenesRoss: I just…I have to find out how it went.ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesRoss: This guy could be my baby’s stepfather!ScenesJoey: They go on one date and you’re worried about them getting married?! He’s not you!ScenesRoss: I just—I-I can’t believe she’s-she’s dating?!ScenesJoey: Well Ross, what did you think she was gonna do?ScenesRoss: I don’t know! I guess I just can’t believe any of this is happening.ScenesJoey: What do you mean?ScenesRoss: It’s just I always thought when I had another kid it would be different. Now I-I love Ben, but every time I have to drop him off at Carol and Susan’s, it’s like—It breaks my heart a little. I mean I’ve always had this picture of me and my next wife in bed on Sunday and, my kid comes running in and leaps up onto the bed. And we all read the paper together. Y’know? Maybe fight over the science section.ScenesJoey: That’s a nice picture. Maybe you can still have that!ScenesRoss: No! No I can’t. I mean Rachel’s out with some guy. My baby went with her. If anything that picture keeps moving further away.ScenesJoey: Hey, can I ask you something? In this, in this picture of you and your wife, is your wife Rachel?ScenesRoss: It used to be. Now she doesn’t really have a face. Smokin’ body though.ScenesJoey: Good call. Yeah. But, the face Ross, the face isn’t Rachel.ScenesRoss: No but ahh! How much easier would it be if it were?ScenesJoey: I know, but I don’t think that’s what she wants.ScenesRoss: No, it’s not what I want either. I mean I-I can’t force myself to fall in love with her again now.ScenesJoey: That’s okay Ross maybe you need a new picture. Okay? It’s not gonna be what you thought, but no matter what there’s gonna be a brand new little baby, your baby. Who cares what the picture looks like?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Hey, I tell you what. Let’s you and me go out and have some fun. Huh? Whatever you want. Come on!ScenesRoss: (checks his watch) We can still catch that Ukrainian film.ScenesJoey: No, I said fun!

rows.Scenes: Outside Chandler’s Office, Chandler is just about to go into his office when Bob calls for him from behind.]
rows.Content: Bob: Hey Toby!ScenesChandler: Hey Bobby.ScenesBob: It’s Bob actually. Hey, you work up here, can you tell me where this Chandler Bing’s office is?ScenesChandler: Uhh yeah. Yeah, it’s (Points down the hall) right, right down there. (When he has Bob looking down the hall, he turns around and knocks his nameplate off of his door.) Right there, yeah. Can I ask you why?ScenesBob: I want to talk to that bastard, see what his problem is.ScenesChandler: Okay Bob listen uhh, I’m the reason you didn’t get the job up here.ScenesBob: Toby don’t.ScenesChandler: Bob!ScenesBob: Toby! I’m not gonna let you cover for him. Anything you say right now will just get me more upset with Chandler!ScenesChandler: Well that puts me in a difficult position.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, Monica is waiting for Tim who enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesTim: I got your page, is everything okay?ScenesMonica: Uh well that depends, how are things with Phoebe?ScenesTim: Oh it’s great! It’s great! Thank you so much for introducing us!ScenesMonica: Oh my pleasure. Okay, I’m afraid I’ve got some bad news. (Phoebe enters.) Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Monica!ScenesMonica: (simultaneously) You’re fired!ScenesPhoebe: (simultaneously) I’m breaking up with you!ScenesTim: What?ScenesPhoebe: I’m, I’m breaking up with you.ScenesMonica: You’re fired.ScenesTim: Why?ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I’m just—I’m…I’m just not ready for a relationship right now.ScenesMonica: Yeah and-and I’m sorry too. But, well I just—I like things done a certain way and the chemistry’s just not right.ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s good, the chemistry thing for us too.ScenesTim: Wow! Umm, okay. Umm… (To Phoebe) I-I-I realize I came on a little strong but, it’s only because I think you’re so amazing. (To Monica) And uh, I-I just wanna, I just wanna tell you how much I appreciate you giving me an opportunity here because I—you’re the most talented chef I’ve ever worked for. Anyway… (Starts to leave and Phoebe and Monica trade looks.)ScenesMonica: Tim wait!ScenesTim: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Umm, I think I spoke too quickly. There-there’s a learning curve with this job and maybe we can try it again.ScenesTim: Really?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesTim: Thank you so much! ‘Cause I-I know I can do better!ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes(They both look at Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: And Tim I just wanna say, good luck here. (Shakes his hand and leaves, which disgusts Monica.)

rows.Scenes: A Street, Ross is walking past a newsstand and sees Rachel.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Well, how was the date?ScenesRachel: Well I’m alone and I just bought fifteen dollars worth of candy bars, what do you think?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. What happened?ScenesRachel: I made the mistake of telling him that I was pregnant.ScenesRoss: Ah, he didn’t uh, take it so well?ScenesRachel: Well better than you, but y’know still not what you want.ScenesRoss: Oh?ScenesRachel: He got all weird and sputtery and then he said uh, "Yeah, I hear those hemorrhoids are a bitch.ScenesRoss: He sounds swell.ScenesRachel: Doesn’t he?ScenesRoss: Hey, wanna…wanna a little cheering up?ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesRoss: Sit down.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(They sit on some front steps.)ScenesRoss: Guess whose middle name is Muriel.ScenesRachel: (thinks then gasps) Chandler M. Bing?ScenesRoss: Yeah-ha!ScenesRachel: Oh my God. (Laughs)ScenesRoss: I’m sorry about your date.ScenesRachel: Oh it’s all right. I’m guess I’m just done with the whole dating thing. It’s one more thing in my life that’s suddenly completely different. This is hard.ScenesRoss: Yeah I know. (Pause) On the other hand in um, in about seven months you’re gonna have something that you’re gonna love more than any guy you’ve ever gone out with. Just wait. Wait until uh, wait until the first time your baby grabs your finger. You have no idea.ScenesRachel: Thanks sweetie.ScenesRoss: You wanna, you wanna grab some coffee?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I think I’m gonna go home and eat ten candy bars.ScenesRoss: Hey, I thought I cheered you up.ScenesRachel: Oh you did, there are twenty in here.ScenesRoss: Right. Good night.ScenesRachel: Good night.Scenes(He kisses her on the cheek and heads to Central Perk.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is entering and Mona from the wedding recognizes him.]
rows.Content: Mona: Ross?ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesMona: Hey it’s Mona! From the wedding.ScenesRoss: Oh hi!ScenesMona: Hi!ScenesRoss: Wow! Uh…how are you?ScenesMona: I’m good except umm, you still owe me a dance.ScenesRoss: Oh that’s right. Well uh, would you be interested in seeing a Ukrainian film?ScenesMona: (laughs then stops) Oh you’re serious. Sure!ScenesRoss: Great! Well umm…Scenes(Ross continues to talk to her as the camera pans to show Rachel standing in the doorway.)ScenesMona: I think I might need one more cup of coffee.ScenesRoss: Sure! Uh, let me get it for ya.ScenesMona: Okay.Scenes(Rachel watches that and slowly backs out to head for home.)ScenesDedicated to the Memory of Richard L. Cox, Sr.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s Office, Bob is ransacking Chandler’s office.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Bob. Bob! Bob!!! (He turns around) What the hell are you doing?!ScenesBob: I just found out this is Chandler’s office! Come on Toby, give me a hand!Scenes(He thinks about it and decides to join in by turning over a chair and continue ransacking the place.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Halloween PartyScenesWritten by: Mark KunerthScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Chandler and Monica enter. Oh, and Joey is wearing a FDNY T-shirt to make this the first nod to the tragedy that Friends have made.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey you guys?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: I know it’s last minute, but we decided to have a Halloween party.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good! (And there’s general excitement.)ScenesMonica: And everybody has to wear costumes. (And there’s general disconcertment.) Come on! It’ll be fun!ScenesRoss: Well, I’ll-I’ll be there. I mean I have to wear a costume to all my classes that day anyway so…ScenesRachel: Please tell me you’re not gonna dress up like a dinosaur.ScenesRoss: (exhales sarcastically) Not two years in a row.ScenesJoey: Look, I’ll come to the party but I’m not dressing up.ScenesMonica: You have to!ScenesJoey: No way! Look, Halloween is so stupid! Dressing up, pretending to be someone you’re not…ScenesChandler: You’re an actor!ScenesMonica: So Ross, are you gonna bring Mona?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Yeah, I think I will.ScenesJoey: That hot girl from their wedding?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well hey-hey if she needs any idea for costumes, she could be a bikini model, or a slutty nurse, or a sexy cheerleader huh—Ooh-ooh, Leatherface from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre—No-no-no! Slutty Leatherface.ScenesPhoebe: Now wasn’t Joey hitting on her at the wedding too?ScenesRoss: That’s right! He was hitting on her, and I got her. I guess the better man won. (To Joey) Please don’t take her from me.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: A Street, Phoebe is walking down it and passes Ursula.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ursula! (Ursula turns, smiles, and continues walking.) Wait! Err-err, it’s me! Phoebe!ScenesUrsula: Oh, I thought there was a mirror there. Okay, bye-bye. (Starts to walk again.)ScenesPhoebe: Wait a second! So, what’s new with you?ScenesUrsula: Umm, nothing. I mean, I’m getting married next week.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesUrsula: Yeah! Yeah, it’s gonna be a small ceremony. Just family. (Phoebe looks at her.) His.ScenesPhoebe: Huh. Okay. Well, I’m really happy for you. (Starts to walk away.)ScenesUrsula: Wait! If umm, if you want to come, I guess that’d be okay.ScenesPhoebe: Really?ScenesUrsula: Sure! Why not? You could be my sister for the day.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Okay. Umm, y’know, my friends are having a Halloween party tonight at my old apartment so, you could come. Maybe I could meet the guy you’re marrying.ScenesUrsula: Huh. Well, I’m supposed to be working at the restaurant tonight. I’m supposed to be working right now, so who cares.ScenesPhoebe: By the way, it’s a costume party.ScenesUrsula: Oh! Okay, so that’s why you’re… (Motions to what she’s wearing.)ScenesPhoebe: (looks down) No. But thanks. (Walks away.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, The Halloween party has started. Monica is setting out some food as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesMonica: Wait! You’re supposed to wear a costume!ScenesRachel: I am! I am a woman who spent a lot of money on a dress and she wants to wear it, because soon she won’t be able to fit into it.ScenesMonica: Oh.ScenesRachel: Ahh!ScenesMonica: I’m Catwoman, who wants to borrow the dress when you’re too big for it.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesKids: Trick or treat!ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh! Can I give out the candy? I really want to be with the kids right now. Y’know, ever since I got pregnant I-I have the strongest maternal instincts.ScenesKids: Trick or treat!!ScenesRachel: (to them) Just a minute!!! (She takes the candy and opens the door to two parents, a witch, a clown, and a cowgirl.) Look at you guys! Wow! You are a very scary witch. (Gives her candy.)ScenesWitch: Thank you.ScenesRachel: And you are a very funny clown. (Gives him candy.)ScenesClown: Thank you.ScenesRachel: (to the cowgirl) And you are so in style right now. Y’know, I work at Ralph Lauren and the whole fall line has got this like equestrian theme going on. I don’t suppose you saw the cover of British Vogue, but…ScenesCowgirl: (interrupting) Can I just have the candy?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Sure. (Throws some in her bag and she walks away as Phoebe, dressed as Supergirl walks up and eyes Monica who eyes her back.)ScenesPhoebe: Ah, Catwoman. So we meet again.ScenesMonica: So we do Supergirl.ScenesPhoebe: No, it’s me. Phoebe!ScenesChandler: (entering from the bedroom wearing a big, pink bunny costume) Monica! Can I talk to you for a second? Listen, I appreciate you getting me the costume…ScenesRachel: (To Monica) Oh, you did this to him?ScenesMonica: What?! I thought he’d love it! His favorite kid's book was the Velveteen Rabbit!ScenesChandler: The Velveteen Rabbit was brown and white!ScenesMonica: Well, it was either a pink bunny or no bunny at all.ScenesChandler: No bunny at all!! Always no bunny at all!!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: You didn’t dress up either?!ScenesJoey: Yes I did! I’m Chandler. (Looks at Chandler) Dude, what happened?ScenesChandler: How is that me?ScenesJoey: Okay. I’m Chandler (makes a growling/gurgling sound at the end and the girls laugh.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Chandler) That is so you!ScenesChandler: When have I ever done that?!ScenesJoey: When have I ever done that?! (And does the sound again.)Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesGirl: Trick or treat!ScenesRachel: Oh! (Opens the door to reveal a ballerina) Well you’re just the prettiest ballerina I’ve ever seen.ScenesBallerina: Thank you. (Pirouettes.)ScenesRachel: Oh wow! That deserves another piece of candy.ScenesBallerina: Thank you. (Does another ballerina move.)ScenesRachel: Well, I have to say that earns tutu pieces of candy.ScenesBallerina: I love you! (Hugs Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Ohh… Oh, honey here. Take it all. (Pours the entire large bowl into her bag and closes the door.) Monica! We need more candy?ScenesMonica: What?! There’s only been like four kids.ScenesRachel: Yeah I know, but one of them just said that she loved me so I just gave her everything.ScenesPhoebe: No wonder your pregnant.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey! (He’s wearing a costume as well.)ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesMonica: What are you supposed to be?ScenesRoss: Remember the Russian satellite, Sputnik? (They all look at him.) Well, I’m a potato or a…spud. And these are my antennae. (Points to the colander with an old TV antenna glued on top that he’s wearing.) So Sputnik, becomes… (They’re still confused) Spud-nik. Spudnik!ScenesChandler: Wow! I don’t have the worst costume anymore!ScenesJoey: (sees Ross) Hey all right, Ross came as doody.ScenesRoss: No, I-I’m not doody.ScenesMonica: No, space doody!Scenes(Joey gives him the okay symbol, and Ross rushes towards him to be stopped by Chandler. Meanwhile, Phoebe goes over to the snack table as some guy, which turns out to be Ursula's fianc�e Eric, walks in and smacks her butt.)ScenesEric: Aren’t you gonna give me a kiss?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I will. But right after you tell me who the hell you are.ScenesEric: Ursula?ScenesPhoebe: Ursula’s fianc�e?ScenesEric: Oh my God, you’re the sister!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesEric: Okay, I just slapped my future sister-in-law’s ass.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesEric: I’m an idiot. Uh, is your mother here? Maybe I can give her a little slap on the butt.ScenesPhoebe: My mother killed herself.ScenesEric: She, now I knew that and…now I’m sweating. Look at me, I’m really sweating—Now I’m saying, "Look at me," I’m getting even sweatier. I think I probably should go.ScenesPhoebe: No-no! That’s okay, we’ll just start over. Okay? Hi! I’m Phoebe.ScenesEric: Eric. (They shake hands and he’s squinting. And, no, it’s not me.)ScenesPhoebe: Why are you looking at me like that?ScenesEric: ‘Cause the sweat’s getting in my eyes and its burning.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Hands him a napkin.) So, what are you?ScenesEric: I don’t think they have a name for it. It’s just I get nervous; I start sweating like crazy.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) No I-I meant your costume.ScenesEric: Oh umm, I’m the solar system. (He’s wearing a black sweater with the planets glued on around the sun.) Yeah, my students helped me make it—I teach the second grade.ScenesPhoebe: I love the second grade!ScenesEric: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! It’s so much better than first grade when you don’t know what’s going on and definitely better than third grade. Y’know with all the politics and mind games.ScenesEric: So what do you do?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I’m a masseuse…by day. (Stands with her hands on her hips like a Supergirl pose.)ScenesEric: Y’know you don’t have to stand here with me, believe me…ScenesPhoebe: No I’m having fun. I’m really—And I’m really-really excited for you and Ursula.ScenesEric: Oh I feel very lucky, she’s great. I think she’s the most beautiful woman I’ve ever seen.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you.Scenes[Time lapse, Monica is going over to talk to Joey.]ScenesMonica: Hey Joey?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesMonica: You read comic books right?ScenesJoey: Exclusively.ScenesMonica: Who do you think would win in a fight, Catwoman or Supergirl?ScenesJoey: Catwoman, hands down.ScenesMonica: Yeah…ScenesJoey: But between you and Phoebe, I’d have to give the edge to Phoebe.ScenesMonica: What?! Really?!ScenesJoey: Are you kiddin’? Phoebe lived on the street. Okay? Plus, she’s got this crazy temper. She—She’s not standing right behind me is she?ScenesMonica: No you’re fine. (Joey checks anyway.) All right well, do you think I could take Rachel?ScenesJoey: I’m not sure.ScenesMonica: What?! Come on I am tough! Punch me right here! (Her stomach) As hard as you can!ScenesJoey: Will you relax?! What are you taking this so seriously for? It doesn’t matter.ScenesMonica: Oh really? Okay? Well what would you say if I told you that, y’know, Ross or Chandler could beat you up?ScenesJoey: I would say, "Woman, please!ScenesPhoebe: (walking over) Hey. Ursula’s fianc�e is really sweet! He’s a teacher, he does all this volunteer work. Y’know normally y’know, I don’t like really sweaty guys. But this one? I could just mop him up!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesMonica: You’re getting a crush on your sister’s fianc�e.ScenesPhoebe: No I’m not! You are!ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Here comes the temper.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Rachel opens it to a little girl.)ScenesGirl: Trick or treat!ScenesRachel: Hi! Y’know what honey, we’re actually out of candy right now. But someone just went out to get some and I have been giving out money but I’m out of that too. Hey, can I write you a check?ScenesGirl: Okay!ScenesRachel: Okay, what’s your name?ScenesGirl: Lelani Mayolanofavich.ScenesRachel: Okay, I’m just gonna write this out to cash.ScenesMona: (entering) Hi!ScenesRachel: Hey Mona!ScenesChandler: Oh! Hi!ScenesMona: Hi!ScenesChandler: Joey’s gonna be thrilled! He was hoping you’d come by as a slutty nurse.ScenesMona: Umm, actually I’m just a nurse.ScenesChandler: You’d think that would embarrass me, but you see I’m maxed out.ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMona: Hi!ScenesRoss: You made it!ScenesMona: Wait-wait! You’re umm, you’re a potato…ScenesRoss: Well, I’m a spud…ScenesMona: And the antennae…Oh my God you’re Spudnik!ScenesRoss: Yes!ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Marry her.Scenes[Cut to Joey and Monica.]ScenesJoey: Okay, here’s a good one for ya. Who do think would win in a fight between Ross and Chandler.ScenesMonica: I can’t answer that! Chandler’s my husband.ScenesJoey: So Ross?ScenesMonica: Yeah.Scenes[Cut to Phoebe and Eric.]ScenesEric: Hey beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: Hello handsome. (Sees Ursula over her shoulder) Oh God. (Walks away in shame as they kiss.) Oh look at you two. So when did you guys meet?ScenesEric: Two weeks ago.ScenesPhoebe: Two weeks? That’s it?ScenesEric: Yeah, I know it sounds crazy, and it’s not like me to do something so impulsive, but she’s just so perfect, and we have so much in common.ScenesPhoebe: Oh really?ScenesEric: We’re both teachers.ScenesPhoebe: Huh? (Ursula motions for Phoebe to keep quiet.)ScenesEric: And we were both in the Peace Corps.ScenesPhoebe: Peace Corps, really? (Ursula motions, "I don’t know.")ScenesEric: In fact when we were building houses in Uruguay, we were, we were just two towns apart and we never met.ScenesUrsula: Yeah. It wasn’t a town when I got there, but it was a town when I left. (To Eric) Shall we get me really drunk?ScenesEric: Sure.Scenes(They walk away.)Scenes[Cut to Mona and Ross walking past Chandler.]ScenesChandler: Howdy doody.ScenesRoss: That’s funny. Yeah. Y’know you’re the funniest man here in a pink bunny costume his wife made him wear.ScenesChandler: Oh relax man, relax. You’re looking a little flushed.ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Hey-hey-hey, I think we might find out the answer to our question.ScenesChandler: What question?ScenesJoey: Monica and I were talking about who could kick whose ass in a fight, you or Ross?ScenesChandler: There’s no question.ScenesJoey: So you think Ross too?Scenes(Monica turns around slowly.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) You picked Ross?!ScenesMonica: Ross is really strong! Okay, he’s the strongest out of all three of you! (Joey looks at her.) Except for Joey.ScenesChandler: I cannot believe you didn’t pick me.ScenesRoss: Uh, in her defense, she’s right. I am stronger. I would destroy you.ScenesChandler: Oh really?! You think you’re stronger? Why don’t you prove it? (He pushes Ross who starts to fall backwards until Mona catches him.)ScenesRoss: Oh I’ll prove it! I’ll prove it like a theorem!!Scenes(They start to fight with Ross pulling on Chandler’s ears and Chandler hitting Ross over the head with his carrot.)ScenesMonica: Wait-wait!! Okay, stop it! Stop it! Stop! (Breaks it up.) Now listen, no one’s gonna fight in this apartment.ScenesJoey: Hey Monica! (Grabs her and pulls her into the living room.) People came to see a fight, let’s give ‘em what they came for!ScenesMona: Hey, you guys could arm wrestle.ScenesJoey: Yeah. Listen to the slutty nurse.ScenesChandler: (To Ross) You’re going down.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah? You’re going further down! Downtown!ScenesJoey: Seriously guys, the trash talk is embarrassing.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, the party continues with Rachel leaning on the counter as Gunther walks in carrying candy.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh Gunther! You brought candy! Thank you so much for picking this up! You are so sweet.ScenesGunther: Really?ScenesRachel: Honey, someday you are gonna make some man the luckiest guy in the world.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesKid: Trick or treat!ScenesRachel: Gotta go! (Opens the door to a boy in a cape.) Hi! Wow! There you go! (Hands him some candy.)ScenesBoy in the Cape: My friend Lewis told me you were giving out money.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, we were but umm, now we’ve got candy.ScenesBoy in the Cape: I’d rather have the money.ScenesRachel: Well, that-that’s not your choice.
