(Katie is uncomfortable.) So, I’m gonna grab my coat. (Does so, leaving Katie and Rachel alone.)ScenesRachel: So, you had a good day huh? Big commission; picked up a daddy.ScenesKatie: Are you okay with this?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! Yeah please, you guys have fun.ScenesKatie: Okay. It was nice to see you.ScenesRachel: Oh and it was great to see you too. And you look fantastic, although you missed a button.ScenesKatie: Oh umm, actually I umm…ScenesRachel: Oh okay, I see what you’re doing there.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Phoebe are entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can’t even believe this! I really come off that badly?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! It’s okay, you calm down after a while and then people can see how really sweet and wonderful you really are.ScenesChandler: Oh good. Good, because I’m sure this interview is gonna last a couple of weeks.ScenesPhoebe: All right, don’t freak out! Okay? I-I will help you. How long before you have to leave?ScenesChandler: An hour.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t help you.ScenesChandler: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: All right, all right, we’ll just do our best. Okay? So let’s say I’m the interviewer and I’m meeting you for the first time. Okay. "Hi! Come on in, I’m uh, Regina Philange.ScenesChandler: Chandler Bing.ScenesPhoebe: Bing, what an unusual name.ScenesChandler: Well you should meet my uncle, Bada. (Pause) I’ll let myself out.

rows.Scenes: The Cooking Class, Joey is trying to cook as the teacher walks over to him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hi.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Your Fettuccini Alfredo looks a little dry, did you use all your cheese?ScenesJoey: When you say used, do you mean eat as a pre-cooking snack?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: And the cream?ScenesJoey: Cheese makes me thirsty.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Okay. Let’s move on.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: (To Monica) Oh! Something smells good over at Monica’s station! (She tries Monica’s fettuccini.) Oh my God! This is absolutely amazing! You’ve never made this before?ScenesMonica: Oh no! I don’t know anything about cooking. I had to ask someone what it’s called when the, when the water makes those little bubbles.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Well, hats off to the chef.ScenesMonica: I-I-I’m sorry, your-your mouth was full, I didn’t hear what you said. Umm, hats off to who now?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: The chef!ScenesMonica: That’s right.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Phoebe are still working on his interviewing techniques.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …I think you’ll find if I come to work here, I don’t micro-manage. I don’t shy away from delegating.ScenesPhoebe: Um-hmm, that’s good to know. But let’s stop focusing on what you don’t do, and start focusing on what you do do.ScenesChandler: (suppressing a smile) What I do do…is manage to uh, create an atmosphere of support for the people working with me.ScenesPhoebe: I see. Nice sidestep on the do do thing by the way.ScenesChandler: Hardest thing I’ve ever done in my life.ScenesPhoebe: You gotta go!ScenesChandler: Oh! (Stands up.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, don’t worry. You’re ready.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Absolutely! Just fight all your natural instincts and you’ll be great.ScenesChandler: Okay.

rows.Scenes: The Cooking Class, everyone has finished baking a batch of cookies and the teacher is going around tasting them.]
rows.Content: The Cooking Teacher: Ah Monica, my star student.ScenesMonica: Y’know, you called me that before so I-I took the liberty of fashioning a star out of aluminum foil. Now, no pressure, you like my cookies, you give me the star. (Hands it to her.)ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: (tasting the cookie and with her mouthful) Oh, yum-yum-yum. (Hands the star back.)ScenesMonica: Wow! A star! (The class glares at her.) I know you all hate me and-and I’m sorry, but I don’t care.Scenes(The teacher goes to Joey’s station.)ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Okay Joey, you’re up next. (Tries one of his cookies.) This are good! This is amazing! You get an A!ScenesJoey: I can an A? In-in school? (To Joey) Hey, I’m a dork.ScenesMonica: Joey! I’m so proud of you!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: I think you should give him your star.ScenesMonica: Excuse me? He doesn’t even know what he’s doing!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: We’re all beginners here. Nobody knows what they’re doing.ScenesMonica: I do! I’m a professional chef! (The class gasps.) Oh relax! It’s not a courtroom drama!ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: If you’re a professional chef, what are you doing taking Introduction to Cooking?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesMonica: I’m-I’m sorry, it’s just that umm… Well I-I cook at this restaurant, Alessandro’s, and umm I just got a really bad review…ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Oh Alessandro’s! I love that place!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Oh yes! You’re an excellent chef! As a person you’re a little…ScenesMonica: Oh, I’m totally crazy, but you-you like the food?ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Very much.ScenesMonica: Okay then, I don’t stink. I’m a good chef. Okay. (Starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I don’t want to go. I’m having fun.ScenesThe Cooking Teacher: Well actually, did either of you pay for this class?ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey, if my friend says it’s time to go, it’s time to go. (Starts to leave, but comes back for his cookies.)

rows.Scenes: An Office Building, Chandler is on his interview.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …also I was the point person on my company’s transition from the KL-5 to GR-6 system.ScenesThe Interviewer: You must’ve had your hands full.ScenesChandler: That I did. That I did.ScenesThe Interviewer: So let’s talk a little bit about your duties.ScenesChandler: (nervous) My duties? (Trying not to crack a joke) All right.ScenesThe Interviewer: Now you’ll be heading a whole division, so you’ll have a lot of duties.ScenesChandler: (trying not to laugh) I see.ScenesThe Interviewer: But there’ll be perhaps 30 people under you so you can dump a certain amount on them.ScenesChandler: (really try not to laugh) Good to know.ScenesThe Interviewer: We can go into detail…ScenesChandler: No don’t I beg of you!ScenesThe Interviewer: All right then, we’ll have a definite answer for you on Monday, but I think I can say with some confidence, you’ll fit in well here.ScenesChandler: (relieved) Really?!ScenesThe Interviewer: Absolutely. (They walk to the door.) You can relax; you did great.ScenesChandler: Yeah I gotta say thank you, I was really nervous. Y’know I’ve been told I come on to strong, make to many jokes, and then it was really hard to sidestep that duty thing. (The interviewer doesn’t understand) Duties. (Still doesn’t.) Duties! (Still doesn’t.) Poo. (Still doesn’t.)ScenesThe Interviewer: Poo?ScenesChandler: Oh my God this doesn’t count! Okay? The interview was over, that was the real Chandler Bing in there, this is just some crazy guy out in the hall! Call security! There’s a crazy guy out in the hall!ScenesThe Interviewer: Poo?!ScenesChandler: I’ll look forward to your call. (Walks away.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is returning from his date.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hi! You’re back from your date!ScenesRoss: How are you?ScenesRachel: I’m fine, but that’s not important. What’s important is how was she?ScenesRoss: Uhh, it was fun. We, we just had coffee.ScenesRachel: Oh uh-huh, uh-huh, coffee, a little rub-rub-rub under the table.ScenesRoss: What’s uh, what’s going on? Do you not, do you not like Katie?ScenesRachel: No! No, she’s—She was nice. I mean, she’s a little slutty, but who isn’t?ScenesRoss: I liked her.ScenesRachel: Of course you did Ross, you would date a gorilla if it called you Indiana Jones!ScenesRoss: Did you get like a fresh batch of pregnancy hormones today?!ScenesRachel: No! It’s just that, Kate bothered me.ScenesRoss: Why? What was wrong with her?ScenesRachel: There was nothing wrong with her! All right? She was perfectly lovely!ScenesRoss: Okay, so what’s the matter?ScenesRachel: I don’t want you to date her!ScenesRoss: (laughs) Why? What, what are you jealous?ScenesRachel: Yes! And not because I want you to go out with me, but because I don’t want you to go out with anybody! Okay? I know it’s a terrible thing to even think this, and it’s completely inappropriate, but I want you to be at my constant beck and call 24 hours a day! I’m very sorry, but that is just the way that I feel.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: I won’t date. I’ll uh, I’ll be here, with you, all the time.ScenesRachel: Really? But I’m being so unreasonable.ScenesRoss: True, but you’re allowed to be unreasonable. You’re having our baby.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Oh Ross, thank you. Thank you. (They hug.)ScenesRoss: Do you feel better?ScenesRachel: No, not really. You’re pressing the baby into my bladder and now I have to pee. Sorry. (She gets up and starts for the bathroom.)ScenesRoss: Uh Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah. (Stops and starts doing the I-have-to-go-to-the-bathroom dance.)ScenesRoss: Just one thing umm…ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: We live together. You’re having our baby. I’m not gonna see anybody else. Are you-are you sure you don’t want something more?ScenesRachel: (pause) Wow! I don’t know, maybe. I’m…ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, Rach! I was just messin’ around! (She’s stunned) Like you did last night when I had to pee?ScenesRachel: (laughs) I knew that! I knew that! I was just messin’ with you too!ScenesRoss: (pause) Okay. Okay. Because for a minute you said you…ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no-no, no!ScenesRoss: …that you actually…ScenesRachel: No that’s just—(Laughs)—That’s just ‘cause I’m such a good messer!Scenes(They both laugh. Ross sits down, but Rachel doesn’t move and is lost in thought.)ScenesRoss: Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesRoss: The bathroom?ScenesRachel: Right! (Heads for the bathroom.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The New School, Joey and Monica are walking down a hallway.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I had a great time! Learned how to bake, ate great food, that’s the first A I’ve gotten since seventh grade, and I didn’t have to sleep with the teacher this time.ScenesMonica: Oh, look! Acting for Beginners! Want to feel good about yourself?ScenesJoey: What the hell!ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes(They enter.)ScenesThe Acting Teacher: All right, let’s start with some basics. Can anybody tell me what the difference between upstage and downstage is?Scenes(No one can and Monica looks at Joey expectantly.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, this was a stupid idea. (Exits.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel Is LateScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is showing everyone a poster as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! What are you guys looking at?ScenesJoey: Oh, it’s a poster for that World War I movie that I’m in, check it out.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Wow! It looks really violent!ScenesJoey: Uh-huh! I know. I’m coming soon to a theater near you! I’m in THX! I’m unsuitable for children!ScenesRoss: Now I cannot wait to see this.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, it’s already generating Oscar buzz.ScenesPhoebe: I started that!ScenesJoey: I thought I did! Oh hey guess what? The premiere is next week and you’re all invited! (They all gasp.)ScenesMonica: Are we gonna take a limo?ScenesJoey: Sure! Why not?!ScenesMonica: Oh I love taking limos when nobody died!ScenesRachel: Well obviously I won’t be able to come, for those of you who haven’t checked their calendars today is my due date. Well y’know, I just want to take a moment and thank you guys for how great you’ve been during this time. I really couldn’t have done it without you. And I have loved these last nine months! And even though I am so looking forward to the next part, I am really gonna miss being pregnant.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, time lapse, and Rachel is entering still pregnant.]
rows.Content: Rachel: That’s right, still no baby! (To Monica, Joey, and Chandler on the couch) Come on people! Please make some room!ScenesRoss: Uh sweetie, maybe you’d be more comfortable here? (Gets up from the green armchair.)ScenesRachel: You. Like you haven’t done enough.ScenesRoss: Look, I-I know how miserable you are, I wish there was something I can do. I mean I wish I were a seahorse. (She glares at him) Because with seahorses it’s the male, they carry the babies. And then also umm, I’d be far away in the sea. (He sits back down.)Scenes(Rachel turns and looks at the group on the couch and they move over. Chandler measures the room they’ve made with his arm and decides it’s not enough and they all move over again.)ScenesRachel: God. (Sits down.) I have never been so uncomfortable in my entire life!ScenesPhoebe: Oh I know, I’ve been there. I remember toward the end…ScenesRachel: (interrupting her) Oh Phoebe, that’s a great story. Can you tell it to me when you’re getting me some iced tea? (Phoebe gets up and Rachel groans.) (To the baby) Oh God, get out! Get out!! Get out!! Get out!!ScenesChandler: Let’s. (Everyone gets up and leaves Rachel.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Phoebe, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! Did you have the baby yet?ScenesRachel: Do you want me to come over there and sit on you? ‘Cause I’ll do it.ScenesMonica: What are you doing here so early?ScenesRachel: They sent me home from work. They were like, "Start your maternity leave now! Just rest, get ready for the baby." Well y’know what? Screw ‘em! If they don’t want me there, I’ll just hang out with you guys.ScenesPhoebe: Or you can do volunteer work.Scenes(Joey’s cell phone rings and he answers it.)ScenesJoey: Hello?ScenesEstelle: Joey! It’s Estelle! Great news, I was able to get you and one guest tickets to your premiere.ScenesJoey: One guest? You told me I can have six tickets!ScenesEstelle: Well, I sold four of them on Ebay. You’ll be sitting next to HotGuy372.ScenesJoey: Oh my God. So that’s it?! I only get to bring one guest?ScenesEstelle: Yeah, what time do you wanna pick me up? (Joey hangs up on her.) Hello?ScenesJoey: (to Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe) Did you hear that? I only get one extra ticket to my premiere. So some how I have to pick between you three and Ross.ScenesRachel: (overhearing that) What-what about me?ScenesJoey: You said you didn’t want to go.ScenesRachel: I don’t. But I would still like to be acknowledged. What? Just because I’m pregnant you think I’m invisible.ScenesJoey: Definitely not invisible.ScenesMonica: Well, well Ross didn’t care enough to be here, so I think he’s out. You snooze you lose.ScenesChandler: He’s not snoozing, he’s teaching a class.ScenesMonica: Well then somebody’s snoozing. Joey, not that this uh should affect you at all, but if you were to pick me, I was planning on wearing a sequined dress, cut down to here. (Points to her stomach just above her belly button.)ScenesChandler: I haven’t seen this dress.ScenesMonica: Star in a movie.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, you pick who ever you want. Okay? You just listen to your heart. What does it tell you? (Mimicking a heartbeat and tapping her chest.) Phoebe, Phoebe.ScenesJoey: Well uh…I think I want to take Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: (still mimicking a heartbeat, only faster) Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe—Burrrrr! (Mimics the sound of a cardiac monitor going off.)ScenesChandler: You really want to take me?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! I mean I’m sorry, I wish I can take everybody, but y’know Chandler always supported my career. He’s paid for acting classes and head shots and stuff and well this will be my way of paying you back.ScenesChandler: So you’re never actually going to pay me back?ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, just because he paid for your head shots you’re gonna take him? Joey, I don’t think you’re comprehending just how slutty this dress is!ScenesJoey: It’s not just the stuff he paid for, I mean it’s-it’s everything. Y’know? He read lines with me. He-he went with me on auditions when I was really nervous, and then he consoled me after I didn’t get parts that I really wanted. You always believed in me man. Even, even when I didn’t believe in myself.ScenesChandler: I always knew you were gonna make it. I’m so proud of you.ScenesJoey: Thanks. That means a lot to me.Scenes(They look at each other and smile for a while.)ScenesPhoebe: Mon, maybe one of these guys wants to wear your dress.ScenesJoey: (in a manly voice) I’m gonna go shave. (Gets up.)ScenesChandler: (in a manly voice) Yeah well, I’m gonna go spit. (He goes into the bedroom. On his way out, Joey gives Rachel a wide berth.)ScenesRachel: Oh, I have to pee. If I don’t come out in five minutes it’s because I’ve choked to death on the potpourri stink. (Goes into the bathroom.)ScenesPhoebe: When she comes out, you hold her nose, I’ll blow in her mouth, and the kid will just (makes a popping sound) right out of her.ScenesMonica: She’s over a week late! She gotta have it today, right?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. I-I think it’s still gonna be a while.ScenesMonica: Hmm, care to make it interesting? I’ll bet you that she’ll have it by this time tomorrow.ScenesPhoebe: You’re on!ScenesMonica: Okay, how much?ScenesPhoebe: One hundred thousand dollars!ScenesMonica: How about fifty bucks?ScenesPhoebe: Fine! I’ll call Zurich and move some money around.ScenesRachel: (calling from the bathroom) All right, who’s turn is it to help me get up!Scenes(They both look at each other, then Phoebe gets an idea.)ScenesPhoebe: No one’s here! (Monica looks at her.) Oh damnit!

rows.Scenes: The World Premiere of Over There, Joey and Chandler are arriving in a limo and are about to walk down the red carpet.]
rows.Content: Chandler: This is so exciting! It’s so glamorous! People taking our picture. How do I look?ScenesJoey: A little tall.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Do you mind crouching down a little bit, so that I look taller? (Chandler does so) There you go. (And they walk down the red carpet.)ScenesChandler: It’s just so glamorous.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel is entering, still pregnant.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh hey Mon? Rach is here! Ohh, you’re still pregnant. Oh, I’m sorry. I know how uncomfortable you are. Y’know what? You look great. Yeah, like fifty bucks.ScenesRachel: Oh, I have to go pee. Apparently this baby thinks that my bladder is a squeeze toy. (Goes to the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: Damnit! Damnit!! Here’s your fifty bucks! (Pays Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: It’s interesting that you lost. Now, I forget, do you like to lose?ScenesMonica: Now stop it! Double or nothing that she has it by tomorrow!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! You’re on!ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Until then, General Grant, why don’t you set up camp (She puts the bill in her bra) right there.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey is Rachel here? We have a doctor’s appointment.ScenesMonica: She’s in the bathroom.ScenesRoss: Rach, we gotta go.ScenesRachel: In a minute!!!ScenesRoss: People ask me why we’re not together, I just don’t know what to tell them.ScenesRachel: (entering) All right, all right. Let’s go!ScenesRoss: Uh, do you wanna go change first? The doctor’s keeping the office open late for us, but if you hurry…ScenesRachel: No, I’m fine.ScenesRoss: Really? You don’t think that’s a little inappropriate. (She’s wearing a tank top and has her belly sticking out.)ScenesPhoebe: Good God man don’t anger it.ScenesRachel: Ross, it is 100 degrees outside. For the first time in weeks, I am somewhat comfortable.ScenesRoss: Fine! Fine! Y’know what? Whatever you want. Okay? You’re the mommy.ScenesRachel: Oh uh-uh pal! Don’t call me mommy! It’s bad enough you call your own mother that. (He looks at Monica.)ScenesMonica: I’m actually with her on this one.

rows.Scenes: Inside Joey’s Premiere, he is intently watching the movie.]
rows.Content: Joey: (onscreen) "I thought I knew who the enemy was, but it was you all along.ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Okay, this is it. It’s my big fight scene coming up. (He looks over and Chandler and notices that he’s asleep.)

rows.Scenes: Dr. Long’s Office, Ross and Rachel are waiting for the doctor. Ross is drumming his fingers on the bed.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ross.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Can I ask you something?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh.ScenesRachel: When Carol was pregnant with Ben…ScenesRoss: Mmm?ScenesRachel: …were you this irritating?ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: Excuse me?!ScenesRoss: Oh nothing. Nothing! Just uh, you’ve been a little short with me lately. I’m not trying to irritate you.ScenesRachel: Well then you just must have a natural talent for it.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? The doctor will be in soon, why don’t we not speak until then.ScenesRachel: (silently) Okay. (Pause) Seriously, breathe louder Ross! That’s great!ScenesRoss: Y’know we should probably ask the doctor if she even knows how to deliver a baby that’s half human and half pure evil!Scenes(Dr. Long enters.)ScenesRachel: Hi Dr. Long, how are you?ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Oh, you’re nice to her.ScenesRachel: She has the drugs!ScenesDr. Long: We’ll do a quick check.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Rachel lies back.)ScenesDr. Long: So, eight days late huh?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesDr. Long: You must be a little uncomfortable.ScenesRachel: Eh, just a tad.ScenesDr. Long: You’re about 80 percent effaced, so you’re on your way. It still could last a little while longer. If you’re anxious there are a few ways to help things along.ScenesRoss: Do them!!ScenesDr. Long: Actually, they’re things you can do. Just some home remedies, but in my experience I’ve found that some of them are quite effective.ScenesRachel: Well, we are ready to try anything.ScenesDr. Long: Okay, there’s an herbal tea you can drink.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesDr. Long: You can take some caster oil, there’s eating spicy foods…ScenesRachel: Great! We will do all of those.ScenesDr. Long: …taking a long walk, and then there’s the one that’s proved most effective: sex.Scenes(Rachel turns and looks at Ross.)ScenesRoss: You’ve got to be kidding me!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Premiere, the movie is ending and it takes the applause to wake up Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Good job Joe! Well done! Top notch!ScenesJoey: You liked it? You really liked it?ScenesChandler: Oh-ho-ho, yeah!ScenesJoey: Which part exactly?ScenesChandler: The whole thing! Can we go?ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no, give me some specifics.ScenesChandler: I love the specifics, the specifics were the best part!ScenesJoey: Hey, what about the scene with the kangaroo? Did-did you like that part?ScenesChandler: I was surprised to see a kangaroo in a World War I epic.ScenesJoey: You fell asleep!! There was no kangaroo! They didn’t take any of my suggestions! That’s for coming buddy. I’ll see you later. (Starts to walk out.)ScenesChandler: Don’t go! I’m sorry. I’m so sorry! (Sees another guy who is still asleep.) Look! This guy fell asleep! He fell asleep too! Be mad at him! (Looks at him more closely.) Or, call an ambulance.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Rachel are there as Phoebe and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMonica: What did the doctor say? Any news on when the baby will come?ScenesRachel: No. But she did give us some ideas on how to induce labor.ScenesRoss: Yeah, we tried them all. We went for a walk, uh we tried a special tea, caster oil, spicy food nothing has worked.ScenesRachel: Well, there is one thing that we haven’t tried, but someone thinks that, (mimicking Ross) "That will open up a can of worms.ScenesMonica: Well what is it? What is it? If it’s gonna help bring the baby here, like today. I mean, I think you should do it.ScenesRoss: It’s sex.ScenesMonica: Do it!ScenesRoss: Monica!ScenesMonica: I’m just saying it’s been a really long time for you. I mean, women have needs. Do it, get yours!ScenesPhoebe: Oh I-I don’t know about that. No, I think that if the two of you had sex the-the-the repercussions would be catastrophic.ScenesMonica: All right, let’s be practical, if Ross isn’t willing to do it, he’s not the only guy in the world you can have sex with. You can borrow Chandler—Chandler is good!ScenesRoss: Monica, what is the matter with you?ScenesMonica: Nothing. I just want the baby to be born today.ScenesRachel: Why? Why today?ScenesMonica: Okay fine! I keep betting Phoebe that you’re gonna have the baby and I don’t want to lose again!ScenesRoss: What?! While she’s been going through this hell, you’ve been making money?! You’re betting on your friend staying in this misery?! (Phoebe lowers her head and shakes it yes.)ScenesRachel: I’ll take that bet.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Well, I’m miserable here! I might as well make some money out it!ScenesRoss: Can I get some of that action?ScenesMonica: Wait a minute! Now I’m betting against all three of you?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, don’t worry. I really do feel like tomorrow’s the day.ScenesMonica: Oh, okay!Scenes(Rachel turns her head to Ross and Phoebe and mouths, "No way.")

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is there as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Sleeping beauty!ScenesChandler: Where have you been?! I tried to call you! I want to talk to you! I still feel so bad!ScenesJoey: (in a baby voice) Oh no, were you upset? Did you lose sleep?ScenesChandler: I’m so sorry.ScenesJoey: Uh-huh look, the only reason I can over here was to settle things between us! Okay? You’ve done a lot for me and my career, I wanted to pay you back so I took you to the premiere but you missed it! Okay, so how much do I owe you?ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Give me a number, I don’t want to owe you anything!ScenesChandler: You don’t owe me anything, I don’t want you money…ScenesJoey: Ah-ah-ah! We’re doing this! Okay, now you got me my first set of head shots. Right, how much were those?ScenesChandler: I don’t know, five hundred dollars?ScenesJoey: Okay, five hundred dollars. What else?ScenesChandler: Well then there was the second set, the infamous booger head shots.ScenesJoey: Okay, so that’s another five hundred. Five hundred and five hundred, that’s… (Pauses to figure it out.)ScenesChandler: Do you want a calculator?ScenesJoey: Please!ScenesChandler: Here! (Hands him one. Joey adds it up and discovers that he was right.)ScenesJoey: All right, what else?ScenesChandler: Well uh, there was acting classes, stage combat classes, tap classes…ScenesJoey: Which we’re still keeping under our hats!ScenesChandler: Uh then there was that dialect coach who helped you with that play where you needed a southern accent. Which after twenty hours of lessons still came out Jamaican.ScenesJoey: What the hell are you talking about, (in a Jamaican accent) "The south will rise again man.ScenesChandler: Yes, money well spent!ScenesJoey: Yeah. Okay, what else? Rent!ScenesChandler: Okay, two, three years of rent, utilities, food…ScenesJoey: Okay. Okay, so I’m writing you a check for…So you fell asleep during my movie. Big deal right? How do you clear this thing?

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are trying the home remedies again.]
rows.Content: Ross: Come on, finish your enchilada.ScenesRachel: Ross I—We tried all the spicy food. It’s not working.ScenesRoss: Okay here, have one of these peppers. Oh ha… Oh God! So…so hot! (Rubs his eyes.) Oh my—(Laughs.) By the way, you don’t want to touch the pepper and then touch your eye.ScenesRachel: I am feeling nothing. Speaking of hot, watching you do that really makes me want to have sex with you.ScenesRoss: Stop it.ScenesRachel: Oh come on Ross, why are we wasting our time with this other stuff?! We know what’s gonna work! It’s doctor recommended!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry, but we have to have some boundaries! My God, I’m dying.ScenesRachel: Oh come on Ross, we’ve done it before we’ll do it again, it’ll be a nice way to bookend the pregnancy.ScenesRoss: This is insane, I’m not gonna make love to you just so that you’ll go into labor.ScenesRachel: Make love? What are you a girl?ScenesRoss: Always a great way to get in a man’s pants.ScenesRachel: But you will, you will be performing a service. Okay? Just-just think of me as a ketchup bottle, y’know you sometimes you have to bang on the end of it just to get something to come out.ScenesRoss: I love when you talk dirty to me.ScenesRachel: Oh, I know it. You’re right. That’s not sexy. Oh…Oh! (Drops a fork on the floor.) Whoops! Oh, I seem to have dropped my fork. Let me just bed over and get it. (Tries too, but can’t quite seem to make it.) Oh God!ScenesRoss: Okay enough! This is, this is not going to happen.ScenesRachel: Come on Ross! I’m miserable here! Come on! You started this, now you finish it! Come on wuss, make love to me.ScenesRoss: Y’know what?ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: Forget it.ScenesRachel: Oh wow! What now Ross you’re not gonna talk? How on earth will you ever annoy me? Oh wait a minute, I know. (Mimics his breathing.) I mean you’d think the damn jalepeno would’ve cleared up your sinuses, but no!! That’s not enough… (Ross jumps over and kisses her.) What are you doing?!ScenesRoss: I’m getting that baby out of you!Scenes(They kiss again.)ScenesRachel: (breaking the kiss) Oh God!ScenesRoss: Oh, I know.ScenesRachel: Oh no. No-no! I think my water just broke.ScenesRoss: I am good. Okay! Okay! Uh, I got the pillow! I got the bag! You got the keys?ScenesRachel: Okay! I got the keys! Okay! Okay!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: We’re having a baby.Scenes(They hug and then kiss one more time.)ScenesRachel: I didn’t uh, really have time to read this part of the books, but do you think we have time to…ScenesRoss: Not so much.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is paying Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Monica: Two hundred.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you!ScenesMonica: That’s it. I’m done. I don’t care when the baby comes, no more betting.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello? (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up.) I guess we can bet one more time.ScenesPhoebe: Is Rachel having the baby?ScenesMonica: How did you know that?! (Runs to yell at Joey’s apartment.) Joey! Chandler!! It’s time!ScenesPhoebe: They’re at the coffeehouse.ScenesMonica: You know everything!! Oh wait, double or nothing. I bet you the baby is over seven pounds. (Phoebe isn’t interested.) I bet you it has hair. (She’s still not interested.) I bet you it’s a girl.ScenesPhoebe: We know it’s a girl! (Exits.)ScenesMonica: (following her) I’ll give you really good odds.ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel Has A BabyScenesPart I Written by: Scott SilveriScenesPart II Written by: David Crane & Marta KauffmanScenesParts I & II Transcribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Hospital, Ross and Rachel, who’s in a wheelchair, are arriving in the waiting room for the maternity ward.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right! (Checking his watch) Yes!! From home to the hospital in under seven minutes! We did it!!ScenesRachel: (deadpan) Yes, the hard part is truly over.ScenesRoss: No, but come on, we’re off to a great start aren’t we? I knew I’d get you here fast, but this has got to be some kind of a record!Scenes(Phoebe and Monica walk in from getting some coffee.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh you made it!ScenesRachel: Hi! (Ross is stunned.)ScenesMonica: How are you doing?ScenesRoss: Wait a minute! How-how the hell did you beat us here?ScenesMonica: We took a cab. Did you guys walk?ScenesRoss: N… No! We took a cab too, but I did test runs!Scenes(Chandler and Joey enter from the vending machines carrying sodas.)ScenesChandler: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey! You made it!ScenesRoss: Okay is there…some kind of magic tunnel to this hospital?!ScenesRachel: Ross, you stay here and talk, I’m gonna go have a baby.ScenesRoss: Okay. Okay. (To the nurse behind the desk.) Umm hi, this is Rachel Green. I’m Ross Geller. We-we called from the car.ScenesNurse: Right! We have a semi-private labor room waiting for you. So in just a minute…ScenesRachel: (interrupting her) Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I’m sorry, semi-private? We (Laughs), we asked for a private room.ScenesNurse: Yes, I see that here. Unfortunately we can’t guarantee a private room and currently they’re all unavailable.ScenesChandler: Man, if only you’d gotten here sooner. (Ross turns and glares at him.)ScenesNurse: I’m sorry. Semi-private rooms are all we have.ScenesRachel: Okay. Just give us a second. Ross! (They walk away from the desk.)ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Give her some money.ScenesRoss: I really think they’re out of rooms.ScenesRachel: They’re not!! Ross, they’re just saving them for the important people!! Okay?! What-what if I was the president?!ScenesRoss: Well then we’d be in a lot of trouble, you don’t know where any countries are. (Rachel glares at him.) Okay. (He goes over to the desk followed by Rachel.) Uh, say would you umm… Would you mind checking again to see if any umm, private rooms may have (Handing her some money) opened up?ScenesNurse: This is a hospital.ScenesRachel: (standing up) Okay. Y’know what? I’d have to say I really don’t care for your tone. And this is not the only hospital in this city and we have no problem to—Whoa! (She starts a contraction) Oh gosh! Whoa!ScenesRoss: What-what?ScenesRachel: Ow! Ow! Contraction. (Sits back down.) Ow-ow! Ow-ow! (Starts breathing heavily.)ScenesNurse: Would you like to see a semi-private room?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it couldn’t hurt to look.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Rachel is in bed, Ross is fooling around, and Dr. Long is checking on Rachel.]
rows.Content: Dr. Long: Well you’re only two centimeters dilated and we need to get to ten. It’ll be a while.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay.ScenesDr. Long: I’ll be back in an hour to check you again.ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (Dr. Long exits.) Well, I guess we have some time to kill.ScenesRoss: Yeah, guess so. Whew! Check these out! (He’s looking at the stirrups on the other bed in the room and Rachel groans. Ross then hops into the bed and puts his legs into the stirrups.) Never done this before.ScenesRachel: Yeah well it looks great!Scenes(A nurse shows another couple into the room.)ScenesMan: Thank you very much.ScenesWoman: Thanks.Scenes(They stop when they see Ross who has to struggle to get out of the bed.)ScenesRoss: Hi! Hi, I’m uh Ross. I’m here to ruin this magical day for you.ScenesMan: Oh no-no, not at all.ScenesWoman: Don’t worry about it.ScenesMan: Marc Coreger, this is my wife Julie.ScenesRoss: Hi Julie.ScenesJulie: Hi.ScenesRoss: This is Rachel. (Points at her.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMarc: Oh hi Rachel.ScenesRachel: How are you?ScenesJulie: Hi. Is this your first?ScenesRachel: Yeah it is.ScenesJulie: Well, little Jamie here is our third. So, if you have questions or you need anything at all, just holler.ScenesRachel: That’s so sweet.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: Umm say, I-I opened this earlier (The privacy screen) but let me give you guys some privacy.ScenesMarc: No nonsense! We’re all in this together.ScenesJulie: Yeah, we are going to share every moment of this with you. And I think we’re gonna have some fun.ScenesMarc: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Oh, okay.ScenesMarc: Hey! Smile! (Points his camera at Ross and Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Oh no, I really don’t want any—(He takes the picture)—Oh! Thank you. Oh. Oh Ross…ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Here comes another contraction.ScenesRoss: Oh. Okay, just breathe.ScenesJulie: Oh honey, I think I’m having one too!Scenes(During the mutual contraction Julie takes a moment to point out they’re having a contraction at the same time.)ScenesMarc: Look at this! (Takes another picture) There we go!

rows.Scenes: The Waiting Room, the rest of the gang is lounging around.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (looking at the clock) Oh wow, three hours and still no baby. Ugh, the miracle of birth sure is a snooze fest.ScenesMonica: Hey, you wanna see something?ScenesPhoebe: Sure! What?ScenesMonica: Umm, this is going to be fun. Watch me freak out Chandler. Honey?ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Listen uh, I-I’ve been doing some thinking, and I don’t know whether it’s because we’re here or Rachel’s giving birth but umm, I think we should try to have a baby.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: (freaking out) What-what-what’s that now?!ScenesChandler: Okay. I’ve been thinking about it too, and I, I think we’re ready.ScenesMonica: What?! Are you kidding me?! You-you-you think we’re ready to have a baby now?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this is fun.ScenesJoey: You’re ready to have a baby? My boy’s all grown up!ScenesChandler: But you said you were ready too.ScenesMonica: Yeah but I was just screwing with you to try to get your voice all high and weird like mine is now!ScenesChandler: Yes, but haven’t you wanted a kid like forever?ScenesMonica: Okay, just back off mister! Whoa. (Pause) ‘Cause I am ready to have a baby. I just want Joey to be the father.ScenesJoey: (voice all high and weird) What?! Are you crazy?!ScenesMonica: That’s it! Right there! Is all I wanted!

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, time lapse, Ross is massaging out a cramp on Rachel’s hip as Marc opens up the privacy screen.]
rows.Content: Marc: I am so sorry. The doctor insisted on closing the curtain for the exam.ScenesRachel: Oh, that’s very—Really very-very okay.ScenesMarc: Julie’s cervix is dilated a seven centimeters, that’s about four fingers. The doctor let me feel it myself.ScenesJulie: Have you felt Rachel’s cervix Ross?ScenesRachel: (simultaneously as Ross) No, I don’t think we’ll be doing that.ScenesRoss: (simultaneously as Rachel) We’re not gonna do that.ScenesJulie: Well, if you like you can feel Rachel’s and then feel mine to compare.ScenesMrs. Geller: (entering) Am I interrupting?ScenesRoss: Uh yes! Thank you.ScenesRachel: Oh. Oh wait no.ScenesRoss: Later.ScenesRachel: No-no-don’t! Don’t leave me here with these people.ScenesRoss: Oh uh, I’m sorry. (Runs out.)ScenesRachel: No Ross! Ross! Ross! My child has no father!

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Ross comes out and hugs Mrs. Geller.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi! I’m so glad you’re here, but it’s gonna be a while. I-I wished you’d called first.ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh that’s all right, I’m coming back later with your father.ScenesRoss: Oh good.ScenesMrs. Geller: I actually needed to talk to you before the birth.ScenesRoss: Okay, what’s up?ScenesMrs. Geller: I brought something that I want to give you, assuming of course that you want it. (She holds up an engagement ring.)ScenesRoss: Ma, you’re asking me to marry you?ScenesMrs. Geller: This is your grandmother’s engagement ring, I want you to give it to Rachel.ScenesRoss: Mom no, come on! Thank you.ScenesMrs. Geller: Just hear me out!ScenesRoss: N-no! Okay? We’ve been through this! We’re not gonna get married just because she’s pregnant, okay?ScenesMrs. Geller: Honestly! Ross, this isn’t just some girl you picked up in a bar and humped. A child should have a family.ScenesRoss: Mom, y’know what? I-I can’t deal with this right now. I’m sorry…ScenesMrs. Geller: Just…think about it. If you don’t, I’ll talk more about humping.ScenesRoss: Gimmie! (Takes the ring and puts it in his coat pocket as Rachel enters the hallway.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh hi dear!ScenesRachel: Oh, thank you so much for coming. Ross, get in here!Scenes(Mrs. Geller leaves as Ross re-enters the room.)

rows.Scenes: The Waiting Room, Ross is explaining to the gang what happened with his mother.]
rows.Content: Ross: …she came and dragged me out of the labor room to ask me why I’m not with Rachel.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. (Pause) Why aren’t you with Rachel?ScenesRoss: Are you kidding? Look, we’re not gonna be together just because we’re having a baby. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: But y’know what? It just seems that you two belong together.ScenesRoss: Okay, stop it! I can’t deal with this right now. I have to go have a baby.ScenesPhoebe: Right. And with who again? (Ross exits.)ScenesJoey: God. He’s crazy! Why doesn’t he want to be with Rachel?ScenesPhoebe: I know!ScenesJoey: I mean seriously, she’s like the perfect woman. I mean I know she turned me down, but if she hadn’t and wanted to be with me, I would take her in my arms and… (Realizes everyone is staring.) I haven’t bummed you guys out like this in a while have I?

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Ross is returning to find another couple has taken the place of Marc and Julie.]
rows.Content: Ross: (To Rachel) Hey. Who’s that?ScenesRachel: New people.ScenesRoss: What happened to the Disgustingtons?ScenesRachel: They’re having their baby! It’s not fair Ross we got here first! Right after you left they wheeled her off into delivery. Oh but not before she gave me a juicy shot of little Jamie just crowning away.ScenesRoss: Wow! Sorry. So uh, how are the new people?ScenesRachel: Well they have uh, some unusual pet names for each other. Including umm, evil bitch and uh, sick bastard. Oh God oh! Contraction!ScenesRoss: Yeah? Okay.ScenesRachel: Ooh! Ow!!ScenesEvil Bitch: Are you looking at her?!ScenesSick Bastard: No!ScenesEvil Bitch: Don’t you look at her you sick bastard!ScenesSick Bastard: Honey I swear! I wasn’t looking at her!ScenesEvil Bitch: She’s in labor! You like that you sick son of a bitch!ScenesRoss: Umm. Umm, I’m-I’m just gonna—(Closes the privacy screen.)ScenesEvil Bitch: See? See? It was because you were looking fat pervert!ScenesRoss: No-no, I’m…I’m sure no one was looking. Just want some privacy. (He closes the screen and stares wide-eyed at Rachel.)ScenesEvil Bitch: You miss your girlfriend?ScenesRoss: Just ignore them.Scenes(Sick Bastard sits down in a chair that enables him to look around the screen and stare at Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Ross.ScenesRoss: What? What?ScenesRachel: He’s looking at me.ScenesRoss: (to him) Hey! You wanna live to see your baby?!ScenesEvil Bitch: Don’t you talk to my husband like that you stupid bastard!Scenes(Ross shrugs his shoulders to Rachel and Sick Bastard closes the screen all the way.)

rows.Scenes: Outside the Nursery, Chandler is looking at the babies as Monica walks up.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh good God! If you want a baby so bad just go steal it!Scenes(The nurse attending to the babies hears this, turns and stares at Chandler. Chandler moves Monica to the side and away from the nurse.)ScenesMonica: What is going on with you? Since when are you so crazy about babies?ScenesChandler: I’m not crazy about babies. I’m crazy about us.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Look, we’ve always talked about having babies someday. I’m not saying it has to be right now, but I’m starting to think that we can handle it. We’re good. We’re really good.ScenesMonica: We are pretty good.ScenesChandler: But nothing has to happen until your ready.ScenesMonica: Well maybe I’m ready now. I mean, it’s a little scary, but maybe it’s right.ScenesChandler: What?! It’s not right! We’re not ready to have a kid now!!ScenesMonica: What?!!ScenesChandler: I’m kidding. This is going to be fun.ScenesMonica: So we’re gonna try? I mean, are we trying?ScenesChandler: We’re trying to get pregnant. (They start kissing, but Chandler stops it.) Y’know I’m not really comfortable doing this in front of the babies. So, when do you want to start trying?ScenesMonica: Okay, hold on a sec.ScenesChandler: Period math?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Well, we could start trying. Now.ScenesChandler: Right here?ScenesMonica: No, not here. Maybe here.ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, it’s perfect. We got a lot of time to kill and we’re in a building that’s full of beds!ScenesMonica: And it’s so clean!!Scenes(They run off in search of a bed.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Vending Machines, Phoebe is buying a soda and Joey is shaking the candy machine.]
rows.Content: Joey: Come on you stupid machine! Come on!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it ate your money?ScenesJoey: (looking at her) No.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’ll see you downstairs then.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesPhoebe: All right.ScenesJoey: Hey I got one! I got one!Scenes[Cut to the elevator lobby, Phoebe walks up and sees a man in a wheelchair with his broken leg extended.]ScenesMan: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hi.ScenesMan: Oh uh, up or down?ScenesPhoebe: Oh down please. (The guy tries to reach the button, but can’t.) I-I hate to be a ball buster can I just do it? (She pushes the button.)ScenesMan: Could you press up too please?ScenesPhoebe: Sure! I feel so bad for you; I broke my leg once too.ScenesMan: Oh yeah? How’d yours happen?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it’s a long story. It’s kind of embarrassing. Let’s just say there was a typographical error with a sex manual. (The guy laughs.) How about you?ScenesMan: Car accident.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMan: Oh, let me guess some idiot on a cell phone wasn’t paying attention?ScenesMan: Yeah. Me. (The elevator door opens.) Oh hey, that’s me. (Rolls onto the elevator.) Hey uh, I take it you’re just visiting someone.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, yeah.ScenesMan: Well umm, if you have sometime y’know and maybe you might want to visit someone else…ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah! I-I would like that.ScenesMan: I’m in the middle… (The elevator door closes, cutting him off.)ScenesPhoebe: Wait! What?! No!! Elevator!! No!ScenesJoey: (standing behind her) Uh, you gotta press the button. (Does so.)

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Evil Bitch and Sick Bastard are gone and Ross has just finished talking to a nurse as Rachel stands and stretches.]
rows.Content: Ross: The nurse said they’re bringing in another woman.ScenesRachel: Ugh, is she pregnant yet? She doesn’t need to be; she’ll still have the baby before I do. Oh Ross, another contraction! (Leans back on Ross for some support.)ScenesRoss: That’s it. That’s it.Scenes(The next couple enters.)ScenesWoman: Oooh, that sounded like a bad one.ScenesRachel: Yeah it was.ScenesWoman: Mine haven’t been so bad. Oh! Here comes one now. (Hums then squeals a little bit.) Oh, that was a big one!Scenes(Rachel motions for Ross to close the privacy screen, which he does.)

rows.Scenes: Another Waiting Room, Phoebe and Joey are trying to find out where the guy with the broken leg is.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the nurse) Excuse me? Could you help me with something? The patient I’m looking for has a broken leg and is in a wheelchair. And umm, he’s like early to mid-thirties, very attractive.ScenesNurse: I think I know who you’re talking about.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yay! Great! Okay, what room number is he in?ScenesNurse: I’m sorry, that information is restricted to hospital staff…ScenesJoey: (walks up) Uh, she’s with me. (Introduces himself) Dr. Drake Remoray.ScenesNurse: Dr. Drake who?ScenesJoey: Remoray. It’s Portuguese. We need that information; I’m a doctor.ScenesNurse: A doctor at this hospital?ScenesJoey: Damnit woman we’re losing precious time! Now do you want this man’s blood on your head?ScenesPhoebe: Hands.ScenesJoey: Hands! It is absolutely essential that you tell me what room the man my assistant described is staying in. He’s a patient of mine, I’ve been treating him for years!ScenesNurse: He’s in room 816.ScenesJoey: 816, thank you!ScenesPhoebe: Thank you. (Starts to exit.)Scenes(Joey starts to leave, but stops.)ScenesJoey: And what is his name?ScenesPhoebe: (coming back for Joey) No! (Grabs Joey and drags him away.)

rows.Scenes: An Empty Hospital Room, Chandler and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: I think we found a place.ScenesChandler: Okay. (They start kissing.)ScenesMonica: Umm, wait! Do you want to set the mood a little?ScenesChandler: Okay. Uh, we’ll dim the lights, dim the lights. (He goes to the light switch and finds it’s not a dimmer switch when he flips the lights off.) Or turn them out all together. Uh, no scented candles. Okay here. Here we go. (He sprays an aerosol air freshener above her.)ScenesMonica: Okay! Okay! Make me sterile, but okay.Scenes(He hops onto the bed and they start making out.)ScenesMonica: Okay. Let’s hurry—Oh wait! Do we have a condom? (He looks at her.) Oh right! (Laughs and they resume making out when a nurse catches them in the act.)ScenesChandler: Yes, 98.6. You’re gonna be fine.

rows.Scenes: Outside Room 816, Phoebe and Joey are approaching.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ooh, this is it! (Looks in the window.) Oh, that’s him! That’s him!ScenesJoey: Great! Go get him.ScenesPhoebe: Wait a second, or maybe you can go in first.ScenesJoey: (looks in the window) He’s not really my type.ScenesPhoebe: No not you, Dr. Drake Remoray. You can ask him questions and see what’s he like. People tell doctors everything.ScenesJoey: But you said he was this great guy!ScenesPhoebe: But lately all the guys I meet seem really nice at first, then they turn out to be the biggest jerks.ScenesJoey: You do attract some stinkers.

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Dr. Long is checking on Rachel again.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Dr. Long, I’ve been at this for seventeen hours! Three women have come and gone with their babies, you gotta give me some good news! How many centimeters am I dilated? Eight? Nine?ScenesDr. Long: Three.ScenesRoss: Just three?! I’m dilated three!ScenesDr. Long: We are moving along, just slowly. (Rachel lies back and sighs.) Don’t worry, you’re doing great. I’ll be back soon. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know what? I’m not waiting! I’m gonna push this baby out! I’m doing it! I mean it’s what? Three centimeters? That’s gotta be like this! (Holds her hands a couple inches apart.)ScenesRoss: Actually it’s more like this. (Pushes her hands to less than an inch apart.)ScenesRachel: Oh stupid metric system!Scenes(Another woman with a nurse and doctor enter, the woman is screaming.)ScenesDoctor: Oh my. We’re gonna need to take you straight to the delivery room.ScenesRachel: Oh for the love of God!ScenesWoman Giving Birth: (yelling from the hallway) It’s coming! It’s coming!ScenesDoctor: And here it is! (The baby cries.)ScenesRachel: Oh come on!!

rows.Scenes: Room 816, Dr. Drake Remoray is entering.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hi! I’m Dr. Drake Remoray and I have a few routine questions I need to ask you.ScenesMan: Really? I’ve been dealing with Dr. Wells.ScenesJoey: I know, but I’m a neurologist. And just to be on the safe side, Dr. Wells wanted a more comprehensive overview of you status so he sent me.ScenesMan: Dr. Wells is a woman.ScenesJoey: That was a test. Good response. All right, full name.ScenesMan: Clifford Burnett.ScenesJoey: Date of birth?ScenesCliff: November 16th, 1968.ScenesJoey: Age?ScenesCliff: Can’t you figure that out based on my date of birth?ScenesJoey: I’m a doctor Cliff, not a mathematician.ScenesCliff: I’m 33.ScenesJoey: Okay. And uh, are you married.ScenesCliff: No.ScenesJoey: Oh really? So, 33 and still single, would you say you have commitment issues?ScenesCliff: Are all the questions this personal?ScenesJoey: (checking the list) Yes.ScenesCliff: Well uh if you must know I’m a widower.ScenesJoey: Oh that’s terrible. I’m-I’m really sorry.ScenesCliff: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Hmm. Do you sleep with women and never call them again?ScenesCliff: No.ScenesJoey: Excellent! Excellent! And uh, finally, are you into any weird stuff y’know, sexually?ScenesCliff: No!ScenesJoey: Oooh, wrong answer. (Exits.)

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, they’re brining in yet another woman.]
rows.Content: Nurse: (calling to the woman) This room’s available.ScenesRachel: Okay! Okay wait! You listen to me! You listen to me! Since I have been waiting four women, that’s four, one higher than the number of centimeters that I am dilated, have come and gone with their babies! I’m next! It’s my turn! It’s only fair! And if you bring in one woman and she has her baby before me I’m going to sue you! Not this hospital, I’m going to sue you! And my husband (Points at Ross) he’s a lawyer!ScenesRoss: Uh Rach…ScenesRachel: Go get back on that case honey!ScenesNurse: I don’t think the next patient is very far along.ScenesRachel: Okay, well then bring her in.Scenes(Another nurse wheels the next pregnant woman in.)ScenesWoman: OH….MY….GAWD!!! (Uh-huh, it’s Janice.)Scenes(Ross and Rachel are, needless to say, stunned at the arrival of Janice.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Janice: I….can’t….believe this!ScenesRoss: And yet somehow it’s true!ScenesJanice: I mean this is so great! We’re gonna be baby buddies! (Does the laugh.)ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Squeeze your legs together and cover the baby’s ears!ScenesMan: (entering, carrying a pillow) Hi sweetie!ScenesJanice: Hi! Hi sweetheart! This is my husband Sid, I don’t think you’ve met him. Ross, Rachel, this is Sid. I nabbed him a year ago at the dermatologist’s office. Thank God for adult acne huh? (Does the laugh.)ScenesSid: I still can’t believe it! I’m the luckiest guy in the world!ScenesRoss: (softly) Really?ScenesSid: (To Janice) What’d he say?ScenesJanice: Oh y’know what? You have to speak very loudly when you’re talking to Sid, because he’s almost completely deaf.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesRoss: Oh there you go!ScenesRachel: I get it!ScenesJanice: So? Congratulations you two, I didn’t even know you got married.ScenesRachel: Oh we-we didn’t.ScenesRoss: No-no. We…ScenesJanice: What?!ScenesRoss: Um uh…We’re-we’re just having this baby together but uh, uh that’s all.ScenesJanice: Why?!!ScenesRoss: Uh well umm…we’re just not in that place, y’know? But we’re very excited about this.ScenesJanice: Oh. Well then shut me up. (Does the laugh.)ScenesRachel: Just tell me how.ScenesJanice: Uh-oh, I feel another one coming. (She makes a sound like a goose during the contraction.)ScenesRoss: Sid you lucky deaf bastard.

rows.Scenes: Outside Room 816, Joey is briefing Phoebe on Cliff.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: What else? What else?ScenesJoey: Uh, well he’s 33.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Ah-uh.ScenesJoey: A widower.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesJoey: He seemed like a stand up guy. Oh, and he’s not into anything weird sexually.ScenesPhoebe: Enter Pheebs.

rows.Scenes: Another Hospital Room, Chandler and Monica enter and start making out.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Should we tell Rachel there’s an empty private room right next door to hers?ScenesMonica: We could, or we can have sex in it.ScenesChandler: Well let me think about that, while I remove my pants!Scenes(They start making out again.)ScenesMonica: (lying down on the bed) Okay mister! Fertilize me!Scenes(Suddenly they hear Janice laughing, and it ruins the moment.)ScenesMonica: Does that sound like Janice?ScenesChandler: If it’s not, then there’s two of them. And that would mean it’s the end of the world!

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Chandler and Monica are entering to see if they in fact did hear Janice.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesRachel: Oh hi.ScenesMonica: I can’t believe this is taking so long. How are you doing?ScenesRachel: Oh not bad. Do you know that feeling when you’re trying to blow a Saint Bernard out your ass?ScenesChandler: Weirdest thing. Did I hear—(A nurse opens the privacy screen and Chandler sees Janice)—Mother of God it’s true!ScenesJanice: Chandler Bing!ScenesChandler: Jan-Janice!ScenesRoss: Not just Janice, Janice in labor, contracting and everything.ScenesJanice: Oh, this should be easy. I have a very wide pelvis. You remember Chandler.ScenesChandler: Janice I didn’t even know you were pregnant! Who’s the unwitting human who’s essence you’ve stolen?ScenesJanice: It’s you. This is yours.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJanice: (laughs) Look how nervous he gets! We haven’t slept together in years! (Laughs again.)ScenesChandler: That’s funny. Does it-does it hurt? Does the labor hurt?

rows.Scenes: Room 816, Phoebe is making her move on Cliff.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay I’ve got one for you, if you had too which one would you rather eat, a seeing eye dog or a talking gorilla?ScenesCliff: I’d have to say…the talking gorilla, because at least I can explain to him that you’re making me eat him.ScenesPhoebe: Somebody went to college. Wow. (Cliff gets uncomfortable) What is it? I’m sorry. (She moves her arm, which was resting on the same pillow his leg is.)ScenesCliff: No, I’m sorry. It’s just my foot itches like crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’ll get it. (She gets up and grabs a spoon.)ScenesCliff: Wow! I usually get to know a girl a little better before I let her spoon me.ScenesPhoebe: Relax, it’s not like we’re forking.

rows.Scenes: The Semi-Private Labor Room, Janice is being moved to the delivery room and is screaming in pain.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh that’s five Ross. Five women have had five babies! And I have had no babies! Why doesn’t she want to come out?ScenesRoss: Y’know what I think it is? I think you’ve made such a nice home for her over the last nine months that she just doesn’t want to leave.ScenesRachel: Oh. Look at you making up crap for me. Oh God! (Starts another contraction as Dr. Long enters.)ScenesDr. Long: Twenty-one hours, you’re a hero.ScenesRachel: Doctor you gotta do something! I think you gotta give me drugs or you gotta light a fire up in there and just smoke it out.ScenesDr. Long: Actually, I think you’re ready to go to the delivery room.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesDr. Long: Ten centimeters, you’re about to become a mom.ScenesRachel: My God. Okay. (Another woman enters.) Ha-ha-ha beat ya! Sucker!

rows.Scenes: Room 816, Phoebe and Cliff are eating some pudding with spoons.]
rows.Content: Cliff: Is this the same spoon that was in my cast? (Smells it.)ScenesPhoebe: Y’know what? This one is. (Eats another spoonful of pudding as Cliff sees something on TV.)ScenesCliff: Oh my God! That’s the doctor who was in my room before!ScenesPhoebe: Huh. Okay, Mr. Perkazet.ScenesCliff: I’m telling you! The guy from that show was here in my room, asking me all these weird questions!ScenesPhoebe: Cliff, do you really believe that a character from a TV show was here in your room?ScenesJoey: (entering) Rachel’s having her baby!! (Phoebe turns and looks at him.) Which is of no interest to me, I’m a neurologist.ScenesCliff: That-that’s him! You know him?ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Okay. I—Okay umm…this…I-I sent my friend Joey in here to find out stuff about you. Umm y’know, if it helps you came off great. A lot better than I’m coming off right now.ScenesCliff: I don’t believe this. You got him to pretend he was some fake doctor?ScenesJoey: Fake? Excuse me? Hello? (Taps the TV screen.)ScenesCliff: And then you tried to make me think that I was crazy.ScenesPhoebe: You’re right, that was wrong. I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. It’s just that I liked you so much. Can we just, can we just start over?ScenesCliff: I don’t think so.ScenesJoey: Uh, if I may? Umm-umm look, Cliff, you told me a lot of personal stuff about you, right? And maybe-maybe it would if-if would help if-if you knew some personal stuff about her. Uh, she was married to a gay ice dancer. Uh, she gave birth to her brother’s triplets. Oh! Oh! Her-her twin sister used to do porn!ScenesPhoebe: Uh Joey, we’re trying to dial down the crazy.ScenesJoey: Right!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, look we don’t, we don’t really know each other so it would be really easy to just forget about this, but there seems to be something between us. And I don’t know about you but that doesn’t happen to me a lot.ScenesCliff: It doesn’t happen to me either.ScenesJoey: Me neither.

rows.Scenes: The Delivery Room, Rachel is finally giving birth.]
rows.Content: Dr. Long: Push. Push. Come on push for five seconds. 5…4…ScenesRachel: 3-2-1 oh!!ScenesDr. Long: Okay, the next contraction should be in about twenty seconds.ScenesRachel: I can’t. I can’t push anymore, I can’t.ScenesRoss: Sweetie you’re doing great.ScenesRachel: Oh God twenty seconds my ass!!ScenesDr. Long: Here we go! Okay, keep pushing! Wait! I see something.ScenesRoss: What? You do? You do? (Looks) Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Don’t say, "Oh my God!" Oh my God what?ScenesRoss: What is that?ScenesDr. Long: It’s the baby’s buttock, she’s breech.ScenesRoss: Oh thank God, I thought she had two heads.ScenesRachel: Oh God. Is she gonna be okay?ScenesDr. Long: She’s gonna be fine. Okay, she’s in a more difficult position so you’re gonna have to push even harder now. Go! Push!ScenesRoss: Go!ScenesDr. Long: Rachel you’re gonna have to push even harder, nothing’s happening!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, I can’t!ScenesRoss: Yes you can!ScenesRachel: I can’t!ScenesRoss: Hey! Hey! Come on! You can! I know you can do this! Let’s go!ScenesRachel: I can’t. Please, you do it for me.ScenesRoss: No! Come on let’s—One more time! One final push! Ready? 1…2…3! (Rachel pushes so hard her head snaps up head-butting Ross and knocking him down.)ScenesDr. Long: Good!ScenesRoss: (from the floor) Keep pushing!ScenesRachel: Are you okay?ScenesRoss: You have no idea how much this hurts. (All of the women in the room turn and glare at him.) Keep going! Keep going!ScenesDr. Long: Here we go!ScenesRoss: Oh! Oh! She’s upside down but she’s coming! She’s coming!ScenesRachel: Oh God!ScenesRoss: Oh! Oh my God oh! Oh my God she’s here.Scenes(The newest friend cries.)ScenesRoss: Oh she’s…she’s perfect.ScenesRachel: Oh, she’s so tiny. (Starts crying) Where’d she go?ScenesRoss: Oh it’s okay. They’re just-they’re just wrapping her up.ScenesRachel: Okay. Well be careful with her, she’s really tiny.ScenesDr. Long: Here she is!Scenes(Dr. Long hands her to Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Oh hey you. Thanks for coming out of me. (The baby cries.) I know. Oh. Yeah. Oh, she’s looking at me. Hi! I know you.ScenesDr. Long: Do we have a name yet?ScenesRachel: No, not yet.ScenesDr. Long: That’s fine, for now we’ll just call her Baby Girl Green.ScenesRachel: Oh no, Baby Girl Geller-Green.Scenes(Ross and Rachel look into each other’s eyes and kiss.)ScenesRachel: Hello baby girl.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Recovery Room, Ross is taking pictures of Rachel holding the baby as the rest of the gang enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Can we come in?ScenesRoss: Oh, come in.ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesJoey: There she is!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she’s so beautiful.ScenesRachel: Here. (Hands her to Monica.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God! She’s amazing. Oh, oh I’m so glad you guys got drunk and had sex!ScenesChandler: It’s incredible, I mean one minute she’s inside you and then 47 hours later here she is.ScenesJoey: (taking the baby) She looks so real! (The gang looks at him.) Y’know what I mean! She’s this whole tiny little person. She already has eyelashes and knees and…uh-oh.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: Oh no-no, no for I second there I counted six fingers, but one was from the other hand so we’re good.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, my turn. My turn. (Joey hands her to Phoebe.) Oh! You’re so cute! Oh, I could squeeze your little head! (Pause) I won’t.Scenes(Rachel starts crying again.)ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesRachel: Oh nothing I… Sorry, I just can’t stop crying.ScenesRoss: The doctor says it’s completely normal with all the hormones. Plus, you-you’re sleep deprived.ScenesRachel: So? You guys are all sleep deprived. I don’t see you weeping because you put your slippers on the wrong feet. Oh God. (Starts to cry harder.)ScenesJoey: What’s the matter now?ScenesRachel: I was reliving it.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh. (Hands her back to Rachel.)ScenesChandler: So, do you know what you’re gonna call her yet?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, wait a minute it’s not gonna be Baby Girl? I thought that was so original!ScenesRoss: Uh actually, we-we’ve narrowed it down to two names.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and y’know what? I love them both, so why don’t you just pick one and that’ll be it.ScenesRoss: Wow! Umm, okay uh…everyone…this…is Isabella. (Rachel starts crying.) What?ScenesRachel: That’s not her name! I’m sorry, she just doesn’t feel like an Isabella.ScenesChandler: So then I guess Ferdinad is out.ScenesJoey: What was the other one Ross?ScenesRoss: Umm, Delilah.ScenesRachel: Oh great! Suddenly she sounds like a biblical whore.ScenesRoss: So I guess we’re back to uh, Baby Girl.ScenesPhoebe: Yay!ScenesRachel: Well what are we going to do?ScenesMonica: It’s okay honey, you’ll find a name.ScenesRoss: Ugh, easy for you to say, you already know what your kids names are going to be.ScenesChandler: You do?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’ve had them picked out since I was fourteen.ScenesChandler: Oh no, it’s gonna be named after some snack or baked good isn’t it?ScenesRachel: Well tell us! What are they?ScenesMonica: Umm, okay. If it’s a boy it’s Daniel.ScenesRachel: And if it’s a girl?ScenesMonica: I don’t want to say.ScenesRachel: Oh, just tell us! We’re not gonna want it!ScenesMonica: Okay. It’s Emma.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Emma! (Looks at the baby and starts to cry.) See? I don’t want it.ScenesMonica: Take it.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: It’s clearly an Emma.ScenesRachel: Oh honey, but you love that name.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but I love you more. Besides y’know, nothing goes with Bing. So I’m screwed. I mean… (Rachel hands Emma to Monica.) Oh, hi Emma. Yeah, that’s you. You’re our little Em. Oh what’s that honey? What? Oh, you want a little cousin? (To Chandler) You want a cousin right now?!

rows.Scenes: A Janitorial Closet, Monica and Chandler are emerging slowly.]
rows.Content: Chandler: That was amazing.ScenesMonica: I know. Hey, do you realize we may have just changed our lives forever? We may have just started a family. Nine months from now we can be here, having our own baby.ScenesChandler: And if not, we got to do it on a bucket.

rows.Scenes: The Recovery Room, Rachel is putting Emma down for a nap.]
rows.Content: Janice: (entering) Yoo-hoo! Aaron Litman-Neurolic would like to say hello to his future bride.ScenesRachel: Ohhh! (Looks at Aaron and recoils in horror.) Wow! He kinda takes your breath away doesn’t he?ScenesJanice: He’s a keeper. How are you feeling?ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m fine. (Gasps in pain as she sits down.)ScenesJanice: Can I just say, I really admire what you’re doing. Just raising her all alone.ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m not doing it alone. I have Ross.ScenesJanice: Oh, sure. Now. But what happens when he meets somebody else and gets married?ScenesRachel: Well then he gets a divorce, it’s Ross!ScenesJanice: I’m telling you Rachel, listen to Janice. They all say they’re gonna be there until they start their real family.ScenesRachel: Well I—That’s never gonna happen with Ross.ScenesJanice: Oh well that’s what I thought about my first husband, now I’m lucky if my kid gets to spend the weekend with her father and the twins and little Ms. New Boobs.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJanice: I hate to be the one to say it, but honey you two (Her and Emma) are on your own.ScenesRachel: Well… That’s…y’know—That’s—We’ve been alone for the last twenty minutes we’re doing okay. Besides y’know what? I-I—Maybe we won’t be alone, ‘cause lately I-I—things have been happening between me and Ross, y’know? Right before I went into labor, we-we had this kiss. Y’know? So it might be the…the beginning of something.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey Janice!ScenesJanice: Oh hi!ScenesRoss: Who’s this little guy? (Gasps when he sees Aaron.)ScenesJanice: Say hello to Aaron, your future son-in-law.ScenesRoss: No-no. No.ScenesJanice: I’m gonna leave the three of you alone.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJanice: Bye. (Exits.)ScenesRoss: Man! Did you see the kid on that nose?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh. (Ross takes off his coat and sets in on a chair.) Y’know what I was, I was thinking about?ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesRachel: Umm…that kiss before we left the apartment. That was some-something huh?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Yeah, it really was. But we…we gotta be careful. We…we can’t let that happen again, y’know?ScenesRachel: (pause) Right.ScenesRoss: I mean we don’t want to go down that road do we?ScenesRachel: No! No, of course not. No. That’s why I brought it up. (Pause) They didn’t have any sodas?ScenesRoss: Oh my God! I’m sorry, I was talking to this nurse, completely forgot.ScenesRachel: That’s all right. (He goes to get her a soda.) And so it begins.

rows.Scenes: Outside the Nursery, Ross is looking at Emma as Phoebe walks up.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Is she in there?ScenesRoss: Yeah. She’s putting her down now, that’s her. (Points to the nurse putting Emma now.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesRoss: Look at Emma!ScenesPhoebe: I just can’t decide who she looks more alike, you or Rachel?ScenesRoss: Oh what are you kidding? She’s gorgeous, it’s all Rachel.Scenes(Pause)ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, for the last time, why aren’t you two together again? (Silence from Ross.) No, I know. I know, because you’re not in that place. Which would be fine, except you totally are.ScenesRoss: It’s…it’s complicated okay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah that’s true. Yeah, you love her. You always have. You have a child together. There is no right answer.ScenesRoss: Look, we’ve been together. Okay? And then apart, and then together, and then apart, and now we have a baby. (Pause) It’s just if-if we got together again and it didn’t work out…I could never do that to Emma. I mean she-she thinking everything—(Starts to cry.) Oh that’s…now me. What do they put something in the water in this place? Since Rachel and I we’re doing really, we’re doing really well right now.ScenesPhoebe: I know. I know. I know. I know, and if you try to make it more you might wreck it.ScenesRoss: Yeah, exactly.ScenesPhoebe: Right. (Pause) Or you might get everything you’ve wanted since you were fifteen.

rows.Scenes: The Delivery Room, Rachel is in bed as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey. I just saw a woman breast feeding both of her twins at the same time; it is like a freak show up here. (Notices she’s wiping her eyes.) What’s the matter?ScenesRachel: Nothing.ScenesJoey: What is it? Hey!ScenesRachel: Really it’s nothing. I’m just…ScenesJoey: Rach come on, what?ScenesRachel: I’ve just been thinking about how my baby and I are gonna be all alone.ScenesJoey: What are you talking about alone? What about Ross?ScenesRachel: Oh please, he’ll be with his real family, the twins and little miss new boobs.ScenesJoey: Okay, how long was I watching that woman?ScenesRachel: I’m just saying that y’know, someday Ross is gonna meet somebody and…he’s gonna have his own life. Right?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I guess so.ScenesRachel: I just never thought I would raise this baby all by myself. Pretty dumb huh?ScenesJoey: Hey, listen to me, listen to me…you are never ever gonna be alone. Okay? I promise that’s not gonna happen.ScenesRachel: Joey. Honey what would I do without you?Scenes(They hug.)ScenesJoey: You don’t have to worry about that okay?Scenes(Pause)ScenesRachel: Oh, hon can you grab me my other box of tissues? They’re right on that chair under Ross’s coat.ScenesJoey: Sure.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(He moves Ross’s coat to get the tissues and the engagement ring box Mrs. Geller gave him falls out of the pocket it was inside. Joey goes to one knee, picks up the box, opens it, and sees that it’s an engagement ring.)ScenesJoey: My God.ScenesRachel: Joey.Scenes(He turns to face Rachel on one knee with the box open.)ScenesRachel: (seeing the ring) Oh my God. (Pause) Okay.Scenes(Joey is stunned.)Scenes[Cut to Ross getting of an elevator carrying a bouquet of flowers and walking down the hall to Rachel’s room.]Scenes[Fade to black.]ScenesClosing CreditsScenes{Transcriber’s Note: As with all the cliffhangers, there was no credits scene. There will be a ninth and final season of Friends starting sometime in September. See you then, have a good summer everyone.}ScenesEnd
